title: Romanos Arent Just Any Green Beans
description: I will impulsively buy romano beans whenever I see them at a farmers market, which is every week right now. The luxurious flat, wide, longish green beans keep well in the crisper, but the beans dont stay in my refrigerator for long.

title: Corruption Case Against Julius Malema, a South African Opposition Leader, Is Dismissed
description: JOHANNESBURG  A South African court dismissed a long-running corruption case against the opposition leader Julius Malema on Tuesday, handing a victory to one of President Jacob G. Zumas most strident critics.

title: In Fashion
description: A Womans Tweed

title: Stewart vs. Crossfire
description: In 2004 the comic appeared on the show to criticize it. Stop hurting America, he told the hosts Paul Begala and Tucker Carlson.

title: Donald Trump Suggests Shutting Down Government Over Planned Parenthood
description: Donald J. Trump suggested he supported shutting down the federal government to stop funding for Planned Parenthood in the wake of videos that show officials with the group discussing fees for tissue from aborted fetuses.

title: New Taliban Leader Faces Discord as a Top Official Quits
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Solidifying reports of high-level rifts within the Taliban over the groups leadership succession, the head of the insurgents official diplomatic delegation in Qatar publicly resigned on Monday.

title: Frisbee, Life Saving, Ballroom Dancing: Olympic Sports? (Maybe.)
description: Its a great moment for undergrads hanging out on college quads everywhere. Ultimate Frisbee has been officially recognized by the International Olympic Committee.

title: Corbyn and the Cringe Caucus
description: I havent been closely following developments in UK politics since the election, but people have been asking me to comment on the emergence of Jeremy Corbyn as a serious contender for Labour leadership. And I do have a few thoughts.

title: GIFs, Glorious GIFs, From Readers
description: GIFs, the fodder of Internet memes for quite some time, have experienced a recent resurgence, propelled by mobile devices into a more widespread form of instant visual-messaging.

title: Spas Import an International Menu of Pampering
description: On a recent summery afternoon, a handful of spa-goers in cotton board shorts and oversize T-shirts sat mostly in pairs in an airy room near a row of saunas lined with gold-plated tiles, South Korean loess soil and chunky bricks of Himalayan salt.

title: The Marie Kondo Effect: A Closets Loss, a Consignors Gain
description: When Marie Kondos blockbuster book, The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up, was published in the United States last year, it quickly reached the top of best-seller lists, sold more than three million copies worldwide and extended the global phenomenon that had already swept her native Japan, as well as Europe.

title: Sarcasm and Science
description: Paul Romer continues his discussion of the wrong turn of freshwater economics, responding in part to my own entry, and makes a surprising suggestion  that Lucas and his followers were driven into their adversarial style by Robert Solows sarcasm:

title: New Orleans Restaurants a Decade After Hurricane Katrina
description: Few would disagree that New Orleans is a much better place to eat than it was even before the storm.

title: The New Orleans Restaurant Bounce, After Katrina
description: NEW ORLEANS  On a brutally humid day almost 10 years ago, Donald Link was a sweaty, desperate man in a respirator mask lugging a rotting pigs head to the curb.

title: 1965: Greek Lawmakers Vote
description: ATHENS  Parliament met for a showdown vote on the nations political crisis tonight [Aug. 4], with observers giving the three- week-old government only a slim chance of success. Shouts and interruptions rang out across the assembly as soon as debate got under way. A vote of confidence in the administration of Premier George Athanasiades-Novas was expected to be held early tomorrow morning. In the lobbies, the predominant opinion was that Mr. Athanasiades-Novas has little chance of mustering a majority of the 300 deputies. At least 143 deputies belonging to the Center Union party are pledged to support former Premier George Papandreou.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, August 5, 1965

title: Lindsey Graham, Hillary Clinton, Monica Lewinsky: A Case Study in Desperation
description: You would think that a struggling (to be charitable) presidential candidate would think about his words on a day when it had just been revealed by the Washington Post that his much bragged-on record in the military reserve was wildly overblown.

title: Article on Darren Wilson Offers Window on His Life After Ferguson Shooting
description: Darren Wilson, the police officer who fatally shot an unarmed black teenager almost a year ago, now lives on a dead-end street on the outskirts of St. Louis. His name is not on the deed of the house. He wears a hat and sunglasses when he goes outside to greet a reporter, having synced his phone with a security system to tip him off to his visitors arrival.

title: New Polls Give Better View of G.O.P. Debate Field
description: Only a few hours remain for polls to land before Fox determines whos in the first Republican debate on Thursday in Cleveland. Fox News wont announce which 10 candidates will be on stage until after todays 5 p.m. deadline, but three new polls released in the last 24 hours make the field look much more stable than before.

title: A Belated Look at New Yorks Cooling Towers, Prime Suspect in Legionnaires Outbreak
description: Since the outbreak that gave Legionnaires disease its name nearly four decades ago, water-cooling towers have been identified as prime breeding grounds for the deadly disease.

title: The Foo Fighters Answer a YouTube Plea: The Band Will Play in Cesena, Italy
description: PARIS  What do you do when you want to convince your favorite band to play in your hometown? Fabio Zaffagnini, an enterprising 39-year-old fan of the Foo Fighters in Cesena, in Northern Italy, had an idea. He organized 1,000 people to play the bands upbeat anthem Learn to Fly, had professionals film it, postedthe video to YouTube and watched it go viral.

title: Answers About Campus Depression and Suicide Risk Among College Students
description: This week, I wrote about the pressures college students face and the related risk for depression and suicide. The article, Suicide on Campus and the Pressure for Perfection, generated numerous comments, and readers also raised important questions about other aspects of mental health.

title: Aron Johannssons Impending Transfer Slows a Talent Leak
description: Aron Johannsson, a striker for the United States mens national soccer team, is on the verge of a transfer to Werder Bremen of Germanys Bundesliga, his Dutch club announced Tuesday. The move will make Johannsson, 24, one of the most high-profile American players in Europe, and it stops a migration of top American pros out of the top European leagues, at least temporarily.

title: Christie and Kasich Appear to Be Probables in Prime-Time Debate
description: The latest round of national polling gives a good clue about who will make the cut for Fox Newss prime-time debate Thursday, with Gov. John Kasich, of Ohio, and Gov. Chris Christie, of New Jersey, very likely to be selected, The Upshot reports.

title: The Daily Show With John Oliver
description: The comedian filled in while Jon Stewart made Rosewater. HBO gave Mr. Oliver his own show a few months later.

title: Pregnant Woman and 4 Others Injured in Brooklyn Shooting
description: A spate of shootings over the weekend spilled into Monday, the police said, when two men opened fire on a crowd in Brooklyn and wounded five people, including a pregnant woman whose fetus later died.

title: Untitled
description: Danny Meyers latest restaurant in the new Whitney Museum of American Art in the Meatpacking District.

title: Untitled at the Whitney in the Meatpacking District
description: If you can get past the name, a graduate-school groaner that I am supposed to underline, but wont, there is nothing pretentious about Untitled.

title: Summer Reading Contest Winner, Week 6 | On Atticus Finch and Go Set a Watchman
description: Another week of our Sixth Annual Summer Reading Contest, another set of excellent essays from teenagers around the globe.

title: A Baby Is Born at the World Trade Center Transportation Hub
description: It surely must be the worlds most expensive delivery room.

title: New Orleans Restaurants a Decade After Hurricane Katrina
description: Few would disagree that New Orleans is a much better place to eat than it was even before the storm.

title: Review: In Shaun the Sheep Movie, a Flock Heads to the City to Find Its Farmer
description: It wouldnt be summer without a movie that stars one or more animals. Free Willy (1993). Babe (1995). Jaws (1975). Jaws: The Revenge (1987). And now, Shaun the Sheep Movie, a charming and clever concoction from the stop-motion animation studio Aardman Animations, which is known for the Wallace & Gromit franchise.

title: Backing Sept. 11 First-Responders
description: Mr. Stewart is credited with helping to get a bill passed that aided sick Sept. 11 first-responders.

title: Forecasting Your Vacation Weather by Looking at the Past
description: Bad weather can often ruin a vacation, but weather forecasts can also be wrong. With these two thoughts in mind, a new service called WeatherPlanner is hoping to give travelers a better sense of when to book their next trip.

title: Frank Langella Will Return to Broadway in The Father
description: Three-time Tony Award winner Frank Langella will be back on Broadway next spring in the title role of The Father, a play by Florian Zeller that has earned acclaim in Europe.

title: First Draft Focus: On to Thursdays Debate
Kosovo Parliament Votes to Allow War Crimes Court
description: LONDON  The Kosovo Parliament has amended the countrys Constitution to allow for the creation of a war crimes court, which is expected to try ethnic Albanians accused of war crimes.

title: Verbatim: Chris Christie on His Religion and Birth Control
description: Gov. Chris Christie, of New Jersey, explaining to voters in New Hampshire how he balances the teachings of his religion with his daily life.

title: A Creperie, Dlice & Sarrasin, Opens
description: Dlice & Sarrasin Hunger for authentic French crepes drove Christophe Caron, a model, to open this creperie. Mr. Caron enlisted his mother, Yvette, a chef and former surgeon, and his father, Patrick, an engineer, in the project. Now for the French lesson: The word sarrasin means buckwheat and refers to the flour traditionally used for savory crepes, or galettes as they are called in France. (Sweet crepes are made with white flour.) And at this charming little cafe, both varieties are well balanced. None of the filling combinations, including smoked salmon with shrimp, or chocolate and banana, overburden the flavor of the delicate crepe. Pastries, coffee drinks, wine and cider are also served: 20 Christopher Street (Gay Street), 212-243-7200, delicesarrasin.com.

title: Siebel Institute Seeks to Make the Smart Grid Smarter
description: Companies and governments are investing heavily to digitize much of the worlds power grid with sensors. The worldwide spending estimates range up to $2 trillion over the next decade for everything from so-called smart meters and thermostats in homes to sensors on transformers and power lines. But if power-curbing and cost-saving sense is to be made of all the data flowing from those sensors, something more is needed  intelligent software.

title: Shires Merger Machine Stumbles on Baxalta Bid
description: Shires merger machine has taken a gentle knock. Shire, the onetime Irish target for AbbVie, is planning a mega-deal of its own. Unlike the previous combination, Shires $30 billion lunge for Baxalta carries a fair slug of industrial logic, as well as tax benefits. Its shareholders, though, still need some persuading.

title: A Dirt Road in Gaza, Devised by Hamas as a Message to Israel
description: GAZA  The new road known as Jakar Street is a rough dirt expanse that Hamas bulldozers cleared parallel to the fence separating this restive Palestinian strip from Israel. Jakar comes from a slang Arabic term that suggests provocation, stubbornness, an effort to vex or annoy or irritate.

title: Even Stevphen
description: Stephen Colbert and Steve Carell were the first Daily Show correspondents to leave for greater stardom.

title: Arnold Scaasi Dies at 85; Dressed Stars and Socialites, His Scaasi Girls
description: Arnold Scaasi, the Canadian clothing designer whose exuberant creations were worn by generations of first ladies, socialites and Hollywood stars, died on Tuesday in Manhattan. He was 85.

title: Stewart vs. Jim Cramer
description: Mr. Stewart grilled the financial pundit in the wake of of the subprime mortgage-fueled economic collapse.

title: Tips for Shady Gardens
description: Leafy greens grow well in partial shade and will last longer before they bolt, or go to seed, and taste bitter. There is still time to plant seeds of arugula, basil, cilantro, leaf lettuces of many kinds, Asian greens, spinach and kale. They all thrive in cooler early-fall conditions. Here are a few tips for success.

title: The First Show
description: Jon Stewart took the Daily Show host chair on Jan. 11, 1999.

title: How to Make Sense of Donald Trumps Perch Atop the Polls
description: It has been more than two weeks since Donald Trump questioned whether John McCain should be considered a war hero, and he has largely withstood the first of what will be many rounds of scrutiny and criticism from party elites and journalists.

title: A City Garden in Harlem Is on the Move to Brooklyn
description: Gardeners are a hardy species, and those who rent apartments are like plants that refuse to die no matter what life, or the landlord, throws at them.

title: Alice Eves Floral, Patchworked Cocktail Dress
description: The Star: Alice Eve

title: Catalonia Calls Election in New Bid for Secession From Spain
description: BARCELONA, Spain  A year ago, secessionist movements were all the rage in Europe  until they were not.

title: Persians of Interest
description: Maziar Bahari, an Iranian-Canadian journalist, was imprisoned after meeting with Jason Jones of The Daily Show.

title: Obama Begins Campaign in Congress for Iran Nuclear Deal
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama is rolling out a campaign of private entreaties and public advocacy over the next several weeks to build support in Congress for the nuclear deal with Iran, an effort to counter a well-financed onslaught from critics who have promised to use a monthlong congressional recess to pressure lawmakers to oppose the accord.

title: Indecision 2000
description: The 2000 presidential election, the first The Daily Show covered, brought the show a higher profile.

title: Driven | 2015 Porsche 911 Carrera GTS
description: Porsche offers up a performance bargain that youll have to spend $115,000 to take advantage of.

title: Video Review: Porsche Gives the 911 More Giddyap With the GTS
description: The Porsche 911 was an instant classic when first seen at the Frankfurt auto show in 1963. The 911 has always been shorthand for top-notch performance, engineering and peer envy, and after 50 years, the teardrop silhouette remains as constant as Ray-Ban aviators.

title: Sandra Blands Family Files Lawsuit
description: Sandra Blands mother Geneva Reed-Veal appeared with her lawyer on Tuesday to announce that the family was filing a federal lawsuit faulting the state trooper who arrested Ms. Bland, and others.

title: The Twitter Primary: Who Makes the Top 10
description: As Fox News determines exactly who will make the cut for the first Republican presidential debate on Thursday, the data team at Twitter has compiled a similar list.

title: Hair Protection From the Sun, One Spritz (or Pump) at a Time
description: In the summer, protecting ones hair from the sun isnt always a top priority, with so much attention and energy paid to safeguarding the skin. But as anyone whos seen blond turn to brass knows, the sun can do long-lasting damage to ones locks. Luckily, there are a handful of products on the market to protect against it: Last summer, the Stockholm-based brand Sachajuan launched a leave-in serum that protects the hair from ultraviolet rays; earlier this year, the French colorist Christophe Robin released a treatment (with SPF 6) infused with lavender and plant oils to strengthen it before sun exposure. Elsewhere, Phyto introduced fiveoils in a single bottle as an after-sun mist to renew hair fibers and Davines relaunched its SU line in a four-product range, all with antioxidant and anti-inflammatory benefits. Even the 58-year-old hair-care company Ren Furterer added three new products to its already-established sun protection line, Soleil. But our favorite of the bunch is a sun-specific hair-repair shampoo, formulated with jojoba wax, that prevents strands from dehydration.

title: In Zimbabwe, We Dont Cry for Lions
description: Winston-Salem, N.C.  MY mind was absorbed by the biochemistry of gene editing when the text messages and Facebook posts distracted me.

title: On Island of Lesbos, a Microcosm of Greeces Other Crisis: Migrants
description: LESBOS, Greece  The immigration center here, a cluster of prefabricated buildings surrounded by rows of chain-link and barbed-wire fences, was full again on a recent evening, leaving hundreds of families, some with infants, to find a place among the piles of garbage outside.

title: Whats the Buzz About Wild Bees?
description: Mark Bittman strolls through a Northern California farm with UC Berkeleys Claire Kremen as she explains why pollinators  especially wild bees  are essential for crops.

title: Whats the Buzz About Wild Bees?
description: This is the fifth in a series of videos about sustainable agriculture and healthy eating. The series was produced in collaboration with the Global Food Initiative at the University of California.

title: Refugee Crisis on the Beach in Greece
description: Refugee camps are always sad, desperate places. I saw a lot of them when I was covering southern Africa for four years. But most were in desolate, poor places, not vacation islands like Lesbos, Greece, where thousands of refugees have been arriving in small inflatable boats, as upscale tourists do their best to unwind.

title: Tomatoes
description: Summer is the time for these fruits straight off the vine.

title: Tomatoes Worth the Wait
description: With tomatoes, its all about waiting for the vigorous, sometimes-gnarly ones grown outdoors. Shun those impostors at the supermarket. Though there have been early outdoor cherry tomatoes to tease us, now we can really let loose.

title: De Blasio Issues Legionnaires Warning
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York advised the public to be on the lookout for symptoms of Legionnaires disease and to immediately seek treatment if symptoms start to appear.

title: Despite 5% Increase, Disney Revenue Disappoints Analysts
description: LOS ANGELES  As the Walt Disney Company extends its growth streak, it is bumping into a challenge faced by high-flying companies of all kinds: With great success comes even greater expectations.

title: Zucchini
description: A cheesy flan and a twist on traditional fried zucchini make the most of summers most prolific vegetable.

title: Zucchini Two Ways
description: If you have a vegetable garden, you know the drill. A zucchini plant is prolific. Yesterdays tiny squash has grown to medium-size seemingly overnight. And there are always a few giants lurking, like big fish that got away. But, if I may say, there is nothing like an unblemished, shiny, just-picked zucchini, whatever the size (well, perhaps not those great, great big ones).

title: Corn
description: Indian-spiced corn soup and corn-jalapeo muffins go beyond corn on the cob.

title: Beyond Corn on the Cob
description: You may have eaten corn on the cob for the Fourth of July, but now is the time to get your fill. Joining the ranks at the corn stand and rummaging for the best ears (heavy and green, with fresh-looking husks and silk) is a summer ritual. The reward for waiting is blissfully sweet corn, the kind that induces a certain euphoria.

title: Review: Emerson String Quartet Plays Beethoven, Mozart and Faur
description: Sometimes there is a moment in a concert when the music-making suddenly comes into focus. During the Emerson String Quartets recital at Alice Tully Hall on Monday evening at the Mostly Mozart Festival, it came during the Lento of Beethovens String Quartet in F.

title: Merkel Aide Seeks Dismissal of Prosecutor Who Opened Treason Inquiry
description: MNSTER, Germany  The uproar over the decision by Germanys top prosecutor to investigate two journalists on charges of treason intensified on Tuesday when the justice minister, with the support of Chancellor Angela Merkel, called for the prosecutor to be fired.

title: Review: Mr. Robinson, a Classroom Comedy on NBC
description: Bad Teacher was a 2014 CBS sitcom whose cancellation was announced after only three episodes. Mr. Robinson, another classroom comedy that begins Wednesday on NBC, makes Bad Teacher look like Emmy material.

title: Photography in Cuba: Its Not Easy
description: An ambitious new survey of photography in Cuba aims to challenge long-held notions about how the island has been portrayed.

title: A 9/11 Artifact Heads to Its New Home at Connecticuts Shore Line Trolley Museum
description: A perilous, improbable rail journey that began at the World Trade Center on Sept. 11, 2001, will end Thursday when PATH car No. 745 is welcomed with a parade  bagpipes, dignitaries and all  through the streets of East Haven, Conn.

title: Review: Difficult People, on Hulu, Has Fun With the Aspiring and the Struggling
description: Theres the Jim Gaffigan career path: Work hard on the comedy circuit, amass a huge following and parlay that into a small-screen series loosely inspired by your own life. And then theres the Julie Klausner career path: Aspire to the Jim Gaffigan career path and then parlay your underachievement into a small-screen series loosely inspired by your own life.

title: Jeb Bush Causes a Stir on Womens Health Issues
description: It was a casual aside from Jeb Bush, but it could haunt him throughout a campaign in which womens votes  and issues  may prove pivotal.

title: Zucchini, Tomatoes and Corn: Ripe for the Cooking
description: Tomatoes, corn and zucchini define summer eating for me. It no doubt has something to do with my memories of childhood summers in the Midwest. Thats when we had fresh vegetables; the rest of the year, they came neatly frozen in their little paper boxes, just right for a family of four.

title: Long Before Patriots Scandal, N.F.L. Was Rocked by High School Ringers
description: In 1925, four high school students, recruited by a star athlete, tried to blend in as professional players during an N.F.L. game in Chicago.

title: Jeb Bush Cautions Donald Trump on Preying on Voters Fear and Angst
description: Jeb Bush suggested on Tuesday that Donald J. Trumps strategy, as he rides to the top of polls, was to prey on the fear and angst of the American electorate, and Mr. Bush reiterated his view that many illegal border crossings by migrant parents were an act of love.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: A Conversation With Kenneth A. Himmel
description: Mr. Himmel, 69, is the president and chief executive of Related Urban, the mixed-use development division of Related Companies, and a managing partner of Gulf Related, a joint venture with Gulf Capital that invests in real estate projects in Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.

title: Robert Conquest, Historian Who Documented Soviet Horrors, Dies at 98
description: Robert Conquest, a historian whose landmark studies of the Stalinist purges and the Ukrainian famine of the 1930s documented the horrors perpetrated by the Soviet regime against its own citizens, died on Monday in Stanford, Calif. He was 98.

title: Touring the New Photo-Friendly White House
description: WASHINGTON  The White House public tour has officially entered the modern era, where photography and social media posting are permitted, encouraged and, at times, pervasive.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel spoke via webcast to Jewish institutions across the United States to outline his opposition to the Iran nuclear accord.

description: Pictures of the Day: France and More

title: August 4, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from France, Macedonia, India and Myanmar.

title: Guide Who Led Hunt That Killed Cecil the Lion in Zimbabwe Says He Did Nothing Wrong
description: The guide who led a Minnesota dentist on the hunt that killed Cecil the lion defended his actions Tuesday, a day before he was scheduled to stand trial in Zimbabwe.

title: Metropolitan Opera Says Its Otello Tenor Will Not Wear Blackface
description: The Confederate battle flag is not the only symbol of a racist past being phased out in many places: The Metropolitan Opera said on Tuesday that the new production of Verdis Otello that will open its season next month will not use blackface makeup on the white tenor singing the title role, breaking with a performance tradition of more than a century.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions

title: John Kasich Is In, Rick Perry Is Out in First Republican Debate
description: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio is in and former Gov. Rick Perry of Texas is out of Fox Newss Republican debate on Thursday night in Cleveland, officials with the network said Tuesday, resolving the mystery of which lower-polling candidates would make the cut for the first debate of the 2016 presidential contest.

title: The Roster: Contenders Named to First Republican Debate
description: A look at the line-up for Thursday nights debate in Cleveland, the first of the Republican primary contest, which will be broadcast by Fox News, and how each candidate could gain with a strong performance.

title: Up for Sale, The Economist Is Unlikely to Alter Its Voice
description: Journalists at The Economist speak, half-jokingly, of a mythical, perfect sentence for the news and business weekly. It is some version of this:

title: I Am Definitely Not a Minimalist!
description: Arnold Scaasi was known for designs that featured bright hues and prints, and had no shortage of embellishments.

title: In Steve: A Docu-Musical, Colin Summers Unveils a Mysterious Collaborator
description: After working with an Australian lyricist named Steve on 200 to 300 songs, Colin Summers has a pretty good bead on his musical tastes and obsessions, his regrets and ambitions.

title: Jon Stewart and The Daily Show: 9 Essential Moments
description: As Jon Stewarts 16-year run on The Daily Show comes to a close, writers, producers and guests look back on key moments and reflect upon his legacy.

title: Blame a Male-Biased Algorithm for the Temperature in Your Office? Readers Respond
description: An article about office air conditioning set off a fierce gender debate among Times readers  and not just about thermostat settings.

title: Neiman Marcus Files to Go Public Again
description: After more than a decade under private equity ownership, and two different sets of investors, Neiman Marcus  home to $10,000 gowns and sometimes outlandish Christmas presents  is preparing to head back to the stock market.

title: Eating Spicy Food Linked to a Longer Life
description: Eating spicy food is associated with a reduced risk for death, an analysis of dietary data on more than 485,000 people found.

title: Katie Ledecky SetsAnother Record, Then Returns to Pool
description: KAZAN, Russia  Before Katie Ledecky embarked on a mission many onlookers at the swimming world championships Tuesday considered pure madness, she consumed two meals. The first was a plate of pasta with pesto sauce, a mound of rice, a piece of bread and green beans. The second, roughly three hours later, consisted of another plate of pasta.

title: Review: In This Comedy of Errors, Shakespeare Gets a Jersey Accent
description: LENOX, Mass.  She is a magnificent specimen: the hair big and honey blond, the clothes snug and revealing, the jewelry copious and gold. Meticulously manicured, stalking around in screaming-orange sandals with wedge heels that would maim a weaker woman, the aggrieved Adriana is pure Jersey girl  the stereotypical variety.

title: Riding the Waves
description: A stunt two years in the making.

title: Russia Stakes New Claim to Expanse in the Arctic
description: MOSCOW  Russia formally staked a claim on Tuesday to a vast area of the Arctic Ocean, including the North Pole.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Remain in Dead Heat in New Hampshire, Poll Shows
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont continues to tighten the race with Hillary Rodham Clinton in New Hampshire, according to a poll released on Tuesday.

title: The Commune
description: Meet some of the residents of rural Cannon County, Tenn., which has become an unlikely refuge for L.G.B.T.Q. noncomformists.

title: Ebola Cases Fall Sharply, W.H.O. Reports
description: The number of new Ebola diagnoses in Sierra Leone and Guinea reached its lowest point in well over a year last week, according to the World Health Organization, with only one reported case in each country. There were no new cases in Liberia, the third nation most severely affected by the outbreak.

title: An Exchange in Australia Woos Listings From China
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Just two companies are listed on the Asia Pacific Stock Exchange in Sydney, and it has to rely on its biggest Australian rival to clear and settle trades.

title: Netflix Offers Expanded Maternity and Paternity Leave
description: Netflix announced on Tuesday that it was starting an unlimited leave policy for new mothers and fathers for the first year after the birth or adoption of a child.

title: Rise of SoundExchange Shows the Growth of Digital Radio Royalties
description: For a sense of how quickly digital radio outlets like Pandora and SiriusXM have become a major source of revenue for the music industry, look no further than their royalty payments.

title: Oklahoma Acts to Limit Earthquake Risk at Oil and Gas Wells
description: Oklahoma regulators have told energy companies to sharply reduce underground wastewater disposal across an earthquake-prone stretch of the state, a move that ratchets up a so-far unsuccessful effort to reduce quakes related to oil and gas production.

title: 330 to Share $21 Million in Abuse Settlement With Milwaukee Archdiocese
description: Leaders of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Milwaukee said Tuesday that they had reached a $21 million settlement with hundreds of victims of sexual abuse by clergy members, though the agreement is still subject to approval by a federal judge.

title: As Debate Goes On Without Bobby Jindal, Super PACs Ad Will Support Him in Iowa
description: The super PAC backing Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana, who was relegated to the second-tier debate panel on Thursday in Cleveland, will broadcast an ad on Fox News in Iowa during the main event.

title: Puerto Rico Has Another Debt Worry on Horizon
description: While Puerto Ricos first bond default in its history reverberated through the financial markets on Tuesday, another move by the cash-poor island may provide a clue to where the next trouble spot lies.

title: Judge Rejects Settlement in American Express Case
description: It sounded like an innocuous message: Amex negotiation has gotten crazy, Gary Friedman, representing merchants in a lawsuit against American Express, said in a text message to his friend and fellow lawyer Keila Ravelo two years ago. Gmailed u the issue.

title: U.N. Chief Appeals for More Aid to Support Palestinian Refugees
description: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon of the United Nations beseeched donors on Tuesday to fill an emergency $100 million gap in funding for the agency that aids five million Palestinian refugees in the Middle East. In a statement, Mr. Ban said the shortfall confronting the United Nations Relief and Works Agency was unprecedented and risked disrupting the education of a half-million children. Many United Nations agencies are under severe financial pressure because of emergency efforts to help people displaced by the conflicts in Syria, Iraq and Yemen.

title: Iraq: Funding Shortfall Deprives Uprooted Iraqis of Health Services
description: Faced with a shortage of funds, international aid agencies have been forced to suspend 84 percent of their health programs in 10 Iraqi provinces, depriving almost three million people of basic medical care, World Health Organization officials said Tuesday. The aid agencies, including the W.H.O., need $60.9 million to operate their health care centers in Iraq but have received only $5.1 million from donors. More than 184 centers serving refugees and other people displaced by violence in Iraq have suspended their operations, the W.H.O. said. The centers were the only health care providers in many parts of Iraq. This is a country ravaged by conflict, said Dr. Syed Jaffar Hussain, the W.H.O. representative in Iraq. Not only do we have innocent civilians being caught in the violence, with so many people fleeing the fighting and living in temporary housing, people are at much higher risk from communicable diseases. Unless additional funding is received, millions more will be deprived of health services they urgently need. The W.H.O. said it was appealing to international donors and seeking alternative sources of funding.

title: Catch a Back-to-School Spending Break With Sales-Tax Holidays
description: August is time for back-to-school shopping  and, in many states, that means so-called sales-tax holidays as well.

title: Friends of Joe Biden Worry a Run for President Could Bruise His Legacy
description: WASHINGTON  Later this month, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. will escape for a family retreat to mourn his late son, Beau, but also to mull, as his dying son urged him to do, a campaign for president. Some of Mr. Bidens friends and allies worry that he will decide it is a good idea.

title: Luis Severino Carries Hopes of Yankees
description: The Yankees took the field on Tuesday with precisely 600 innings from their starting pitchers this season. Only one winning team in the major leagues, the Kansas City Royals, had fewer. This explains the Yankees seemingly daily habit of calling up a fresh bullpen arm from the minors.

title: Group Plans to Renovate Long-Neglected Areas of Prospect Park
description: When the gleaming Lakeside skating complex opened in Prospect Parks southeast corner in 2013, it quieted critics who had long said that the parks east side, which faces grittier neighborhoods, was being neglected.

title: M.L.B. Advanced Media Joins With N.H.L. in Unusual Intersport Deal
description: In an unusual transaction between two major sports entities, Major League Baseball Advanced Media will pay the National Hockey League $100 million annually starting next year to operate the NHL.com website, and the NHL Network will also distribute out-of-market games online through NHL GameCenter Live and through television providers on NHL Center Ice.

title: Another Exoneration in Brooklyn Brings Total Since Last Year to 14
description: Joel Fowler wore his green, prison-issued clothes for the last time on Tuesday.

title: Fruit at an Oasis
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  If youve been reading Wordplay for a while, you will know that I firmly believe that the themes in some of the crosswords published here are subliminal messages from the constructors or, if theyve been doing this for many years, an occasional cry for help. Today, we have a call for help from Patrick Berry, who has apparently landed himself in prison.

title: Kentucky: Sheriff Defends Officer Shown Handcuffing Child in Video
description: The county sheriff in Covington on Tuesday defended a school resource officer who was shown on a video restraining an 8-year-old boy with handcuffs last year, saying the officer had acted appropriately while responding to a request from school officials to de-escalate and defuse a threat to others. The handcuffing is the subject of a federal lawsuit filed Monday by the American Civil Liberties Union against the Kenton County sheriffs office, Sheriff Charles L. Korzenborn and the resource officer, Deputy Kevin Sumner; a video shows the boy, who has attention hyperactivity deficit disorder and had been acting out in school, crying as Deputy Sumner holds his arms behind his back and places handcuffs on his biceps. In a statement, Sheriff Korzenborn said the deputy did what he is sworn to do and in conformity with all constitutional and law enforcement standards.

title: New York City Task Force Targets Cheating by Teachers and Principals
description: The New York City Department of Education said on Tuesday that it would establish a task force to root out cheating by teachers and administrators in city schools, responding to recent episodes and allegations of grade inflation, forged test answers and the passing of students who rarely attended class.

title: Seeking Comedy at City Hall, Louis C.K. Shadows Mayorde Blasio
description: Louis C.K., the actor and comedian, has a knack for finding humor in unexpected places.

title: Double the Fun
description: Participants in the Police Athletic Leagues summer day camp showed their jumping and turning skills in a double Dutch tournament in Manhattan.

title: Cilla Black, Top Pop Star in Swinging Sixties Britain, Dies at 72
description: Cilla Black, who rose from a job checking coats in a Liverpool nightclub to become Britains top female vocalist of the 1960s, died on Saturday at her villa in Estepona, Spain. She was 72.

title: Mets, Well Aware of Status as Leaders, Rally to Fifth Straight Win
description: MIAMI  Terry Collins was trying to ignore the widespread attention the Mets were receiving as they surged into first place in the National League East with an invigorated offense and stout pitching.

title: Yankees Surging Offense Makes Up for Imperfections in Rout of Red Sox
description: The way the Yankees are swinging the bats, pounding pitchers and racking up runs, as they did again Tuesday night in a 13-3 win over the Boston Red Sox, they do more than overwhelm opponents.

title: Alan Cheuse, Late-Blooming Author and NPR Book Critic, Dies at 75
description: Alan Cheuse, a late-blooming author who published his first short story just before his 40th birthday and went on to write two dozen books, but who became even better known as a longtime book critic for NPR, died on July 31 in San Jose, Calif. He was 75.

title: A B.Y.O.B. Peking Duck Feast With Some of New Yorks Top Sommeliers
description: Last Thursday, Chinatown blazed in a noontime swelter as some of the citys top sommeliers filed into the Peking Duck House on Mott Street. Each had a thing or two tucked under his or her arm  bottles of wine from their personal collections. Michael Madrigale, Bar Bouluds head sommelier, entered with a 2007 Albert Boxler Riesling Grand Cru Brand ($50). Ashley Santoro, the wine director at Narcissa, came with a 1974 Francesco Rinaldi & Figli Barolo from Piedmont, Italy (about $115 retail). Patrick Cappiello was waiting for the sommeliers  eight, in all  with a magnum of Savart Premier Cru LAccomplie Brut Champagne ($80). As the wine director for Rebelle and Pearl & Ash, sister restaurants on Bowery, Cappiello convenes these impromptu lunches about once a month, whenever the time allows. There are only two rules: Bring an intriguing bottle of wine; and keep it to around $100 each.

title: Motorola Solutions Chooses Silver Lake to Help Fund Transition Away From Radios
description: Motorola Solutions has been the target of several prominent investors over the years, notably the activists Carl C. Icahn and ValueAct Capital.

title: G.E. Plans App Store for Gears of Industry
description: General Electric has seen the future of manufacturing and it involves competing with some very big technology companies.

title: Word of the Day | traduce
description: traduce  \tr-ds, -dys\  verb

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, August 5, 2015
description: It seems shell stay in the sea. I think she would like that.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 3:40 P.M. (HBO Signature) FOUR WEDDINGS AND A FUNERAL (1994) Hugh Grant portrays an Englishman with a fear of commitment who happens to be a favored best man among the marrying kind of his circle in this comedy, directed by Mike Newell and written by Richard Curtis. Andie MacDowell is the American beauty who just may change his mind  if only his friends (played by Kristin Scott Thomas, Simon Callow, James Fleet, John Hannah and Charlotte Coleman, among others) would stop getting in his way. Writing in The New York Times, Janet Maslin compared this multitiered confection with a romantic spirit and an enchantingly pretty veneer to a wedding cake, adding that it was elegant, festive and very, very funny.

title: Corrections: August 5, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Socit Gnrales Profit Jumped 25% in Second Quarter
description: LONDON  Socit Gnrale said on Wednesday that its profit rose 25 percent in the second quarter, bolstered by gains in its equity trading business as markets remained volatile in the quarter and by robust activity in its mergers and acquisitions advisory business.

title: Photography in Cuba: Its Not Easy
description: If you spend enough time talking with people in Cuba, there is a phrase you are sure to hear: No es fcil  its not easy. Those three words attest to a hard-earned wisdom, of learning how to survive challenges big and small, ideological and practical, without getting caught in the middle or, worse, on the wrong side.

title: Student Crossword | Earthquakes
description: Test your knowledge of earthquakes by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

description: To the Editor:

title: Psychologists, the Pentagon and Unethical Interrogations
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:
