description: To the Editor:

title: A Judges Rebuke of Immigration Detention
description: Children do not belong in prison. The mass detention of families offends American values, a lesson this country learned long ago at Manzanar, Tule Lake, Heart Mountain and the other Japanese-American internment camps of World War II.

title: My Question for the Republican Presidential Debate
description: If I got to ask one question of the presidential aspirants at Thursdays Fox Republican debate, it would be this: As part of a 1982 transportation bill, President Ronald Reagan agreed to boost the then 4-cent-a-gallon gasoline tax to 9 cents, saying, When we first built our highways, we paid for them with a gas tax, adding, It was a fair concept then, and it is today. Do you believe Reagan was right then, and would you agree to raise the gasoline tax by 5 cents a gallon today so we can pay for our highway bill, which is now stalled in Congress over funding?

title: Where Should a Poor Family Live?
description: If its goal is to move up the ladder, where should a poor family live? Should federal dollars go toward affordable housing within high-poverty neighborhoods, or should subsidies be used to move residents of impoverished communities into more upscale  and more resistant  sections of cities and suburbs with better schools and job opportunities?

title: How to Really Defend Planned Parenthood
description: WHY does the pro-choice movement so often find itself in a defensive crouch?

title: The Voting Rights Act at 50
description: For the first 48 years of its existence, the Voting Rights Act  signed by President Lyndon Johnson 50 years ago this week  was one of the most popular and effective civil rights laws in American history. Centuries of slavery, segregation and officially sanctioned discrimination had kept African-Americans from having any real voice in the nations politics. Under the aggressive new law, black voter registration and turnout soared, as did the number of black elected officials.

title: Who Will Fund the M.T.A.?
description: New York States Metropolitan Transportation Authority has said that it needs $29.8 billion in capital spending over the next five years if the nations largest mass transit system  the network of trains, buses and subways that supports New York City and its suburbs and serves 15.2 million people  has any real hope of improvement. The question, as always, is where this money will come from.

title: Verbatim: The Ferguson Case
description: By now, most Americans have heard of Ferguson, Mo.: on Aug. 9, 2014, a white police officer, Darren Wilson, shot an unarmed black teenager, Michael Brown, on a street in that suburb of St. Louis. One year later, the word Ferguson has become indelibly linked to the charged conversation about racial justice in the United States. Like many Americans, I followed the case and ensuing protests, absorbing a barrage of commentary from news sources and my social networks. And yet as the months wore on, and the officer was not indicted, I realized that I (perhaps like many others), was never clear on the details: What exactly happened in Ferguson the day Mr. Brown was shot?

title: Verbatim: The Ferguson Case
description: This short video juxtaposes the reenacted testimony of two key witnesses in the shooting of the unarmed black teenager Michael Brown by a police officer in Ferguson, MO.

title: Verbatim: Grand Jury Testimony in the Ferguson Shooting
description: The full grand jury testimonies from Officer Darren Wilson and Dorian Johnson.

title: The Future of Voting Rights
Kerry Urges Beijing to Halt Actions in South China Sea
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  With tensions mounting over Chinas land reclamation projects in disputed South China Sea waters, Secretary of State John Kerry urged his Chinese counterpart on Wednesday to halt problematic actions in the area to provide an opportunity for diplomacy, a senior State Department official said.

title: News Qs | With Halo 5, Microsoft Seeks to Lure E-Sports Players Back
description: Note: Weve updated 6 Qs About the News for the new school year. This feature, now known as News Qs, will be a daily mini-lesson, with both Before Reading and After Reading questions, and a suggested activity for going further. Let us know what you think.

title: Runion Debris Is Almost Surely From Flight 370, Officials Say
description: PARIS  Investigators and the families of those who were aboard Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 now have what they have sought for more than a year  the first tangible trace of the vanished airplane.

title: Living in the Financial District
description: The neighborhood is undeniably crowded during rush hour and around tourist hubs, but quiet corners can be found.

title: The Financial District: A Neighborhood With Two Faces
description: Sara Benda remembers when the Financial District didnt feel like a neighborhood. That was eight years ago, when she moved there shortly before giving birth to twins.

title: Gary Rivlins Katrina: After the Flood
description: New Orleanians have been hearing it for 10 years now: Hows New Orleans doing? Is it back? Is the Lower Ninth Ward ... O.K.? The questioner takes the tentative, commiserating tone one might use to inquire about a friends infirm grandmother who, at last report, had been moved to hospice. The local, sighing, responds tersely: New Orleans is doing terrifically and terribly. Its back but different and currently undergoing a furious transformation. Much of the Lower Ninth Ward is not O.K. But each of these answers requires a book-length footnote. If you really want to know how New Orleans is doing, you have to ask different questions.

title: Were Still Here Ya Bastards, by Roberta Brandes Gratz
description: When I first lived in New Orleans, during the spring of 2005, the unfinished work of Reconstruction was much on my mind. An obelisk near the Mississippi River commemorates a revolt against the Reconstruction government led by former Confederate soldiers. Half a mile away, where Canal Street meets North Rampart, Id wait at a bus stop among people going home post-shift  hotel chambermaids and kitchen workers in their black-and-white checkered pants  waiting to be carried away from the citys hallucinatory core to the New Orleans that lay beyond, a city whose racialized inequality was so entrenched it masqueraded as the natural order of things. During a public forum on gentrification at the historic St. Augustine Church, people spoke of being under siege. A neighbor told me, If you cut the ground here, it will bleed black.

title: How to Vacation Like Its 1999
description: Lets take a road trip back in time to, say, 1999.

title: In Sea of Memorial Patches, a Former Mets Owner Sinks From Sight
description: When Nelson Doubleday Jr. died in mid-June, the Mets honored him with a short statement and a moment of silence.

title: The Kansas Experiment
description: When I think of my uncle Gene, I think of a man who, late into the night at a particularly boisterous family wedding, would flatten his palms against the dance floor, extend his body parallel to the ground and then begin to undulate his legs and torso in a move known as the worm. Or I think of how, even later that same evening, he would agitate for a midnight meal at a diner in west Wichita, Kan., called the Golden Bell. Or of how, in his more abstemious workaday life, he left the family business  a small bank based in Colwich, a town of about 1,000 people in south-central Kansas, where he grew up alongside my father and 11 other siblings  so that he could expand a chain of pizzerias, which grew to include 48 franchises in five states.

title: Real Estate Investment Aided by Ponzi Scheme Could Recoup Victims Money
description: MONTAUK, N.Y.  With the ocean roaring in front of them, guests relaxed under white umbrellas on a recent summer afternoon here. Stacked against a hill behind them were the villas and cottages of the Panoramic View, the beneficiary of one of the most audacious frauds in Long Island history.

title: Push for Retribution in Egypt Frays Muslim Brotherhood
description: CAIRO  A veteran leader of the Muslim Brotherhood was so alarmed by the rising calls for violence from the groups youth that he risked arrest to urge the movement to stay peaceful.

title: Brooklyn Sites Get $2.6 Million to Undo Hurricane Sandys Toll
description: Hurricane Sandy isnt over yet.

title: A Year Later, Ferguson Sees Change, but Asks if Its Real
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  Brianna West stepped before the judge as her daughter Morgan, 3, fidgeted beside her. Ms. West had waited weeks to get this case behind her, facing citations that included failure to comply with a police officer. She worried about steep fines, even jail time, on charges she felt were baseless. But the hearing brought relief.

title: Former First Lady of South Korea Visits Pyongyang in Good-Will Trip
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The 92-year-old widow of Kim Dae-jung, the South Korean president who championed political reconciliation with North Korea, arrived in Pyongyang, the Norths capital, on Wednesday amid cautious hopes that her trip might help thaw relations between the two countries.

title: Choosing the Right Running Shoes
description: Many runners may be wearing the wrong shoes for their particular stride or the right shoes that were chosen for the wrong reasons, according to a new scientific review about running shoes and injury risks.

title: Trains Derail in Indias Madhya Pradesh, Killing Dozens
description: NEW DELHI  At least 29 people were killed when two trains derailed at a flooded river crossing in central India, and rescuers were still searching for survivors, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Wednesdays Digest: A New Christmas Cruise, and Other Resort News
description: Our weekday morning digest that includes information about cruises, resorts and theme parks, with deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Dozens Killed as Trains Derail in India
description: Railway authorities attributed the deadly accident to monsoon rains, which they said had washed soft soil away from under the tracks.

title: Q. and A.: Calais Has Become Flashpoint in Europes Migrant Crisis
description: Thousands of migrants have crowded into a makeshift camp near the port city of Calais, France, close to the entrance to the tunnel underneath the English Channel.

title: New York Today: Sinking In
description: Good morning on this sun-speckled Wednesday.

title: Standard Chartered Profit Fell 37% in First Half
description: LONDON  The British bank Standard Chartered said on Wednesday that its profit declined 37 percent in the first half of the year, as the lender reshapes its business under the leadership of William T. Winters, its new chief executive.

title: Ungrounded
description: When I was 14, my family moved into a house that was basically a big wooden box perched on the side of a mountain. At my new school, I became The Girl in the House on Stilts. Despite this minor celebrity, there were certain perils to living in a house that didnt touch the ground, the foremost being its sway in a powerful storm.

title: Today in Politics: Commotion Over Ad-Libbed Remarks Fills Divide Between Two Jebs
description: Good Wednesday morning from Washington, where all eyes are on Thursdays Republican debate now that the lineup has been finalized. Jeb Bush is among those who made the cut, but on Tuesday, he rekindled some concerns about his propensity for off-the-cuff remarks that often require subsequent clarification.

title: Wedding in Berlin Finally Has Its Moment
description: At a Berlin dinner party, few punch lines used to be as reliable as naming the citys Wedding neighborhood as the next big thing. This working-class area has been trumpeted as up-and-coming since the Berlin Wall came down 26 years ago. But at last this 3.5-square-mile district is showing signs of delivering on that promise.

title: The Cost of Natural Disasters
description: Every year, natural disasters cost the United States billions in insured losses. In 2014, the figure reached $25 billion. Which disasters are the most common, and what do they cost?

title: Is It Wrong If a Friend Sells My Hand-Me-Downs?
description: I have two small children and am frequently divesting our household of toys, clothes and other child supplies. I sell the larger items, but I typically give the smaller items away to a neighborhood parent or leave them in a box in front of my house to be taken for free. A friend on my block recently indicated that she takes much of what we leave out, and Ive since offered her first pick before leaving the remaining items outside. I was happy to do so, as she has two children a bit younger than mine, and I considered it a worthwhile gesture to share what we no longer need with her, despite the fact that she is of similar economic status and likely doesnt need our castoffs. She recently held a stoop sale, and I recognized a very large number of the items that were formerly ours on display for sale. Am I wrong to see this as somehow inappropriate? I recognize that a gift means Im not free to question what the receiver does with it, but this has changed the way I feel about her and the prospect of putting out other items in the future. Am I wrong to feel that she should have passed on these items to others? NAME WITHHELD, BROOKLYN

title: Assessing Tom Bradys Stock in the Fashion World
description: If we accept as a given in the fashion/celebrity complex that public figures sell clothes (and cars and cookies)  that their carefully constructed image transfers itself to the stuff that surrounds them, along the way suggesting that if we get that stuff, too, we might be more like them  does it then follow that the obverse is true? That the tarnishing of public figures tarnishes that which is associated with them, too?

title: A Mess of Clams
description: The hard-shell is the king of the clams, a clam merchant named Archie M. Clock told the New Yorker writer Joseph Mitchell in 1939. They were sitting on Clocks battered old sloop, the Jennie Tucker, out on the wind-ruffled waters of the Great South Bay, off Islip and Babylon, on Long Island. Mitchell was there to report on the harvest of the hard-shell littleneck and cherrystone clams that then dominated the shellfish sections of New York restaurant menus.

title: Whats Left of the Voting Rights Act?
description: My cover story in the Aug. 2 magazine details the half-century-long arc of the Voting Rights Act, from its passage as a signal accomplishment of the civil rights movement to the ultimately successful campaign to eradicate its strongest provisions at the Supreme Court in 2013. During my reporting I became particularly interested in the federal court challenge to North Carolinas sweeping new voting law, which showed how the Supreme Courts decision gutting key provisions of the law had immediate consequences in some states.

title: Zimbabwe Court Postpones Trial of Guide in Killing of Cecil the Lion
description: The trial in Zimbabwe of Theo Bronkhorst, the professional hunter accused of failing to prevent the killing of Cecil, a 13-year-old lion, was postponed on Wednesday until Sept. 28, after a request from his lawyer.

title: 8 Awkward Wet Hot American Looks, Explained
description: Leslie Schilling, the costume designer for the new Netflix series Wet Hot American Summer: First Day of Camp, discusses the shows most memorable looks.

title: Classical Music This Week: The Festival Circuit, Blackness at the Met and Reynaldo Hahn
description: Tumbleweeds have been drifting in the classical music section of The New York Times newsroom, as our critics have spread far and wide to bring you reports from the broad world beyond the city.

title: Donald Trump and the G.O.P. Debate: Policy Is Not His Point
description: He announced a foolproof plan to destroy the Islamic State, but said, Im not going to tell you what it is tonight.

title: New Bishop in China Signals Hope for Relations With Vatican
description: HONG KONG  Amid tight security, Chinas Catholics have consecrated their first new bishop in three years, signaling a possible thawing in tension between the Vatican and Beijing.

title: Rand Paul Is Faulted in Ad Over Previous Calls for Iran Talks
description: An outside group that sought to mar Senator Rand Pauls presidential campaign kickoff with a television advertisement linking him to President Obamas Iran policy is going on the air with a new spot about the candidate and the recent nuclear deal.

title: Orphans Essay Sets Off Debate About Poverty in China
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Hiroshima Marks 70 Years Since Bombing
description: Participants lay on the ground in silence in front of the Hiroshima Peace Memorial a day before the 70th anniversary of the worlds first nuclear attack.

title: Times Have Changed: Senior Version
description: Dear Diary:

title: Barrel Bombs, Not ISIS, Are the Greatest Threat to Syrians
description: GAZIANTEP, Turkey  As the self-proclaimed Islamic State, or ISIS, commits horrendous videotaped executions, it might seem to pose the greatest threat to Syrian civilians. In fact, that ignoble distinction belongs to the barrel bombs being dropped by the military of Syrias president, Bashar al-Assad. The Islamic State has distracted us from this deadly reality.

title: What You Get for $2,000,000
description: Water views in Georgia, Connecticut and Minneapolis

title: $2,000,000 Homes inSavannah, Minneapolis and Connecticut
description: SAVANNAH, GA.

title: Halsey, With Badlands, Is Moving Fast to Share a Secret Language
description: It was one thing for Ashley Nicolette Frangipane, a kid from New Jersey, to have 14,000 friends on MySpace at age 14 and 16,000 subscribers on YouTube at 18. But its quite another for Halsey, Ms. Frangipanes pop-star alter ego, to have taken that innate 21st-century talent for self-presentation  not to mention songwriting  from her bedroom to arena stages in a mere year since signing with a record label.

title: A Five-Bedroom 1927 Townhouse in a Suburb of Brussels
description: The house, in Uccle, south of the city, is on the market for $3.2 million.

title: House Hunting in Belgium
description: A FIVE-BEDROOM TOWNHOUSE IN A SUBURB OF BRUSSELS

title: Daily Report: E-Sports Continues to Reshape Gaming Landscape
description: Video games used to be such a simple business. You bought a console (say, an Xbox), you bought a game at your local big-box retailer ($46 for Halo: Combat Evolved at Wal-Mart), and you went on your merry way  spending hundreds of hours glued to a TV screen, blasting away at the bad guys.

title: Morning Agenda: Puerto Ricos Next Debt Problem
description: PUERTO RICOS NEXT DEBT PROBLEM | The Puerto Rican government quietly disclosed on Monday afternoon that it had stopped making contributions of $92 million a month into a fund used to make payments on $13 billion in bond debt, Mary Williams Walsh writes in DealBook. A small payment from the fund is due on Sept. 1 and unlike the bond payments that went into default on Monday, these are general obligation bonds. Puerto Rico had issued such bonds over the years to raise money for government projects, with a guarantee in the islands constitution that the bonds would be paid.

title: There is No Pro-Life Case For Planned Parenthood
description: Im hoping to do something broader about the abortion issue in this space soon, given the prominencethat the debate over Planned Parenthood fundinghas suddenly assumed.But for this week aword (well, a few words) on the argument in this Dana Milbank column, which was also basically the argument in this earlier Milbank column, which is also roughly the argument in this Ruth Marcus column, which is also the argument in this Damon Linker column,which is also a case that Slates Will Saletan has made repeatedly in the past, which  well, you get the idea. The claim theyre all making, in different ways,is that even though Planned Parenthood performs hundreds of thousands of abortions every year (while lobbying constantly against any restriction on the practice), to oppose channeling public dollars to its family planning operations is to be objectively pro-abortion, because those operations objectively prevent many more abortions still.

title: Right to Be Forgotten Online Could Spread
description: More than a year ago, in a decision that stunned many American Internet companies, Europes highest court ruled that search engines were required to grant an unusual right  the right to be forgotten. Privacy advocates cheered the decision by the European Court of Justice, which seemed to offer citizens some recourse to what had become a growing menace of modern life: The Internet never forgets, and, in its robotic zeal to collect and organize every scrap of data about everyone, it was beginning to wreak havoc on personal privacy.

title: Tim Blanks Joins the Industry Website The Business of Fashion
description: Fashions never-ending game of musical chairs, a nonstop roundelay of personnel moves, tends to confine itself to those who create, rather than observe, fashion. Designers shuffle; those who file into the stands season after season to see their shows, less so.

title: Review: Lets Be Less Stupid, a Distracted Meditation on Absent-Mindedness
description: When you need something short and funny to read, it helps to have a few old journalistic favorites on standby. Mine include Dave Barrys seminal Miami Herald piece Can New York Save Itself? and a Guardian article from 2002 in which the writer, Tim Dowling, was forced by his editors to spend a night in a trench in his backyard.

title: No, Giving More People Health Insurance Doesnt Save Money
description: In 2014, an estimated  nine million people became newly insured thanks to Obamacare.

title: Floyd Mayweathers Choice of Andre Berto Excites Few
description: Floyd Mayweather Jr. has named the final opponent in his storied career. But the general reaction to his announcement has been resigned disappointment.

title: Report Finds Wide Diversity Gap Among 2014s Top-Grossing Films
description: The numbers are stunning: From 2007 through 2014, women made up only 30.2 percent of all speaking or named characters in the 100 top-grossing fictional films released in the United States. Thats bad enough to repeat: For every 2.3 male characters who say Dude, there is just one woman saying, Hello?!

title: 1890: Push for President to Resign
description: BUENOS AYRES, Aug. 5  Having failed to obtain a single Opposition Minister, President Celman has offered the city all kinds of privileges, including practical autonomy. The populace, sullen and menacing, refuse everything except the Presidents resignation. The officers of the regiments that recently fought on opposite sides have fraternized and declare that in future the troops will not fight against each other. The naval opposition officers have been quietly permitted to resume their commands in the fleet. The situation here is unprecedented and almost incredible.  The New York Herald, European Edition, August 6, 1890

title: Jeb Bush on Funding for Womens Health
description: Jeb Bush, the Republican presidential candidate, said on Tuesday that he would cut off federal funding for Planned Parenthood if elected to the White House.

title: A Spread of Spanish Snacks at Despaa
description: Despaa Brand Foods, in Jackson Heights, Queens, ships its chorizo all over the world. On Saturdays, it sets out samples of sausage and cheese for customers.

title: Britain Charges Anjem Choudary, Radical Preacher, With Aiding ISIS
description: LONDON  The radical preacher Anjem Choudary, some of whose followers have joined the Islamic State, was charged by the British authorities on Wednesday with inciting support for the organization.

title: Travel Diary
description: Photos of the designer Adi Gil in South Sinai.

title: Staging Passion Play for 200 Years, Italians Become More Than Merely Players
description: SORDEVOLO, Italy  The horses were skittish. The microphones occasionally went silent or screeched shrilly. Phones in the audience trilled a little too often.

title: From a Spanish Shop in Queens, Chorizo Thats Out of This World
description: It is true that theres a SoHo branch of Despaa Brand Foods, a chic and airy boutique on Broome Street. But to get the full sense of Despaa, you have to visit the original outlet in Queens, where the chorizo has been made for four decades.

title: Kids in the Kitchen: No-Knead Bread for All Ages
description: Who wouldnt want children who can be independent in the kitchen, able to prepare a few healthy meals and snacks and with the confidence to tackle a new recipe or task? In our Kids in the Kitchen series, Motherlodes KJ DellAntonia and Cookings Margaux Laskey work toward that long term goal with their very differently aged families. Margaux finds ways for her 3-year-old and toddler to help cook, while KJ stands back and coaches her two 9-year-olds and her 11 and 14-year-olds in cooking on their own. This week, both families tried simple bread-making.

title: Summer in Iraq: Beneath the Heat and Abaya and a Flak Jacket Too
description: BAGHDAD  It was August 2004 in Najaf, in southern Iraq. Off to the west past the edge of town, the desert shimmered like a sea. In the streets, mud brick and cinder block magnified the heat. I was too busy to check the temperature, but at midafternoon, it was likely heading toward 120 degrees Fahrenheit.

title: Egypts President Leads Celebration of New Suez Canal
description: CAIRO  An image of President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt triumphantly piloting a ship full of smiling Egyptians appears Wednesday on the cover of the state-owned newspaper Al Akhbar al Youm to mark the successful excavation of what he has called a new Suez Canal. Really, it is a new channel, parallel to about a third of the existing canal, intended to reduce shipping bottlenecks.

title: Turkeys Push Into War Is Seen as Erdogans Political Strategy
description: ISTANBUL  Confronted with widespread protests two summers ago, Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan ordered a harsh police crackdown and tarnished the demonstrators as traitors and spies. Faced with a corruption inquiry focused on his inner circle, he responded by purging the police and judiciary.

title: Shanice Williams to Play Dorothy in NBCs Live Version of The Wiz
description: Shanice Williams will have some big silver shoes to fill. NBC announced Wednesday that she will play the lead role of Dorothy, made famous by Diana Ross in a 1978 film, in the networks live version of The Wiz. Following on the heels of NBCs live The Sound of Music in 2013 and Peter Pan in 2014, The Wiz will air Dec. 3.

title: Kerry Washingtons Colorful, All-Paisley Layers
description: The Star: Kerry Washington

title: A New Action Camera, Born From a Cycling Crash
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In 2012, a Brazilian software engineer named Bruno Gregory and a friend went for a bicycle ride in the hills of the East Bay, where Mr. Gregory was living. With a GoPro camera on one of their bikes recording the ride, a car mowed into the two cyclists, sending them hurtling to the pavement.

title: Spotifys Content Chief Moves to Online Video Start-Up Pluto TV
description: Spotify is losing a top executive to Pluto TV, a start-up in the fragmented and competitive world of online video.

title: 1965: U.S. Jobless Rate at New Low
description: WASHINGTON  The unemployment rate dropped to an eight-year low in July and President Johnson pledged today that his administration would try to cut it further. The Labor Department announced that unemployment fell to 4.5 percent of the working force last month from 4.7 percent in June. It attributed the drop to the heavy hiring of teenagers, young men, and adult women. Employment jumped sharply to a record high of 74,854,000. There were 1.1 million more at work in July than in June and 2.4 million more than in July a year ago. Mr. Johnson said he was extremely pleased.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, August 6, 1965

title: James Lecesne of the Trevor Project, Inhabiting Lives and Saving Them
description: Late in the first episode of Caitlyn Jenners documentary series I Am Cait, Ms. Jenner visits the family of Kyler Prescott, a 14-year-old transgender boy who committed suicide in May. Its so hard for young people, Ms. Jenner says. They cant see the future, and because of that they become extraordinarily desperate and suicide becomes an option. We have to do something about that.

title: A Real Adventure: Sorting Out All the F.K.T.s (Fastest Known Times)
description: When a man named Brett Maune completed Californias 223-mile John Muir Trail in record time in 2009, crushing the previous mark by many hours, he was surprised to be greeted mostly by online doubters.

title: Blocking a PCs Webcam
description: Q. I never use the built-in webcam on my PC laptop. Is there a way to deactivate it in case I ever get infected with any malware that tries to use the camera?

title: Guerrilla Girls, Going and Going
description: Thirty years after the feminist activists began, the Guerrilla Girls are still going. Their identities remain a secret but their fight for equality in the art world still attracts legions of fans.

title: Cheryl Boone Isaacs Re-Elected President of Motion Picture Academy
description: LOS ANGELES  Cheryl Boone Isaacs was elected to a third one-year term as president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences on Tuesday, the Academy said. Academy presidents may serve up to four consecutive years under the groups rules, and have typically been re-elected by its governors if they choose to return.

title: Style, Substance, and The Donald
description: Just about the entire political commentariat has been caught completely flatfooted by Donald Trumps durable front-runner status; he was supposed to collapse after being nasty to St. John McCain, but nothing of the sort happened.

title: The Guerrilla Girls, After 3 Decades, Still Rattling Art World Cages
description: When youve spent 30 years wearing a gorilla mask, as the women known by the aliases Frida Kahlo and Kthe Kollwitz have, certain behavior becomes second nature. So there were Kahlo and Kollwitz, two of the pseudonymous founding members of the Guerrilla Girls, the activist, feminist art collective, preening and posing at their 30th anniversary party and retrospective in May. They sipped prosecco through straws (their gorilla lips wouldnt allow much more) at the Abrons Arts Center on the Lower East Side, while guests gazed at walls lined with the posters protesting elitism and bias that first shook the art world in the 1980s. Do Women Have to Be Naked to Get Into the Met Museum? one provocatively asked. The Guerrillas name tags identified them as pioneering dead female artists (like Alice Neel, the portraitist, or Zubeida Agha, the Pakistani modernist) whose legacies they hope to continue.

title: S.E.C. Approves Rule on C.E.O. Pay Ratio
description: The chief executive of General Electric raked in a $37.3 million pay package last year, a large sum by any standard.

title: A Virtual Reality Film Festival Becomes a Reality
description: Would you like to be in a movie? How about inside a movie? A new film festival focused solely on virtual reality projects will give audiences that opportunity. The inaugural Kaleidoscope VR Film Festival, announced by organizers on Wednesday, will go on a 10-city tour and will feature a variety of virtual reality films by independent filmmakers. It will start Aug. 22 in Portland, Ore., and move on to San Francisco and Los Angeles, among other cities. It comes to New York on Oct. 6.

title: National Museum of Dance to Honor Mark Morris, Nureyev and Chita Rivera
description: Three titans in the world of dance will be honored by the National Museum of Dance at its annual gala Saturday in Saratoga Springs, N.Y.

title: Verbatim: Obama Says Iran Deal Is Good for America
description: President Obama, making the case for a nuclear agreement with Iran, in a speech at American University.

title: Obama Drafts Order on Paid Sick Leave for Federal Contractors
description: WASHINGTON  Stymied by Republicans in Congress, President Obama has drafted an executive order to force any company that contracts with the federal government to issue paid leave to employees who are sick, are seeking medical attention or need to care for a sick relative.

title: Today was the first day tourists can take photos at White House.
description: Our videographer shot on Snapchat

title: Katie Ledecky Claims Third Gold Medal at World Championships
description: KAZAN, Russia  In the middle of the pool on Wednesday was Federica Pellegrini, who took ownership of the 200-meter-freestyle world record in 2008 and has shooed away dozens of squatters in the ensuing years.

title: Obama Defends Iran Deal in Speech
description: President Obama delivered remarks on Wednesday about the Iran nuclear deal at American University, where President John F. Kennedy delivered a speech in 1963 on nuclear diplomacy.

title: Liquefied Natural Gas Makes Qatar an Energy Giant
description: RAS LAFFAN, Qatar  The temperature hovered around 100 degrees on the jetty here, where a set of pipes were connected to a giant red-hulled ship. But the moisture in the air froze on the pipes and flaked off, creating snowlike flurries on the early summer evening.

title: Qatars Liquid Gold
description: In 2014, Qatar produced more than a third of all liquefied natural gas, which is chilled to minus 260 degrees.

title: Hundreds of Migrants Rescued After Boat Capsizes Off Libya
description: ROME  An overcrowded fishing boat carrying migrants to Europe capsized on Wednesday, apparently after being approached by a rescue vessel a few miles off the coast of Libya. Rescuers saved 400 people, though 25 died when the boat overturned, and another hundred were feared to have drowned, Italian officials said.

title: Babies Who Couldnt Wait a New York Minute
description: A girl born at the new World Trade Center transit hub on Tuesday joins a parade of New York babies whose first glimpse was of something more interesting than a hospital maternity ward.

title: Fare Thee Well? Not Quite: 3 Members of Dead Uniting Again
description: The surviving members of the Grateful Dead closed the curtains on their long, strange trip in July. But this fall three of them will be back: Bob Weir, Mickey Hart and Bill Kreutzmann will play at Madison Square Garden, in a concert titled Dead & Company, on Oct. 31.

title: Clintons Recent Criticisms of Bush
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, a Democratic presidential candidate, has openly criticized Jeb Bush, Republican presidential candidate, at several recent appearances.

title: Moving Into a Shipping Container, but Staying Put
description: Living in a shipping container? Its not something Scott Crosby had imagined for his family of five.

title: 36 Hours in Provence
description: Provenal pleasures: Exploring the gastronomy, cultural spaces and sun-soaked beauty of Arles and Avignon.

title: Rand Paul Aide Indicted on Charges of Hiding Payments
description: A supporter and former close adviser to Senator Rand Paul has been charged with hiding secret payments to secure the endorsement of an Iowa lawmaker during the 2012 presidential campaign of the senators father, former Representative Ron Paul, the Justice Department said on Wednesday.

title: Its Either Iran Nuclear Deal or Some Form of War, Obama Warns
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama took on critics of the nuclear deal between Iran and six world powers in an aggressive speech on Wednesday, saying they were the same people who created the drumbeat of war and played on public fears to push the United States into the Iraq war more than a decade ago.

title: Three Reasons to (Still) Visit Puerto Rico
description: Puerto Rico faces a potentially crippling financial crisis that is drawing comparisons with Greece. Weve asked travel experts to share their perspective on how the crisis will affect the islands $7 billion tourism industry. So if youre planning a trip to Puerto Rico, here are three things to keep in mind.

title: 36 Hours in Provence
description: Exploring Provences vast, rugged sprawl can be exhilarating  and daunting. From the salt marshes of the Camargue to storybook hilltop villages like Gordes to the lively Mediterranean city of Marseille, the famously picturesque French region offers an array of landscapes and experiences that could take months to uncover. Where to start? Arles and Avignon. Just 20 minutes apart by train, the Roman-era town of Arles and the medieval walled city of Avignon enfold a dense mix of architectural beauty, world-class art, sun-soaked Provenal gastronomy and Unesco World Heritage sites. Toss in ambitious new cultural spaces, a hint of urban cool and a high-speed rail link with Paris (about three hours away), and the result is a southern French smorgasbord that can be devoured in a weekend.

title: Bank of America Starts to Pull Clients Money Out of a Paulson Fund
description: John A. Paulson, the billionaire investor who rose to fame betting against the housing market bubble, is having a rocky 2015. And at least one major investor may have had enough.

title: Revisiting Ferguson
description: The strangest thing about returning to write about Ferguson, Mo., almost a year after the death of Michael Brown, the black teenager who was fatally shot by a white police officer, was how ordinary the place looked.

title: The Key Numbers in the California Wildfires
description: Dozens of wildfires have burned tens of thousands of acres in California and prompted the evacuation of entire communities. The fires are part of a regional phenomenon of severe drought and heat that has gripped the West.

title: Pope Francis Urges Priests to Welcome Remarried Catholics
description: ROME  In brief remarks on Wednesday, Pope Francis offered a comforting word for divorced Catholics and their children, urging priests to welcome and foster these families with doors wide open.

title: Departing German Prosecutor Defends Treason Inquiry Against Bloggers
description: MNSTER, Germany  Germanys outgoing federal prosecutor defended his decision to open a treason inquiry against two journalists, saying on Wednesday that an independent assessment he had ordered supported the domestic intelligence agencys claim that the journalists publication of an official document, on April 15, violated a state secret.

title: Manslaughter Charges for Construction Managers After Queens Worker Dies in Pit Collapse
description: With construction-related deaths and injuries on the rise, prosecutors announced on Wednesday that manslaughter and other charges were being brought against two construction managers and the companies they worked for in the April death of a worker at a Lower Manhattan building site.

title: Eleanor Roosevelt Is Top Choice for the $10 Bill, Poll Finds
description: Eleanor Roosevelt, who spent 12 years in the White House as first lady and traveled the world as a human-rights advocate, is the front-runner for the new face of the $10 bill, according to a poll.

title: Diving Headfirst Into the Internet of Things
description: Just because you can do something, does it mean you should?

title: New Poll Shows Mayor de Blasios Support Has Eroded
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio has stumbled to the worst net approval rating of his tenure, according to a poll released on Wednesday, placing his popularity with New York City voters well behind that of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo  his counterpart in a protracted municipal feud.

title: Can You Make an Awesome Burger at Home? Yes, You Can
description: Have questions about recipes, cooking and food? Thats what Im here for. Inquire at foodeditor@nytimes.com. Ill answer what I can.

title: Jebs Guacamole Bowl, Hillarys Beer Koozies: The Best of 2016 Campaign Merchandise (So Far)
description: The race to the presidency is often full of missteps, intense scrutiny and gaffes that go viral. It is also full of campaign swag.

title: Significant Other Looks at Friendships That End at Marriage
description: Theres just over a week left to see one of the summers most charming plays, Joshua Harmons Significant Other, running through Aug. 16 at the Roundabout Theater Companys Laura Pels Theater.

title: Clip: Kahlil Gibrans The Prophet
description: A segment from the film animated by Bill Plympton.

title: Malaysian Premier Discusses Flight 370
description: Prime Minister Najib Razak announced Thursday in Kuala Lumpur that the wing flap found on Runion Island last week had been confirmed as coming from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370.

title: Daniel Loebs Third Point Takes a Big Stake in Baxter
description: Last year, the hedge fund magnate Daniel S. Loeb prevailed in a number of prominent corporate challenges, including one over Sothebys, the famed auction house.

title: Alvin Ailey Season Will Feature World Premiere From Robert Battle
description: Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater will present the first world premiere from Robert Battle since he became the companys artistic director.

title: A New Throwback Joint From the Cabin Down Belows Jesse Malin
description: The East Village nightlife entrepreneur and musician Jesse Malin has a fondness for the neighborhoods bygone, coarser days. Now, the area is filled with rising rents and Pilates studios, but the little empire of hip haunts Malin has helped to build below 14th Street  Black Market, the Bowery Electric, Niagara, Lovers of Today, Dream Baby and the Cabin Down Below, the intimate clubhouse-like bar just off Tompkins Square Park  pay homage to the neighborhood of 40 years ago. And Malins obsessive interest in creating auras of New York authenticity (or, at least, the closest approximation 2015 can offer) is likewise demonstrated in Berlin, the small club he opened last Tuesday on Avenue A.

title: Adidas Acquires Runtastic, a Maker of Fitness Apps and Devices
description: Interest in the companies that make wearable technology is heating up as more consumers use their devices.

title: Estate of Man Exonerated in 1992 Murders Sues New York City and Police
description: Tiffany Wilson had just turned 6 when her brother Sharrif, 15, was arrested. He and another teenager were convicted of murdering the other teenagers mother, 12-year-old sister and another girl. All of the victims had been stabbed then strangled with electrical cords.

title: For His Next Adventure, a Rothschild Explores Fashion
description: On a warm day in London, David de Rothschild, an heir to a centuries-old banking fortune, was pointing at a butterfly with translucent blue wings.

title: Following Netflix, Microsoft Sweetens Parental Leave Benefits
description: SEATTLE  Microsoft said on Wednesday that it would offer new parents an additional eight weeks of paid time off from their jobs at the company, in a significant boost to its parental leave benefits.

title: Richard Matt, New York Prison Escapee, Was Intoxicated When He Died, Police Say
description: Richard W. Matt, the prison escapee who was shot and killed by a federal agent in June, had a blood alcohol content of 0.18 percent when he died, more than double the level that would make him legally intoxicated, the New York State Police said on Wednesday.

title: Bears Feeding at Katmai National Park
description: Explore.orgs cameras filmed bears fishing for salmon at Katmai National Park in Alaska.

title: Edie Campbell Conjures Fashions Dark Side
description: The model heads to the moors of Scotland to summon the Highland gothic spirit.

title: Egyptian Militants Tied to ISIS Threaten to Kill Croatian Hostage
description: CAIRO  Egyptian militants affiliated with the Islamic State extremist group have threatened to kill a hostage from Croatia within 48 hours unless the Egyptian government releases female prisoners, according to a video released Wednesday.

title: Shaun the Sheep Movie: Designing the Characters
description: The filmmakers behind Shaun the Sheep Movie used comedy and quirkiness in designing its stars.

title: The International Answers to Uber and Lyft
description: THE business of paying to travel from A to B by car is being shaken up by companies like Uber and Lyft, with both grabbing headlines and new investment dollars as their businesses expand. Last week, Uber garnered an additional $1 billion or so in new funding from investors including Microsoft.

title: How Much Is a C.E.O. Worth? Americas Confused Approach to Pay
description: Do corporate chief executives make too much money, or too little?

title: Pictures of the Day: United States and Elsewhere
description: United States and More  Pictures of the Day

title: 1945: Hiroshima Hit by Atomic Bomb
description: Seventy years have passed since the bombing of Hiroshima, which was followed by the bombing of Nagasaki three days later. Warfare had gone nuclear. Below, our coverage of the event and of the immediate aftermath.

title: August 5, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from the United States, France, Nepal and Myanmar.

title: Woman Behind #ILookLikeAnEngineer Says Campaign Against Gender Stereotypes Is Long Overdue
description: What started as an employee recruitment campaign has become a social media movement for women aiming to break stereotypes in the tech industry.

title: California Fire, Aided by Drought, Defies Tactics to Defeat It
description: LAKEPORT, Calif.  As firefighters on Wednesday embarked on their sixth day of battling the largest of the many wildfires that have flared across the state, fire officials said the Rocky Fire, which has grown to consume nearly 70,000 acres here in the northern reaches of wine country, was still nowhere near under control and may not be until perhaps Monday.

title: Obama Takes On Opponents of the Iran Deal
description: President Obama on Wednesday made a powerful case for the strong and effective nuclear agreement with Iran. In a speech at American University, he directly rebutted critics like Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel and rightly warned of the damage to global security if the Republican-led Congress rejects the agreement.

title: Money, Lust and Kung Fu: Shaolins C.E.O. Monk Is Under Fire
description: DENGFENG, China  Incense drifting through ancient cedars. Saffron-robed monks, limbs a blur of movement, making quick work of imagined enemies. The boing of a giant bronze bell calling the faithful to prayer.

title: App Smart | Catch a Cab Overseas
description: While a few taxi apps work on a global scale, there are options in the world.

title: Days of Selling Popular College Players Jerseys Seem Numbered
description: Last year, any Ohio State fan could buy an officially licensed Buckeyes football jersey bearing No. 97. Though N.C.A.A. rules prohibit colleges from selling jerseys with players names on them, Ohio State fans understood what a scarlet jersey with a white 97 meant: a tribute to the star defensive end Joey Bosa, who wears the number when the Buckeyes play.

title: Canceling Deal for 2 Warships, France Agrees to Repay Russia
description: MOSCOW  France has reimbursed Russia for two warships that were never delivered after economic sanctions imposed against Russia last year blocked the deal.

title: The Proms, BBCs Classical Music Festival, Is All the More Important as Austerity Looms
description: LONDON  Classical music has been part of the British Broadcasting Corporations mission since its early years. In 1927, when the BBCs first royal charter  dedicated it to education and entertainment, the corporation also took over the Henry Wood Promenade Concerts. That music festival, dating to 1895, has been under the BBCs stewardship ever since, barring a brief wartime interlude.

title: A Woman on the $10 or the $20 Bill?
description: A new poll out on Wednesday shows that 27 percent of Americans would like to see Eleanor Roosevelt on the $10 bill and about 17 percent want Harriet Tubman. Sacagawea came in third with 13 percent and Susan B. Anthony and Amelia Earhart each had 11 percent.

title: Temporary Tattoos, Now for Grown-Ups, Too
description: At a Friday night cocktail party early this year at the auction house Christies, some 400 prospective buyers in their 30s and 40s were checking out the old masterworks up for auction, including Caravaggio, a pair of Canalettos and a sketch by Rubens. But the art that drew the most fuss from the collectors was free: temporary tattoos that echoed the paintings for sale, including demons by a follower of Hieronymus Bosch and the monogram-like signature of Albrecht Drer.

title: Disney, Time Warner and Other Media Shares Fall as Investors Worry About TVs Future
description: If ESPN is having trouble, is the rest of television burnt toast?

title: Obamas Full Speech Defending Iran Deal
description: The president gave remarks on the Iran nuclear deal at American University.

title: At Calliope, Beautiful Things for Beautiful, Moneyed People
description: On certain summer days, making your way through downtown New York feels less like walking than doggy-paddling through steamed milk. The air is weighty. The streets are filmy. Puddles of sinister-looking water proliferate near the curb.

title: Pope Speaks on Divorced Catholics
description: Pope Francis called upon the Catholic church on Tuesday to be more welcoming of divorced people who remarry.

title: The Enemy
description: A primal lesson in aggression.

title: A George Benjamin Exacting Storm in Opera Comes to Mostly Mozart
description: If theres one description that persistently attaches to the music of George Benjamin its fastidious: a word that doesnt promise much for a career in opera, where grand, sweeping gestures tend to count for more than careful details. Opera is a rough-and-tumble business. Mr. Benjamin is, in the nicest way, exquisite.

title: Donald Trump and Bill Clinton Chatted by Phone Before Trump Announced Candidacy
description: Shortly before Donald J. Trump kicked off his presidential campaign, he had a genial phone conversation with former President Bill Clinton, but the two apparently did not discuss the race itself or Hillary Rodham Clintons bid for the Democratic nomination.

title: Hiroshima Atomic Bomb Survivors Pass Their Stories to a New Generation
description: HIROSHIMA, Japan  Hiromi Hasai was being trained to make machine gun bullets when the flash from the atomic bomb that destroyed his city lit up the already bright morning sky. Just 14, he had been pulled from school a week before to help Japans failing war effort.

title: Best Is Still to Come in Pearson Breakup
description: The best chapter of Pearsons breakup is yet to be written. Selling a 47 percent stake in the book publisher Penguin Random House to the co-owner Bertelsmann might generate twice as much as The Financial Times, which the British company sold to Japans Nikkei for 844 million pounds ($1.3 billion) last month. Pearsons chief executive, John Fallon, can unshackle himself from the publisher of Fifty Shades of Grey as early as October, when a lockup ends. Yet it makes sense to wait.

title: Texas ID Law Called Breach of Voting Rights Act
description: A federal appeals panel ruled Wednesday that a strict voter identification law in Texas discriminated against blacks and Hispanics and violated the Voting Rights Act of 1965  a decision that election experts called an important step toward defining the reach of the landmark law.

title: Value of Iran Sanctions Relief Is Hard to Measure
description: A principal argument opponents raise against the nuclear agreement with Iran is that it would release at least $100 billion in impounded funds that Tehran could then use for attacks against the West and others. But exactly how much money the Iranians would actually receive and how they would use it, should the accord survive, remain difficult and unresolved questions.

title: At Glimmerglass Festival, The Magic Flute Is Among the Reimagined
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y.  No, Vivaldis Cato in Utica is set not in Utica, N.Y., some 40 miles to the north of here, but in the ancient North African city of that name. Mozarts The Magic Flute, on the other hand, is set in the woods virtually next door.

title: Reddit Sets New Content Policy, Banning Some Racist Communities
description: Reddit, the popular community news site, formalized a new set of guidelines that aim to restrict some of the risqu and potentially offensive content posted to the site.

title: Shooting Suspect Killed in Tennessee
description: A police spokesman said the suspect in an attack at a movie theater in Antioch, Tenn., a suburb of Nashville, was shot dead by the police.

title: Review: Revive Music Marries Jazz and Hip-Hop
description: REVIVE MUSIC

title: Complete Video of Obamas Case for the Iran Deal
description: As my colleague Julie Hirschfeld Davis reports, President Obama on Wednesday cast the debate over the deal to constrain Irans nuclear program as a choice between diplomacy and some sort of war.

title: Review: Dej Loaf Releases #AndSeeThatsTheThing
description: DEJ LOAF

title: Spain Says Bankers Seized Picasso Will Head Back Home
description: PARIS  To the Spanish authorities, Picassos 1906 Head of a Young Woman is a unique painting, the only example in Spain from a pivotal period in the artists life. Because of that status, the courts labeled it a national treasure that should not be sold outside the country.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Catch up on the days top stories.

title: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Tesla Motors Trims Delivery Outlook, Sending Stock Down
description: Even as Tesla Motors painted a better-than-expected financial picture in announcing its second-quarter earnings on Wednesday, it warned of fewer car deliveries for the year, sending the stock tumbling.

title: Review: Joshua Beamish Takes On Challenges Within Couples, in 4 Takes
description: Do major ballet companies commission new works by committee, or does it just seem that way? Depending on the year, certain choreographers  lately Liam Scarlett and Justin Peck are suddenly everywhere. But what about all the others plugging away? The Joyce Theater plays host to several in its two-week Ballet Festival, which began Tuesday with Joshua Beamishs MOVE: the company.

title: Review: Swing That Music, Effortless Fun in a Tribute to Jazz Forerunners
description: The secret of serious fun is not to take it too seriously, especially if it involves playing jazz. That attitude is something that the easygoing singer and saxophonist Danny Bacher, who appeared with a small swing band at the Metropolitan Room on Tuesday evening, knows in his bones. It is about making hot music but staying cool, about cutting up while maintaining effortless self-control, about having a blast with friends. And at his performance of Swing That Music, a homage to the era of jumpin jive with a dollop of Dixieland, Mr. Bacher conflated the music of three Louises  Armstrong, Jordan and Prima  in a concert revealing him to be a prodigiously talented musical preservationist.

title: Los Angeles Agrees to Overhaul Jails to Care for Mentally Ill and Curb Abuse
description: LOS ANGELES  After disclosures of routine prisoner abuse by the Los Angeles County Sheriffs Department  where jailers were found to break prisoners bones and sexually humiliate them  a settlement was announced Wednesday with the Justice Department in which the county will submit to sweeping reforms of its jail system, with the goals of improving the care of mentally ill inmates and curtailing abuse by deputies.

title: The Pop Singer Borns Is on the Threshold to Tomorrow
description: Age 23

title: Review: Vail International Dance Festival Celebrates Meter
description: VAIL, Colo.  Every August, the Vail International Dance Festival, high in the Rockies here, presents an impressive collection of world premieres: ballet, modern dance and other genres. While theres no scenery (except the mountains), most performances are accompanied by live music. And most of the dancers and choreographers are well known  often from New York.

title: Yahoo Tweaks Email to Make Search More Personal
description: SUNNYVALE, Calif.  Searching email is generally an exercise in frustration.

title: When Architecture Meets Pop Culture (Kanye West Included)
description: For a serious architect who has designed public housing in Dallas and a bridge in Slovenia, it may come as a surprise that Oana Stanescus best-known work is a 50-foot-high volcano that Kanye West ascended onstage during his grandiose Yeezus tour.

title: Ex-Detective Going to Jail for Role in Manhattan Biker Assault
description: An undercover New York police detective who joined a gang of motorcyclists as they attacked a driver and his family in Upper Manhattan was sentenced to two years in jail on Wednesday.

title: Midcentury Chic at Loosie Rouge, in Williamsburgs South Side
description: For longtime Williamsburg denizens, the areas North Side now feels like a grim Mad Max wasteland patrolled by clean-cut conquistadors in hipster Halloween costumes. Seeking cooler climes, the neighborhoods holdouts now huddle in a South Side oasis along Broadway, just south of the Williamsburg Bridge, where new spots like Loosie Rouge have cropped up around the stately century-old street.

title: The Cultivists Top 12 International Hidden Art Gems
description: The art startups founders and colleagues share sights that havent been Instagrammed to death.

title: Martin OMalley Accuses D.N.C. of Favoring Hillary Clinton
description: Martin OMalley, who is struggling to gain traction in the Democratic presidential contest, accused the Democratic National Committee on Wednesday of tipping the scales in Hillary Rodham Clintons favor by limiting the number of debates to six.

title: Chrysler Posts a 3% Drop in Profit After $90 Million Fine
description: DETROIT  Fiat Chrysler Automobiles said on Wednesday that profits at its American subsidiary fell 3 percent in the second quarter, primarily because of a record civil penalty against the company for violating federal safety laws.

title: Lena Dunham Survives to Party in the Hamptons
description: Lena Dunham looked at ease in a mod Lisa Perry dress as she greeted guests last Saturday night at the fourth annual Hamptons Paddle & Party for Pink fund-raiser.

title: Boxings Faces, Old and New
description: The sport is drawing a fresh wave of gymgoers hungry for a serious, old-school workout, save for the body blows.

title: A History of Drag Queen Culture in New York City, Told Through Images
description: Linda Simpson documented performers during the scenes 80s and 90s boom.

title: The Accidental Historian of Drag Queens
description: Long before RuPauls Drag Race made cross-dressing a televised form of mainstream entertainment, there was the drag boom of the 1980s and 90s, when a burgeoning New York club scene was filled with drag performers who perfected the art form.

title: Four Cool New(ish) Summer Surf Breaks
description: You dont have to own a quiver of boards or a vintage Volkswagen Westfalia to head out on an old-school surfari this season. A quick flight and a few phone calls to surf schools and hotels will put you on the best waves of your life. Listed here are the greatest quick hits for an endless summer.

title: Shopping Events and Sales Happening This Week in New York
description: Whats up, Doc? This week, Moschino opens a New York boutique in SoHo. There youll find all manner of Looney Tunes-themed items from the designer Jeremy Scotts fall collection, like a Bugs Bunny sweater dress ($895), a Tweety Bird bucket bag ($950) and a Daffy Duck iPhone 6 case ($75) to celebrate your inner child. At 73 Wooster Street.

title: Bill Plympton Lends His Animation Skills to Kahlil Gibrans The Prophet
description: Since the late 1970s, Bill Plympton has been creating shorts and features that use hand-drawn animation to explore adult themes, like relationships and sexuality. That was the case with his recent film Cheatin  which looked at difficulties in a relationship with a fever-dream kind of style. He has also collaborated with recording artists including Kanye West on music videos and has drawn some of the opening couch gags for Simpsons episodes. His contributions to anthology projects included a segment in the film The ABCs of Death 2 and The Animation Show, a compilation put together by Don Hertzfeldt and Mike Judge.

title: Photographs Most Muscular
description: Beyond the glistening muscles and dramatic poses, Brian Finke wanted to get at the spirit and personalities of competitive bodybuilders.

title: Summertime Musts
description: Barely-there dresses that can segue into a new season with the right layers, an accessory from Simone Rocha thatll fix a bad hair day and more.

title: Photographs Most Muscular
description: Brian Finke wanted to go beyond the glistening muscles and dramatic poses and get at the spirit and personalities of competitive bodybuilders.

title: Fox, Topping Projections, Reports a Tough Quarter
description: LOS ANGELES  Reporting its first quarterly results since Rupert Murdoch stepped aside as chief executive, 21st Century Fox revealed a mixed picture on Wednesday: Profits beat expectations, but were down nonetheless, as broadcasting trouble, lower movie revenue and higher sports costs cut into cable-affiliate growth.

title: New Hampshire: A Vote Against Planned Parenthood
description: Officials on Wednesdayvoted against funding health centers operated by Planned Parenthood of Northern New England. New Hampshires Executive Council voted, 3 to 2, to reject contracts that would have provided the organizations centers in the state with about $638,000 over two years, roughly one-third of the public funding for the centers, which is primarily federal. Planned Parenthood, whose centers provides reproductive health services that sometimes include abortion, has been under fire after an abortion opponent released undercover videos showing its officials discussing fees for fetal tissue donation. Lawmakers elsewhere have also called for funding cuts.On Monday, Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana announced that his state would terminate its Medicaid contract with the organization.On Wednesday, the councilors in New Hampshire approved contracts for three other reproductive health service providers.

title: Charles Goldstein, Lawyer Who Helped Find Looted Art, Dies at 78
description: Charles Goldstein, a high-stakes New York real estate lawyer who transformed himself into a tenacious advocate for recovering art looted from Holocaust victims, died on July 30 in Manhattan. He was 78.

title: Jon Stewart, Sarcastic Critic of Politics and Media, Is Signing Off
description: On Thursday night 10 presidential candidates will spill onto a stage in Cleveland, and the already crowded Republican primary race will begin in earnest with the first day of debates, live on Fox News.

title: Red Sox Quickly Go From Lifting Trophy to Raising Doubts
description: Another member of the brotherhood left the family just before game time on Wednesday. Daniel Nava, an outfielder on the Boston Red Sox 2013 championship team, was claimed on waivers by Tampa Bay. The Red Sox cut him last week, when he was hitting .152.

title: Qatars Liquid Gold
description: In 2014, Qatar produced more than a third of all liquefied natural gas, which is chilled to minus 260 degrees.

title: U.S. Imposes Sanctions on 2 Qataris for Qaeda Ties
description: The United States imposed sanctions on two Qatar-based financiers on Wednesday for what it described as their support for Qaeda extremists in Syria, Pakistan and Sudan.

title: Companies See Benefits in Publicizing Pay Ratios
description: While chief executives generally prefer not to say how much more money they make than their typical employee, some have found it advantageous to do just that.

title: Fox News Moderators Look for Ways to Keep 10 Candidates on Their Toes
description: CLEVELAND  Just over 24 hours before the first Republican primary debate here, more than a dozen Fox News executives and producers gathered Wednesday with their debate moderators  Bret Baier, Megyn Kelly and Chris Wallace  backstage at Quicken Loans Arena for a final run-through of logistics.

title: High Diving, a Crowd-Pleasing Sport, Pursues an Olympic Platform
description: KAZAN, Russia  It makes no sense that the International Olympic Committee voted Beijing, a city devoid of snow, to be a Winter Games host but has resisted inviting high diving into the Summer Olympics. The mens high diving event on Wednesday at the FINA world championships, won by Britains Gary Hunt, was more entertaining than puppy videos on YouTube.

title: De Blasio, Facing Criticism, Is Taking On Homelessness With $22 Million Initiative
description: The question has leapt from dinner parties to community boards to the nightly news, its implications echoing in the highest echelons of City Hall: Why are there so many homeless people in New York?

title: Bronx Mans Death From Legionnaires Disease Gives Family Cause to Worry
description: Carmelo Quiles was a man of routine. He did not live with his wife anymore, but he rode two buses every day to see her. No later than 9 a.m., he would knock on the door of her brick house in the South Bronx and call her name through the window to let her know he had arrived for his daily visit.

title: Bob Timmons, 91, a Demanding Coach Who Developed a Star Runner, Is Dead
description: Bob Timmons, a former wartime Marine whose rugged brand of coaching helped Jim Ryun become Americas most celebrated mile runner of the 1960s, died on Tuesday in Lawrence, Kan. He was 91.

title: Bernie Sanders to Visit Liberty University, a Rare Venue for a Democratic Campaign
description: Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont will address a convocation next month at Liberty University, the evangelical school where the firebrand Senator Ted Cruz kicked off his own presidential campaign.

title: High Emotion at Aurora Shooting Trial as Families Share Stories of Lives Cut Short
description: CENTENNIAL, Colo.  Through three months of testimony and deliberation, the 12 people killed inside a Colorado movie theater have existed as little more than names and faces, glimpsed mostly through their final actions before an armor-clad gunman walked in and started shooting one night in July 2012.

title: Cybersecurity Bill Is Latest to Be Delayed in Senate
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate headed into its August recess on Wednesday without voting on a cybersecurity bill, adding it to a contentious to-do list for September that includes a push to disapprove the Iran nuclear deal and a spending fight mired in abortion politics.

title: Seeing Likely Nominee, Hillary Clinton Hits Jeb Bush Hard
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton has very noticeably and intensely trained her sights on a single rival candidate for president: Jeb Bush.

title: Senate Report Cites I.R.S. Mismanagement in Targeting of Tea Party Groups
description: WASHINGTON  A Senate committee on Wednesday closed a two-year investigation with unanimous agreement that mismanagement at the Internal Revenue Service led it to improperly target conservative groups seeking tax-exempt status. But a report by the panel did not suggest that any laws were broken, and Republicans and Democrats were divided over whether White House politics was behind the problems.

title: We Write to Taste Life Twice
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Ah, cross-referenced clues. For some solvers, they are the bane of existence, while others just dont care. I highly doubt that anyone loves them, because they have a tendency to interrupt a good solving flow.

title: Louis Sokoloff, Pioneer of PET Scan, Dies at 93
description: Dr. Louis Sokoloff, who pioneered the PET scan technique for measuring human brain function and diagnosing disorders, died on July 30 in Washington. He was 93.

title: Luis Severino, in a Loss, Shows the Yankees What Theyve Gained
description: His preparations complete, Luis Severino left the bullpen and made his way across the outfield grass toward the first-base dugout. Soon, he would take the mound in a major league stadium for the first time. As he made that walk, he reflected on what the moment meant.

title: OSHA to Propose Beryllium Limit in the Works Since 1975
description: After decades of delay, federal workplace regulators on Thursday proposed a sharply lower limit for exposure to beryllium, a widely used industrial mineral, which is linked to a deadly lung disease.

title: Draft of an Executive Order for Paid Sick Leave
description: President Obama has written, but not released, an executive order that would force any company that contracts with the federal government to issue paid leave to employees.

title: Bill Cosby Ordered to Testify in Second Sexual Assault Case
description: Bill Cosby will be questioned under oath in October in a second case involving accusations that he sexually assaulted a young woman, a judge said on Wednesday.

title: Police Say Brooklyn Sergeant Had Sex With Underage Girl
description: A New York police sergeant was arrested in Brooklyn on Wednesday on charges that he had sex with an underage girl he had met online in 2007, the authorities said.

title: Jets Linebacker Carries New Load as Fullback
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Like many players in high school, Julian Howsare started on both sides of the ball, though for college he had to choose. The coaches at Clarion University projected him as a defensive end, so that was where he played, demoralizing quarterbacks with an array of speed rushes and spin moves.

title: Most Americans Support South Carolinas Removal of Rebel Flag, Poll Says
description: A majority of Americans support South Carolinas decision to remove the Confederate battle flag from its State House grounds, while a third of Americans oppose the move, according to a national survey released on Wednesday.

title: Mexicans Arent Buying Official Account of El Chapo Escape
description: MEXICO CITY  When Mexicos most powerful drug lord, Joaqun Guzmn Loera, escaped from prison last month, he walked out of captivity and straight into the conspiracy-obsessed imaginations of his countrymen, who are willing, it seems, to believe almost anything except what their government tells them.

title: Marlins Erupt, With Six Runs in Final Inning, but the Mets Avert a Meltdown
description: MIAMI  The Mets entered the bottom of the ninth inning Wednesday with an 8-0 lead. Matt Harvey had just put in a sterling performance: six strikeouts, two hits and no runs in seven efficient innings. Their offense, powered by recent additions, had hammered the Marlins pitching for 12 hits. The Mets were an inning away from a day off, nine strikes from their second straight series sweep.

title: Anniversary of Hiroshima and Nagasaki Revives Debate Over the Atomic Bomb
description: Did the United States have to drop the bomb?

title: A Sergeant Is Laid to Rest
description: The funeral for Frank Musella, 37, a New York City sanitation officer who died on the job, was held in Brooklyn on Wednesday.

title: Aerial Artistry
description: Competitors at the world high diving championships in Kazan, Russia, entertained crowds from heights of up to 27 meters, about 89 feet.

title: Word of the Day | levee
description: levee  \le-ve; l-ve, -va\  noun

title: Ackman Amasses 7.5% Stake in Snack Company Mondelez
description: The activist investor William A. Ackman has built up a $5.5 billion stake in Mondelez International, the maker of Oreo cookies and Cadbury chocolate, in a bet that the food company may be a target as the industry consolidates.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 6:25 P.M. (Flix) FLIRTING WITH DISASTER (1996) Mel Coplin (Ben Stiller), a worker at the American Museum of Natural History and a new father, goes in search of his biological parents with the help of Tina (Ta Leoni), an adoption agency employee, and encounters a succession of oddballs in this comedy from David O. Russell. Patricia Arquette (above right, with, from left, Josh Brolin, Ms. Leoni, Mr. Stiller and Richard Jenkins) plays Mels wife, who is just getting her sexual footing back after the birth of their son and doesnt like Tinas flirty ways. Mary Tyler Moore plays the mother who raised Mel. She nags a lot and likes to show off her body. I want you to consider my age and ask yourself how I maintain this, she declares, lifting her sweater. Writing in The Times, Janet Maslin called the film a wonderfully mad odyssey of a movie, adding that thanks to this filmmakers fine comic acumen, the payoff is always there. In The Secret Life of Walter Mitty (2013), at 8 on Cinemax, Mr. Stiller, who also directed this adaptation of the James Thurber short story, stars as Walter, a dutiful drone in the photography department of Life magazine, who finds himself in a caper beyond his wildest imagination when the negative for the publications final print edition goes missing. Kristen Wiig plays the crinkly-nosed co-worker on whom Walter has a crush; Adam Scott is the leader of the new tech-jerk bosses who have Walters job on the line; and Sean Penn is the mysterious photographer behind Walters travels to Iceland, Afghanistan and other stunning far-off places. Though it is a celebration of modesty, there is also quite a lot of vanity in The Secret Life of Walter Mitty, A. O. Scott wrote in The Times. There is also a contradiction: An ordinary fellow should not have to be quite so special to win our admiration.

title: Corrections: August 6, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, August 6, 2015
description: A lot of pent-up frustration has now really come forward, and that doesnt get well in 12 months.

title: Photographs Most Muscular
description: In Brian Finkes photographs of the bodybuilding world, almost everyone and everything is ripped  even the trophies. Many of the men and women boast layers upon layers of muscles stacked like bricks, their thighs rippling with cuts and their bodies glowing from orange dye. Muscles are abundant, clothing is not: glittery bathing suits, thong-like performance suits and the occasional pair of heels.

title: Student Crossword | The Food Pyramid
description: Test your knowledge of the food pyramid by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Elliott Sells Shares of Samsung C&T After Losing Merger Battle
description: HONG KONG  The activist hedge fund Elliott Associates has sold shares in Samsung C&T, the South Korean construction company, after Elliott failed to block an $8 billion merger with another Samsung affiliate, Cheil Industries.
