title: SFX Entertainment Is Back on the Block
description: SFX Entertainment, a company devoted to electronic music festivals, is back on the block after a brutal week on the stock market and a failed takeover bid by the companys founder, the media executive Robert F. X. Sillerman.

title: Yemeni Government Faces Choice Between a Truce and Fighting On
description: SANA, Yemen  After five months of war in which more than 4,000 people have been killed, Yemens government, exiled in Saudi Arabia, faces a fateful decision: leverage recent battlefield gains to negotiate a cease-fire with a weakened Houthi rebel movement, or try to rout the rebels once and for all.

title: FIFA Official Agrees to Extradition, Just Not to U.S.
description: A FIFA official indicted by the United States on corruption charges has agreed to be extradited, but not to the United States. The official, Julio Rocha, the former president of the Nicaraguan soccer federation, consented to be extradited from Switzerland to Nicaragua, Swiss officials said Friday.

title: Kidnapping and Sex Slavery: Covering ISIS Religious Justification for Rape
description: Rukmini Callimachi has told the stories of those held as prisoners of the Islamic State before. This week, her front-page article detailed the kidnapping, enslaving and ISIS-sanctioned rape of women and girls from the Yazidi religious minority.

title: Rescued Firefighter Describes His Ordeal
description: Zhou Ti, a firefighter who was rescued from the site of two enormous blasts in Tianjin, China, spoke Friday from the hospital where he was being treated.

title: Post-Katrina, Vietnamese Success
description: IT has been 10 years since Hurricane Katrina struck New Orleans, and in the Vietnamese enclave of Village de lEst, a neighborhood in a remote eastern corner of the city that was extensively flooded, there are now bustling restaurants, tidy homes with well-tended lawns and brisk street traffic. Much of the surrounding area, by contrast, still seems to be struggling.

title: Bill Cunningham | Summer Madness
description: Its mid-August in New York City and suddenly everyone is in black, white or gray.

title: Bill Cunningham | Summer Madness
description: Its mid-August and suddenly everyone is in black, white or gray. The glittering skyline is full of dreams and the Holly Golightlys are having breakfast at Tiffanys. A poodle pranced by in a pearl necklace. These scenes capture the exuberance and the magic of the city at the end of summer.

title: U.S. Is Poised to Oppose Freeing Guantnamo Hunger Striker
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has decided for now to fight any court-ordered release of a detainee at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, who has been on a hunger strike since February 2007 and now weighs less than 75 pounds, according to officials familiar with internal deliberations.

title: Chinese Independent Filmmakers Look to Locarno Festival
description: LOCARNO, Switzerland  Thanks largely to financing by a university teacher, Bi Gan was able to make his first feature film, Kaili Blues, an elliptical story about a mans family relationships and his journey through the lush rural hilltowns of Guizhou Province in China. He even received approval from official censors. But its art house techniques and narrative style guarantee a minuscule Chinese audience.

title: Airbnb Horror Story Points to Need for Precautions
description: Early in the evening of July 4, Micaela Giless mobile phone started sounding alerts, and a series of messages straight out of a horror movie began scrolling down her screen.

title: F.B.I. Tracking Path of Classified Email From State Dept. to Hillary Clinton
description: WASHINGTON  F.B.I. agents investigating Hillary Rodham Clintons private email server are seeking to determine who at the State Department passed highly classified information from secure networks to Mrs. Clintons personal account, according to law enforcement and diplomatic officials and others briefed on the investigation.

title: Jukely App Offers Unlimited Concert Tickets, With Limits
description: The term pivot has become almost as much of a clich in tech circles as disrupt. It describes the way that many young start-ups change their approach to business, recycling elements of an initial idea and using them to pursue something new. Pivoting often suggests a last-ditch attempt to salvage a failing start-up. But sometimes, the strategy can turn a business thats simply chugging along into one with more staying power.

title: Review: Brothers ... Blood Against Blood, Set in the Mean Streets of Mumbai
description: Fighter, are you ready?

title: U.N. Rights Experts Urge Iran to Free Washington Posts Jason Rezaian
description: United Nations human rights experts added their voices Friday to the pressure on Iran to release the Washington Posts Tehran reporter, Jason Rezaian, calling his year-old imprisonment and closed trial a violation of international law and press freedom.

title: Revised Program Will Reduce Student Loan Repayments
description: MORE student loan borrowers are expected to gain access this year to a repayment plan that cuts monthly debt payments to a small share of their income.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Jennifer Granholm, ex-Michigan Governor, Takes On New Role Supporting Hillary Clinton
description: Jennifer M. Granholm, the former governor of Michigan, will leave the big-money super PAC supporting Hillary Rodham Clintons presidential candidacy and take a role with another outside group backing Mrs. Clinton.

title: A Bustling Beach Market
description: At Red Horse Market, famous patrons are outshined by the hand-made mozzarella.

title: Mo Rocca Finds Calm in the Kitchen in My Grandmothers Ravioli
description: Its a frenetic time on the culinary TV front. On Wednesday, the Food Network rolled out Camp Cutthroat, a Cutthroat Kitchen spinoff competition show advertised with the tagline This time, were playing with campfire. On Thursday, Destination Americas BBQ Pit Wars reached the finale of a grueling season of cross-country grilling. Next Tuesday, the Season 2 premiere of the amusing truTV show Hack My Life has a segment on cooking lasagna in a dishwasher.

title: 1896 | Without Fear or Favor
description: Political madness has surely gripped the nation when a Fox News journalist publicly embraces a 119-year-old guiding principle of The New York Times, as Megyn Kelly did this week by vowing  Donald Trumps taunts notwithstanding  to continue doing my job without fear or favor.

title: Mozzarella for Big Cheeses at an East Hampton Market
description: Unlike other East Hampton haunts treasured by affluent summer people for their beachy, low-key vibe, Red Horse Market bustles with productivity. The produce is arranged like a Flemish still life, women in equestrian garb demand to know the provenance of the grass in the grass-fed beef, and the Kardashian sisters once fought on camera in this small shop. Its patrons are a devoted lot.

title: Pictures of the Day: Cuba and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Cuba, China, Japan and Greece.

title: Mylans Bid to Buy Perrigo Is Complicated by Opposing Declarations
description: Mylan appeared on Friday morning to hit a significant hurdle in its quest to buy a fellow drug maker, Perrigo, when an influential advisory firm recommended that investors vote down the pursuit.

title: Quenching a Thirst for Tacos in the Rockaways
description: It looked at one point that the Rockaways, the beachy peninsula in southern Queens, home to firefighters, midlevel Wall Street guys and armies of sun-seeking Brooklyn hipsters, was headed toward a taco-less summer. Late in March, the news slipped out that Andrew Field and David Selig, the co-owners of Rockaway Taco, had parted ways over business plans and that their ramshackle joint on Beach 96th Street would not return this season. But then, Mr. Selig decided to take a food-truck version of Rockaway Taco across the country, and Mr. Field made plans to move his own new venture, Tacoway Beach, onto the premises of the Rockaway Beach Surf Club on Beach 87th Street. Showing no sign of the hostilities, Tacoway Beach was booming recently, filled with a ruddy, beer-drinking crowd that included two newlywed (or newlywed-ish) couples.

title: Aug. 14, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photographs from Cuba, China, Japan and Greece.

title: Review: From La Otra Orilla, Flamenco Without Flounces at Jacobs Pillow
description: BECKET, Mass.  For about 10 fairly good minutes of Moi & Les Autres, the four performers of La Otra Orilla (The Other Coast) share the stage in equal measure and at close quarters: the dancer Myriam Allard, the guitarist Caroline Plant, the percussionist Miguel Medina and the vocalist Hedi Graja. Flamenco rhythms and sonorities pour forth.

title: Orbitz Offers Vacation Packages by App
description: Reflecting a major shift in travel planning, Orbitz.com, the web-based travel company, now offers vacation packages in its mobile application. With a few taps, users can purchase combined flight and hotel packages on the app and view their total savings before they complete any sale.

title: Bill Cunningham | Period Pieces
description: On Mr. Cunninghams Evening Hours page this week, a weekend of vintage dancing that took place at Nahant, Mass.

title: Evening Hours | Period Pieces
description: A weekend of vintage dancing took place at Nahant, Mass. The three-day event, which benefited the Nahant Historical Society, was originally created 25 years ago as a Viennese dance by Katy and Ben Bishop at the urging of Ms. Bishops mother, the Viennese-born Olli Heil. RoAnn Costin lent her familys 1867 seaside home for the gala and the Edwardian tea dance. Most guests wore period clothes for the dance at the Costin house, which has a ballroom and billiards room.

title: Efforts to Preserve Henry Varnum Poors House and Its History Have Stalled
description: CLARKSTOWN, N.Y.  The rambling stone cottage here where the artist Henry Varnum Poor created his ceramics and his paintings and other artworks now held at major museums around the country is called Crow House, perhaps because of the birds that circled overhead when Poor designed and built it, by hand, nearly 100 years ago.

title: You Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Paul Kalkbrenner, a Techno Star, Rises From Berlins Clubs
description: The German techno producer Paul Kalkbrenner is not just a famous musician in his home country  hes also a movie star (Berlin Calling, 2008) and a folk hero, having taken his minimal electronic compositions from the Berlin underground to a performance last year for a half-million people at the 25th anniversary of the Berlin Walls crumbling.

title: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Review: Mother of the Maid, a Lesson on Raising a Teenage Saint
description: LENOX, Mass.  Teenage saints  and yes, religious history records the existence of such improbable phenomena  are apparently not so unlike other teenagers. Theyre moody, rebellious, impulsive and prone to intense crushes on glamorous, inaccessible idols. They also love, loathe and are deeply embarrassed by their parents, who spend sleepless nights fretting over their wayward and baffling progeny.

title: A South Bronx Graffiti Walkabout
description: For the first @nytimes Instameet, a group of photographers descended upon Hunts Point to see bold murals and hidden gems.

title: U.S.-Led Air Campaign Is Linked to Civilian Deaths in Syria
description: ANTAKYA, Turkey  An airstrike by the American-led military coalition in northern Syria this week killed eight civilians, including two women and five children, according to neighbors and relatives of the dead.

title: Mail Theft, With a Milk Carton and Some Glue
description: The young man approached a mailbox on a dark corner in the Bronx. It was a Tuesday in November 2013, almost 4 a.m. He carried two tools: a milk crate and a crushed milk carton on a string. The carton was very sticky, covered in glue from rattraps.

title: The Mystery of San Marzano
description: Beware the tomato that masquerades as a true Italian.

title: Internet Hoax on Downing of Malaysian Jet Spreads in Russia
description: In the immediate aftermath of the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 over rebel-held, eastern Ukraine last year, Ukraines intelligence agency released what it said was audio from intercepted phone calls between separatist leaders and Russian military intelligence officers, in which the militants appeared to acknowledge shooting down a civilian plane by mistake.

title: Yankees to Honor Alex Rodriguezs 3,000th Hit With a Ceremony in September
description: TORONTO  The once frigid relationship between Alex Rodriguez and the Yankees has turned downright cuddly. The latest example came Friday when the team announced it would celebrate Rodriguez reaching the 3,000-hit plateau by holding a day in his honor at Yankee Stadium.

title: Abandoned Cars Are a New York Memory
description: Abandoned cars were a fixture on the New York landscape from the 60s to the early 90s. A look back in The New York Times photo archive shows a city all but gone from memory.

title: Volkswagen and Mazda Recall Over 600,000 Vehicles
description: Volkswagen and Mazda are recalling about 613,000 vehicles, several years after the automakers changed parts on new vehicles to fix the possible loss of steering or failure of airbags, according to documents filed with the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. The automakers decided on a recall after the federal regulators opened investigations this year. The automakers said they were not aware of any accidents or injuries related to the problems. Volkswagens recall covers about 420,000 vehicles because the drivers-side airbag may not deploy properly in a crash. They are the 2010-13 Eos and Jetta, the 2011-14 Golf GTI, the 2010-14 Passat and Tiguan and the 2010-14 CC. Mazda is recalling 2007-14 CX-9 family vans in some states because rust on a front suspension part could cause the loss of steering.

title: Man Is Released After 34 Years in Prison; Murder Conviction Is Thrown Out
description: A man who served 34 years in prison for the rape and murder of a teenager in Pennsylvania has been freed after new DNA analysis led a judge to vacate his murder conviction.

title: Brazil: Police Suspected in Killings of 18
description: The authorities in So Paulo said Friday that they were investigating whether police officers were involved in a series of execution-style killings that left at least 18 people dead. The shootings were carried out by gunmen wearing balaclavas during a span of about three hours on Thursday night in the metropolitan area of So Paulo, Brazils largest city, according to video images captured on security cameras and witness accounts. When we get to the suspects, whether they are police or not, well act quickly to detain them, Alexandre de Moraes, the top security official in So Paulo State, told reporters. He said investigators were examining whether the killings were reprisals for the recent shooting deaths of two police officers. The killings added to concern among human rights groups over a spate of similar episodes in Brazil that have left dozens dead in other cities, including Manaus and Belm. Police officers killed at least 2,212 people in Brazil in 2013, though the actual number of such killings around the country is thought to be much higher because some states do not report them.

title: Richard S. Ross, Johns Hopkins Dean and Watergate Walk-On, Dies at 91
description: Dr. Richard S. Ross, an innovative cardiologist and medical school dean who encouraged prospective doctors to pursue broader undergraduate education, and who earlier had the distinction of examining Richard M. Nixon during the Watergate investigation, died on Tuesday at his home in Baltimore. He was 91.

title: Retaliation at the Clinton Prison in Upstate New York
description: To the Editor:

title: How the F.B.I. Uses Facial Recognition Analysis
description: To the Editor:

title: Tracking Police Use of Force
description: To the Editor:

title: Defending the N.F.L. Settlement of a Concussion Suit
Saving Cecil the Lions Brethren
description: To the Editor:

title: Hedge Funds Shed Shares in Alibaba and Baidu in Second Quarter
description: As Chinas stock market took a free fall earlier this summer, big money managers looked to sell shares of two of the largest Chinese tech companies listed in the United States  Alibaba and Baidu  during the second quarter.

title: ISIS Is Suspected of a Chemical Attack Against Kurds in Syria
description: WASHINGTON  The Islamic State is suspected of using chemical agents  said by some American officials to be mustard gas  in an attack on Kurdish fighters in northern Syria two weeks ago, United States officials said Friday.

title: Betting on a Smooth Ride, Investors Flock to Tesla
description: Tesla Motors has seemingly defied the law of financial gravity on Wall Street ever since the company began proving that electric cars could be sporty, powerful and trendy  not just green.

title: Connecticut Death Penalty Ruling Stirs Painful Memories of 3 Grisly Killings
description: CHESHIRE, Conn.  Celine Bonilla was only 11 when she looked out her first-floor window and saw police officers pinning a man down on her front lawn. It was 2007, and that man and an accomplice had just killed two of her friends and their mother, dousing them with gasoline and burning them alive in their home in what became known as one of the grisliest crimes in Connecticut history.

title: In Familiar Fashion, Giants Stumble in Preseason Opener
description: CINCINNATI  After an off-season of strategic renovations designed to restore their proud franchise, the Giants opened the preseason in a familiar bumbling manner on Friday.

title: Most Health Insurance Co-ops Are Losing Money, Federal Audit Finds
description: WASHINGTON  Most federal insurance cooperatives created under the Affordable Care Act are losing money and could have difficulty repaying millions of dollars in federal loans, an internal government audit has found, prompting the Obama administration to step up supervision of the carriers.

title: Edward Thomas, Policing Pioneer Who Wore a Burden Stoically, Dies at 95
description: When Edward Thomas joined the Houston Police Department in 1948, he could not report for work through the front door.

title: Jordan Spieth Is an Approachable Star on the Course
description: HAVEN, Wis.  Walking up a stone stairway halfway through his round on Friday, Jordan Spieth lifted his head to see his father, Shawn, waiting in his path.

title: ISIS Held Kayla Mueller, U.S. Aid Worker, as Sex Slave Before Fatal Airstrike
description: DOHUK, Iraq  Somewhere in territory controlled by the Islamic State, Kayla Mueller, an American aid worker, was chained in a room with other female captives. The leader of the Islamic State, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, would regularly enter and lead Ms. Mueller away, her parents say.

title: Many Sailors Are Not Put Off by Rio de Janeiros Polluted Waters
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Putting aside concerns over health risks to athletes, about 339 sailors from 52 countries will begin racing here Saturday on the picturesque and polluted Guanabara Bay in the second official test race ahead of next years Summer Olympics.

title: Donald Trump Called to Jury Duty in Manhattan
description: Donald J. Trump, whose bid for the Republican presidential nomination has shaken up the race, will participate in a more common civic activity next week: jury duty.

title: The Affluent Ante Up for the Presidency
description: When the Republican candidates for president expounded on what they would do for ordinary Americans in their debate this month, they neglected to mention that more than half the money underpinning their campaigns has been coming from just 130 big-spending families and the businesses they run. These families are determined to influence the election with six- and seven-figure checks.

title: Opting Out of Standardized Tests Isnt the Answer
description: An alarming 200,000, or 20 percent, of the students in grades three through eight in New York State public schools this year refused to take the states standardized tests in reading and math that are supposed to measure progress in meeting national academic standards.

title: Hillary Clinton Jokes About Emails at Fund-Raiser
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton at the Annual Wing Ding Dinner in Clear Lake, Iowa, a Democratic fund-raising event.

title: Brooklyn Man Accused of Supporting ISIS Pleads Guilty
description: A Brooklyn man accused this year of trying to join the Islamic State pleaded guilty on Friday to conspiring to provide material support to the terrorist organization.

title: Redemption as a Mark of Public Service
description: After 33 years in public office in Albany and New York City, Oliver Koppell is finally admitting to himself that the one achievement likely to be featured in his obituary is a humble state law known as the bottle bill. This was a 1982 measure that introduced 5-cent redemptions on empty beverage cans and bottles. It thereby created an unintended subculture of midnight garbage gleaners  down-and-out citizens who quietly pick bottles and cans from curbside refuse collections and cash them in for sustenance.

title: New Monitoring Program Aims to Keep Youths Out of Rikers Island
description: Youths accused of felonies will be tracked and monitored with smartphones and electronic bracelets instead of awaiting trial in jail under a new program created by the Manhattan district attorneys office.

title: Hiroshi Iwata Ties a Record, Then Takes a Star Turn
description: HAVEN, Wis.  After signing his scorecard on Friday, Hiroshi Iwata started walking toward the clubhouse. He looked surprised when he was redirected to the media center. Iwata, who is making his first major start in the United States, did not draw much notice during his opening five-over-par 77, but in the second round of the P.G.A. Championship he came tantalizingly close to making history.

title: Let Older Americans Keep Working
description: BOSTON  EVERY day, 10,000 baby boomers  Americans born from 1946 to 1964  leave the work force. Most of them have not saved enough for retirement; at least one-fifth have basically no retirement savings. Our economy has a shortage of skilled workers.

title: The Painful Lessons of the Yonkers Housing Crisis
description: IS that what all the trouble was about? Just that? a young actor asked me, sweeping her hand toward a row of cream-shingled townhouses on a leafy residential street in Yonkers.

title: Bank of America Stiffs Shareholders
description: The year 2009 was rough for the Bank of America and its chairman and chief executive, Ken Lewis. On Jan. 1, the bank closed its $50 billion purchase of Merrill Lynch, a deal Lewis had hastily negotiated the previous September, as the financial world appeared close to collapse.

title: Iconoclast Stiflers
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Ironically, the very entry that Jeff Chen found hard to fill at 20 Down was one of the last entries that went in for me, and that was only because I am so used to using click-type ballpoint pens. I cant remember the last time I used a pen with a cap, but thats on me. I might have been more likely to be the back-of-the-head recipient of a flying PEN CAP in school, not that Im bitter, Mr. Chen. But thanks for being that guy.

title: Test-Refusal Movements Success Hampers Analysis of New York State Exam Results
description: With 20 percent of eligible students sitting out the New York state standardized tests this year, even some central organizers of the opt out movement were surprised at their own success.

title: Disney Announces Its Coming Slate of Animated Films at D23 Expo
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  John Lasseter, the Walt Disney Companys top animation executive, jogged onto a stage at a sprawling Disney fan convention here on Friday and started throwing red meat to the masses.

title: Brooklyn Man Awarded $4 Million After 2009 Rooftop Fall in Police Chase
description: The impact from the fall, on Aug. 22, 2009, was undeniable: A Brooklyn man, Brian D. Martin, fell more than 30 feet to the ground, fracturing his back in several spots and shattering his left heel.

title: Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders Woo Democrats at Iowa Dinner
description: CLEAR LAKE, Iowa  The annual Wing Ding Dinner here delivered on its name Friday night, with no shortage of thrown elbows and plenty of baked ones, as four Democratic presidential candidates tried to excite a crowd of Iowa voters by attacking their Republican counterparts.

title: Raised to Be Respectful, Ikemefuna Enemkpali Lets a Dispute Get the Better of Him
description: His parents expected him to work hard, show respect and always be a man of his word, and Ikemefuna Enemkpali tried to uphold their teachings, partly rooted in their Nigerian upbringing, as he rose from high school football star to budding linebacker with the Jets.

title: Community Seeks Answers After Officers Shoot Trenton Boy
description: TRENTON  It was the start of a violent weekend in this capital city of 85,000.

title: Carlos Beltran Propels Yankees Past Blue Jays
description: TORONTO  If, at age 38, Carlos Beltran is not the player he once was, he does not think of himself as anything other than an everyday player. He sticks to the same routine before each game, 25 or so batting practice cuts from each side of the plate, just enough to keep his swing finely tuned but not so many as to wear himself out.

title: Mets Face a Truer Measuring Stick in the Pirates, and Fall Short
description: At a news conference Friday afternoon, hours before the Mets and the Pittsburgh Pirates were to begin a three-game series at Citi Field, Mets Manager Terry Collins was asked to characterize what was at stake. He made no effort to mask or minimize the significance of the weekend.

title: Showtimes Spotlight Shifts at South Bend
description: The Houston Texans are being tailed at training camp by HBO Sports and NFL Films cameras for the 10th edition of the Hard Knocks series.

title: Whats on TV Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) THE THEORY OF EVERYTHING (2014) Eddie Redmayne won an Oscar for his portrayal of the British theoretical physicist Stephen Hawking, who, as a graduate student at Cambridge intent on fathoming the origins of the universe and locating the beginning of time, learned he had amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. Felicity Jones, who earned a nomination, plays his first wife, Jane Hawking, whose memoir, Traveling to Infinity: My Life With Stephen, is the main source for James Marshs portrait of a marriage. Mr. Redmayne, hunched into a wheelchair, the muscles of his face spread into what looks like a permanent smile, must communicate his characters feelings almost entirely with his eyes, which are remarkably expressive, conveying Stephens mischievous wit as well as his intelligence, A. O. Scott wrote in The New York Times about this best picture nominee. But it is in showing the application of that intelligence that The Theory of Everything tumbles into a black hole of biopic banality. The films historical and scientific lapses have been enumerated, but taking liberties with facts is a prerogative of storytelling, he said. The greater failing is that Mr. Marsh seems unable to capture the spirit and energy of scientific inquiry.

title: Quotation of the Day: August 15, 2015
description: I feel like a 5-year-old trying to learn this stuff.

title: Corrections: August 15, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: South Korean Leader Marks Anniversary of Wars End With Warnings to North Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Park Geun-hye of South Korea on Saturday urged North Korea to stop what she called military provocations on the border, hours after the North threatened to attack loudspeakers that the South has begun using to blast propaganda messages into North Korea.

title: In China, Single Women Live by Their Own Rules
description: Single women past a certain age are called leftover women, though some are pushing back against such traditional Chinese strictures.

title: How Video Killed the Family Vacation
description: Like most parents, I imagine, I keep a running list of things Ive done well and things Ive flubbed. Help our children get lots of sleep? Check. Play fun, stimulating games at dinner? Score. Have peaceful, stress-free mornings when everyone goes into the day uplifted and on time? Hardly. Produce handsome scrapbooks with carefully captioned memories? Not a one. (We do have a few boxes labeled keepsakes.)

title: Celebrities on Scooters (Catch Them if You Can)
description: Meek Mill was in the meatpacking district last month, on the way to a photo shoot, and passers-by were understandably ogling.

title: How Celebrities Keep Their Weddings a Secret
description: A secret celebrity wedding: In the age of social media, it seems like a Hollywood oxymoron on the order of late-career comeback and no-fault divorce.

title: Sound Baths Move From Metaphysical to Mainstream
description: LOS ANGELES  On a recent Wednesday, a pregnant woman in yoga attire, a young bearded man and two 20-somethings with crystals around their necks settled themselves onto the floor of the Temple of Intuition next to the House of Intuition, a self-described metaphysical shop on a hill in the Silver Lake neighborhood here.

title: Finding Love in Her Voice
description: Victoria Clark and Thomas Reidy, who were married on Aug. 1 in Durham, N.C., found love online, with an assist or two from lyrics from songs the bride has recorded.

title: Victoria Clark and Thomas Reidy: An eHarmony, and Musical, Match
description: If one were to read between the song titles of Victoria Clarks 2008 solo album, Fifteen Seconds of Grace, it may serve as a road map to her heart.

title: Inside Amazon: Wrestling Big Ideas in a Bruising Workplace
description: SEATTLE  On Monday mornings, fresh recruits line up for an orientation intended to catapult them into Amazons singular way of working.

title: Abandoned Cars Are a New York Memory
description: In 1988, the Department of Sanitation removed 148,257 abandoned cars from city streets (and parks and waterways).

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: Google and Tinder Shake Up the Internet
description: Mike: Hello, Farhad! How was your week? Mine has been stressful. Im going on vacation and just booked my dog a sitter on the Internet. What a time to be alive!

title: Icy Reception to a Backyard Party
description: Ice Bath From Above

title: Tianjin Officials Struggle to Contain Fallout as Angry Relatives Demand Answers
description: BEIJING  The authorities in the port city of Tianjin in northern China struggled to contain contamination from an enormous chemical fire on Saturday amid mounting frustration from people demanding information about missing loved ones.

title: Don Charlton of Jazz on the Power of Candid Questions
description: This interview with Don Charlton, founder and C.E.O. of Jazz, a recruiting software firm, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Variety Puzzle: Fitting Words
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  One of my favorite things about writing Wordplay is that it gives me a chance to show you all how smart you are, at least compared to me. Today is going to be one of those days.

title: G.O.P. Is Vague on Using Power Abroad
description: If the diverse group of candidates competing for the Republican presidential nomination agree on one thing when describing how they would engage with the world if they made it to the White House, it is this: If only the United States were stronger, and more feared, the country would not feel threatened by the Islamic State, manipulated by Iran or challenged by a rising China.

title: Tiger Woods Misses Cut at P.G.A. Championship, His Season Fizzling
description: HAVEN, Wis.  Only a handful of people occupied the Kohler skybox near the 18th green before 8 a.m. Saturday, but the public grandstand opposite it was full. No matter how ragged his game, Tiger Woods, like any headliner worth his marquee billing, can still command a crowd of everyday fans.

title: Locked in Solitary at 14: Adult Jails Isolate Youths Despite Risk
description: HATTIESBURG, Miss.  The prisoner spent a fitful August night trying to tune out the howls and moans of inmates in adjoining cells. He did not stir from his thin sleep mat until well after 1 p.m. A breakfast of cold grits waited in a slot in the reinforced steel door.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Newly Disclosed N.S.A. Files Detail Partnerships With AT&T and Verizon
description: These National Security Agency documents shed new light on the agencys relationship through the years with American telecommunications companies. They show how the agencys partnership with AT&T has been particularly important, enabling it to conduct surveillance, under several different legal rules, of international and foreign-to-foreign Internet communications that passed through network hubs on American soil.

title: AT&T Helped U.S. Spy on Internet on a Vast Scale
description: The National Security Agencys ability to spy on vast quantities of Internet traffic passing through the United States has relied on its extraordinary, decades-long partnership with a single company: the telecom giant AT&T.

title: Why Starbucks Prices Went Up as Coffee Beans Got Cheaper
description: Starbucks isnt the place to go for cheap coffee. It is selling an experience, not a commodity.

title: From the Iowa State Fair
description: At Iowas State Fair, Candidates Brave Cholesterol and Hecklers

title: A Price Is Right Winners Showcase Letdown
description: People are constantly praising the Hagglers willingness to fight for consumers. By constantly, the Haggler means about twice a year. Actually, that might be an exaggeration. Its probably happened. Once. Dont ask for specifics, though.

title: Red Cross Offers Workshops in International Law to Hamas
description: GAZA CITY  A new training regimen for fighters in Hamass armed wing employs slide presentations and a whiteboard rather than Kalashnikov rifles and grenades. The young men wear polo shirts instead of fatigues and black masks. They do not chant anti-Israel slogans, but discuss how the Geneva Conventions governing armed conflict dovetail with Islamic principles.

title: For French-Algerians and Algerian-French, No Place to Truly Call Home
description: CAP FALCON, Algeria  The fishermen of Cap Falcon, a peaceful beach on Algerias western Mediterranean coast, swear they can see the Spanish mountaintops when the weather is clear. So tantalizingly close is Europe, the beach is a favorite launching point for the harragas, as illegal migrants are known here.

title: Emperor Akihito Expresses Deep Remorse for Japans Role in World War II
description: TOKYO  Emperor Akihito, whose father announced his exhausted countrys surrender in World War II, expressed deep remorse for the conflict on Saturday at a memorial service on the 70th anniversary of the wars end.

title: The Galloping Gourmet
description: Tim Kellogg is a cowboy and a chocolatier, with a store in Meeteetse, Wyo.

title: P.G.A. Championship Course a Site of Intense Rounds, for Gunners and Golfers
description: HAVEN, Wis.  Before Whistling Straits was a golf course, all the shots fired on the property plummeted to the bottom of adjacent Lake Michigan. Antiaircraft guns, machine guns and tanks fired at targets high above the water, part of artillery exercises at Camp Haven, a military base from 1949 to 1959 that was transformed into the setting for the P.G.A. Championship.

title: David Raff
description: David Raff is the science integrity officer for the United States Bureau of Reclamation, the nations largest water wholesaler, which is currently struggling to manage competing demands for a dwindling resource.

title: The Murder of Mexicos Free Press
description: A month before the Mexican photojournalist Rubn Espinosa was murdered in Mexico City in late July, the governor of Veracruz, the province Mr. Espinosa had fled fearing for his life, gave other journalists a warning.

title: Hillary Clintons Got This
description: HER favorable ratings have fallen. The investigation into her private email server is tightening. Bernie Sanders is drawing huge crowds. Joe Biden is considering one last White House bid. Al Gore has advisers who have friends whove told reporters that they might have heard about conversations spitballing about a possible Gore run.

title: Ugly Attacks on Refugees in Europe
description: It is one of the tragedies of the European refugee crisis that the country with the fewest means, Greece, is the one coping with the greatest number of migrants fleeing tumult and poverty in the Middle East and Africa.

title: Sex Offenders Locked Up on a Hunch
description: The essence of the American criminal justice system is reactive, not predictive: You are punished for the crime you committed. You cant be punished simply because you might commit one someday. You certainly cant be held indefinitely to prevent that possibility.

title: Kale, With Fudge on Top
description: Americans eating habits have begun changing for the better.

title: Mom Plans, God Laughs
description: EVERY May, I start fantasizing about lazy, long days at the pool. I order a sundress from Athleta and picture myself wearing it while carrying a cheerful melamine platter of snacks and lemonade to my sweaty trio of children in the backyard. In June, I get a pedicure, bring the beach towels up from the basement, and compose a list of day trips well embark on as soon as school gets out. This summer, my dream itinerary featured a spectrum of activities, ranging from rafting and boogie boarding to visiting a science museum and an aquarium. I imagined my family picking blueberries outside a tiny house in the Berkshires.

title: The Frontier Chocolatier
description: Meeteetse, Wyo.  IN the arid hills that rim this remote town of just 327 people, Tim Kellogg spent countless hours with cattle: feeding them, herding them, even helping them give birth. He was a cowboy through and through.

title: Vacation in Rome? Or on That Oil Rig?
description: ON A PLATFORM IN THE CELEBES SEA  IN the next several years, thousands of offshore oil and gas drilling rigs, many of them built during a global construction boom in the 1970s and 80s, will reach retirement age and require decommissioning. Countries will have to decide whether to sink, remove or repurpose them.

title: Introducing Donald Trump, Diplomat
description: DONALD TRUMP gives me his Grumpy Cat look.

title: Lightning Round With Donald Trump
description: Maureen Dowd shares some of Trumps rapid-fire impressions about his rivals and other boldfaced names.

title: Looking for a Breakthrough? Study Says to Make Time for Tedium
description: Innovation isnt all about eureka moments. In fact, the road to creative breakthroughs is paved with mundane, workaday tasks. Thats the message of a recent study that might as well be titled In Praise of Tedium.

title: Hometown Is a Picture of Texas Tradition
description: Ikemefuna Enemkpali, the linebacker who punched Geno Smith, is the product of the Austin suburb Pflugerville, where he was raised by his parents from Nigeria.

title: Times Reaches Online Milestone, but Many Challenges Await
description: LAST spring, Mark Thompson, chief executive of The New York Times Company, said The Times would soon boast of one million digital-only subscribers. Early this month, his prediction came to pass.

title: The V.A.s Woman Problem
description: ON Sept. 11, 2001, Desma Brooks was a single mother in her mid-20s who served part-time in the Indiana Army National Guard. Watching the attack on TV, she wondered if she might be called up. She had three kids, so maybe she would be assigned to some kind of support role on the home front. Instead, she served two yearlong deployments, the first to Afghanistan, the second to Iraq. During the second, while driving a military vehicle that was guarding a supply convoy, she hit a roadside bomb. Ms. Brooks returned home with a mild case of traumatic brain injury and a serious case of post-traumatic stress disorder.

title: EnChromas Accidental Spectacles Find Niche Among the Colorblind
No Matter How Terry Collins Orders It, Mets Offense Is Producing
description: The trade was met with little fanfare at the time, but on July 24, when the Mets acquired Juan Uribe and Kelly Johnson from the Atlanta Braves, Manager Terry Collins was given two versatile players for a team that had been mostly devoid of offense. But perhaps more important to the way Collins tends to run his team, it allowed him to start tinkering with the lineup in hope of finding the combination that worked best.

title: Jessica Jones: Sizing Up the Latest Fashions
description: Jessica Jones, 31, is a fit model with True Model Management in New York.

title: The Teacher Shortage
description: Educators cite low pay, lack of respect and support, and high-stakes tests as causes.

title: When Youre in Charge, Your Whisper May Feel Like a Shout
description: Gail, I need to talk with you about something this afternoon. Can you come by my office at 3 p.m.? I didnt think much about my seemingly innocuous words, spoken to one of my departments doctoral students one morning back when I was an assistant professor.

title: A Last Splash of Summer
description: Photographs of the water slide in Foley Square on the last day of Summer Streets.

title: A Fashion Trailblazers Stylish Leap From Touch to Touch Screen
description: In a small house in South London, five executives of the high-end fashion retailer MatchesFashion.com sat around an oval conference table, discussing a coming event. From outside, the house looked like any sweet two-story London cottage, with a cobblestone courtyard and small balcony, but inside, it was all white and open plan  more Silicon Valley than Staffordshire.

title: Puzzling Through My Fiction
description: When I was growing up, crossword puzzles were  along with watching Ken Burns movies and eating lox  among the unfathomable pleasures of grown-ups. My grandmother would sit in her den for hours, the puzzle in her lap, looking blankly around the room as if she had just read a piece of news whose enormity she could scarcely comprehend. Other adults would periodically drift by to offer their condolences (A nine-letter religious figure, hmm) and I would stare from the rug in disbelieving boredom.

title: Now With the Mets, Its All Come Into Focus for Tyler Clippard
description: Tyler Clippard cannot remember the exact moment when he decided to see the eye doctor. He might have been standing on a mound in Columbus, Ohio, squinting at the sign in the shadows between the catchers legs. That happened often during the summer of 2008. Clippard also squinted when he was in the clubhouse, or looking at the television. His teammates teased him endlessly.

title: After Protests for Racial Justice, Activists Ask: What Next?
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  Leaning on a chain-link fence, Charles Mayo surveyed what was transpiring before him with a heavy dose of skepticism.

title: The Greek Debt Deals Missing Piece
description: At long last, European creditor nations and Greece have reached an agreement on a third bailout in five years.

title: California Town, United by Drought, Is Split Over New Water Park
description: DUBLIN, Calif.  On a typical hard-hat tour of a major municipal construction project, city officials extol the ventures expansiveness and rave about how many citizens will benefit. But this city has taken a different approach to a nearly $44 million recreational complex underway: Officials boast how small it is and how few people are expected to use it.

title: Yankees Resist Toll of Dog Days, Rebuilding Division Lead Over Toronto
description: TORONTO  These can be the miserable days of a baseball season, with the finish line still not quite in sight and the daily grind taking its toll on the body and the mind. They are called the dog days for a reason.

title: Hillary Clinton Fires Back Against Jeb Bush on Rise of ISIS
description: DES MOINES  Hillary Rodham Clinton hit back at Jeb Bush on Saturday over his accusation that the Obama administrations handling of the withdrawal of 10,000 troops in Iraq had facilitated the rise of the Islamic State now sweeping violently through Syria and Iraq.

title: As N.F.L. Prepares for Longer Extra Points, C.F.L. Offers a Preview
description: MONTREAL  Boris Bede, the rookie kicker of the Montreal Alouettes in the Canadian Football League, made league history on June 25 when he launched the first rule-mandated 32-yard extra point.

title: Key & Peele Ends While Nation Could Still Use a Laugh
description: The scene is a hauntingly familiar one: A white police officer stalks an unarmed black man in a dark alley and slams the mans head into the open door of his patrol car.

title: A North Korean Defectors Regret
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Since the late 1990s, some 28,000 North Koreans have fled to South Korea.

title: Jerome G. Miller, 83, Dies; Emptied Reformatories to Better Juvenile Justice
description: Jerome G. Miller, who inspired a revolution in Americas juvenile justice system by virtually emptying Massachusettss reformatories in the early 1970s, died on Aug. 7 at his home in Woodstock, Va. He was 83.

title: Susan Newhouse, Who Guided Fresh Air Fund, Dies at 80
description: Susan Newhouse, the longtime chairwoman of the Fresh Air Fund, among other philanthropic endeavors, and a fixture of New York high society, died on Thursday at her home in Manhattan. She was 80.

title: As It Were
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Todays puzzle by Don Gagliardo and Zhouqin Burnikel is nice and straightforward, which may be just the way you like it.

title: Technical Problem Suspends Flights Along East Coast
description: A technical glitch at an air traffic control center in Northern Virginia disrupted flights along the East Coast for hours on Saturday, causing far-reaching delays and cancellations, federal regulators and airlines said.

title: Bernard dEspagnat, 93, Physicist, Dies; Sought Implications of Quantum Theory
description: Bernard dEspagnat, a French physicist and philosopher whose writings explored the philosophical implications of the paradoxical laws that govern the subatomic realm, died on Aug. 1 in Paris. He was 93.

title: Obama Power Foursome Hits Links Before Vernon Jordan Soiree
description: President Obamas golf habit on Marthas Vineyard is so frequent that locals shrug it off. But there was nothing routine about his Saturday foursome, which included former President Bill Clinton, the civil rights activist Vernon E. Jordan Jr. and Ron Kirk, Americas former trade representative.

title: Wolves, Resurgent and Protected, Vex Swedish Farmers
description: OLMHULT, Sweden  Electric fences surround his sheep, two large dogs stand guard and a neighbor monitors the adjacent forest from a security camera.

title: 40 Migrants Found Dead in Sea Rescue
description: ROME  The crew of an Italian Navy ship that responded to a distress call on Saturday morning from a boat carrying hundreds of migrants discovered the bodies of more than 20 people piled on top of one another in the boats hold, Italian officials said. It was another ghastly reminder of the perils faced by migrants crossing the Mediterranean in overcrowded and unsafe vessels.

title: Disney Bulks Up Theme Parks, as Universal Gains Ground
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  The empire is striking back.

title: Clinton and Trump at the Iowa State Fair
description: The presidential candidates Donald J. Trump and Hillary Rodham Clinton speak at the Iowa State Fair.

title: Excess in Iowa: 90, a Butter Cow and Rides on Donald Trumps Helicopter
description: DES MOINES, Iowa  Hillary Rodham Clinton denounced Jeb Bush and discussed the rise of the Islamic State. Bernie Sanders held forth on Social Security. But at the Iowa State Fair, where a life-size butter cow rules and fairgoers devour stick-impaled delicacies, it is the candidacy of Donald J. Trump that perhaps best captures the air of raucous excess.

title: Jason Day Leads a P.G.A. Championship Round Filled With Zany Shots
description: HAVEN, Wis.  No sequence exemplified the madcap, can-you-top-this personality of the third round at the P.G.A. Championship as perfectly as Matt Joness shot from the blue carpet of a hospitality tent.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your week.

title: A 6-Under Round for Phil Mickelson Bolsters His Presidents Cup Bid
description: HAVEN, Wis.  Phil Mickelson has never depended on the kindness of Team USA captains, and he does not intend to start now. That is why his six-under 66 in the P.G.A. Championship on Saturday mattered. Mickelsons first subpar round of the week not only catapulted him up the leaderboard into a tie for 24th from 61st, but also gave him hope that the payoff for all his hard work would come in time for him to make the United States team for the Presidents Cup in South Korea in October.

title: Three Killed and Eight Injured in Crash on Taconic State Parkway
description: Three people were killed in a four-car collision on the Taconic State Parkway in Westchester County on Saturday when a sport utility vehicle careered over an embankment separating the northbound and southbound lanes and went into oncoming traffic, the police said.

title: Jordan Spieth Studies a Legend and Chases a Nearly Grand Finale
description: HAVEN, Wis.  As he approached his teenage years, Jordan Spieth decided to give up baseball and get serious about golf. Around that time, he entered a junior event in his native Texas that was named after Ben Hogan.

title: Xing-Yin Ni, Arthur Shum

On Tuesday, the couple are to have a traditional Chinese tea ceremony in celebration of the marriage at the Legend Chinese restaurant in Thornhill, Ontario, Canada.

title: Anne Levine and Michael Hill: Riding the (Radio) Waves
description: Anne Hall Levine and Michael Wayne Hill were married Saturday evening at their home on Cape Cod in Dennis, Mass. Rabbi Geoffrey Huntting officiated.

title: A Taste of October, Disappointment Included, for the Mets
description: After surviving four losing seasons as the Mets manager, Terry Collins will not allow himself, even with his team in first place in mid-August, to become wistful about playoff baseball at Citi Field.

title: Blending Tech Workers and Locals in San Franciscos Troubled Mid-Market
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Last spring, Carlo Gascons organization took a chance on this citys extraordinary technology boom, paying $1.4 million to turn a rundown single-family structure in the troubled Mid-Market area into its headquarters.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, August 16, 2015
description: Im in extreme isolation, and I dont understand why they would do this to me.

title: Corrections: August 16, 2015
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Julian Bond, Charismatic Civil Rights Leader, Dies at 75
description: Julian Bond, a charismatic figure of the 1960s civil rights movement, a lightning rod of the anti-Vietnam War campaign and a lifelong champion of equal rights, notably as chairman of the N.A.A.C.P., died on Saturday night in Fort Walton Beach, Fla. He was 75.

title: If She Can Make It There (Europe) Shell Make It Anywhere (College). Right?
description: In a matter of days, Ill send my oldest to college 1,700 miles away from home. I may not be totally ready for that, but I know without a doubt that she is.

title: Amid Perilous Mediterranean Crossings, Migrants Find a Relatively Easy Path to Greece
description: BODRUM, Turkey  As darkness falls and the last of the shorefront cafes in Bodrum clear their tables for the night, dozens of migrants pour out of a waiting bus. In the gloam, they charge for the sea, dragging a large rubber dinghy.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories.

title: Exclusion of Blacks From Juries Raises Renewed Scrutiny
description: SHREVEPORT, La.  Here are some reasons prosecutors have offered for excluding blacks from juries: They were young or old, single or divorced, religious or not, failed to make eye contact, lived in a poor part of town, had served in the military, had a hyphenated last name, displayed bad posture, were sullen, disrespectful or talkative, had long hair, wore a beard.

title: When Vegans Wont Compromise
description: If a man collapses at the opera, should the show go on?

title: Hamid Gul, 78, Dies; Backed Militants in Leading Pakistan Spy Agency
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Hamid Gul, an influential and contentious three-star general who served as the head of Inter-Services Intelligence, Pakistans spy agency, from 1987 to 1989 and was deeply involved in the countrys policy toward neighboring Afghanistan when Soviet troops were withdrawing, died on Saturday in Muree, a hill station near Islamabad, the capital of Pakistan. He was 78.

title: Provincial Minister in Pakistan Is Killed in Suicide Bombing
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A senior provincial minister in Pakistan who was at the forefront of the countrys fight against militants and banned sectarian groups was killed in a suicide bomb attack on Sunday, officials said. At least 10 other people were also said to have been killed in the bombing, and several were reported wounded.

title: Indonesian Plane Carrying 54 Is Declared Missing in Papua
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Rescue teams were searching Monday for the wreckage of an Indonesian commercial aircraft carrying 54 people that was believed to have crashed on Sunday amid inclement weather in the eastern region of Papua.

title: 1915: M. Venizelos Scores Triumph in Greek Chamber Election
description: ATHENS  The Greek Chamber met at Athens yesterday for the first time after the elections, and M. Zavitsanos, the Venizelist candidate, was elected President of the Chamber by a clear majority of 58 votes. The Chamber was opened with the customary ceremonial. M. Venizelos will be summoned by King Constantine to-morrow. So soon as he has made known his programme, the King will give him his decision.

title: Remembering Julian Bond, a Champion for Civil Rights
description: Mr. Bond, a former chairman of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, was a charismatic figure of the 1960s civil rights movement.

title: Remembering Julian Bond, a Champion for Civil Rights
description: Mr. Bond, a former chairman of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, was a charismatic figure of the 1960s civil rights movement.

title: Government Airstrikes on Market in Syria Kill More Than 80
description: ANTAKYA, Turkey  Government airstrikes on a rebel-held suburb of the Syrian capital, Damascus, killed more than 80 people and wounded about 200 on Sunday, according to local activists and monitoring organizations.

title: Migrants Find an Unbridled Route to Greece
description: Compared with other paths for refugees crossing the Mediterranean, the journey from Bodrum, Turkey, to Kos is relatively organized and easy.

title: Migrants Find an Unbridled Route to Greece
description: Compared with other paths for refugees crossing the Mediterranean, the journey from Bodrum, Turkey, to Kos is relatively organized and easy.

title: John Scott, Organist and Choirmaster in London and New York, Dies at 59
description: John Scott, an esteemed organist and choirmaster who held prestigious posts in London and New York, died on Wednesday in Manhattan. He was 59.

title: Priced Out of Brooklyn, a Sculptor Seeks a New Studio to Rent
description: Sometimes, Gabriel Koren visits her masterwork, the bronze sculpture of Frederick Douglass that stands on the Upper West Side of Manhattan and gazes north toward Harlem.

title: Champion of Gardens in New York Savors a Lush Victory Lap
description: Betsy Pinover Schiff realized she no longer recognized New York, and that made her happy. It made her happier than she was in 1997 or 1998, when, she said, book publishers scorned the idea she was championing: gardens in the city.

title: Messes Pile Up for de Blasio in 2nd Year
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio was already having a bad week. Then Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo called.

title: Whats On TV Sunday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) SHOW ME A HERO Nick Wasicsko (Oscar Isaac, above, with Carla Quevedo), a young Yonkers mayor, tries to get the city to abide by a federal judges desegregation order, despite savage opposition  and destroys his future in the process  in David Simons mini-series, based on a nonfiction book by Lisa Belkin, a former reporter for The New York Times. The cast includes Alfred Molina as a machine politician, Bob Balaban as the judge, and Terry Kinney, Clarke Peters and Catherine Keener. What Mr. Simon and his Wire collaborator William F. Zorzi have written, and Paul Haggis (Crash) has directed, is many things: meticulously and cleverly assembled, wonderfully coherent, often moving and funny, painstaking in its evocation of a midsize, tired city in the late 1980s and early 90s, Mike Hale wrote in The New York Times. In its later episodes, as the first black and Latino residents move into their new homes in formerly all-white neighborhoods of east Yonkers, it has a real (if modest) emotional punch. But, ultimately, its a show to be admired, not loved.

title: Hannibal Recap: Caught Between Two Gods
description: Season 3, Episode 11: And the Beast from the Sea

title: One Dead in Crash of Small Plane on Long Island
description: One person was killed and another was injured on Sunday when a small plane crashed on Long Island, leaving debris scattered across the tracks of the Long Island Rail Road near Hicksville and disrupting commuter service throughout the day, the authorities said.

title: Straight Outta Compton Tops Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  The N.W.A. biopic Straight Outta Compton, backed by a sophisticated marketing campaign, touched a cultural nerve over the weekend, taking in $56.1 million at the domestic box office, an astounding total for an R-rated drama.

title: Scenes From the Iowa State Fair
description: Iowans meet and greet the presidential candidates, eat hot dogs and get helicopter rides in Des Moines.

title: 1965: U.S. Drops Effort to make Russia Pay UN Debts
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y.  The United States today said it would bow to the will of the majority and permit the UN General Assembly to resume normal operations without a confrontation over Soviet voting rights. U.S. Ambassador Arthur J. Goldberg, in his first UN speech, told the 33-nation Committee on Peace-Keeping Operations that the United States had regretfully concluded, on ample evidence, that at this stage in the history of the United Nations, the General Assembly is not prepared to carry out the relevant provisions of the Charter in the context of the present situation.

title: Obama Administration Warns Beijing About Covert Agents Operating in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration has delivered a warning to Beijing about the presence of Chinese government agents operating secretly in the United States to pressure prominent expatriates  some wanted in China on charges of corruption  to return home immediately, according to American officials.

title: Donald Trump Releases Plan to Combat Illegal Immigration
description: After staking his early campaign on caustic and contentious remarks about undocumented immigrants, Donald J. Trump on Sunday outlined his plan to fix the countrys immigration system and deal with people who are in the country illegally.

title: Yankees Fall to Blue Jays, Tightening A.L. East Race Again
description: TORONTO  Yankees General Manager Brian Cashman walked out on a ledge near the top of CN Tower late Saturday afternoon, tethered only by a harness, which was stronger than his nerves.

title: Review: Lars Vogt Presents Late-Career Beethoven and Schubert at Mostly Mozart
description: The word muscular often came to mind while listening to the German pianist Lars Vogt perform Beethovens Piano Concerto No. 4 at Avery Fisher Hall on Friday evening. Mr. Vogt balanced a powerful touch that stopped just short of harsh in forte passages, particularly in the pianos upper register, with a limpid delicacy, control and poise that proved striking in intimate sections.

title: Review: Erasing Borders Festival of Indian Dance, a Showcase of Dizzying Movement
description: Now that the weeklong Battery Dance Festival  an August perennial  has settled on a stage in Robert F. Wagner Jr. Park, it has the best backdrop in New York. The audience sees, behind the dancers, the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Sailboats, cruise boats and yachts pass. Airplanes pass silently above. The drawback is that audience members, at 6:30 p.m., have the early-evening sun in their eyes. Baseball caps or dark sunglasses are advised.

title: An Ex-Player at the Center of the N.F.L. Concussion Settlement Dispute
description: MIRAMAR, Fla.  During his nine years in the N.F.L., Shawn Wooden was a steady, if unspectacular, presence on the field. Selected in the sixth round of the 1996 draft by the Miami Dolphins, he never made it to the Super Bowl, and in all likelihood, he will never be elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

title: Review: Emery LeCrone Dance and Amy Seiwerts Imagery Balance Elements
description: Its not news that female choreographers are underrepresented within major ballet companies. Take the coming season at New York City Ballet, which includes 58 works, among them seven new commissions, and not one by a woman. In the midst of this landscape, the emphasis on female choreographers at the Joyce Theaters recent Ballet Festival  where four out of the six engagements were produced and/or choreographed by women  was probably not incidental, an effort to counter that imbalance. And it made for a nice change of pace.

title: New Dr. Dre Album Serves as a Test for Apple Music
description: When Apple introduced its new streaming service, Apple Music, at the end of June, one of the big questions hanging over it was whether it could compete with outlets like Spotify to deliver blockbuster results for big new albums.

title: Review: Lynn Nottages Sweat Examines Lives Unraveling by Industrys Demise
description: ASHLAND, Ore.  Sweat, the title of Lynn Nottages scorching new play, refers to the hard labor that its characters have put in for decades, only to find their modest livelihoods threatened by the evaporation of manufacturing jobs in America. But members of the audience may find themselves getting a little moist with anxiety as this extraordinarily moving drama hurtles toward its conclusion with the awful inevitability of Greek tragedy.

title: On Chinas Economy
description: Is it time to panic?

title: Janelle Mone, and Other Wondaland Artists, Step Back in Time at the Highline Ballroom
description: Janelle Mone is on her third, maybe fourth life, a striking fact given that shes been an avowed futurist from the very start. For almost a decade, shes been treating R&B and funk as technologies badly in need of updating, planning for their cyborg future and waiting for everyone else to catch up.

title: Lucia Berlins Roving, Rowdy Life Is Reflected in a Book of Her Stories
description: In order to write about life, first you must live it. Thats often attributed to Hemingway, and he would have applauded Lucia Berlin, who made fiction from her life and had a surplus of raw material. Born in Alaska in 1936 to a father who was a mining engineer, Ms. Berlin lived all over the American West and in Chile, New York City and Mexico. She survived childhood abuse and adult alcoholism, an addiction that sent her, in her words, to jails, hospitals, psych wards. She hung out with poets and musicians (marrying two jazz players). By her early 30s, she had been divorced three times and had four sons. She worked as a house cleaner, a substitute teacher and a hospital clerk. She put much of her roving, rowdy life onto the page in vivid stories that garnered the respect of a modest audience and now could be on the verge of making her posthumously famous.

title: Review: In Susan Barkers The Incarnations, Lives of Despair (Past and Present) in China
description: Trying to spruce up its public image before the 2008 Summer Olympics, China embarked on a program of enforced self-improvement in which citizens were meant to change their ways on the spot. No more spitting; no more queue-jumping. No more risible translation of signs, either: In one fell swoop, the Dongda Anus Hospital, a much-photographed Beijing tourist attraction, became the Dongda Proctology Hospital.

title: Catch Charlie Barnett and Other Rising Stand-Up Stars Who Never Hit the Top
description: I was walking through Central Park last year when I came across a comic on a bench selling jokes for a dollar. After I bought a punch line, we started talking comedy. My dream, he said, is to be like Charlie Barnett.

title: Marc Quinns The Toxic Sublime Shows a Provocateur and Social Observer
description: LONDON  Marc Quinn led the way through his East London studio late last month, past a marble sculpture of a fetus, a photorealist painting of raw meat and a bronze statue of Kate Moss in a yoga position.

title: Review: Detectorists on BBC and Acorntv Hope to Unearth a Fortune
description: Detectorists, a 2014 BBC sitcom, is part of a long tradition of British comedies about daft eccentrics. But instead of going in the direction of noisy farce, its dreamy and steeped in melancholy, with a hint of the charm of the Ealing films and the great Scottish comedies of Bill Forsyth.

title: Bits of Textspeak
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  There is nothing better than completing a task that makes you smile. Its even better when you get a reminder from the task at hand to smile or, better yet, laugh. And on a Monday, yet.

title: A Concert Honoring Abe Lebewohl
description: Metropolitan Diary:

title: With High-Profile Help, Obama Plots Life After Presidency
description: WASHINGTON  The dinner in the private upstairs dining room of the White House went so late that Reid Hoffman, the LinkedIn billionaire, finally suggested around midnight that President Obama might like to go to bed.

title: Ambiguity Shrouds the Case of a Missing Israeli of Ethiopian Descent
description: ASHKELON, Israel  In the grainy security camera footage, Avera Mengistu walks along the beach on the Israeli side of the border, marked by a wall and netting. Then, suddenly, he appears on the other side, in Gaza.

title: Merkel Seeks to Head Off Opposition to Greek Bailout
description: BERLIN  Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Sunday that she expected the International Monetary Fund to take part in the new bailout for Greece, as she sought to head off opposition to the aid package in the German Parliament.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Aug. 17
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Collision of 2 Small Planes Near a San Diego Airport Kills 4
description: Four people were killed on Sunday when two small airplanes collided in flight near an airport in San Diego, according to the authorities.

title: Jason Day Wins P.G.A. Championship in a Record-Shattering Breakthrough
description: HAVEN, Wis.  After a 314-yard drive on the par-5 16th hole at Whistling Straits, Jason Day had a decision to make. Ahead by three strokes in his bid to win his first major championship, Day could lay up with his next shot, which was the smart but conservative move, or go for the green as if he had nothing to lose.

title: Bobby Parnell and Mets Stumble as Pirates Complete Sweep
description: The Mets and the Pittsburgh Pirates, one of the best teams in baseball, were tied, 1-1, at Citi Field on Sunday when Pirates pinch-hitter Michael Morse hit a comebacker to the mound in the seventh inning. The Pirates had a runner on first with no outs. It was a routine play, the kind winning teams execute with ease.

title: After Delicate Negotiations, U.S. Says It Will Pull Patriot Missiles From Turkey
description: WASHINGTON  The United States said Sunday that it would withdraw two Patriot missile-defense batteries from southern Turkey this fall, a sign that the Pentagon believes the risk of Syrian Army missile attacks has eased since the Patriots were deployed in 2013. Officials said the antimissile systems would be needed elsewhere to defend against threats from Iran and North Korea.

title: Racial Wealth Gap Persists Despite Degree, Study Says

title: Q. and A.: Qiu Xiaolong on His Novel Shanghai Redemption
description: In Qiu Xiaolongs new novel, Shanghai Redemption, Inspector Chen Cao of the Shanghai police finds himself once again enmeshed in elite political struggles inside the Chinese Communist Party, but it is now harder than ever for him to navigate the conflicts. This latest installment in the Inspector Chen series was published in March in France, and an English-language edition is set for release in the United States in September. In an interview, Mr. Qiu, a Shanghai native who now lives in St. Louis, discussed how the 2012 downfall of Bo Xilai, the ambitious party chief of Chongqing and Politburo member, influenced the novel. Mr. Bos purge from the party and criminal trial on corruption charges were precipitated by the flight of his former police chief, Wang Lijun, to the United States Consulate in Chengdu, where Mr. Wang told American officials that Mr. Bos wife, Gu Kailai, had killed a British businessman with poison.

title: The Mindy Project Is Revived on Hulu; CBS News Makes News
description: LOS ANGELES  The two-plus weeks of the Television Critics Associations media tour, which wrapped up late last week, gives networks, cable channels and streaming services an opportunity to preview coming shows and to tackle questions about the uncertain future of television.

title: Finding Their Rhythm After Improvising
description: Mike McGinnis thought she must be a pumped-up arts investor when he saw her in the audience. He was playing woodwinds at a promotional event for Fine and Dandy, a musical he arranged. And there, amid a sea of old white rich guys, was a woman in a red sleeveless dress, with spiky hair and undeniably pronounced biceps.

title: Order to Clean Towers Strains Crews Amid Legionnaires Outbreak in Bronx

title: Colorado Spill Heightens Debate Over Future of Old Mines

When the mine here opened in the early 1890s amid a frenzy of frontier gold exploration, its founders gave it a lofty name: the Gold King, reflecting their great hopes for finding riches in its depths. Over the next decade, the Gold King went on to become one of the most productive mines in Colorados San Juan County, with three shifts of men working 24 hours a day in its dark corridors.

On the other hand, Home Depot, the home improvement retailer, has been riding a recovery in the housing market to sales gains, and analysts expect it to book a solid quarter. This documentary, directed by Andrew Hinton and Johnny Burke, follows Mr. Phuntsok into the foothills of the Indian Himalayas, where he has created a community called Jhamtse Gatsal (translation: the garden of love and compassion) that offers a home and education to 85 children who have been orphaned or abandoned  among them Tashi, above, a 5-year-old girl with an alcoholic father who, at the time of filming, was the newest and youngest resident, and perhaps the most challenging.

For years, it turns out, Citizens often kept the difference, up to $50.

title: Mario Vargas Llosas Notes on the Death of Culture
description: I call it the newspaper problem: About a decade ago I wrote an essay on contemporary poetry for a newspaper that will remain nameless, and had the occasion to quote a line by Eliot. The editor sent back many changes, the most telling of which was that the quotation was now attributed to the English poet T.S. Eliot. Vaguely piqued, I asked what the editor was trying to clarify: Was he afraid readers wouldnt realize the quotation came from a poem? Or was he afraid readers might confuse the Eliot who wrote it with, say, George Eliot, the pseudonymous author of Middlemarch? Anyway, I noted that the English qualifier was misleading: Though T.S. Eliot had taken British citizenship, he had been born in America. The editor, then, sent on another suggestion: the American-born English poet T.S. Eliot. I, having lost all the patience I had as a 24-year-old, replied by modifying that tag to: the American-born, British-citizen English-language poet, essayist, dramatist, teacher, publisher and bank teller Thomas Stearns Eliot (1888-1965), after which the editor finally got the point and canceled the assignment.

title: NeuroTribes, by Steve Silberman
description: The history of science is studded with stories of simultaneous discovery, in which two imaginative souls (or more!) turn out to have been digging tunnels to the same unspoiled destination. The most fabled example is calculus, developed independently in two different countries by Isaac Newton and Gottfried Wilhelm von Leibniz, but the list stretches back centuries and unfurls right into the present. One can add to it sunspots, evolution, platinum, chloroform ... and now autism, as the science journalist Steve Silberman informs us, identified separately by Leo Kanner and Hans Asperger. The crucial difference is that Kanner had the fortune to publish his work in Baltimore, while Asperger had the misfortune to publish his in Nazi-controlled Vienna, and this accident of geopolitics lies at the tragic core of Silbermans ambitious, meticulous and largehearted (if occasionally long-winded) history, NeuroTribes: The Legacy of Autism and the Future of Neurodiversity.
