title: Looks from the Blue Carpet at theTeen Choice Awards
description: The 2015 Teen Choice Awards on Sunday evening brought together a bevy of stars, including Zendaya, Britney Spears and Shay Mitchell.

title: Tracy Morgan to Host Saturday Night Live in First Performance Since Accident
description: More than a year after he was critically injured in an automobile accident, Tracy Morgan will return to host Saturday Night Live in his first announced performance since the accident. NBC said on Monday that Mr. Morgan, an alumnus of Saturday Night Live and the comedy series 30 Rock, is scheduled to host S.N.L. on Oct. 17 in one of its first new episodes of the fall season. He has been recovering since he was injured in a crash on the New Jersey Turnpike in June 2014, when a luxury van he was riding in was struck from behind by a Walmart tractor-trailer. Mr. Morgan said in an interview on NBCs Today show in June that he hoped to return to comedy when he was able, adding, When Im there, youll know it. Ill get back to making you laugh. I promise you.

title: Russia Burns Dutch Flowers Amid Netherlands Inquiry Into Malaysia Airlines Crash
description: MOSCOW  In recent years, trade relations between Russia and the Netherlands have at times blossomed and at times wilted. This summer they went up in smoke.

title: Lobbying Fight Over Iran Nuclear Deal Centers on Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  From his rented vacation home on Marthas Vineyard with sweeping views of the Atlantic Ocean, President Obama has been making phone calls to Democratic members of Congress, trying to rally support for the nuclear deal with Iran that faces a vote next month.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch This Week
description: That music you hear when you close your eyes is this seasons first true stirrings of the Champions League anthem. The final playoff rounds begin this week, with hope still alive for scrappy little challengers like ... wait, is that Manchester United over there?

title: Donald Trump Arrives for Jury Duty
description: Mr. Trump, a Republican presidential candidate, reported for jury duty at State Supreme Court in Manhattan.

title: Stalled Train and Burning Car Create Another Bad Commute for N.J. Transit
description: New Jersey Transit riders faced another morning of difficult delays on Monday after a car caught fire inside the Lincoln Tunnel and a train stalled in one of the Hudson River rail tunnels.

title: 2015 Fantasy Football: Running Back Preview and Rankings
description: Any fantasy football owner with the No. 1 overall draft pick this season will not have an easy decision, as there is no clear consensus on which player is the safest choice, though based on average draft position, at least most drafters agree that the selection should be a running back.

title: Chris Christie Assails Donald Trumps Immigration Plan
description: Donald J. Trumps immigration plan has been panned by many Democrats as an extreme measure, but some of his Republican rivals also have their doubts.

title: Exposures Puerto Rico
description: Summary TK

title: 1915: U.S. Angered by German Plots
description: LONDON According to the New York correspondent of the Daily Express, the revelations concerning the great German plot in the United States have caused a nation-wide sensation, and the Government is considering whether formal action can be taken against the conspirators. The New York World to-day prints a memorandum on a project to obtain possession of all the liquid chlorine in America in order to prevent its exportation to the Allies for the manufacture of asphyxiating gases.  The New York Herald, European Edition, August 18, 1915

title: Bedtime Stories for Young Brains
description: A little more than a year ago, the American Academy of Pediatrics issued a policy statement saying that all pediatric primary care should include literacy promotion, starting at birth.

title: Facing Money Gap, Hillary Clinton Slowly Warms to Super PAC Gifts
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton recently spent four days straight scurrying across the Western United States, mingling for hours at a time with hundreds of Democratic donors from the Rockies to Portland, Ore., from Southern California to the southern tip of Texas, and everywhere seeking the maximum primary campaign contribution allowed by law: $2,700.

title: Scott Walker Is Heckled in Iowa State Fair Appearance
description: DES MOINES  They sported Wisconsin cheese hats but the impression that Gov. Scott Walker had brought a home-state cheering section was demolished when catcalls began as soon as he started speaking Monday morning.

title: A Mouthwash Rinse May Predict Throat Cancer Recurrence
description: A simple mouthwash rinse may be able to predict the dangerous recurrence of a kind of throat cancer that is rapidly increasing in heterosexual men, according to a new study.

title: Paul Smiths College Will Get $20 Million, if It Changes Its Name
description: PAUL SMITHS, N.Y.  To administrators of the financially troubled college here, Joan Weills appearance on campus more than 20 years ago may have seemed like the arrival of a fairy godmother.

title: Communicating Through Whistling
description: Two men arrange to meet at a cafe by whistling across a valley about 765 yards wide in Kuky, Turkey.

title: David Denson, Gay Minor Leaguer, Has Power but Faces Long Odds
description: Stepping into the batters box at Marlins Park in Miami three years ago, David Denson, 17, looked as if he might have a future in the big leagues when he mashed a 515-foot drive off the scoreboard in a home run competition, breaking the distance record by 12 feet.

title: Sorry Im Late Again, Boss
description: Anybody trying to cross the Hudson River by tunnel between New Jersey and New York on Monday morning probably had to rely on a reserve of patience, good humor and an understanding boss.

title: Hacking Case Raises Question on Securities Fraud
description: The elaborate scheme described by the Justice Department and the Securities and Exchange Commission last week, which involved breaking into computer servers to obtain confidential information about impending corporate announcements, certainly looks like a classic case of insider trading. The defendants are accused of making millions of dollars in profits by using information to trade profitably.

title: Batches of Root Beer Generate a Noticeable Buzz
description: Hard root beer is flying off the shelves. Not Your Fathers Root Beer, an ale fermented with spices, made by Small Town Brewery in Wauconda, Ill., landed in New York and elsewhere late last month. The taste, like soda fountain root beer with less sweetness, does not hide the gentle kick from 5.9 percent alcohol. Coney Island Brewing, which opened recently, also has a hard root beer. It is 5.8 percent alcohol and a tad sweeter and fizzier than the competition. The flavor is less earthy with more vanilla and coffee in the flavor notes. Coney Islands main backer is Boston Beer, the parent company of Sam Adams. The root beer is being made at a Boston Beer plant, not in Brooklyn. Now you can turn that root beer float into a nightcap: Not Your Fathers Root Beer, $10.99 for a six-pack at Fairway markets; Coney Island Hard Root Beer, $2.50 a bottle at Malt & Mold, maltandmold.com.

title: Ayatollah Khamenei Says Talk of U.S. Influences in Iran Is Hollow Fantasy
description: TEHRAN  Irans highest leader lashed out at the United States on Monday, saying talk that American influences would pour into the country on a wave of positive feelings over the nuclear deal is nothing more than a hollow fantasy.

title: A Womans Tweed
description: The traditional mens wear fabric has been nipped and tucked to new feminine proportions.

title: In Tianjin Blasts, a Heavy Toll for Unsuspecting Firefighters
description: BEIJING  The young firefighters, their thin frames puffed up by insulated coveralls, some of them barely old enough to shave, rushed to the scene of a modest warehouse blaze in the port city of Tianjin on Wednesday night with little idea of the danger that awaited them.

title: South Sudans President Lets Deadline for Signing a Peace Deal Pass
description: UNITED NATIONS  Bucking the threat of international sanctions, the president of South Sudan, Salva Kiir, refused to sign a peace deal to halt the nations civil war on Monday, the deadline for a final accord mediated by African leaders.

title: Whistled Form of Turkish Is One of a Kind
description: Unlike all other spoken languages, a whistled form of Turkish requires that speakers rely as heavily on the right side of their brain as on the left.

title: What Would You Pay for This Meal?
description: How often have you bought something you felt wasnt worth the money?

title: Katherine Sorensen, Patrick Hebert
description: Katherine Kelly Sorensen and Patrick Daniel Hebert were married Saturday at the Castle Hill Inn in Newport, R.I. Matan Ariel, a friend of the couple who became a minister of the Church of Spiritual Humanism for the occasion, officiated.

title: Breast-Feedings Heart Benefits
description: Breast-feeding has many benefits. Now a new study found it may reduce a womans risk for cardiovascular disease later in life.

title: Citigroup to Pay $180 Million Over Collapsed Hedge Funds
description: Citigroup has agreed to pay $180 million to settle charges by the Securities and Exchange Commission that the bank concealed problems at two of its now-defunct hedge funds, while taking in additional investments in the months before the financial crisis.

title: A Chinese Drought Weather Report Written on Cave Walls
description: Writings on the walls of a cave in China record the effects of droughts over the last 500 years, researchers have found.

title: Neighbors Surprised by New York Attack
description: Residents of the Washington Heights area of New York responded with shock to the stabbing death of EDena Hines, the granddaughter of the actor Morgan Freemans former wife.

title: U.S. Budgets Cash to Treat Heroin Abuse in Northeast
description: CHILMARK, Mass.  Faced with a surge in heroin abuse in recent years, especially in the Northeast, the White House on Monday announced a program aimed at improving the governments response to the drug across 15 states in that region.

title: Summer Vacation: Goodbye Restaurants, Hello Kitchen
description: There are people who plan their vacations around restaurant reservations that have to be secured months in advance. I am not one of them. When I need to get away from it all, competing for a table is one of the main things Im getting away from. That, and meals longer than a filibuster, and hearing that Chef would like me to eat this particular taste in one bite while rubbing my stomach and patting my head.

title: The Butterfly, the Ant and the Oregano
description: It may be hard to imagine a mnage  trois, satisfactory to all parties, in which one member tries to dislodge another with a toxic gas and a third eats the offspring of the other two. But such an arrangement exists, and one of its members may even be sitting quietly in your kitchens spice rack.

title: 1940: Electroshock Therapy
description: Insanity Treated By Electric Shock read the headline of an article published on July 6, 1940, in The New York Times. The article described a new method, introduced in Italy, of treating certain types of mental disorders by sending an electric shock through the brain.

title: Egypt Widens Government Power With New Anti-Terrorism Law
description: CAIRO  President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt has issued a counterterrorism law that gives state security officers wider immunity from prosecution, expands the governments surveillance powers and penalizes journalists for contradicting official accounts of militant attacks.

title: Thai Police Statement on Explosion
description: Officials provided an update about the deadly blast at the Erawan Shrine in Bangkok.

title: Ted Cruz Megadonor Identified as Cellphone Executive
description: A New York cellphone executive has emerged as a mystery megadonor behind the presidential campaign of Senator Ted Cruz of Texas.

title: Warren Braren, 82, Dies; Urged Ban on Broadcast Tobacco Ads
description: Warren Braren, a reformed smoker who helped trigger a congressional ban on tobacco advertising on television and radio in 1970 by blowing the whistle on broadcasters lax self-regulation, died on Thursday at his home in New Milford, Conn. He was 82.

title: Palestinian Man Fatally Shot in Confrontation With Israeli Police
description: RAMALLAH, West Bank  A Palestinian man wearing jeans, a black shirt and sneakers approached two heavily armed Israeli police officers at a West Bank checkpoint in Nablus on Monday, claiming he was sick and needed medical assistance. It was a ruse, according to an Israeli police spokeswoman, who said the man tried to stab the border officers before they shot him dead.

title: Daily Coffee May Boost Colon Cancer Survival
description: Colon cancer patients who were heavy coffee drinkers had a far lower risk of dying or having their cancer return than those who did not drink coffee, with significant benefits starting at two to three cups a day, a new study found. Patients who drank four cups of caffeinated coffee or more a day had half the rate of recurrence or death than noncoffee drinkers.

title: Luke Bryan Tops Dr. Dre in Album Sales
description: On the music charts this week, the country star Luke Bryan beat Dr. Dre for the No. 1 album, as expected, while OMIs Cheerleader returns as the top single.

title: Police Officers Are Killed at a Checkpoint in Afghanistans South
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  At least five Afghan police officers were poisoned and then shot to death in the southern province of Helmand late on Sunday, according to Afghan officials, who said the attack was the third of its kind in the province in less than two weeks.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Ukraine, Greece, Thailand and Bulgaria.

title: August 17, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photographs from Ukraine, Greece, Thailand and Bulgaria.

title: Hamilton Shows Its Muscle on Broadway
description: It was a big week at the box office for the founding fathers and a pair of magicians, according to data released on Monday by the Broadway League, a trade group for theater owners and producers.

title: Jury Duty for Donald Trump: Amazing, Really Good and Done in a Day
description: The prospective juror emerged from his stretch limousine at 9:07 a.m. He spoke briefly to the waiting media horde, walked a gantlet of photographers and climbed the steps of State Supreme Court in Lower Manhattan.

title: As Winning Majors Gets Tougher, Losing Them Is Easier to Stomach
description: HAVEN, Wis.  Can we agree that it has never been harder to win a major in mens professional golf? Consider the case of Justin Rose, who produced 72-hole scores of 14 under par at the Masters and the P.G.A. Championship only to lose by a combined 10 strokes. In golfs four showcase events, Rose was 34 under, the fourth-lowest cumulative total in history.

title: Off the Coast of Iran, a High-Stakes Version of Spy Versus Spy
description: MANAMA, Bahrain  The commander of the Navys Fifth Fleet was in his office on the afternoon of July 25 when he got the phone call: An Iranian Navy frigate in the Gulf of Aden had approached a ship where an American military helicopter had just landed.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the editor:

title: Negotiators on South Sudan Peace Accord
description: Officials in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, commented on the failure of the South Sudanese president, Salva Kiir, to sign the peace agreement that was reached on Monday.

title: Hamptons Night at the Apollo
description: Christina Aguilera, Jamie Foxx, Jimmy Fallon, Smokey Robinson and others perform at Ron Perelmans fund-raiser for the Apollo.

title: Stevie Wonder Performs Free D.C. Concert
description: Mr. Wonder surprised fans with a free concert on the Armory Mall in Washington on Monday, before heading to perform free shows in Philadelphia and New York.

title: Petco Files for an I.P.O.
description: Only months after one of the countrys big retailers of dog food and catnip went private, another is planning a return to the public markets.

title: Hamptons Night at the Apollo
description: It has become of one of the Hamptons most glamorous galas: Ron Perelman hosted a Saturday night gala for the Apollo Theater at his East Hampton estate. Performers included Jamie Foxx and Jimmy Fallon, who, it turns out, does an uncanny impression of Mick Jagger. See the photos.

title: Lifetime Commits to Unauthorized Movie Franchise
description: Critics panned it. Fans skewered it. Ratings were middling. But in the end it didnt really matter what anyone thought about Lifetimes The Unauthorized Saved by the Bell Story when it ran over Labor Day weekend last year. It did the job.

title: A Double Dose of Divine, and Other Reports From the Fringe Festival
description: On Saturday night, I stood in a basement space in the East Village, holding hands with a man who was attempting to regurgitate a bean, possibly cannellini. The bean, he promised, would have a number on it that matched a slip of paper Id chosen from a plastic bag. The man was red-faced, groaning and coughing and retching. (Im still not sure why he had to hold my hand.) Finally, he ejected the numbered bean from an unlikely orifice. Everyone applauded.

title: Review: In Unity (1918), a Town Blindsided by Spanish Influenza
description: So much for genteel images of the 1918 Spanish flu. Kevin Kerrs Unity (1918) can make any Upstairs Downstairs fan forget the tasteful expiration of James Bellamys febrile young wife in a grand bedroom at Eaton Place. Unity, having its United States premiere at the Gene Frankel Theater, is much more like a horror story. The flu killed an estimated 50 million people worldwide in less than two years. (AIDS has killed around 39 million, but over 34 years.)

title: Review: The Last Love Song, a Biography of Joan Didion
description: Loss, nostalgia for a vanished past and the unspeakable peril of the everyday represented by swimming pools, high-tension wires, lye under the sink, aspirin in the medicine cabinet  these are the themes that have animated Joan Didions work, since Slouching Towards Bethlehem established her as one of Americas most distinctive and acute literary voices almost five decades ago.

title: Review: In Head Over Heels, Jukebox Musical Meets Elizabethan Romance
description: ASHLAND, Ore.  One ancient and venerable theatrical genre, the jukebox musical, is merrily mashed up with another, the Elizabethan romance, in Head Over Heels, having its premiere at the Oregon Shakespeare Festival here. In this funny and frolicsome concoction, the back catalog of the Go-Gos, the new wave girl group that made a splash in ye olde 1980s, is wedded to a book by Jeff Whitty (Avenue Q) that pays winking homage to Sir Philip Sidneys prose poem The Arcadia, from way back in the late 16th century.

title: Review: George Benjamin, at Mostly Mozart, Shows Depth as a Conductor
description: Last week, during a discussion onstage after the opening-night performance of George Benjamins haunting opera Written on Skin, Mr. Benjamin, who has conducted the piece many times, lavished praise on the textured, exciting performance Alan Gilbert had just led.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: This Looks Like a National Strategy
description: On the 50th anniversary of the signing of the Voting Rights Act earlier this month, Ari Berman, a contributing writer for The Nation, published Give Us the Ballot, a book about the decades-long political battle over minority voting rights that followed the acts passage, which I also wrote about recently in the magazine. I caught up with Berman to discuss his book, the voting rights fights of the past and those that are to come.

title: Of Camera Work and Fine Art
description: In Camera Work, Alfred Stieglitz sought to promote photography as fine art. To this day, some collectors have gone as far as to mount individual gravures from the fabled publication.

title: Claren Road Investors Seek to Pull Out Nearly $2 Billion
description: Investors in Claren Road Asset Management may think the hedge fund has come to the end of the road.

title: Shake-Up in Moscow as Railways Chief, a Putin Friend, Is Reported Ousted
description: MOSCOW  Vladimir I. Yakunin, the director of Russias national railway company and a longtime associate of President Vladimir V. Putin, has reportedly been ousted in one of the most significant shake-ups in domestic politics since the Russian economy slipped into recession last year.

title: Major Flaws Found in Inquiry That Led to Suspension of Public-School Therapist
description: For sheer bureaucratic folly, it would be hard to top the suspension last year of a devoted occupational therapist in the public school system who showed children in wheelchairs how to get places.

title: Why Amazon May Take a Page From Walmarts Labor Playbook
description: Amazons latest results were so superb that they catapulted the online retailers market value beyond that of Walmart Stores for the first time. Now, the $250 billion goliath led by Jeff Bezos finds itself in another spot that its bricks-and-mortar rival will more happily cede: defending labor practices.

title: Ta-Nehisi Coatess Between the World and Me
description: For the past several years, Ive greeted Ta-Nehisi Coatess essays and blog posts for The Atlantic with nothing short of gratitude. As an African-American, he makes me proud. There is no other way to put it. I do not always agree with him, but it hardly matters. In a media world populated with pundits, so-called experts and public intellectuals driven by ego and familiar agendas, Coatess voice stands nearly alone  a black man raised in the streets of Baltimore who narrowly escaped the violence that lurked around every corner and dodged the clutches of the prisons and jails that were built for him, and who now speaks unpopular, unconventional and sometimes even radical truths in his own voice, unfiltered. He is invariably humble, yet subtly defiant. And people listen.

title: Hacking of Tax Returns More Extensive Than First Reported, I.R.S. Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Internal Revenue Service said Monday that hackers had gained access to the tax returns of more than 300,000 people, a far higher number than the agency had reported previously.

title: As Scott Walker Struggles in Iowa, His Campaign Reaches Out to a Strategist
description: A consultant to Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsins presidential campaign telephoned a Georgia-based Republican strategist last week to sound him out about working for Mr. Walker, a sign that he is considering staff changes at a moment when his campaign has been eclipsed by Donald J. Trump.

title: Syrian State TV Edits Out Criticism From Visiting U.N. Official
description: Wrapping up a three-day visit to Syria on Monday, the new emergency relief coordinator of the United Nations, Stephen OBrien, told reporters he was absolutely horrified by the total disregard for civilian life by all parties in this conflict.

title: John Malones Big Bet on Online Shopping
description: John C. Malone is taking home shopping over the top.

title: Messy Music at Berserktown Festival
description: This provocative three-day festival of various extremes of punk, noise, metal and D.I.Y. culture featured over 100 acts in Santa Ana, Calif.

title: Berserktown Festival Offers a Chance to Meet Lesser Known Bands
description: SANTA ANA, Calif.  We are not all born equal, announced Victoria Ruiz, the singer of Downtown Boys, on Sunday afternoon at the Berserktown festival here, in a voice usually reserved for megaphones at protests.

title: Former Goldman Executive Is Chosen to Lead Dallas Fed
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas on Monday chose for its new president Robert Steven Kaplan, a former Goldman Sachs executive.

title: Iraq: Monitoring Group to Investigate Possible Chemical Weapons Use by ISIS
description: The group responsible for monitoring adherence to the global ban on chemical weapons said Monday that it had contacted Iraq over reports of the possible use of such munitions there. A statement by the group, the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons, based in The Hague, came a few days after United States officials said Islamic State militants appeared to have used such munitions, possibly mustard gas, on Kurdish fighters in Iraq. If confirmed, it would be the first known use of the weapons by the Islamic State, which occupies parts of Syria and Iraq. The monitoring group called such reports a matter of serious concern, and its director, Ahmet Uzumcu, said it would examine any substantive reports it receives including pertinent information that might be shared by other signers of the chemical weapons ban, which appeared to be a reference to both Iraq and Syria. Iraq, where hundreds of old, corroded mustard artillery shells remained after the 2003 American invasion, signed the chemical weapons ban in 2009. Syria joined in 2013 after having promised to destroy its chemical stockpile, although the monitoring organization said this year that chlorine bombs had been used in the Syrian conflict. On Aug. 7, the United Nations Security Council passed a resolution authorizing an inquiry into who was responsible for the chlorine attacks.

title: Starters Injury Tempers Yankees Extra-Inning Win OverTwins
description: In a frightening scene at Yankee Stadium on Monday night, Yankees starter Bryan Mitchell was hit in the face with a line drive off the bat of Eduardo Nunez, a right-handed hitter for the Minnesota Twins, in the second inning of an 8-7, 10-inning Yankees victory. In 2013, when Nunez was an infielder with the Yankees and on a rehab assignment with Class A Tampa, he and Mitchell were teammates for three games.

title: Shell Wins Final Permission for Arctic Oil and Gas Drilling
description: The Obama administration on Monday issued a final permit for Shell to start drilling for oil and gas in the Arctic Ocean. The Interior Department gave conditional approval in May for the companys long-delayed application to drill in the untouched waters of the Chukchi Sea off Alaskas northwest coast. In July, the administration issued a permit that would allow Shell to start drilling at the top of the seabed but would not allow the drill to penetrate into the oil reserves until Shell had quick access to a capping stack, which is used to shut down wells in case of emergency spills. The ship carrying that capping stack arrived at the drilling site last week. Environmentalists have criticized Mr. Obama for moving forward with the drilling.

title: Many Black Lawyers Navigate a Rocky, Lonely Road to Partner
description: Jimmie L. McMillians path to partnership in an Indianapolis law firm might seem unexceptional  except for a few telling details.

title: Bob Johnston, 83, Dies; Produced Bob Dylan and Johnny Cash Albums
description: Bob Johnston, who produced a string of classic albums in the 1960s and 70s including Bob Dylans Highway 61 Revisited and Blonde on Blonde and Johnny Cashs At Folsom Prison, died on Friday in Gallatin, Tenn. He was 83.

title: Amazon Chiefs Message to Employees
description: After the weekend publication of an article in The New York Times about his companys management practices, Jeff Bezos, chief executive of Amazon, sent this message to all employees, linking to the Times article and a counterpoint written on LinkedIn:

title: U.N. Finds Its Voice on Syrias Transition
description: UNITED NATIONS  For four years, the United Nations Security Council has been unable to agree on what to say  let alone what to do  to stop the civil war in Syria.

title: Mormon Leader Joseph Smiths 34 Wives Inspire Utah Artist
description: SALT LAKE CITY  In Leslie O. Petersons mind, Fanny Algers almond-shaped face, with its soulful green eyes and rosebud mouth, is framed by close-cropped brown hair and perched atop a long, slender neck.

title: Yankees C. C. Sabathia Is Contrite After Scuffle Outside Club
description: C.C. Sabathia acknowledged having used poor judgment in confronting a heckler outside a Toronto nightclub over the weekend after video of the incident was released Monday on the celebrity website TMZ.

title: States Move to Cut Funds for Planned Parenthood
description: WASHINGTON  With Congress in summer recess into September, anti-abortion officials in a number of Republican-controlled states are rushing to halt public funding for Planned Parenthood or to investigate it in reaction to hidden-camera videos claiming that it profits from fetal tissue sales.

title: Two Female Soldiers Poised to Graduate From Ranger School
description: Two female soldiers will graduate this week from Ranger School in Fort Benning, Ga., the first women to have made it through the Armys premier leadership course and one of the most challenging and exhausting training programs in the military, Army officials said on Monday.

title: Carly Fiorinas Business Record: Not So Sterling
description: I come from a world outside of politics, where track records and accomplishments count.

title: Union Ruling Underlines N.C.A.A.s Evolution
description: Among the more notable features of Mondays landmark decision by the National Labor Relations Board declining to recognize Northwestern football players unionization efforts was the time it took to make it. A petition was filed in January 2014. An N.L.R.B. regional director recognized its legitimacy in March 2014, prompting an appeal to the federal board. But before Monday, it had been more than a year since anything appeared on the cases docket.

title: Yankees Game Turns Grisly in an Instant as Bryan Mitchell Is Hit
description: Bryan Mitchell ended the top of the first inning at Yankee Stadium by striking out the cleanup hitter with a 97-mile-an-hour fastball. He punched his glove in excitement as he bounced off the mound.

title: Route 29 Batman, Who Thrilled Sick Children, Is Struck by Carand Killed
description: A Maryland businessman who thrilled thousands of sick children with his impersonation of Batman over more than a decade was hit by a car and killed on Sunday on a highway in western Maryland, the state police said.

title: Everything One Can Do
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE:  This was a bumpy one for me and perhaps that is prophetic, because this puzzle by Bill Thompson is about the MIDDLE EAST. Hes not editorializing, however; hes merely noticed that there are words and phrases with the word EAST in the MIDDLE.

title: Work Policies May Be Kinder, but Brutal Competition Isnt
description: On Wall Street, in Silicon Valley, across the legal profession and the corporate world, a growing chorus of companies are singing the praises of a kinder workplace, announcing policies like generous maternity leave at Netflix, and Goldman Sachss rule against investment-banking analysts working on Saturdays.

title: Jolt in California Adds to Trove of Quake Commentary
description: SAN FRANCISCO  To one Twitter user who experienced his first California earthquake on Monday, the 4.0 temblor was tiny, and Disneyland had better rides. Another post from the Bay Area derided earthquakes as just Gods push notifications. Several other people posted notices saying that the biggest disturbance by the overnight quake had been to their pets behavior.

title: Having a Ball
U.S. Is Set to Propose Regulation to Cut Methane Emissions
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is expected to propose as soon as Tuesday the first-ever federal regulation to cut emissions of methane, a powerful greenhouse gas that contributes to global warming, by the nations oil and natural-gas industry, officials familiar with the plan said on Monday.

title: After Blast, a Warning for American Tourists
description: As the Thai authorities cleaned up the site of Mondays bombing, a State Department spokesman advised American citizens to stay away from the area.

title: Patricia Clarksons Elegant Turtleneck Dress
description: The Star: Patricia Clarkson

title: Frances Stark and the Art of Narcissism
description: Junk mail, job concerns, a lovers penis and a young male muse called Bobby Jesus  the artists material is her life.

title: Myanmars Beautiful Spirit
description: Richard Christiansen, the founder of Chandelier Creative, and Vanessa Holden, former senior vice president of West Elm, document their three-week trip around the world searching for creative inspiration exclusively for T.

title: Flo Morrisseys Free-Spirited Style Moment
description: Upon the release of her poetic debut album, Tomorrow Will Be Beautiful, the folk singer pauses to enjoy the tender subtlety of fashions new bohemianism.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | yokel
description: yokel  \yo-kl\  noun

title: Former President Concedes, Then Reverses, in Sri Lanka
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka  Mahinda Rajapaksas hopes of returning to power hung by a thread on Tuesday, as he first appeared to concede defeat but then backed away and said he wanted to await official results of Mondays parliamentary vote.

title: Yankees Deliveries Are Handled With Care
description: His timeline was questionable, like his judgment last weekend in Toronto, when he confronted hecklers and narrowly missed being part of a street fight outside a nightclub. But whenever C. C. Sabathia was asked to take another day to rest before his next start, his response was firm.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday
description: 8:20 A.M. (Encore) BLUE JASMINE (2013) Cate Blanchett won an Oscar for her role as Jasmine French, a Park Avenue matron fallen on hard times after her husband, Hal (Alec Baldwin), lands in prison for bilking his clients, leaving her with little more than her pearls, Chanel jacket, Herms bag and Louis Vuitton luggage. Destitute, in a manner of speaking, Jasmine flies first-class to San Francisco to begin life anew with her sister, Ginger (Sally Hawkins), whose scrappy existence and brutish men Jasmine can barely stomach without self-medicating with vodka and Xanax. Then she meets a diplomatic type (Peter Sarsgaard) with an appreciation for her decorating talents and designer threads and starts to see light at the end of her dark tunnel. With intimations of Ruth Madoff and Blanche DuBois, this shattered woman is brilliantly brought to quivering life by Ms. Blanchett, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times, in Woody Allens most sustained, satisfying and resonant film since Match Point.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, August 18, 2015
description: Fifty-three. Where are all these girls?

title: Corrections: August 18, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Of Camera Work and Fine Art
description: The hand camera has come to stay  its importance is acknowledged, Alfred Stieglitz begrudgingly declared at the end of an 1897 essay about Eastman Kodaks campaign You Press the Button, We Do the Rest. For Stieglitz, this meant that Every Tom, Dick and Harry could, without trouble, learn how to get something or other on a sensitive plate, and this is what the public wanted  no work and lots of fun.

title: Student Crossword | Biodiversity
description: Test your knowledge of biodiversity by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Helix, a New Gene Sequencing Venture, Aims to Create Digital Hub for Genomics
description: SAN FRANCISCO  One of the top providers of gene-sequencing technology, Illumina, is teaming up with investors in hopes of buttressing the growing universe of genetic analysis businesses.

description: To the Editor:

title: Empire State Building Light Displays Effects on Wildlife
description: To the Editor:

title: How Cuomo Could Learn From Rockefeller
description: To the Editor:

title: Californias Saint, and a Churchs Sins
description: On his trip to the United States next month, Pope Francis is going to canonize the Rev. Junipero Serra, the great Spanish missionary of 18th-century California. As fourth graders from Chico to Chula Vista have been taught for generations, Father Serra founded the first of the 21 Catholic missions that stretch along the coast like rosary beads. He laid the foundation of California as we know it: the tile-and-adobe wonderland of vineyards, citrus, olives, wheat and cattle.

title: Remembering Julian Bond
description: To the Editor:

title: What Your Vacation Says About You
description: TWENTY-THREE years ago, my wife and I were having an argument about how to celebrate our first anniversary. Money was tight, and we had to choose between taking a beach vacation or buying a couch, which we did not have. Being a Spaniard, she naturally advocated for the beach. As a thrifty American, I argued for the couch because it was permanent. In the end, we compromised  we went to the beach.

title: Horrified by ISIS Use of Sex Slaves
description: To the Editor:

title: Europe, Listen to the I.M.F. and Restructure the Greek Debt
description: The International Monetary Fund is doing the right thing by not participating  in a deeply flawed loan agreement that European leaders have negotiated with Greece.

title: A Tobacco Tax to Save Lives
description: A smokeless tobacco product called snus, which a user puts between his gums and his upper lip, has a long history in Sweden. At the start of the last century, it was the most common way Swedes ingested nicotine. By the early 1950s, however, sales of snus had been overtaken by cigarettes, a trend that continued for two decades.

title: President Obamas Department of Injustice
description: WASHINGTON  LAST month, President Obama used his clemency power to reduce the sentences of 46 federal prisoners locked up on drug-related charges. But for the last six years, his administration has worked repeatedly behind the scenes to ensure that tens of thousands of poor people  disproportionately minorities  languish in federal prison on sentences declared by the courts, and even the president himself, to be illegal and unjustifiable.

title: I Am Republican, Hear Me Roar
description: To hear most of the Republican candidates tell it, all an American president has to do is talk tough, make demands, send more troops overseas, pour billions more dollars into the Pentagon and the world will fall in line. The notion theyre peddling boils down to this: President Obama is weak, I am strong and America will be great again when I am in the White House.

title: The Idealist Versus the Therapist
description: I was giving a lecture in New York not all that long ago. I was talking about ideals. The audience was made up of therapists and therapists in training at the eminent William Alanson White Institute on the Upper West Side. After the talk was over, I was asked a remarkable question. Certainly it was the best-posed question that I have ever gotten at a talk.

title: Diving for Scallops
description: For James Sewell, diving for scallops on the ocean floor off Maines jagged coastline transcends making a living  its what keeps him alive.

title: Diving for Scallops
description: This short documentary profiles a fisherman in Maine who practices a fading craft: diving for sea scallops on the ocean floor.

title: Japan's Military Dilemma
Koreas Agree to Raise Minimum Wage at Joint Industrial Park
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Even as tensions rise on other fronts, North and South Korea have reached agreement on at least one subject, officials said Tuesday: a raise for North Korean workers.

title: $8.8 Billion Acquisition of Australian Port and Railroad Operator
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Brookfield Infrastructure Partners, a global asset manager, said on Tuesday that a group it leads had reached an agreement to buy the Australian port and railroad operator Asciano for about $8.8 billion in cash and stock, and that it was shopping for ports farther afield in a push to expand.

title: Block by Block | Hoboken
description: Hoboken, N.J., which offers an easy commute to Manhattan, has expansive views and an increasing number of baby strollers.

title: Block by Block: Hoboken
description: Hoboken, N.J., is a city of around 53,000 on the Hudson River that increasingly draws young families that have been priced out of Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: Why New Orleanss Black Residents Are Still Underwater After Katrina
description: Bring a map of New Orleans. That was all that Alden J. McDonald Jr., president and chief executive of Liberty Bank and Trust Company, said when I first asked to meet him. It was the summer of 2005, less than two weeks after the citys flood-protection system failed to keep out the storm surge created by Hurricane Katrina, and I was reporting in Louisiana for this newspaper. The Gulf of Mexico was sitting in the lobby of his New Orleans headquarters. The flood had destroyed Libertys mainframe computer; a good many of the banks most essential documents  deeds for houses, titles for cars  were ruined as well. Six of Libertys eight branches were flooded and a seventh had been battered by looters. The banks central operations had to be moved to a branch office in Baton Rouge, 70 miles away.

title: The Unwelcome Return of Illegals
description: Ten years ago, the political strategist Frank Luntz issued a proclamation about the language of immigration. Always refer to people crossing the border illegally as illegal immigrants  NOT as illegals, Luntz instructed fellow conservatives. Illegals sounds harsh and spiky. As with fatties in high school, or thugs, its a way to write off a group and justify its mistreatment. Luntz says his research showed that if you used the word illegals, you didnt get a chance to say anything else  Latino audiences would turn you off. Republicans have long respected Luntzs messaging skills: This is the man who helped them write the Contract With America and pioneer the phrase death tax. Yet G.O.P. candidates for president have repeatedly ignored his warning.

title: Most Likely to Succeed, by Tony Wagner and Ted Dintersmith
description: Here, then, is yet another book about success. This time its not grit that helps children succeed. Nor is it having a Tiger Mom or letting children walk home alone or allowing them to skin their knees or teaching them Arabic or Mandarin. Its not about supporting their spiritual development or eliminating the gluten in their diets or teaching them about white privilege or the importance of team sports. No, this new tract aimed at the heart of parental anxiety  Most Likely to Succeed: Preparing Our Kids for the Innovation Era, by Tony Wagner and Ted Dintersmith  argues that the only way to ensure any kind of future security for our children is to totally upend the education system and rethink what school is for.

title: The Gift of Failure, by Jessica Lahey
description: When I was learning to drive, my mother sat in the passenger seat pressing her foot on an imaginary brake, gripping the door handle for dear life. She couldnt do it for me; she could only watch. It wasnt pretty, but I did learn.

title: The Two-State Delusion, by Padraig OMalley
description: Padraig OMalleys The Two-State Delusion is an impressive and frustrating book. Its impressive because OMalley, a professor at the University of Massachusetts at Boston who has written extensively on South Africa and Northern Ireland, has done a tremendous amount of research about the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Hes not only delved deeply into its literature; hes also interviewed dozens of participants on both sides. The result is a book so packed with information that it will reward even the reader so dedicated that she consumes the Israel-Palestine stories buried on Page A17 of The Times.

title: News Qs | Just How Tall Can Roller Coasters Get?
description: Note: Weve updated 6 Qs About the News for the new school year. Let us know what you think.

title: Taking the Starch Out of Orchestra Attire
description: Mountaineers no longer wear the scratchy tweeds favored by their 19th-century forebears. Modern swimwear bears little resemblance to the flesh-covering woolen bathing costumes of summers long past. But orchestra musicians still tend to saw away at Beethoven and Mahler in hot, constricting formal attire that would be instantly recognizable to audiences of a century ago.

title: In Quiet Woods, a Clamorous Gun Debate
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, Utah  As a lover of ancient rock art, Steve Acerson usually roams Utahs backcountry searching for images of hunters and rams carved on boulders and canyon walls. But one morning, on a hillside speckled with those prehistoric petroglyphs, he was also finding signs of a younger civilization: Shotgun shells. Bullets. Shredded juniper trees. Exploded cans of spray paint.

title: Emily Ratajkowski on Her Beauty Regimen and How She Doesnt Use a Trainer
description: Emily Ratajkowski, 24, shot to fame as the playful and scandalously bare brunette in Robin Thickes Blurred Lines music video, but she has been earning her marks on the silver screen ever since. After supporting roles in Gone Girl and this summers Entourage, Ms. Ratajkowski will star opposite Zac Efron in We Are Your Friends, out Aug. 28. Raised in the San Diego area, she now lives in Los Angeles. She talks about her personal care regimen. BEE SHAPIRO

title: Texting Comes of Age as a Political Messenger
description: WASHINGTON  Even a presidential candidates most devoted supporters could be forgiven for trying to tune out the torrent of campaign emails, Twitter messages, Facebook posts, Instagrams and Snapchats that steadily flood voters inboxes and social-media feeds in this digitized, pixelated, endlessly streaming election cycle.

title: Prison Guard Beat Up Squad Is Blamed in New York Inmates Death
description: On the evening of April 21 in Building 21 at the Fishkill Correctional Facility, Samuel Harrell, an inmate with a history of erratic behavior linked to bipolar disorder, packed his bags and announced he was going home, though he still had several years left to serve on his drug sentence.

title: Exploring Kentucky Bourbon at Its Source
description: I grew up in Memphis with a faint tantalizing aroma emanating from my fathers whiskey glass.

description: A stylish parade of art professionals, savvy New Yorkers and tourists stroll through the new museum.

description: HONG KONG  Mainland Chinese stock markets unexpectedly slumped again on Tuesday, with the Shanghai market plunging by 6.2 percent.

title: New York Today: All Ears in Brooklyn
description: Good morning on this still-hot Tuesday.

title: Foster Parents, Trying Not to Ask What Will We Do If He Leaves?
description: We walked shoulder-to-shoulder into the crowd. The sky was cloudy but the air was warm. Really, it could have been pouring rain and it wouldnt have mattered; my husband, Mike, and I were ready for a little time to ourselves however we could get it.

title: Indonesian Crash Searchers Recover Black Boxes From Plane
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesian search teams on Tuesday found the so-called black boxes from a commercial aircraft that went down in the remote eastern province of Papua, but low clouds were hampering efforts to remove bodies from the mountainous site of the crash, which killed all 54 people aboard, officials said.

title: U.S. Transfer of Internet Oversight Is Delayed
description: In a climate of international mistrust over how the government of the United States handles Internet data, the Commerce Department on Monday said it would delay by at least a year its plan to cede authority over the global address system for the web.

title: Today in Politics: Donald Trumps Immigration Plan Casts Rivals as the Rope in a Tug of War
description: Good Tuesday morning. Cameras and microphones flocked to Donald J. Trump on Monday as he fulfilled his civic responsibilities and reported for jury duty in Manhattan. But it is his strict immigration proposals that continue to gain widespread attention and expose tension in the party over which crucial voting bloc is best to alienate and upset: Mr. Trumps already angry supporters or Hispanics.

title: Morning Agenda: Carly Fiorinas Track Record
description: CARLY FIORINAS TRACK RECORD  | I come from a world outside of politics, where track records and accomplishments count, Carly Fiorina, a Republican candidate for president, said this year. In spite of her continued promotion of her business experience, she is still not often measured by her record as chief executive of Hewlett-Packard,Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in the DealBook column.

title: No Survivors from Crash, Officials Say
description: The Indonesian Search and Rescue Agency said on Tuesday that none of the 54 passengers aboard the aircraft that crashed in Papua Province had survived.

title: Methane Leaks in Natural-Gas Supply Chain Far Exceed Estimates, Study Says
description: A little-noted portion of the chain of pipelines and equipment that brings natural gas from the field into power plants and homes is responsible for a surprising amount of methane emissions, according to a study published on Tuesday.

title: Peach, a Lunch Delivery Service, Plans Expansion
description: Peach, a growing lunch delivery service that operates in Seattle and San Diego, has secured $8 million from Madrona Venture Group and Vulcan Capital.

title: Europes Civil War of Words
description: HAMBURG, Germany  CONVENTIONAL wisdom says the best way to ruin a friendship is to lend money to someone. Does that make the euro the worst idea the architects of the European Union ever had?

title: Thai Police Seek Suspect Seen on Video Before Bangkok Bombing
description: BANGKOK  The Thai authorities on Tuesday said they were pursuing a man captured on video before the bombing of a religious shrine in Bangkok the night before, an attack that killed at least 20 people, many of them tourists.

title: Depiction of Amazon Stirs a Debate About Work Culture
description: Amazon recently surpassed Walmart as the most valuable retailer in the country. It is ceaselessly inventive, unafraid to try something and fail. Its ambitious goal: sell everything to everyone everywhere. It is also figuring out how to extract the most from its employees, whose dedication and obsession is the real engine behind the companys success.

description: Have you been following the news?

title: Sri Lankans Reject Ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa in Election, and Prosecution May Follow
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka  Sri Lankan voters decisively rejected former President Mahinda Rajapaksas comeback bid, election results showed on Tuesday, leaving this island nation firmly in the hands of officials intent on dismantling most of his policies and completing corruption inquiries that have been closing in on him and his family.

description: TOKYO  For months, speculation built in East Asia in the lead-up to the 70th anniversary of Japans surrender, which ended World War II.

description: VENICE  As subversive books go, many of the 49 childrens tales hardly seem seditious.

description: YANGON, Myanmar  Myanmars opposition leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, said Tuesday that turmoil within the countrys governing party had bolstered her relationship with the partys ousted chairman.

title: The Most Important Story in the G.O.P. Race Isnt About Donald Trump
description: Donald Trump is dominating the news media and the Internet. He is leading in the polls. But even as journalists scour those surveys for signs of whether his surge will last, an important story with the potential to decide the race is being overlooked.

title: Readers Turn: How to Reduce the Prison Population
description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: Divisions and Inertia in Congress May Hand Obama a Victory on Iran Deal
description: WASHINGTON  Partisanship has become the pre-eminent scapegoat for American political failure, an all-purpose explanation for Washingtons inability to act. Yet in rare circumstances, it can actually guarantee action. So, notwithstanding an acrimonious debate, polarization makes the United States acceptance of the Iran nuclear deal very likely.

title: Why Latino Children Are Scared of Donald Trump
description: LYNWOOD, Calif.  MANY monsters and ghosts haunt the dreams of Latino children. There is La Llorona, who is said to moan for her dead children. And more recently, the Chupacabra, which sucks the blood from farm animals and maybe a boy or a girl if he or she doesnt behave.

title: Youll Love What Weve Done With the Place!
description: SPECIAL POST  Starting today, you will be able to solve your puzzles on our new Games Page. As we mentioned last week, a small number of subscribers received a preview of the new Page, and now we are unveiling it to all of you.

title: Inflation Robs Russians of Buying Power
description: RAMENSKOYE, Russia  A basic barometer of economic activity in this tidy town south of Moscow is the pirozhok, a small pie filled with cabbage and meat that is a staple of the Russian diet.

title: Surveillance Video Shows Bangkok Suspect
description: Thai police released a video, without audio, that shows a suspect in the bombing of a popular shrine that killed at least 20 people in the capital of Bangkok.

title: Italy Arrests Ships Captain and Crew Over Suffocation Deaths of 49 Migrants
description: ROME  Italian officials said on Tuesday that they had arrested the captain and crew of a boat in which 49 migrants suffocated over the weekend after they were blocked from leaving the ships hold.

title: Online and Telephone Fraud Surges in Mainland China and Hong Kong, Officials Say
description: Law enforcement officials in China and surrounding regions have reported a surge in online and telephone fraud by criminals who, with a powerful mix of technological and psychological savvy, pose as Chinese officials and cheat people of their life savings.

title: Daily Report: Amazons Workplace Culture Continues to Spur Online Debates
description: The hard-charging white-collar culture at Amazon, which was chronicled by Jodi Kantor and David Streitfeld over the weekend, has sparked numerous online debates about the company.

title: Latest CNN Republican Poll Has Donald Trump at 24%
description: Support for Donald J. Trump remains robust among Republicans after the first debate, according to a new poll from CNN that shows nearly a quarter of the partys likely voters would support his nomination for president.

title: 1890: Finding a Substitute for War
description: The Portuguese have discovered a substitute for war, which is both cheaper and more feasible than arbitration. Portugal has recently quarreled with England, but it was impolite for her to declare war against such a powerful adversary. The Portuguese therefore relieve their minds by the use of spittoons, made to represent pompous and plethoric Englishmen. Germany might demand the settlement of her next dispute with Russia under penalty of furnishing every German home with a receptacle for sauerkraut made in the image of a moujik. Thus would the horrors and expenses of war be avoided, while at the same time the overburdened hearts of nations relieved.  The New York Herald, European Edition, August 19, 1890

title: City Center Adds to Season With Wendy Whelan, Ballet and Flamenco
description: Wendy Whelan, the former New York City Ballet dancer whose retirement has been anything but quiet, will perform at City Center as part of three programs that have been added to round out the theaters spring season.

title: With The Visit, M. Night Shyamalan Returns to His Filmmaking Roots
description: LOS ANGELES  I dont know, bro. I was screwed up in the head.

title: DNA Shows Warren Harding Wasnt Americas First Black President
description: WASHINGTON  Bill Clinton was called the first black president because he crossed racial lines so easily, a distinction he lost when Barack Obama became the first actual black president. But for decades, some Americans claimed that the nations first black president was really Warren G. Harding.

title: Carly Fiorina Runs on Her Corporate Record, Despite Its Flaws
description: Carly Fiorina is rising in the polls as she campaigns for president on the strength of her track record as a businesswoman. The trouble is, its not a good record, writes Andrew Ross Sorkin, The Timess DealBook columnist.

title: Summer Looks at the Whitney
description: The Whitney Museum of American Art, which moved to the meatpacking district this summer, draws 5,000 to 6,000 visitors each day. On a recent Thursday, that included a colorful cross-section of well-dressed tourists, art professionals, museum staff members and quite a number of stylish New Yorkers taking in the art and waterfront views. See the photos.

title: Fashions Love Story With The 70s Continues
description: But with cleaner lines and artful juxtapositions, the look is distinctly modern.

title: Afghan Vice President Raises Concerns by Turning to Militias in Taliban Fight
description: ALMAR, Afghanistan  At first, Vice President Abdul Rashid Dostum tried to get help from his own government, lobbying the National Security Council to intervene as a Taliban offensive began making serious inroads on his home territory, a once relatively quiet northern region of Afghanistan.

title: Chinas Turbulent Markets Keep Still-Eager Investors Guessing
description: As Chinas once-staid currency suddenly dropped sharply last week, Wall Street began sniffing around for a way to profit.

title: Donald Trumps American Idiocy
description: Donald Trump has an immigration plan. Its bananas, of course, the kind of policy menu youd get from a think tank made up of people who yell at the TV.

title: State Department Fights for Rights of Gay Envoys
description: WASHINGTON  Matthew Cuenca-Daigles husband is a Foreign Service officer who last year gladly accepted a position at the American Embassy in Beijing. But only months before his husbands language training was to begin, embassy officials said it was unclear if Mr. Cuenca-Daigle could get a long-term visa, given that China does not recognize same-sex marriages.

title: Jon Stewart to Enjoy Retirement by Hosting WWE SummerSlam
description: When Jon Stewart announced in February that he would retire from The Daily Show, he said: I dont have any specific plans. Got a lot of ideas. I got a lot of things in my head. After more than 16 years behind the desk of one of TVs most notable late-night shows, Mr. Stewart could really do anything: embark on a lucrative speaking tour; direct another movie; attend every Bruce Springsteen concert for the next several years.

title: Providence, R.I., Is Building on a Highways Footprint
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.  A real estate initiative involving 19 acres of vacant land made available after the relocation of Interstate 195 is attracting interest from developers after a sluggish start.

title: Scott Walkers Health Care Plan Relies on Tax Credits to Buy Coverage
description: Repeal and replace has been a mantra for Republicans when discussing President Obamas health law. On Tuesday, Gov. Scott Walker, the Republican presidential candidate from Wisconsin, offered some details on how he would replace the Affordable Care Act if he is elected.

title: Transportation Secretary and New Jersey Officials Meet to Discuss Hudson River Rail Tunnels
description: NEWARK  The revived plan to build new rail tunnels under the Hudson River appeared to gain momentum on Tuesday, as the federal transportation secretary, Anthony Foxx, and New Jersey officials agreed at a meeting to work together to move forward on it.

title: Drone Footage of Tianjin Blast Aftermath
description: Footage released by firefighters shows aerial images of a warehouse in Tianjin, China, the site of huge explosions on Aug. 12.

title: Skyscraper That Would Soar Over Sutton Place Runs Into Neighborhood Opposition
description: Herndon Werth met with several lawyers last week in a restaurant around the corner from his home of over 40 years, on a sleepy stretch of 58th Street near luxurious Sutton Place on the East Side of Manhattan.

title: Films With Political Themes Among Those Added to Toronto Lineup
description: LOS ANGELES  The Toronto International Film Festival sharpened its political edge, as a pair of issues-oriented films joined another 22 additions to its September lineup of galas and special presentations.

title: Was Portrayal of Amazons Brutal Workplace on Target?
description: Soon after The Timess massive takeout on the culture of Amazons workplace (Where overachievers go to feel bad about themselves.), an Amazon employee, Nick Ciubotariu, wrote a long, passionate response in disagreement.

title: Fear of Toxic Air and Distrust of Government Follow Tianjin Blasts
description: BEIJING  Within minutes of the immense chemical explosions that sent apocalyptic fireballs into the night sky over Tianjin, Zhou Haisen, 23, was making arrangements to leave town. He was terrified that poisonous gases would reach his apartment six miles from the scene, and his fears were swiftly reinforced by posts on Chinese social media. So he and his parents fled to his grandmothers house an hours drive away.

title: 1965: Rift Over Vietnam Denied
description: WASHINGTON  President Johnson moved to dispel suggestions of a rift between him and former President Eisenhower over policy in Vietnam. The chief executive abruptly sent an envoy to the Eisenhower farm at Gettysburg, Pa., by helicopter to discuss UN matters. However, the surprise announcement came after a strong statement by the presidential press secretary that Mr. Johnson sees no division between himself and Gen. Eisenhower on Vietnam.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, August 19, 1965

title: Videos Show Bangkok Bombing
description: A compilation of surveillance and witness videos shows the frantic moments before and after Mondays bombing at a religious shrine in Bangkok.

title: Smashed Cucumber Salad Takes Manhattan
description: The difference between a sliced cucumber salad and a smashed cucumber salad reveals itself on first bite.

title: NBCUniversal to Invest $200 Million in BuzzFeed
description: BuzzFeed, the digital media hub known for its shareable lists and a relatively recent push into more ambitious journalism, has landed a $200 million strategic investment from the entertainment conglomerate NBCUniversal, the two companies confirmed on Tuesday.

title: Poll Finds Most Back Healthy School Meals
description: WASHINGTON  A majority of Americans support providing schoolchildren with healthy meals that consist of more fruits and vegetables and fewer foods high in calories and sodium, according to a national poll released on Tuesday by the W. K. Kellogg Foundation.

title: How Artists Are Making a (Better) Living in the Internet Age
description: Six creatives in the Los Angeles area are supporting themselves with professions that would have been impossible 15 years ago.

title: Beatles First Recording Contract Up for Auction
description: The Beatles first recording contract, signed in Hamburg, Germany, in 1961, is being sold by Heritage Auctions next month. The six-page contract led to the recording of the single My Bonnie with the singer Tony Sheridan, and landed the Beatles about $80. The contract is now expected to be sold for $150,000.

title: Elections Seem Likely in Turkey as ISIS Threat Rises
description: ISTANBUL  Prospects for a period of instability in Turkey increased on Tuesday after attempts by the dominant party to form a new coalition government officially ended in failure.

title: Readers Share Their Pay-Gap Experiences

description: Weve learned from running this contest over many years that as summer winds down, the competition heats up  evidenced in Week 8 by 828 entries.

description: Korean for the small-plate set in the East Village.

title: Restaurant Review: Oiji in the East Village
description: Ill get to the heftier items on Oijis menu. Ill praise the pine-smoked mackerel that a mackerel-conscious friend and I have been emailing each other about for a month now. Ill reminisce about the bowl of buttered rice and stewed beef that seemed boring at first and then not boring at all. Ill try to explain what makes the bubble-cluster of crust on the fried chicken so good. All in due time, all in due time.

title: Bangladesh Arrests 3 Men in Killings of Secular Bloggers
description: DHAKA  The authorities in Bangladesh have arrested three men in connection with the brutal killings of secular bloggers, an official said on Tuesday.
