description: It came to me, as most things do nowadays, while staring at my phone.

title: Cancellation of Play About Islamic State Recruits Prompts Concern in London
description: LONDON  In a letter published in The Times of London, prominent theater figures and other artists expressed concern that the National Youth Theater had been pressured to cancel a new play, Homegrown, about young Islamic State recruits.

title: Atlas, a Humanoid Robot, Takes a Walk in the Woods
description: Scientists trying to build a better robot are encouraged by the steps, however tentative, of a humanoid named Atlas.

title: Unicorns Hunt for Talent Among Silicon Valleys Giants
description: For the last year, Googles work force has increasingly been under attack from a herd of unicorns.

title: A Roving Manhattan Pool Party Eases the Summer Heat
description: On sweltering summer days, the mind wanders masochistically to the beaches of the Hamptons, or the private pools tucked behind exclusive addresses. The Downtown Pool Club offers a refreshing option, with a roving Manhattan pool party, three times a week.

title: Familiar Talk on Women, From an Unfamiliar Trump
description: The outspoken scion of the New York real estate developer Fred C. Trump stood on stage in Washington one day in 1992 and told a mostly female crowd of law enforcement agents to lighten up when it came to sexual harassment.

title: New Lonergan Play Added to Atlantic Roster; Labyrinth Sets New Season
description: The characters in Kenneth Lonergans plays like This Is Our Youth and The Waverly Gallery usually find themselves in the cloistered world of New York City (with one time-traveling detour to the Europe of the Hundred Years War, Medieval Play).

title: Little League Softball Scandal Ends in Elimination for the Accused
description: A girls softball team accused of intentionally losing at the Little League World Series was eliminated on Tuesday after being ordered to play a special play-in game.

title: Will the Pentagon Change Its Manual on the Law of War?
description: A senior lawyer at the Defense Department said last week that criticism about a section on the role and treatment of journalists in the Pentagons new Law of War manual, is something of major concern. And well it should be.

title: Cruise to New Guinea Is Offered
description: Lindblad Expeditions-National Geographic is offering a cruise to New Guinea, which it calls one of the least explored places. The 20-day trip aboard the National Geographic Orion, which can accommodate 102 passengers, departs Sept. 22 from Brisbane, Australia. The tour includes forays into largely inaccessible terrain where art, tribal life, biology and history intersect. The highlight is learning about the cultures of West Papua, Papua and Papua New Guinea and meeting Asmat, above, and Trobriand islanders.

title: E.P.A. Announces New Rules to Cut Methane Emissions
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Tuesday proposed the first federal regulations requiring the nations oil and gas industry to cut emissions of methane as part of an expanding and increasingly aggressive effort to combat climate change.

title: ISIS Lures 3 Teenage Girls: Reporters Notebook
description: A foreign correspondent based in London, Katrin Bennhold has written about everything from the migrant crisis in Calais and Scotlands independence movement to trigger-happy fox snipers. She has a front-page article in Tuesdays paper about three well-educated teenage girls who left their childhood home in Bethnal Green in East London for Syria, where they joined forces with ISIS. She talked with Times Insider about her reporting.

title: German Art Historian to Direct Uffizi Gallery in Italy
description: ROME  A German art historian will run the Uffizi Gallery in Florence, Italys culture minister said Tuesday, announcing the appointment of the directors of the countrys top 20 museums, selected after an international competition.

title: At the Internet Yami-ichi Flea Market, Nothing but Net
description: A traveling tech convention where memes become mementos.

title: Baseball Fever Grows in Montreal With Hope of a New Team
description: MONTREAL  Along the back wall of a sleek new souvenir and magazine shop at Trudeau International Airport in Montreal, there was an array of sports team products: jerseys, hats, coffee mugs and the like.

title: Twyla Tharps Rehearsal: On the First Day, No Surprises Please
description: Twyla Tharp is writing about rehearsing, touring and creating new work, 50 years after her first dance concert.

title: Chicken in a Time of Figs
description: When ripe figs are as plentiful as they are now, I use them in savory dishes, not just sweet ones. I like figs quickly grilled or seared, and sometimes I cook my figs long enough to render them a bit jammy. It takes only a few minutes for this to happen.

title: Attacks, and Accusations, Escalate in Eastern Ukraine
description: MOSCOW  Fighting between government forces and Russian-backed rebels in eastern Ukraine has escalated sharply in recent days, with each side blaming the other for the violence.

title: ISIS Threatens Istanbul
description: In a new video from the Islamic State, an unidentified fighter calls for people in Turkey to fight President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and conquer Istanbul.

title: The Quiet Demise of the Armys Plan to Understand Afghanistan and Iraq
description: One dreary winter day in 2010, I joined a Georgia National Guard unit on a routine patrol in Zormat, a ragged mountain town in eastern Afghanistan, not far from the Pakistani border. With us were two American civilians in military uniforms who worked for a United States Army social-science program called the Human Terrain System. The Army had begun developing the program as an experiment in 2006; it expanded quickly as the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan foundered and American policy makers cast about for novel approaches. The idea was to send teams of social scientists, including anthropologists, to gather ethnographic, sociocultural and economic information and advise front-line soldiers on a range of delicate topics, from the mechanics of forging tribal alliances to how to respond to local offers of hospitality.

title: Robert Menendez Says Hell Vote Against Iran Nuclear Deal
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Robert Menendez, Democrat of New Jersey, said Tuesday that he would vote against the nuclear accord with Iran, contending the agreement did not go far enough to limit Tehrans potential to pursue a weapons program.

title: Louis C.K. Defends Bill de Blasio on the Radio. Maybe.
description: Amid a bumpy summer, Mayor Bill de Blasio has said that everyday New Yorkers understand the good work his administration is doing.

title: Technology to Keep Swimmers Safe
description: On a hot summer afternoon in July, my friends 8-year-old son Cody nearly drowned in a backyard swimming pool. There were two moms supervising and only one other family in the water. It was quiet and calm, and those watching him thought he was just trying to see how long he could hold his breath. When they realized it wasnt a game and pulled him out, he was unconscious and his lips were blue. Both moms started CPR and the child was coughing up blood by the time the paramedics arrived less than 10 minutes later.

title: Promontory Financial Settles With New York Regulator
description: When New York States financial regulator challenged the independence of a top Wall Street consultant, the Promontory Financial Group, the firm threatened to sue, vowing to litigate the matter and defend our firm against this regulatory overreach.

title: Driven | 2016 Nissan Maxima
description: The Maxima distances itself from its sibling the Altima with a crafted interior and a look all its own.

title: Video Review: New Maxima Gives Nissan Fans a Reason to Trade Up
description: NISSAN has offered few reasons for buyers to step up from a loaded Altima to the Maxima the last few years. Many of the same features and much of the same performance and design panache in the Maxima could be had with its less expensive sibling. There was no 2015 Maxima, and what 2014 models remained were sold to loyalists (and there are many)  until the 2016 models arrived this summer.

title: Bank of New York Mellon Settles Bribery Case Over Interns
description: The three interns at Bank of New York Mellon who joined the firm in the summer of 2010 seemed unusual choices on paper. None met the financial giants rigorous criteria, and none were hired through the usual internship programs.

title: Amnesty International Says All Sides in Yemen Have Committed War Crimes
description: Amnesty International issued a scathing report Tuesday on the Yemen conflict, accusing all armed antagonists there of complicity in war crimes, including indiscriminate attacks on civilians.

title: A Brooklyn Original
description: Mark Iacono may run one of the citys best pizzerias, but hes still just a guy from Carroll Gardens.

title: At Lucali, Pizza for the A-List and the Landlady Upstairs
description: Mark Iacono strolls through Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, at a regal pace, knowing few will allow him to pass without a handshake or a loving mention of his grandmother the cook or his grandfather the pawnbroker.

title: Sorority Video Generates Charges of Discrimination
description: A video promoting the University of Alabamas chapter of a largely white sorority has been taken down after being widely criticized online for its portrayal of women and for its lack of diversity.

title: First Draft Focus: Straightening Out Old Glory
Russian Police Get Tough on Illicit Cheese
description: MOSCOW  One of Russias tabloid TV channels began a news bulletin Tuesday with a breathless report about a major international criminal gang freshly rolled up in the Moscow region.

title: Review: Aimard Plays George Benjamins Shadowlines, Uniting Prelude and Canon
description: It was appropriate that Pierre-Laurent Aimard, one of our most lucid, instructive pianists, gave a solo recital late Monday evening in the form of a class. But this wasnt one of those dry high school lectures you snoozed through or skipped.

title: N.F.L.s Case Against Tom Brady Is Returning to Courtroom as Talks Stall
description: The showdown between the N.F.L. and its star quarterback, Tom Brady of the New England Patriots, is expected to continue Wednesday in federal court as both sides resist pressure from a judge to settle and instead dig their heels in further.

title: A Jams Revival (in Spirit)
description: Jams The California-style restaurant Jams, a trailblazer in New York when it opened on East 79th Street in 1984, remained part of Jonathan Waxmans persona long after it closed. Now, for a restaurant project in a new hotel, Mr. Waxman is reviving Jams in spirit, though not in detail. It is an airy space done in stone and wood, and more rustic than the original, with simpler table settings and dishtowel napkins. Some of the 100 seats are at a long bar, and an open kitchen anchors the rear of the space. Along with grilled chicken with tarragon butter; and red pepper latkes with smoked salmon, corn and California caviar  which are holdovers from the 1980s  Jams will serve brightly accented dishes like rigatoni with crab meat and chile as well as swordfish with grilled pineapple salsa. Its my food, less Italian than Barbuto, but still what I like to cook, Mr. Waxman said. Barbuto is his West Village restaurant, and its pastry chef Heather Miller is making the desserts at Jams, too. Melvyn Master, the wine expert who was Mr. Waxmans partner and the m in the name (Jams stands for Jonathan and Melvyn) is providing some of his wines to the new restaurant: 1 Hotel Central Park, 1414 Avenue of the Americas (58th Street), 212-703-2007.

title: Writers Room: Patrice Nganang
description: The novelist in his Hopewell, N.J., house.

title: Writers Room: Valeria Luiselli
description: The debut novelist in the light-filled Harlem studio that she shares with her husband.

title: Bronx Rabbi Who Took Boys Naked to Sauna Will Keep His Job
description: A prominent Orthodox rabbi in the Bronx who was the focus of scrutiny for having taken boys naked to a sauna will keep his job, after his synagogues board changed course and decided not to seek his removal.

title: Gabons President Offers Some of His Wealth to the People
description: COURBEVOIE, France  One of Africas wealthiest presidents said this week that he was giving up at least some of his holdings to the people of Gabon, a declaration heralded by his inner circle but quickly met with skepticism by critics who pointed out the legal and political pressure the leader, Ali Ben Bongo, is facing over the vast riches acquired by his family.

title: Review: A Manual for Cleaning Women, Lucia Berlins Soul-Baring Stories
description: Theres a fine crude moment in A Manual for Cleaning Women, an overdue collection of stories by Lucia Berlin (1936-2004), when one of her narrators, a nurse, pauses to consider the nature of clear colostomy bags.

title: In Israel, a Focus on Chinese Tourists
description: The Israeli government, still reeling from a drop-off in visitors following last summers war with Gaza, is betting on China to jump-start the nations flagging tourism industry.

title: A Deluge of Comments From Readers With an Opinion About Amazon
description: Toilet paper-delivering drones may not be a thing (yet), but history was made over the weekend when Jodi Kantor and David Streitfelds expos on workplace practices at Amazon became the most commented-on story at The New York Times.

title: American Ballet Theater to Debut Ratmansky Work Next Spring
description: American Ballet Theaters spring 2016 season, from May 9 to July 2 at the Metropolitan Opera House, is to include one world premiere and one American premiere, the company announced on Tuesday. As usual, the lineup includes seven full-length ballets and two triple bills. The full-lengths are Le Corsaire, La Fille Mal Garde, The Golden Cockerel, Romeo and Juliet, The Sleeping Beauty, Swan Lake and Sylvia. The two triple bills will be The Shostakovich Trilogy (which can be considered a full-length ballet, though not narrative) and another trio yet to be announced.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi Speaks to Reporters
description: At a news conference on Tuesday, Myanmars opposition leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, criticized the manner in which the governing partys chairman, Thura Shwe Mann, was removed.

title: Samsungs New Big-Screen Phones Differ in the Little Things
description: SAMSUNG Electronics recently introduced two jumbo-screen smartphones with so much in common youll wonder why there is more than one.

title: Scott Walker Vows to Repeal Obamacare
description: Mr. Walker, a Republican presidential candidate and the governor of Wisconsin, said Tuesday that he had a plan to repeal the Affordable Care Act and replace it with a better system.

title: Putin Goes Diving in Black Sea
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia used a submersible to explore the waters off the coast of Crimea, looking for a centuries-old shipwreck.

title: Rogelio Livieres Plano, Bishop Ousted by Pope Francis, Dies at 69
description: Rogelio Livieres Plano, a conservative bishop in eastern Paraguay who was deposed by Pope Francis last year, died Friday in Buenos Aires. He was 69.

title: Kik Raises $50 Million From Tencent, in Bid to Become WeChat of the West
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Kik has long aspired to become the Western worlds equivalent of WeChat, the hugely popular Chinese messaging app that lets users book taxis, send payments  and also talk with their friends.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Pictures of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Turkey and More  Pictures of the Day

title: August 18, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photographs from Turkey, West Bank, Thailand and India.

title: Writers Room: Luc Sante
description: Inside the authors home in Kingston, N.Y.

title: BB&T Is New Deal-Making Powerhouse in Banking
description: Americas new bank merger and acquisition powerhouse is leaving its rivals for dead. The regional lender BB&Ts $1.8 billion swoop for National Penn Bancshares is its fourth deal in a year.

title: Writers Room: David Hare
description: The dramatist in his airy London studio, where he sometimes stages readings, with a table he was given by his first wifes parents in 1970.

title: Writers Room: Jane Smiley
description: Inside the novelists office in her Carmel Valley, Calif., home.

title: German Vote on Bailout Carries Risks for Merkel
description: BERLIN  Faced with a revolt among her own deputies over approval of a new 86-billion-euro bailout for Greece, Chancellor Angela Merkel and her government on Tuesday met with lawmakers to try to contain the political damage from the conservative rebellion.

title: Kansas City Art Institute Receives $25 Million Donation
description: The Kansas City Art Institute in Missouri, which has trained or employed artists including Thomas Hart Benton, Robert Rauschenberg and Nick Cave and is celebrating its 130th anniversary, announced Tuesday that it had received a donation of $25 million, one of the largest gifts ever to an American art school.

title: Clinton Says Republicans Skip Issues
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, a Democratic presidential candidate, appeared at a town hall event in Las Vegas on Tuesday and criticized Republican candidates for what she found was a lack of substance.

title: Pivotal Software Gets a New Leader and Announces Strong Cloud Revenue
description: Pivotal Software announced on Tuesday that it had a new leader and that bookings for its cloud computing software is now a $100 million-a-year business, double the size of a year ago.

title: Supporters of College Athletes Unions Look Past Setback
description: WASHINGTON  It was a cold January morning more than a year and a half ago when Kain Colter and the activist Ramogi Huma called a news conference at a downtown Chicago hotel to announce their intention to form the first college sports union.

title: Review: Grey Gardens Is Revived in Its Real Setting, the Hamptons
description: SAG HARBOR, N.Y.  Here in the manicured Hamptons, where affluence parades in the summer months, Grey Gardens counts as a local story: the Camelot relatives  Jacqueline Kennedy Onassiss elderly aunt and middle-aged cousin  whose spectacularly mangy living conditions, in their wreck of an East Hampton mansion, grabbed headlines in the 1970s. The neighbors, naturally, had complained.

title: Meal-Delivery Start-Ups Take Aim at Your Dinner
description: Baking a cake has evolved over the years. When my grandmother learned to bake, she had to buy all the ingredients at the store, including flour, eggs, butter and sugar, and bake the cake from scratch.

title: Hurricane Sandys Red Tape Makes a Veteran Say, Id Rather Go Back to Falluja
description: BALDWIN, N.Y.  The recent letter from the Federal Emergency Management Agency about his flood insurance claim should have come as good news to William T. Lynch, who is now on his third apartment rental since his 1920s cottage here was gutted by Hurricane Sandy nearly three years ago.

title: White House Hires First Openly Transgender Staff Member
description: CHILMARK, Mass.  The White House has hired its first openly transgender staff member, officials said Tuesday, adding a longtime advocate for transgender rights to the office of presidential personnel.

title: A Dual Review of Whats New Starring Laverne Cox and Imogen Poots
description: See the chart as a PDF.

title: A Conversation With Teresa Bryce Bazemore
description: Ms. Bazemore, 56, is the president of Radian Guaranty, the private mortgage insurance subsidiary of the Radian Group, based in Philadelphia.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: Good evening. Heres the latest.

title: Festival in Oslo Rejects Film by Roy Zafrani, Citing Cultural Boycott of Israel
description: Israeli-Norwegian relations have hardly been a flash point in the troubled history of the Middle East. But a programming decision last week by a film festival in Oslo to reject a film simply for its Israeli-ness may have opened a new chapter in the boycott movement against Israel.

title: Shooting Unarmed Black Man Was Self-Defense, Officers Lawyer Tells Charlotte Jury
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  The lawyer for a white Charlotte police officer charged with voluntary manslaughter concluded his defense on Tuesday by shifting accusations onto the black former college football player who died in the 2013 shooting, portraying the unarmed victim as a would-be burglar who dared the police to kill him.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Review: In Slow Learners, Aspirational Hedonists Doff Their Glasses
description: The romantic comedy Slow Learners opens with Jeff (Adam Pally from The Mindy Project) enduring his latest first date to go south: Youre just soft and doughy, she explains helpfully. Youre sort of like an old baby.

title: Hedwig and the Angry Inch Sets Broadway Closing Date
description: Its time to put that wig back on the shelf: Hedwig and the Angry Inch is closing on Broadway.

title: The Education of a Gardener
description: In one of Englands greatest flower gardens, an Italian formalist learns to appreciate the subtleties of seasons.

title: Review: Beltracchi: The Art of Forgery Tells How a Swindler Fooled the World
description: In the documentary Beltracchi: The Art of Forgery, the German forger Wolfgang Beltracchi  who was sentenced in 2011 to six years in prison but released this year  professes to be able to paint anything. The art historian Henry Keazor gives him names. Leonardo? Of course. Hes not difficult, Mr. Beltracchi replies. When Mr. Keazor notes that the forger has the potential to deceive even scholars like him, Mr. Beltracchi replies, If you write a catalog of works, bring it to me first. This is ostensibly to make sure that undiscovered fakes are not accidentally included.

title: Rape CasePuts Focus on Culture of Elite St. Pauls School
description: CONCORD, N.H.  Owen Labrie, a senior at the St. Pauls School, made up a list of potential girls for his senior salute  a school ritual in which older students proposition younger ones for as much intimacy as they can get away with: a kiss, touching, or more.

title: F.D.A. Approves Addyi, a Libido Pill for Women
description: The first prescription drug to enhance womens sexual drive won regulatory approval on Tuesday, clinching a victory for a lobbying campaign that had accused the Food and Drug Administration of gender bias for ignoring the sexual needs of women.

title: Ohio States Quarterback Plan Still Unclear Months After National Title
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Cardale Jones has a flair for embracing his newfound fame, and anyplace he goes is a stage. His latest performance came at Ohio States media day over the weekend, when Jones, the quarterback who went from third-stringer to starter as the Buckeyes won the national championship last season, sat down at a table with his 9-month-old daughter, Chloe, on his lap to conduct his interviews.

title: U.S. Investigates Airbag Rupture in a Volkswagen
description: Volkswagen has been one of the few global automakers unaffected by rupturing airbags made by Takata that are linked to at least eight deaths and more than 100 injuries.

title: Donald Trump Paints Republicans Into Corner With Hispanics
description: Republicans thought they had learned a lesson after 2012: Turning off Latino voters ensures defeat in the general election.

title: Tumblr 554  557
description: Tumblr 554  557

title: Hackers Say They Have Released Ashley Madison Files
description: Hackers claim to have made good on their threat to release data they stole in a breach last month of the company behind Ashley Madison, the popular online dating website aimed at people hoping to cheat on their spouses.

title: Libya Asks Arab League Countries to Help Battle Islamic State
description: CAIRO  The Islamic State militants who control the Libyan city of Surt are resorting to mass beheadings, public crucifixions and other stark displays of brutality as they seek to crush an insurrection, the foreign minister of Libyas internationally recognized government said Tuesday at a meeting of Arab diplomats here.

title: Howard Brody, an Expert in the Physics of Tennis, Dies at 83
description: Howard Brody, the worlds foremost physicist of tennis, who explored what happens when the stoppable force known as a ball meets the movable object called a racket, died on Aug. 11 in Bryn Mawr, Pa. He was 83.

title: Ex-Officers in Georgia Charged in Death Linked to Taser
description: ATLANTA  Two former police officers in East Point, Ga., have been charged with felony murder in connection with the 2014 death of a man who was repeatedly shocked with Taser devices while he was handcuffed.

title: Russian Pagans Continue Ancient Traditions
description: Over the past four years, Tatiana Plotnikova has photographed Russian Pagans who follow their ancestors traditions in the Mari El Republic.

title: W.H.O. Calls Vaccine Hesitancy an Increasing Concern Globally
description: The World Health Organization warned Tuesday of what it called the growing problem of vaccine hesitancy, when people delay or refuse vaccines for themselves or their children. In a statement on its website, the organization called the problem a growing challenge for countries seeking to close the immunization gap. Globally, the organization said, one in five children still do not receive routine lifesaving immunizations, and 1.5 million children die each year of diseases that could have been thwarted by vaccines.

title: Bullpen Wobbles in Victory After Parnell Heads to D.L.
description: BALTIMORE  After Bobby Parnell was booed off the mound Sunday during an embarrassing Mets loss, his manager, Terry Collins, approached him about taking a break. Parnell was obviously still feeling the effects of Tommy John surgery. He might not feel pain, Collins told him, but it was natural for him to need time to regain his touch.

title: Hillary Clinton Turns to Nevada as a General Election Litmus Test
description: LAS VEGAS  On Tuesday, Hillary Rodham Clinton declared this city  with its flashy strip of casinos, rows of middle-class subdivisions and one of the highest unemployment rates in the nation  the perfect place to pitch her campaign message.

title: New Mexico: Officers to Be Tried for Mans Killing
description: A judgeon Tuesdayordered an Albuquerque police officer and a retired detective to stand trial for the killing of a homeless man, James Boyd, last year during a long confrontation that started when the police accused Mr. Boyd of illegally camping on the foothills of the Sandia Mountains. The officer, Dominique Perez, and the retired detective, Keith Sandy, will face second-degree murder and manslaughter charges. A video of the shooting, captured by an officers lapel camera, set off protests in Albuquerque over the use of force by city police officers, who had fired at civilians at least 37 times in four years. These and other use-of-force incidents were the basis of a scathing report by the Justice Department, which entered into an agreement with the city last October to improve officers training, among other changes.

title: Making Tires From a Desert Shrub Found in the U.S.
description: For years, tire industry executives, as well as government officials and scientists, have sought a domestic source for natural rubber to escape the price fluctuations of imports and, more recently, to avoid petroleum, which is used to make synthetic rubber.

title: Disagreeing With President, Hillary Clinton Says She Opposes Drilling in Arctic Ocean
description: In a rare disagreement with President Obama, Hillary Rodham Clinton on Tuesday came out against drilling for oil and gas in the Arctic Ocean, one day after the White House granted approval for exploration off the coast of Alaska.

title: Yankees Bryan Mitchell Lands on 7-Day Disabled List
description: A couple of dozen members of the hard-bitten, not-easily-impressed news media gathered Tuesday around Bryan Mitchell, who was hit in the face by a line drive the night before, when someone asked him about his cap, which the ball ticked off before striking his nose.

title: South Sudan: U.S. Threatens Sanctions Over Rejection of Pact
description: The White House chastised President Salva Kiir of South Sudan on Tuesday for refusing to sign a peace agreement to halt that nations civil war, and it threatened to pursue sanctions against those who undermine the peace process. Susan E. Rice, the national security adviser, said in a statement that there must be consequences for those who continue to stand in the way of peace and that the United States had begun consultations at the United Nations and with regional partners to initiate action in the Security Council. This summer, President Obama met with the regions leaders during a trip to Africa and urged them to seek an end to the fighting. The leaders agreed to seek sanctions if the warring parties refused to sign a peace deal by Monday. At the deadline, Mr. Kiir declined to sign, saying in a Twitter message: If it is signed today and then tomorrow we go back to war, then what have we achieved?

title: Amazons Social Rift
description: The recent New York Times article about Amazon inspired an unprecedented online conversation about workplace stress. Here are a few of the thousands of comments posted across the web.

title: One Palestinians Refusal to Eat Puts Israel in a Bind
description: JERUSALEM  A single Palestinian prisoners determination to starve himself to death unless he is freed is flummoxing Israels legal, medical, political and security systems.

title: Times Squares Topless Women Should Be Regulated, Mayor Says
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio said on Tuesday that he sees the women parading around Times Square covered in little but body paint not as creative artists, but as pushy panhandlers whose efforts to separate tourists from their money should be regulated.

title: Using Technology to Close a Mortgage, and Relieve Stress
description: Anyone who has purchased a home knows how stressful the closing of a mortgage loan can be.

title: For Hillary Clinton, Another Grilling About Emails
description: NORTH LAS VEGAS, Nev.  In a testy exchange with Ed Henry of Fox News on Tuesday, Hillary Rodham Clinton defended her handling of the server that hosted the personal email account she exclusively used as secretary of state and reiterated that she did not receive any emails that were marked as classified.

title: After Swift Exit, Kyrgios Proves Reserved in Loss
description: MASON, Ohio  Days after making a remark to an opponent in Montreal that was picked up by on-court microphones and resulted in a $10,000 fine, Nick Kyrgios received a mixed reaction upon his arrival at his opening-round match at the Western & Southern Open.

title: Video of Man Restrained by San Francisco Police Causes Stir
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A video that apparently shows police officers roughly restraining a black man with a prosthetic leg has caused a stir since it was posted to a popular online commentary magazine.

title: Melva Bucksbaum, Art Collector and Curator, Dies at 82
description: Melva Bucksbaum, who transformed her childhood passion for collecting dolls and glass animals into a career as one of Americas leading art collectors, curators and patrons, died on Sunday at her home in Aspen, Colo. She was 82.

title: Health Proposals by Walker and Rubio Are Less Concerned About the Poor
description: Obamacare gives federal money to poor people to help them get health insurance. Scott Walker, Wisconsins governor, has a replacement plan. It would give federal money to old people instead.

title: Tony Gleatons Defiantly Vivid Photographs
description: Tony Gleaton turned his back on a career in New York fashion and embarked on an itinerant artistic quest.

title: Tony Gleaton, 67, Dies, Leaving Legacy in Pictures of Africans in the Americas
description: Tony Gleaton, a photographer who turned his back on a career in New York fashion and embarked on an itinerant artistic quest, documenting the lives of black cowboys and creating images of the African diaspora in Latin America, died on Friday in Palo Alto, Calif. He was 67.

title: Leader at Washington National Cathedral Steps Down
description: WASHINGTON  The Very Rev. Gary Hall, the dean of Washington National Cathedral, announced on Tuesday that he would step down at years end to make way for a younger leader who can help guide the century-old Episcopal church as it tries to overcome financial and demographic challenges.

title: After Friction, Renewed Zen for de Blasio
description: He was the mayor of populist messages, pledging to crack down on toplessness in Times Square, a recent pet cause of the New York City tabloids, whose campaigns he typically ignores.

title: Review: Informed Consent Tests the Ethics of Genetic Research
description: In Informed Consent, a thoughtful and engrossing play by Deborah Zoe Laufer, a research scientist specializing in genetic diseases finds herself embroiled in controversy when her fierce dedication to her work, and her deeply personal reasons for pursuing it, lead her into murky ethical waters.

title: Similar to a Cor Anglais
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Sometimes a crossword puzzle theme can take you out of the act of routinely inserting letters into squares, and evoke pleasant memories of experiences past. [Uh oh. Proustian flashback ahead. Everyone buckle your seat belts.  Ed.]

title: Another Red Sox Shake-Up as Dave Dombrowski Is Hired
description: Say this for the Boston Red Sox: When a season turns sour, they do not stand still. As they lurch to the finish of a third wretched season in the last four years, the Red Sox on Tuesday hired Dave Dombrowski as president of baseball operations. It was only the latest seismic shake-up for the franchise.

title: Scott Walker to Increase Attacks on Washington
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin suggested to donors on Monday that he was pivoting to a message more directly attacking Washington to fend off a growing threat to his campaign from candidates who have never held elected office, such as Donald J. Trump.

title: Charges Brought Against 14-Year-Old Who Was Shot by Officers in Trenton
description: Prosecutors in New Jersey filed charges on Tuesday against a 14-year-old Trenton boy who was shot by law enforcement officers as he ran from them.

title: Admiral Says No Reason to Bar Women From SEALs
description: The Navy is on track to open up its storied SEAL teams to women, a top admiral said in an interview with a military-focused publication, the latest sign of a movement to widen access to roles long forbidden to women across all branches of the military.

title: Yankees Alex Rodriguez Ends Drought With a Pivotal Grand Slam
description: When Alex Rodriguez arrived at home plate Tuesday night with the bases loaded in the seventh inning and the Yankees trailing the Minnesota Twins by three runs, chants of Lets Go A-Rod seemed like wishful thinking.

title: Bud Yorkin, Writer and Producer of All in the Family, Dies at 89
description: Bud Yorkin, who broke into television as a repairman and less than a decade later teamed with the producer Norman Lear to create pioneering, provocative and singularly successful satirical series including All in the Family, died on Tuesday at his home in the Bel Air neighborhood of Los Angeles. He was 89.

title: An Oasis in a Changing South Bronx
description: Mott Haven is rapidly developing, and Charlies Bar & Kitchen offers an alternative to catching the train to Manhattan for a special drink.

title: Charlies Bar & Kitchen Is a Pioneering Dining Option in a Poor Bronx Neighborhood
description: For most of its recent past, Mott Haven was known as a South Bronx industrial stretch, dotted with auto parts shops and vacant buildings. It had the woeful distinction in the last census of being in the poorest congressional district in the country. But longtime residents, and newcomers who venture across the nearby Third Avenue Bridge, see a neighborhood in full transformation, and many of them are drawn to a local watering hole with the sleek look of Lower Manhattan and the casual feel of the Bronx.

title: Berlin-Style Tiki on the River Spree, Home to a New Artists Enclave
description: This past weekend, east of Berlins city center on the banks of the River Spree, and despite the August heat, an invite-only crowd of local and international creative types arrived just before sunset, by land and by water, to enjoy the latest in a series of Jackie O outdoor parties. Their host, the Berlin-based developer Christian Rosche, is known for bringing together interesting artists, collectors, investors, DJs, chefs and scenesters to help cultivate an active, creative community in Berlin. As Rosche says, for him, its all about catalyzing magic moments, where people are so happy and grateful to come together, be themselves and share their talents, and truly connect.

title: The Romantic Drama of the Victorian Era
Word of the Day + Quiz | habituate
description: habituate  \h-bi-ch-wat\  verb

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 8 P.M. (FX) PIRATES OF THE CARIBBEAN: THE CURSE OF THE BLACK PEARL (2003) Johnny Depp portrays Capt. Jack Sparrow, the grooviest swashbuckler on the bounding main, in this swaggering action adventure. And why shouldnt he swagger, since he reportedly turned to Keith Richards of the Rolling Stones for inspiration? Orlando Bloom (above right, with Mr. Depp) is the blacksmith Will Turner, Sparrows unlikely ally. Keira Knightley is the damsel in distress and the love of Wills life. The film, directed by Gore Verbinski, raises one of the most overlooked and important cinematic questions of our time: Can a movie maintain the dramatic integrity of a theme park ride?, Elvis Mitchell wrote in The New York Times. In this case the answer is  sure.

title: Airbnb Seeks to Expand in China With Local Help
description: HONG KONG  For large Internet companies in the United States, the prevailing wisdom has long been that China is off limits.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, August 19, 2015
description: I saw the officers kicking him, jumping on his head multiple times and screaming, Stop resisting, even though I didnt see him moving.

title: Russian Pagans Continue Ancient Traditions
description: This year many Russians are observing the 1,000th anniversary of the death of Vladimir the Great, the grand prince of ancient Kiev who adopted Christianity and converted his people and neighboring tribes whether they wanted to become Christians or not.

description: Test your knowledge of the United States Constitution by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.
