description: After the blaze ruined a sports hall near Berlin that was intended to host asylum seekers, Germanys interior minister condemned what appeared to be the latest violent reaction against migrants.

title: Korean Official: Deal Reached With North
description: South Koreas national security adviser said on Tuesday that the North expressed regret over a landmine explosion earlier in the month, ending a standoff with the South.

title: Showing Courage on Iran
description: Intense lobbying and heated (often demagogic and hateful) rhetoric has made deciding whether to support the Iran nuclear deal an excruciating process for many members of Congress. None have come under more pressure and scrutiny than Jewish-American lawmakers. And among those, Representative Jerrold Nadler stands out. He represents a district of New York City from the liberal Upper West Side to ultra-Orthodox Borough Park in Brooklyn that is believed to have the largest Jewish population in the country.

title: U.N. Predicts 3,000 Migrants a Day Will Pass Through Balkans
description: BERLIN  Three thousand migrants a day will pour into the Balkans trying to reach Western Europe in the next few months, the United Nations forecast on Tuesday, a few hours after a suspected arson attack destroyed a sports hall in Germany where some migrants were to be sheltered.

title: Unnatural Obsessions
description: One enduring constant of the world economy since 2008 is the chorus of sober-sounding people declaring that the Fed must act responsibly and raise rates. A few years back, rising commodity prices and a flood of money into emerging markets were proof that low rates were dangerously inflationary and must be hiked. Now we have plunging commodity prices and a flood of money out of emerging markets; clearly, this shows that the Fed must do the right thing, and raise rates.

title: Guatemalas Corruption Investigations Make Swift Strides
description: GUATEMALA CITY  Just about every weekend for months, Jorge Castiglione, a 70-year-old engineer with a thinning ponytail, has gone to the Plaza de la Constitucin here to support what has become a ritual in this nation: weekly protests calling for the resignation of the president and an end to political impunity.

title: Bieber, Diplo and Skrillex Make a Hit
description: Justin Bieber, Diplo and Skrillex talk about the making of their hit song Where Are U Now.

title: How High Schoolers Spent Their Summer: Online, Taking More Courses
description: As summer began, Dan Akim, a junior at Manhattans ultracompetitive Stuyvesant High School, planned to attend debate camp, to study for the PSATs and to go on some family vacations.

title: Chinas Party-Run Media Is Silent on Market Mayhem
description: HONG KONG  After Chinas stock markets crumpled, prompting a global sell-off, Peoples Daily, the premier newspaper of the Chinese Communist Party, had other things on its mind.

title: Why Your Face Is Now Part of Your Workout
description: The fitness boom in New York pretty much ensures that, head to toe, every muscle in our bodies can be toned, stretched and massaged.

title: Jon Stewart Certainly Seems to Be Enjoying Retirement
description: Jon Stewart spent 16 years sitting behind a desk and influencing national politics. Is his retirement dream to become a professional wrestling star?

title: White House Is Pressed to Help Widen Access to Hepatitis C Drugs via Medicaid
description: WASHINGTON  Federal and state Medicaid officials should widen access to prescription drugs that could cure tens of thousands of people with hepatitis C, including medications that can cost up to $1,000 a pill, health care experts have told the White House.

title: Dr. Dres Apology Is Acknowledged, With Some Misgivings
description: Dr. Dres public apology on Friday, which he directed to the women Ive hurt after new questions about decades-old abuse allegations against him, has been met in recent days with varying degrees of acceptance from his accusers.

title: 1965: French Find U.S. Worth a Visit
description: PARIS  The French are discovering the United States, and finding its something to write home about. Following the big year of 1964, when the number of Frenchmen visiting the United States rose by 31.9 percent, and a continuing increase this year, French publishers are rushing travelogues into print. The reports go beyond the traditional observations about Americans putting mayonnaise on fruit salad. Articles and serials, some of them inspired by a Trans World Airlines tour of America for 25 French journalists in May, have appeared in publications throughout the country.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, August 26, 1965

title: Hillary Clinton Holds Strong Lead in New Iowa Poll
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton holds a strong lead against her Democratic rivals in Iowa despite lingering concerns about her honesty, according to a new poll.

title: Jeb Bushs Choice of Words Upsets Asian-Americans
description: While trying to soothe feelings among Hispanics for use of the term anchor babies, former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida appears to have offended some in the Asian-American community.

title: Safari Guide Killed in Zimbabwe Park That Was Home to Cecil the Lion
description: A tour guide died after being mauled by a lion in the same park in Zimbabwe where Cecil, a well-known lion, was killed by an American dentist.

title: Without a Shoe, Jennifer Simpson Fades to 11th at Track Worlds
description: The former world champion Jennifer Simpson of the United States finished 11th in the 1,500 meters at this years world track and field championships in Beijing on Tuesday after losing her shoe in the final.

title: Jeb Bush on How He and Donald Trump Differ Over Immigration
description: Jeb Bush offered a concise explanation Tuesday morning of how his plan to tackle illegal immigration differs from Donald Trumps. His answer, prompted by a question from a member of the audience during a town hall in Englewood, Colo., is excerpted below:

title: Pro-Choice Questions, Pro-Life Answers, Part II
description: This the second part of my extended response to Katha Pollitts questions for abortion opponents, inspired by the still-ongoing release of Planned Parenthood sting videos;you can find the first half of my responsehere. If you like you can consider this a strange sort of counterprogramming for theglobal economys current China-driven jitters, and fear not: Full-spectrum Trump coverage will no doubt resume shortly.

title: Marco Rubio to Take On China in Foreign Policy Address
description: With a financial crisis in China rattling global markets, Senator Marco Rubio plans to deliver a major foreign policy speech on Friday outlining how a Rubio administration would more assertively challenge the Chinese, joining leading Republican rivals in pressing this line of attack.

title: The Crimes of Palmyra
description: The Islamic State, the ultrafundamentalist group better known as ISIS, has laid a trail of unspeakable horrors in its march through Syria and Iraq  videotaped beheadings, ritualized rape and all manner of grisly torture and murder of anyone who does not subscribe to its extreme version of Islam.

title: Following the March of Migrants Along the Balkans
description: I set out from my base in Berlin for southern Hungary to write about the wave of tens of thousands of migrants and refugees  many fleeing wars in Iraq, Syria and Afghanistan  that has worked its way up the length of the Balkans in recent days. How, I wondered, even with the skills of our local fixer and translator, Helene Bienvenu, might one expect to find migrants on the move? Or officials willing to talk about the challenges.

title: London Theater Journal: En Travesti, Both Sides Now
description: LONDON  Theres more than one crafty celebrity television sleuth in disguise on this citys stages. People are of, course, queuing up to witness Benedict Cumberbatch, who plays the problem-solving title character of the BBCs Sherlock, transform himself into the problem-evading Prince Hamlet at the Barbican.

title: From the Graphics Archive: Mapping Katrina and Its Aftermath
description: A selection of maps published in The New York Times that shows the storms impact.

title: New Jerseys Effort to Legalize Sports Betting Is Denied on Appeal
description: New Jerseys effort to offer legalized sports betting was stopped again on Tuesday by a federal appeals court, leaving legal gambling on professional and college sports to a handful of states  predominantly Nevada  and the booming daily fantasy game industry.

title: French Train Attack Suspect Viewed Jihadist Video, Official Says
description: PARIS  In the moments before he loaded his gun to shoot up a train full of passengers, the suspect in Fridays failed attack on the Amsterdam-Paris express, Ayoub El Khazzani, watched a YouTube video exhorting the faithful to commit violent acts in the name of radical Islam, the chief Paris prosecutor said Tuesday.

title: Five Face Oils That Stand Out
description: Some people are discovering that oil-free products are not always the best option for sensitive skin.

title: Megyn Kelly Draws Support After Latest Donald Trump Attacks
description: By midmorning Tuesday, the Twitter posts in defense of the Fox News anchor Megyn Kelly were rolling in from her colleagues, one digital burst of support after another.

title: A 21st-Century Migrants Essentials: Food, Shelter, Smartphone
description: BELGRADE, Serbia  The tens of thousands of migrants who have flooded into the Balkans in recent weeks need food, water and shelter, just like the millions displaced by war the world over. But there is also one other thing they swear they cannot live without: a smartphone charging station.

title: Donald Trump, the Green Lantern Candidate
description: Why is Donald Trump leading the polls in the G.O.P. presidential race? One explanation is his celebrity and the media attention he attracts. But he has also exploited our vulnerability to pleasing fictions about presidential power.

title: Regulator Votes to Block Merger of Pepco and Exelon
description: Before Tuesday, Exelon seemed close to sealing its $6.8 billion takeover of a fellow utility operator, Pepco Holdings, having secured support from most of the power regulators it needed to satisfy.

title: The Clocktower
description: The chef Jason Atherton cooks contemporary English food at Stephen Starrs restaurant in Midtown South.

title: Restaurant Review: The Clocktower in Midtown South
description: If you hope dinner at the Clocktower will get you a backstage view of the ticking cogs at the top of the former Metropolitan Life Tower, forget it. The restaurant is on the second floor of the New York Edition hotel, which opened in the skyscraper at the foot of Madison Avenue in May. Marriott and Ian Schrager, who run the place, brought in the restaurateur Stephen Starr to operate the Clocktower.

title: New Jerseys $225 Million Settlement With Exxon Mobil Is Approved
description: New Jerseys widely debated $225 million settlement of a pollution lawsuit with Exxon Mobil Corporation was approved on Tuesday by a state judge who called the deal fair, reasonable and in the public interest.

title: Museums Engage in Virtual Collection Swap Via Instagram
description: LONDON  Ten of this citys leading museums are diving into one anothers collections for an Instagram swap this week.

title: Anna Kashfi, Actress Who Was Brandos First Wife, Dies at 80
description: Anna Kashfi, an actress who appeared in several Hollywood films in parts calling for, in the parlance of the day, an exotic beauty, but who became better known for playing a continuing role in a real-life soap opera as Marlon Brandos first wife, died on Aug. 16 in Woodland, Wash. She was 80.

title: French Prosecutor Discusses Train Attack
description: On Tuesday, Franois Molins, a French prosecutor, described an attack on a high-speed train as terrorism and dismissed the suspects fantastical assertion that he intended it only as a robbery.

title: Julianne Moore and Film Producer Start Petition to Remove Confederate General From School Name
description: The fight against Confederate symbols nationwide has lined up some Hollywood supporters. Julianne Moore and the film producer Bruce Cohen have started a Change.org petition to rename their high school, J.E.B. Stuart High in Fairfax County, Va. Founded in 1959, the school was named for a Confederate general who befriended Robert E. Lee during their West Point days. The name was chosen, the petition says, as a rebuke against the 1954 Brown v. Board of Education ruling that ended public school segregation.

title: Russia Gives Ukrainian Filmmaker Oleg Sentsov a 20-Year Sentence
description: MOSCOW  A Russian military court sentenced a Ukrainian filmmaker, Oleg Sentsov, to 20 years in a prison camp on Tuesday after convicting him of terrorism in the Crimean Peninsula after its annexation by Russia last year.

title: Bold Fall Fashion, Grounded in Boyish Basics
description: Loud prints and colors from the pre-fall collections are subdued by tank tops, jeans and sneakers  and casual enough for everyday.

title: An Island Compound Off the West Coast of Sweden
description: The property, which dates to 1870 and includes a private beach, a dock and a boathouse, is on the market for $2.44 million.

title: A Corn Gratin Welcomes Chard Into the Fold
description: A neighbor posted on our shared email list that she had harvested from her garden more chard than she could use. If anybody wanted it, she would leave it on her front porch for pickup.

title: Summer Reading Contest Winner, Week 9 | My Jon Stewart Withdrawal Syndrome
description: Week 9 of our Summer Reading Contests delivered so many outstanding entries from students that we had trouble choosing our favorites.

title: Jeb Bush Falls Into a Trap
description: Jeb Bush went to the border town of McAllen, Tex., on Monday to raise money and to talk about immigration, in English and fluent Spanish. Because the Republican presidential campaign has been so fixated on border security and the immigrant peril  thank you, Donald Trump  it was a chance to see how the supposed expert on this fraught subject handled it.

title: Sheen Center Announces Lineup for Opening Festival
description: Sacred dance from several traditions, a Hollywood premiere, panels on religion and politics, and an evening of music and chocolate are among the events scheduled for the three-week grand opening festival of the Sheen Center for Thought and Culture, a new arts center on Bleecker Street in Greenwich Village run by the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York.

title: Vaucluse Moves In on the Upper East Side
description: Vaucluse Proof that the Upper East Side is not prepared to abandon elegance in favor of salvaged barn siding comes with this palatial new restaurant from Michael White and Ahmass Fakahany, partners in the Altamarea Group. With well-mannered neutral-toned surroundings and white tablecloths, they have turned to France for inspiration instead of their usual Italy. Mr. Fakahany pointed out that several French restaurants, including Voisin and Le Prigord Park, have anchored the space, and Mr. White has cooked in France with Roger Verg and Jacques Chibois. I can now use lavender, thyme and bay, ingredients that I dont get to use often, Mr. White said. Though the name refers to a region of Provence, the food is not Provenal. The menu is broad brasserie-style, offering sections devoted to chilled seafood, vegetables, starters, fresh pastas, main courses and a list of daily specials like blanquette de veau (Tuesdays). The executive chef is Jared Gadbaw. The bar area on the mezzanine has been widened, and a stunning vaulted ceiling has been uncovered; the light fixtures suggest Art Deco. The dining room on the upper level is somewhat less formal-looking than the main room and is accented with cushy dark-sea-green leather chairs. (Opens Sept. 2): 100 East 63rd Street, vauclusenyc.com.

title: Boy Avoids a Fall, but Punches a Hole in a $1.5 Million Painting
description: A 12-year-old in Taiwan lived out many museum-goers nightmare (and many parents) when he tripped and caught his balance by punching a hole in an oil painting that is over 300 years old and valued at $1.5 million.

title: Joe Biden to Hold Unusual Call With Democratic Party Officials
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. may not be attending the Democratic National Committees summer meeting this week, but hes making his presence felt as he mulls a run for the partys 2016 presidential nomination against Hillary Rodham Clinton, Bernie Sanders and others who will be speaking at the party gathering.

title: Test for Donald Trump: Turning Crowds Into Real Voters
description: DUBUQUE, Iowa  Donald J. Trump, it is abundantly clear, is not a conventional candidate. And neither is his approach to recruiting campaign activists.

title: The Price of Silence on Wall Street
description: What is the price of silence on Wall Street? That is the question confronting Peter Sivere, a 46-year-old soon-to-be former compliance officer at Barclays in New York.

title: Patty Murray Comes Out in Support of Iran Nuclear Deal
description: Senator Patty Murray of Washington, the only member of the Democratic leadership who had not weighed in on the Iran nuclear deal, broke her silence on Tuesday and threw her weight behind the accord.

title: Adam Lippess Guide to the Berkshires
description: The Berkshires are so not about fashion, says the designer Adam Lippes, summing up the appeal of his country escape in the mountains of western Massachusetts. I love that the spirit of the area is so eclectic and genuine. Its this non-high-heel lifestyle.

title: Curt Schilling Off Little League Broadcasts After Unacceptable Tweet
description: Curt Schilling, the ESPN Sunday Night Baseball analyst and former major league pitcher, was pulled from calling a Little League World Series game Tuesday night because of a post he shared on his Twitter account that suggested extremist Muslims were comparable to Nazis. The post featured an image of Adolf Hitler.

title: South Floridas Construction Boom Heads North
description: HALLANDALE BEACH, Fla.  Known for years as little more than a retirement community with a racetrack and a few pastel-hued motels that had seen better days, this small oceanfront town is not the first place that comes to mind when wealthy Brazilians and Russians seek out expensive condominiums.

title: In Colorado, Bush Explains Asian Comment
description: Jeb Bush, the Republican presidential candidate, responded on Tuesday to a question about his use of the term anchor babies.

title: Israel Begins Releasing African Migrants From Detention Center
description: JERUSALEM  Israel began releasing hundreds of African migrants and asylum seekers from a detention center in the southern Negev desert on Tuesday, in line with a recent Supreme Court ruling that reduced the time they could be held there to 12 months from 20 months.

title: Math Anxiety? A Reporter Knows the Subject All Too Well
description: I know exactly when my severe math anxiety began: with my third-grade teacher, Miss S. (I am afraid to write her full name because even if she is no longer among the living, her ghost will most certainly come roaring back and thrust more work sheets at me).

title: The Idea Lab Behind Harry & Idas
description: Siblings and their friends take a science-fair approach to food with delicious results.

title: The Family Spirit of Harry & Idas and Ducks Eatery
description: It is possible to wander into Harry & Idas Meat and Supply Co., a delicatessen and provisions shop that opened in June in the East Village, with expectations of nothing more than a good pastrami sandwich.

title: Photos of the Day: Greece and Elsewhere
description: As we edited hundreds of images documenting migrants and refugees making their way from Greece through the Balkans into Hungary, we were compelled to do a Pictures of the Day edit today solely on this subject.

title: August 25, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: As we edited hundreds of images documenting migrants and refugees making their way from Greece through the Balkans into Hungary, we were compelled to do a Pictures of the Day edit today solely on this subject.

title: Fall of Beirut Wall Reminds Some of Berlin, Others of Miley Cyrus
description: Lebanese officials might still be struggling to solve the trash crisis engulfing Beirut, but they seemed to acknowledge on Tuesday that blocking themselves off from protesters enraged by the stench behind a high concrete wall was not helping.

title: Alibabas Stock Still Looks Expensive
description: Alibabas stock price still looks expensive despite the recent sell-off. Less than a year after the Chinese web giants record $25 billion initial public offering of stock, its shares are near their $68 initial price. Though macroeconomic worries have afflicted all Chinese companies, the company, founded by Jack Ma, is still highly valued when compared with rivals.

title: On the Road, in Accessories Form
description: I might have an escape fantasy, suggests the New York-based accessories designer Adam Davidson of AANDD, speaking to T from a factory in Mexico. I certainly fixate on modes of travel, he continues, mentioning that many of the five-year-old brands early shapes and detailing relied on nautical references. For his fall 2015 collection  which includes, for the first time, small leather goods  Davidson found himself thinking about the open road. His Accordion Wallet streamlines motorcyclists money-holders and the Key Lanyard resembles the hooded fobs once commonly affixed to car keys. The currant, ochre, white and cobalt blue (or mineral) of 1970s auto upholstery hold together the line thats rounded out by AANDD staples, like the Pyramid Pouch, inspired by a knotted bodega bag. Its not a noble inspiration, but it has a good attitude that I can reinterpret in my own aesthetic, Davidson says. Im always watching the way people carry things, wherever I am.

title: Political Risks May Foil Economic Reform in China
description: Can China pull it off?

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: Under Armour Seeks to Do for Maryland What Nike Did for Oregon
description: Within a few years, the midcentury red-brick field house in the center of the University of Maryland campus will be a glassy, sunlit home of medical facilities and classrooms, as well as an athletic conditioning center, a locker room and three football fields  two outdoors and one inside.

title: Review: Billion-Dollar Ball Explores the Economics of College Footballs Top Programs
description: When it is reported that the University of Alabama pays its head coach an annual salary of $6.5 million a year, or that the University of Oregon erected a $42 million academic support center for it players, or that the University of Texas assesses its fans as much as $20,000 in the form of seat donations for preferred locations, it is clear that college football is no longer just a game.

title: Serena Williams, Pete Sampras and Andre Agassi Play Tennis in the Street
description: Tennis greats convened for a U.S.-Open-themed spectacle.

title: American Coaches Have a Field Day, but for Other Countries
description: BEIJING  Randy Huntingtons laugh boomed through the hallways of the Birds Nest stadium after the long jump competition, making him something of a rarity at the world track and field championships on Tuesday: an American with something to celebrate.

title: Sydney Theater Company Names New Artistic Director
description: After months of speculation, the Sydney Theater Company has appointed a new artistic director to succeed Andrew Upton, who announced his exit from the position in February.

title: Tennis Greats Convene for a U.S.-Open-Themed Spectacle
description: In 1995, Andre Agassi and Pete Sampras appeared together in a commercial for Nike. In the ad, a taxi pulls up to a bustling New York intersection; the players run onto the street, unfurl a net and begin a game of pick-up tennis. Last night, in honor of its 20th anniversary  and to mark the 2015 U.S. Open, which begins next week  Sampras and Agassi reconvened to restage the ad, taxi and all, in another made-for-TV (and now, publicist-orchestrated) moment: They played a quick round of tennis in front of fans on a pop-up tennis court in the Meatpacking District. They were joined by Serena Williams, Maria Sharapova, Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer  and many more. Photographer Dina Litovsky was on hand to capture the scene.

title: How Stressful Work Environments Hurt Workers Health
description: A lot of people would not work in a place where co-workers smoke. And most people will never be faced with that decision because smoking is typically banned in the workplace on the sensible ground that secondhand smoke is dangerous to everyone.

title: Chris Christie Pushes Cory Booker to Oppose Iran Deal
description: Gov. Chris Christie stood before an audience on Tuesday as the leader of our state, the golden seal of New Jersey adorning the lectern before him, and excoriated President Obamas nuclear deal with Iran, accusing the president of lying to the American people and putting the entire world in danger.

title: Rutgers Investigating Football Coach Over Possible N.C.A.A. Violation
description: Rutgers confirmed Tuesday that it was investigating its football coach, Kyle Flood, over an allegation that he improperly contacted a faculty member about the academic status of a top player.

title: Midwest Gasoline Prices to Normalize After BP Refinery Repair
description: HOUSTON  BP has restarted a large distillation unit at a refinery outside Chicago that broke down on Aug. 8 and caused a jump in gasoline prices across the Midwest.

title: Letters: L.A. Laws
description: L.A. Laws

title: Lebanons Garbage Crisis Underscores Governments Disarray
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The haplessness of the Lebanese government was evident on Tuesday when its attempts to contain a political crisis over festering garbage were thwarted on several fronts.

title: Looking Back on Mr. Robot and a Season of Hacker Drama
description: Theres a scene during the sixth episode of USAs Mr. Robot in which the lead character, a painfully anxious computer hacker named Elliot, pulls off an extraordinary feat. He cripples a prisons security system to free a single inmate: a drug dealer whose thugs have been holding Elliots girlfriend captive. After he frees the bad guy, he is handed the keys to the car hes been riding around in all day. In the trunk lies his girlfriend, dead.

title: 10 Things That Influence Ira Kaplan
description: The Yo La Tengo musician shares the diverse inspirations  from bakeries to baseball announcers  that have inspired his music.

title: Twyla Tharps Rehearsal: On Day Eight, Just One More Time
description: Twyla Tharp is writing about rehearsing, touring and creating new work, 50 years after her first dance concert.

title: Viola Davis, on Finding Creative Space in TV With No Limitations
description: Viola Davis is a two-time Tony winner and Oscar nominee and yet she had to go to television to find a role that would put her out front in Hollywood. I was always the Academy Award nominee who was only in two or three scenes and was grossly underused in a film, she says. I was tired of that. I didnt want to do television, but in film I was just a supporting character. The fear of the television schedule ultimately did not outweigh my love for the role.

title: Queen of Earth (With Movie Trailer): Alex Ross Perry Narrates a Scene
description: What was meant to be a relaxing time away at a vacation house turns to anguish in Queen of Earth, Alex Ross Perrys intimate, fractured follow-up to his 2014 literary comedy, Listen Up Philip. Here, the writer and director departs from the humor and coyness of his previous work and uses tools from the 70s psychodrama playbook to tell the story of Catherine (Elisabeth Moss) and Virginia (Katherine Waterston), two women whose friendship begins to disintegrate as Catherine becomes more distant and isolated. In this scene, Catherine attends a party that turns out none too cheerful.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Queen of Earth
description: Alex Ross Perry narrates a sequence from Queen of Earth with Elisabeth Moss.

title: Review: The Carmichael Show, With Jabs and Jokes, Has Its Debut on NBC
description: You remember your mothers admonition: If you cant say something nice, dont say anything at all. In that spirit, lets just say that The Carmichael Show, a comedy that begins Wednesday on NBC, is marginally better than the awful Mr. Robinson, another comedy the network disgorged this month.

title: Review: Elisabeth Moss at All Angles in Queen of Earth
description: When you first see Catherine, shes looking upward, her teary, blotchy face filling the frame. Shes suffering, all right, you better believe it, although she doesnt seem to be doing a particularly good job of convincing the guy whos mostly off-camera. She looks like a mess  pathetic, really, with her smeared black eye makeup and the tears that just keep pooling and dribbling. The funny thing is that with her wet raccoon eyes and red nose, Catherine  a sensational Elisabeth Moss  also looks like a sad clown. All thats missing is the black velvet background.

title: Yo La Tengos Ira Kaplan on 10 of His Influences
description: Of all the indie bands considered indispensable to the 80s and 90s underground, perhaps none have aged more gracefully, or with as little ceremony, as New Jerseys own Yo La Tengo. The husband-wife team of Ira Kaplan and Georgia Hubley, along with bassist James McNew, who joined the band in 1992, are known equally well for their heart-rending melodies as they are for ear-splitting guitars. For Yo La Tengos new record, Stuff Like That There, which falls firmly in the former category, the band looks backward to Fakebook, an LP that came that out 25 years ago and remains a fan favorite today. Like its predecessor, Stuff Like That There is made up predominantly of covers  both of classic acts (Hank Williams, The Cure) and of Yo La Tengo themselves (Deeper Into Movies, The Ballad of Red Buckets). We kind of took some of the things from Fakebook and said, Its 25 years later, lets see what happens if we do it again. Its definitely a companion, in our mind, Kaplan says.

title: What You Get for  $785,000
description: Downtown views in Maine, a floating house in Seattle and a cabin in Virginia

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: Benedict Cumberbatch in Hamlet
description: LONDON  He is, he complains sulkily, too much in the sun. That is correct on so many levels.

title: Weighing the Odds in Fight Over Iran Nuclear Deal
description: WASHINGTON  After Congress passes foreign policy legislation that the president strongly opposes, he vetoes the bill, saying it unlawfully restricts executive authority. Lawmakers refuse to accept the action and override the veto, with the Senate quickly following the House.

title: Excerpt: The Carmichael Show
description: The new NBC family sitcom stars the rising comic Jerrod Carmichael.

title: On YouTube, Iran Activists Urge America to Back Nuclear Deal
description: A growing number of Iranian human rights activists and artists, including a Nobel laureate and people who have spent time in prison for their views, are asking Americans in a social media campaign to support the nuclear deal with Iran.

title: Trump-ward, Christian Soldiers?
description: Let me get this straight. If I want the admiration and blessings of the most flamboyant, judgmental Christians in America, I should marry three times, do a queasy-making amount of sexual boasting, verbally degrade women, talk trash about pretty much everyone else while Im at it, encourage gamblers to hemorrhage their savings in casinos bearing my name and crow incessantly about how much money Ive amassed?

title: American Pharoah Is 1-5 Morning-Line Favorite in Travers Stakes
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y.  Three Triple Crown champions over the years have ventured to the historic racetrack here, amid mineral springs and pastel-colored Victorian houses, to compete in what is called the Midsummer Derby, the Travers Stakes. Only one, Whirlaway in 1941, left victorious.

title: Luxury Shoppers in London Seem Unfazed by Market Free Fall
description: London  Twenty-four hours after the worlds financial markets sustained a temporary free fall, wiping out almost $3 trillion in value from global stocks over three days, the dark clouds had yet to dampen the spirits of luxury shoppers on the streets of London.

title: Review: No Escape, Starring Owen Wilson as a Man in the Cross Hairs
description: In 2001, already developing a comic acting career, Owen Wilson tried to stretch. In Behind Enemy Lines, he played a naval aviator shot down and pursued by bloodthirsty Serbian paramilitary units. Not quite an action hero, he conveyed the intense fear and desperation of a fugitive in the cross hairs.

title: A Conversation With David von Spreckelsen
description: Mr. von Spreckelsen, 52, is the president of Toll Brothers City Living, New York, a division of the luxury home builder Toll Brothers that he started in 2004. Its current condominium projects include 400 Park Avenue South and the Pierhouse at Brooklyn Bridge Park.

title: In Latin Americas Rich Lands, Poor People
description: As Gustavo Jononovich documented, the bounty of natural resources in Latin America can sustain a community, but also destroy it through pollution and overdevelopment.

title: Living In Silvermine, Conn.
description: Silvermine, an enclave that overlaps Norwalk, Wilton and New Canaan, Conn., has a cachet bound up with its past.

title: Inquiry Weighs Whether ISIS Analysis Was Distorted
description: WASHINGTON  The Pentagons inspector general is investigating allegations that military officials have skewed intelligence assessments about the United States-led campaign in Iraq against the Islamic State to provide a more optimistic account of progress, according to several officials familiar with the inquiry.

title: Malia Obama, Fashion Influencer
description: The first daughter employs bold colors and patterns but manages to come across as an approachable teen.

title: Review: Taking In the New York International Fringe Festival, From Ferry to Theater
description: The tall young man in the baseball cap was upwind of me, which should have made me cautious, but my attention was a bit divided. It was Monday night and I was at a play, part of the New York International Fringe Festival. I was also standing at a railing on the Staten Island Ferry as it churned toward Manhattan, and the actor Tom Nelis was speaking into my ear.

title: New Superintendent Named at New York Prison Where Inmate Died
description: The state corrections department on Tuesday named a new superintendent for the Fishkill Correctional Facility in Beacon, N.Y., and vowed to review safety concerns after the April death of a prisoner who inmates said was handcuffed and badly beaten by a group of corrections officers.

title: Just Mayo Spread Violates Mayonnaise and Label Rules, F.D.A. Says
description: The Food and Drug Administration has told Hampton Creek, a tiny company selling plant-based replacements for proteins derived from animals, that some of its Just Mayo products violate federal regulations related to standards for mayonnaise and proper labeling.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Red Cross Suspends Operations in Yemen Port
description: CAIRO  The International Committee of the Red Cross said Tuesday that it was temporarily suspending its operations in Yemens southern port city of Aden after gunmen stormed the organizations offices and demanded money, vehicles and other equipment.

title: Augusta Chiwy, Forgotten Wartime Nurse, Dies at 94
description: Augusta Chiwy, a Belgian nurse whose unsung bravery in saving countless American soldiers wounded in the Battle of the Bulge was belatedly celebrated in 2011, died on Sunday near Brussels. She was 94.

title: Caroline Kennedy Used Personal Email for State Department Business, Report Finds
description: Caroline Kennedy, the United States ambassador to Japan, and several other senior American diplomats there have used personal email accounts to conduct State Department business, the inspector general for the department said in a report released Tuesday.

title: Among Friends: Linda Rosenkrantz on Talk
description: Linda Rosenkrantz spent the summer of 1965 in East Hampton recording conversations between herself and two close friends. The resulting book, Talk, is formatted like a play, with the three characters discussing their ambitions in the buzzing 1960s New York City art world and cultural sea changes in psychoanalysis and sexual politics. (How does a mnage  trois work? someone asks. Doesnt it make you feel competitive?) When it was published in 1968, the book was called fiction.

title: First Data Names 15 Banks Chosen to Lead Public Offering
description: The army of banks recruited to oversee what may be one of the biggest market debuts of 2015 has finally come to light.

title: Judge Doesnt Settle Bitter Dispute Over Floridas Redistricting Plan
description: MIAMI  A Leon County judge on Tuesday postponed a decision about Floridas still incomplete congressional redistricting map after Republican legislative leaders failed to agree on how to redraw the boundaries.

title: F.B.I. to Look at Guards at County Jail in Missouri
description: F.B.I. agents have started a civil rights investigation into guards use of force at a towering county jail in downtown Kansas City, Mo., federal officials said Tuesday.

title: Genocide Retrial Is Set for Guatemalan Former Dictator
description: MEXICO CITY  A Guatemalan court ruled on Tuesday that the former dictator Gen. Efran Ros Montt must face a new genocide trial in the persecution of the Maya Ixil Indians during his rule, but agreed to hold it behind closed doors because he has dementia.

title: Soccer Convention Is Coming to Brooklyn, Courtesy of the Men in Blazers
description: Soccer is getting its own Con, courtesy of the Men in Blazers.

title: 7 Charged With Promoting Prostitution by Working on Rentboy.com, an Escort Website
description: The terms of service on the website Rentboy.com said that people could not use it to exchange money for sex. But federal authorities, who called it the largest online male-escort service and arrested the sites chief executive and several other employees on Tuesday, said that was exactly what was happening.

title: At Donald Trump Event, Jorge Ramos of Univision Is Snubbed, Ejected and Debated
description: DUBUQUE, Iowa  A journalist for the Spanish-language network Univision who asked Donald J. Trump about immigration was mocked by the candidate, then escorted out of a news conference here on Tuesday evening.

title: Maryland Restricts Racial Profiling in New Guidelines for Law Enforcement
description: BALTIMORE  Eight months after the Justice Department announced new curbs on racial profiling, Maryland became on Tuesday the first state to follow suit, with guidelines aimed at severely restricting law enforcement officers from singling out suspects based on traits including race, ethnicity and sexual orientation.

title: Vultures Face Own Death
description: Across East Africa, vulture populations have been decimated by poaching, poisoning and other human interventions.

title: Los Angeles Unveils Plan for 2024 Olympic Bid
description: LOS ANGELES  With this city now likely to replace Boston as the American bidder for the 2024 Olympics, organizers released detailed financial projections on Tuesday that put the cost of hosting the Games at $4.1 billion.

title: Water Is Called Casualty of Syrian War
description: Water availability in Syria has been halved since the conflict there began nearly four and a half years ago, and millions of people around the country endure long and sometimes deliberate interruptions to their water supplies, the United Nations said Tuesday.

title: Tourists Have Landed in Queens. Theyre Staying.
description: The panel on tourism was an all-star lineup of local entrepreneurs  a restaurateur, a museum director, a hotel executive, the founder of a weekend markets and a theater impresario.

title: Jeb Bushs Emails as Governor Show His Feelings on Same-Sex Marriage
description: The exchange is raw, personal and angry: Xavier Cortada, a gay friend of Jeb Bush, then the governor of Florida, sent him an email on March 3, 2004, with a plea.

title: Queens: The Next Tourist Destination
description: Lonely Planet named Queens the No. 1 United States tourist destination of 2015. Residents and business owners wonder if the borough can become more than just a day trip from Manhattan.

title: Bernie Sanderss Success in Attracting Small Donors Tests Importance of Super PACs
description: WASHINGTON  Donna Mae Litowitz, a Miami Beach retiree, likes Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont so much that three months ago she sent his presidential campaign $10,000. His campaign sent back all but $2,700 because it was more than he was allowed to take under federal election law, but she wishes he had kept it all.

title: Driver Killed in IndyCar Wreck Was a Student of Crashes
description: SONOMA, Calif.  When IndyCars disintegrate, Justin Wilson once said, things can get messy.

title: Iran: Official Denies Any Plan to Trade U.S. Reporter
description: Iran has no plans to trade Jason Rezaian, the imprisoned Washington Post correspondent, for any Iranian citizens held by the United States, a Foreign Ministry official was quoted as saying Tuesday by Irans private Tasnim News Agency. The assertion, by Hassan Qashqavi, deputy foreign minister for consular, parliamentary and expatriates affairs, was a response to what he described as news media reports about such an exchange. There are no talks on the swap of Jason Rezaian, he was quoted as saying.

title: Puerto Rico Turmoil Sinks Sewer Bond
description: Up against a deadline to reveal its plan to restructure its staggering debt, Puerto Rico has decided not to move ahead with a controversial proposal to borrow an additional $750 million to pay for improvements to its water and sewer authority.

title: Signs, Long Unheeded, Now Point to Risks in U.S. Economy
description: As investors scramble to make sense of the wild market swings in recent days, a number of financial experts argue that, for more than a year now, signs pointing to an equity crisis were there for all to see.

title: Construction Worker Falls to His Death in Manhattan Elevator Shaft
description: A worker at a building under construction in Midtown Manhattan was killed on Tuesday after a platform in an elevator shaft collapsed, causing him to fall 30 feet, officials said.

title: U.N. Report Details Flow of Foreign Weapons Into South Sudan
description: UNITED NATIONS  The South Sudan government spent $20 million last summer on weapons including machine guns and grenade launchers from China, while rebels procured ammunition made by their onetime rivals in neighboring Sudan, according to the United Nations, fueling a war in which villages have been razed and women reportedly raped.

title: Estate of Heiress Loses Fight to Recover Millions in Donations From Hospital
description: The estate of the copper heiress Huguette Clark has lost a battle to recover more than $4 million worth of donations, including an Edouard Manet painting, that she gave the Manhattan hospital where she lived for the last two decades of her life.

title: Middle of the Week
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Guess what day it is! Its midweek, that time when we really have to gather up all of our strength and make that push through to Friday and the weekend.

title: Univision Anchor Ejected at Trump Event
description: The anchor Jorge Ramos was thrown out of a campaign news conference in Iowa for the Republican presidential candidate Donald J. Trump.

title: Nearly 200 Buildings in New York City Flouted Tax Rules, Officials Say
description: Developers of nearly 200 small buildings in New York City have flouted the terms of tax breaks they received by failing to place their apartments on the rent-stabilization rolls, state and city officials said.

title: Soothing Talk by Federal Reserve Official Buoys Wall Street
description: Once again, the Federal Reserve helped save the day for investors.

title: Astros Have the Final Say, and Not Just in a Shouting Match
description: With the Astros trouncing the Yankees, Carlos Gomez  Houstons lightning rod of an outfielder  slammed his bat down after a sixth-inning at-bat, mad at himself for missing the pitch he was sitting on and for hitting a harmless fly ball to center.

title: Sixth-Inning Rally Helps Mets Edge the Phillies
description: PHILADELPHIA  During the Mets batting practice Tuesday, General Manager Sandy Alderson was milling about the dugout when a young boy called out to him, asking for an autograph. Alderson paused for a moment, surprised by the request. Then he signed the boys baseball with a Sharpie, the way the players do, and tossed the ball back, smiling.

title: Seafood With a Popular Touch
description: Atlantic Seafood and Fish Market in Center Moriches is a Long Island institution.

title: China: Legal Ordeals for Brothers of a Journalist
description: A court in Chinas western region of Xinjiang tried two brothers of an American reporter on charges of endangering state security and leaking secrets, according to a spokesman for Radio Free Asia, the journalists employer. No verdict has yet been announced in the trials of Shawket Hoshur on Tuesday and his younger brother Rexim Hoshur, which took place on Aug. 19, Rohit Mahajan, a spokesman for the United States government-funded R.F.A., said in an interview. Their brother, Shohret Hoshur, is a United States citizen whose reports on the Chinese governments crackdown on Xinjiangs Uighur ethnic group have been criticized by Beijing. The plight of Shohret Hoshurs brothers  a third brother, Tudaxun, was convicted of endangering state security last year and sentenced to five years in prison  has become an issue between the two countries before President Xi Jinpings summit meeting with President Obama in Washington next month.

title: Closer Scrutiny as Chinese Seek to Give Birth in the United States
description: When Ma Yi, 36, a senior manager from Shanghai, landed at Los Angeles International Airport on June 5, she had her own version of the American dream. She was entering her eighth month of pregnancy and intended to give birth to an American baby.

title: Burger King to McDonalds: Lets Make a McWhopper
description: Burger Kings mascot, The Burger King, is seeking a truce, albeit temporary, with Ronald McDonald.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, August 26, 2015
description: Every time I go to a new country, I buy a SIM card and activate the Internet and download the map to locate myself. I would never have been able to arrive at my destination without my smartphone.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | discombobulated

title: Big Push by Disney on Star Wars Merchandise
description: LOS ANGELES  Disney will use Maker Studios, its embattled network of online video creators, and ABC News as part of a global promotional campaign for Star Wars merchandise that is unusual in its sheer ambition.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 5:45 P.M. (IFC) SNAKES ON A PLANE (2006) The F.B.I. agent Neville Flynn (Samuel L. Jackson) is escorting a witness on a flight to Los Angeles to testify against the murderous gangster Eddie Kim (Byron Lawson). Kim makes sure that a lot of snakes are hidden in the planes cargo hold and that a pheromone is present that provokes them to attack. When the snakes slither into the cabin, Agent Flynn must leap into action. There are snakes and smoke, giggles and shrieks, slamming edits and lots of goosy, lurch-in-your seat moments, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. Mostly, of course, there are snakes and Sam. At once hard-working and hardly working, Mr. Jackson turns in one of his customary performances, meaning that he glowers, barks and periodically unleashes a 13-letter epithet the way only he can.

title: Corrections: August 26, 2015
description: FRONT PAGE

title: In Latin Americas Rich Lands, Poor People
description: There it was, the mighty Amazon, biggest jungle on earth, more wondrous than even Sir David Attenborough could convey. And it was dying.

title: Museum Piggybacks on the Broads Opening With Free Membership Offer
description: The Museum of Contemporary Art in downtown Los Angeles has long struggled to grow its attendance, which hovers around 250,000 visitors a year. Its leaders are now looking for a boost from the much-anticipated opening of Eli and Edythe Broads art museum across the street. Known as the Broad, the museum is scheduled to open to the public on Sept. 20 and announced a free admission policy two years ago.

title: Two Setbacks for Coalition in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Two NATO soldiers were killed Wednesday when men wearing uniforms of the Afghan security forces opened fire at an Afghan military base in the southern province of Helmand, the American-led international coalition said in a statement.

title: Student Crossword | Latitude and Longitude

title: False Alarm on a Crisis in China
description: Washington  CHINA, many believe, is in a financial and economic meltdown causing anxiety and panic everywhere. Chinas stock market dive first dragged down other emerging markets and has now spread to the United States, slicing trillions of dollars off the value of stocks traded here and in other global markets. Since China is the worlds second largest economy and has growing financial ties around the world, developments there clearly have enormous potential implications for both developed and emerging markets.

title: Bonfire of the Assets, With Trump Lighting Matches
description: Normally, when your main geopolitical rivals are shooting themselves in both feet, the military manual says step back and enjoy the show. But I take little comfort in watching China burning money and Russia burning food, because in todays interdependent world were all affected.

title: The Republican Conception of Conception
description: The battle for the Republican presidential nomination has produced an unexpectedly intense burst of attacks on womens reproductive rights, not only on the right to abortion, but also by implication on some of the most commonly used methods of contraception.

title: North and South Korea Take a Breath
description: After three days of talks, North Korea and South Korea have wisely backed away from a dangerous confrontation. The two adversaries havent begun to come to grips with the unresolved hostilities from their 1950-53 war, but at least both sides proved capable of agreeing on a deal that, for now at least, avoids a new military conflict.

title: Should Prostitution Be a Crime?
The I.C.U. Is Not a Pause Button
description: With my elderly stroke patients back arched and his head tilted back, too many angles of his skeleton were on display. A nose covered in thin gray skin sliced the air like a shark fin, and beneath it his mouth hung open. He didnt look like he was resting.

title: Chinese Investors Express Despair
description: Chinas investors fear the countrys stock markets could fall further.

title: News Qs | Banksys Dismaland in England
description: In Banksys Dismaland in England: Its a Strange World, After All, Christopher D. Shea writes about the artist Banksys latest work, a gloomy anti-Disneyland.

title: Ronald Reagan Receives a New Term, on TV
description: The Gippers having a great year on TV.

title: Silvermine, Conn., an Enclave Attached to Its Past
description: The Silvermine Tavern was once a defining landmark for the wooded Silvermine area that overlaps Norwalk, Wilton and New Canaan, Conn. Set along the Silvermine River among other historic buildings from the areas early days as a mill village, the white-clapboard tavern in Norwalk drew out-of-towners with its reputation as a Sunday brunch destination, wedding backdrop and jazz spot. For locals, the tavern, in a 200-year-old building, provided something more fundamental.

title: The Upside of a Downturn in Silicon Valley
description: In October 2008, in the early days of the last economic collapse, Sequoia Capital invited founders of technology companies to a frank meeting outlining the new global reality.

title: Netflix Looks to Narcos for a New Audience
description: Say yes to your life, Nancy Reagan commands near the end of the first episode of Netflixs new series Narcos. Its a moment from the famous Just Say No speech that she delivered with her husband, President Ronald Reagan, in 1986. And when it comes to drugs and alcohol, she continues, just say no.

title: Paradise of the Pacific, by Susanna Moore
description: The most peculiar place on this planet, as I see it from my vantage point in Wales, is the 50th state of the American union, the Pacific archipelago called Hawaii. Everything about it is peculiar. Its capital, Honolulu, is one of the remotest big cities on the face of the earth. Its geography is weird, consisting as it does of some 130 assorted islands and atolls, scattered across 1,500 miles of ocean. Its history is spectacularly unexpected, beginning with mass immigrations of Pacific canoeists and culminating in the virtual extinction of an American fleet by several hundred Japanese airplanes. Its indigenous culture is a marvel of intricate legends, faiths, musics and superstitions, and its native written language is a prodigy of alliterations.

title: The Story of the Lost Child, by Elena Ferrante
description: Elena Ferrante has written her story twice: once in a group of intense, highly modeled short novels whose action unfolds over a brief time span; and again in the four sprawling, rambunctious, decades-spanning works that compose her Neapolitan saga. That these two modes of storytelling  the compact and the commodious; the modern and the historical; the distilling of life into metaphor and its picaresque, riotous expansion  are so obviously the obverse of each other constitutes yet another narrative, the story of how an individual (more specifically, a woman) arrives, after the vicissitudes of living, at a definition of self. Do you want the long answer or the short? is the customary divide between explanations versus outcomes in the retelling of events. Ferrante gives us both the long answer and the short, and in doing so adumbrates the mysterious beauty and brutality of personal experience.

title: Malia Obama Follows Her Mother Into the Fashion Spotlight
description: It was the T-shirt seen round the world.

title: Should Restaurants Do Away With Tipping?
description: Tipping at restaurants is a deeply ingrained part of American culture. But is it a practice that is ineffective, unfair and even discriminatory?

title: Parks Stone Wall Is a Vestige of Manhattans Rail History
description: Almost hidden in the thick understory of a Manhattan park on West End Avenue, a primitive little wall of roughly dressed stones has posed a mystery for 20 years.

title: Donald Trump Gets Earful in Spanish as Latino Outlets Air Disdain
description: Ricardo Snchez, known as El Mandril on his Spanish drive-time radio show in Los Angeles, has taken to calling Donald J. Trump El hombre del peluqun  the man of the toupee.

title: Resort and Cruise News: Safaris by Air in Australia
description: Our Wednesday morning resort and cruise digest, with deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: For Athletes, the Risk of Too Much Water
description: Are we, with the best of intentions, putting young athletes at risk when we urge them to drink lots of fluids during steamy sports practices and games?

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: New York Today: Empty City
description: Good morning on this bright Wednesday:

title: Today in Politics: Conference Call Could Give Democrats Reason to Hold for Joe Biden
description: Good Wednesday morning. Before telling a large crowd in Iowa that the Summer of Trump had been great for his ego, Donald J. Trump got into a heated exchange with a journalist from a Spanish-language network, adding to a season of early twists and surprises in both parties. And another could be in the works as Mr. Trump might have to soon move over to make room in the spotlight.

title: Can I Wear Jewelry If I Dont Support Its Origins?
description: When my mother passed away, I inherited an antique necklace made of carved ivory beads. I love the look of  and am sentimentally tied to  this necklace, but I am also a supporter of anti-poaching programs and organizations. I have avoided wearing the necklace because I dont want to appear to support the ivory trade. On the other hand, I hate not being able to wear one of the few pieces of jewelry that I have from my mother. What should I do with the necklace? J. F., TUSTIN, CALIF.

title: Zip-a-Dee-Doo-#&$!
description: The creators of Zoobe intended to make their program cute, clean and simple: a mobile app that turns voice recordings into 3-D animated videos, starring woodland creatures with gigantic heads. It was introduced in 2013 as a playful alternative to text messaging and quickly became a hit on its home turf in Germany. Users record brief messages on their smartphones, and anthropomorphic beings recite them back, in a video that can be shared with friends or posted online. The craze soon spread to neighboring countries, especially social-media-obsessed Russia, spawning some 170 million short videos that delivered short messages from the apps cast of bears, rabbits and foxes.

title: Jamaica Will Always Be Home for Damian Marley
description: As a celebrated musician and bearer of the most recognizable name in reggae, Damian Marley is often on tour.

title: Who Gets to Play Tennis?
description: When the Hyde Park Racquet Club opened in the late 1970s, amid the countrys short-lived tennis boom, there wasnt another indoor facility in Chicago for 10 miles. The club occupied a section of 47th Street, near the lake, that long served as the boundary between the aging mansions of Kenwood and the greater South Side beyond. Across the street was a record shop that sold house music and a drive-through liquor store that peddled home brew in gallon jugs with the promise Wont go flat! In a hot-dog stand on the block, two teenagers once pummeled me with their fists while three of my tennis buddies could only watch, as we were useless at hitting anything other than yellow balls. The original owners of the club soon bailed. The many racquetball courts they had built went mostly unused. The sauna wasnt properly ventilated and rotted the locker room. A fitness chain eventually rented the space, filling half the tennis courts with weight benches and treadmills; the other five courts remained playable but were invariably coated in tennis ball fuzz, many of their overhead lights askew and glaring or altogether dark.

title: Larry King Is Preparing for the Final Cancellation
description: Bring me a plate of radishes.

title: 10 Years After Katrina
description: The New Orleans of 2015 has been altered, and not just by nature. In some ways, it is booming as never before. In others, it is returning to pre-Katrina realities of poverty and violence, but with a new sense of dislocation for many, too.

title: Morning Agenda: Seesawing Stocks
description: SEESAWING STOCKS | Volatility continued to dominate markets on Wednesday, Neil Gough reports in DealBook. Chinas rate cut, which came late on Tuesday, did little to rally the market. Shares in Shanghai swung between sharp gains and losses, falling nearly 4 percent before rallying more than 4 percent, then closing down 1.3 percent.

title: Spanish Town Celebrates Tomatina
description: The annual festival, in which tens of thousands of people pelt tomatoes at one another, took place in Buol, Spain, on Wednesday.

title: The Reactionary Soul
description: Frank Bruni marvels at polls indicating that Donald Trump, with his multiple marriages and casinos, is the preferred candidate among Republican evangelicals. Others are shocked to see a crude mercantilist make so much headway in the alleged party of free markets. What happened to conservative principles?

title: As Markets Flail, China Investigates Large Brokerage Firms
description: HONG KONG  The authorities in China have opened two investigations into the countrys biggest brokerage firms amid market turmoil.

title: Serena Williams Reveals Her U.S. Open Fashion Strategy: Greatness
description: What does Greatness look like? This is Serena Williams speaking, sitting on a sofa in the Standard hotel in Manhattan a week before the United States Open, the tournament that will determine whether she becomes the first woman since Steffi Graf in 1988 to win a Grand Slam (all four major tennis tournaments) in a calendar year.

title: Comments on Queens Tourism Win
description: Out of everywhere in the United States, Lonely Planet guidebook says Queens should be top on your list. Locals in the borough react to the news.

title: Advantage
description: On The South Side Of Chicago, A Campaign To Diversify Who Gets To Play Tennis.

title: How to End the Feud Between the Mayor and the Governor
description: THE mayor and the governor dont get along. The mayor of New York City chafes at so much of his agenda being subject to the approval of Albany. The governor of New York State resents being overshadowed by the mayor of the most important city in the world.

title: Announcing Our 2015-16 Student Contest Calendar
description: Update: You can find our 2016-17 student contest calendar here.

title: Obama to Face Reckoning in New Orleans Over Katrina Promises
description: WASHINGTON  Eight years ago as a senator running for president, Barack Obama visited New Orleans, a city still battered and broken two years after Hurricane Katrina, and made the kind of extravagant promises that candidates often make to get elected.

title: Trumps Troubles With Hispanic TV Journalists
description: From the beginning, Spanish-language TV has been covering Donald J. Trumps presidential campaign more critically than the mainstream news media, especially after his remarks on immigrants.

title: German Leaders Seek to Ease Tensions Over Migrant Crisis
description: BERLIN  German leaders responded on Wednesday to persistent violence led by far-right extremists against the increasing number of foreigners seeking asylum, with the chancellor and the president making visits to refugee reception centers to send a message of acceptance.

description: Dear Diary:

title: Jobs Forecast Is Another Reason for the Fed Not to Raise Rates
description: There was a bit of good news buried in an update of the Congressional Budget Offices economic projections released Tuesday. It has increased its estimate of how many Americans are going to look for work in coming years, and how many of those people will find jobs.

title: $785,000 Homes in Maine, Seattle and Virginia
Vacations End
description: Among the possible drawbacks of a family vacation is that it requires leaving somewhere, then arriving somewhere, twice over. With certain children, that is far more challenging than it sounds. The narrator of The Specific Ocean is this kind of child  sensitive, internal, averse to change. Shes reluctant to leave her home and friends in the city for a trip to the beach far away. We see her curled up on her bed, wearing her backpack, as her father tries to lure her out the door. Even arriving at their breathtaking destination  a boxy house on the Pacific Ocean  does not impress her. There is dull, droning, dreary water all around. The next day she stays in the house while her mother and brother go down to the beach.

title: Potential for Democratic Filibuster on Iran Deal Angers Key Republican
description: With the tide flowing in President Obamas favor on the Iran nuclear deal, the architect of legislation that gave Congress a say in its approval is none too happy about the possibility that the accord may never reach a final vote.

title: Sean Hayes Will Star in An Act of God in Los Angeles
description: God is on the move.

title: Theres Evidence That Trumps Polling Support Is Overstated
description: Ever since Donald Trump has risen to the top of the polls, Republican strategists have questioned whether those polls might be overestimating his support.

title: 1940: London Bombed in Nazi Raid
description: LONDON  The longest air raid London has undergone during the war, lasting almost six hours last night and early today, brought a scattering of bombs in the capital area and its outskirts. Flash followed flash as one raider dropped a salvo of bombs in a London area early this morning. The raider sped away, only to return from a different point some minutes later. Buildings were damaged on the outskirts of London by another salvo of bombs. Through the early morning hours the drone of German war planes continued. New York Herald Tribune, August 27, 1940

title: Ex-Broadcaster Kills 2 on Air in Virginia Shooting; Takes Own Life
description: ROANOKE, Va.  He was a fired television reporter with a history of conflicts at work and rage apparently stoked by racial grievances. And when he sought revenge on Wednesday, gunning down two former colleagues, he used the tools of social media to ensure that his crime was broadcast live, recorded from multiple angles and posted online.

title: Daily Report: A Small Breather for Tech Stocks
description: These days, a good day is when not every tech stock ends in the red.

title: House Hunting in ... Sweden
description: AN ISLAND COMPOUND OFF THE WEST COAST OF SWEDEN

title: Donald Trump Holds Firm, Saying Jorge Ramos Was Out of Line
description: Donald J. Trump expressed no regrets on Wednesday morning for temporarily ejecting a Univision journalist from a news conference and denied that he has been bullying the media.

title: The Nationals Are Healthy. The Problem: So Is the Mets Lead.
description: WASHINGTON  Everything the Washington Nationals had envisioned was on display at their ballpark on Tuesday night. All of the regular position players took their spots on the field. The starter pitched like an ace. A crowd of more than 34,000 left happy on a warm summer night.

title: Jennifer Lawrence and Amy Schumer Writing Screenplay Together
description: LOS ANGELES  Lucy and Ethel. Laverne and Shirley. Poehler and Fey. And now  Jennifer and Amy?

title: Being Picky About Customers Early On Can Bolster Long-Term Success
description: Jim Adkinson, an accountant in Orlando, Fla., has a litmus test for when its time to part ways with a client: If he sees the caller I.D. and cant bear to pick up the phone.

title: In-Flight Wi-Fi Prices Jump as Demand Surges
description: During a Tuesday-morning flight in April from Los Angeles to New York, Christine Lus smartphone web browser loaded an unpleasant surprise: Gogo, the in-flight Wi-Fi provider, wanted to charge her $27 to use its service during the five-and-a-half-hour trip.

title: A Toothy Welcome to a Family Fish Restaurant on Long Island
description: Heading out toward eastern Long Island, just before the patina of the Hamptons wealth starts to emerge, the Montauk Highway slips past quaint hamlets and faded farmhouses and watery fingers of Moriches Bay. On the roadside in Center Moriches, through a yawning sharks mouth, Atlantic Seafood Restaurant and Fish Market offers a bounty from the sea  to eat in, take out or prepare at home  but the main attraction is the welcoming feel of the place, orchestrated by the establishments owner, Dennis Donovan, a local for 50 years.

title: Vulture Populations Wane, Poisoned by Man
description: MASAI MARA NATIONAL RESERVE, Kenya  Death feeds life on the Mara.

title: What We Learn From Old Recipes
description: Out with the old and in with the new! Or so the saying goes. But it often goes the opposite way for me: In a reading life full of recipes, I like old ones better. I didnt realize how much, or why, until I recently started writing a book updating a hundred of them  mostly from the 20th century, but all with timeworn roots.

title: Landfalls, by Naomi J. Williams
description: When the explorers in Landfalls confess their purpose  We were ... ready below with maps outspread and the journals of our predecessors open to the relevant pages, ready on deck and aloft with our keen young eyes and burnished telescopes  they also describe the parallel joys of history and fiction, those most sympathetic bedfellows. Both demand an engagement with humanity that must skate across time and space to achieve any sort of context, any degree of relevance or reach. The best kind of historical fiction, then, should involve intelligence, experimentation, boldness and curiosity.

title: An Unlikely Debut
description: A map changed Naomi J. Williamss life. The author of the debut novel Landfalls, reviewed this week, received an antique map of Alaska from her husband, and became curious about two ships listed on it: the Boussole and the Astrolabe. Next thing I knew, she said in an email interview, a decade had passed and I had this book.

title: Salva Kiir,South Sudans President, Signs Peace Deal With Rebels
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  President Salva Kiir of South Sudan, facing the threat of immediate action by the United Nations if he did not endorse a proposed peace deal, signed an accord with rebels on Wednesday aimed at ending nearly two years of conflict marked by widespread atrocities.

title: As Service Gaps Remain, City Says Verizon Broke Promise on FiOS
description: When New York City was preparing to let Verizon offer its high-speed FiOS Internet service in 2008, a city councilwoman, Gale A. Brewer, warned that New Yorkers need to know whether they are going to wait three years or six years.

title: Saudi Arabia Said to Arrest Suspect in 1996 Khobar Towers Bombing
description: CAIRO  Saudi Arabia has arrested the man accused as the mastermind of a 1996 bombing that killed 19 American airmen, a Saudi-owned pan-Arab newspaper reported on Wednesday, citing unnamed officials.

title: 2015 Fantasy Football: Wide Receiver Preview and Rankings
description: Wide receiver is considered by many to be the deepest position in fantasy football, and we agree. But there is something to be said about getting consistent production from the position, which is not so easy to obtain.

title: Monsanto Abandons $47 Billion Takeover Bid for Syngenta
description: Monsanto said on Wednesday that it was abandoning its $47 billion takeover bid for the Swiss agricultural chemical manufacturer Syngenta after the company rebuffed a newly sweetened offer.

title: Church Inquiry May Pit Pope Against a Popular Bosnian Shrine
description: MEDJUGORJE, Bosnia and Herzegovina  At exactly 6:40 p.m. one sultry day this month, the peal of church bells rang though the main square of this town, bringing countless pilgrims instantly to their knees.

title: California Agriculture Posted Record Revenues During Drought
description: Californias drought has brought with it stories of acres of farmland fallowed and billions of dollars lost. Farmers have undeniably been affected by water shortages, some more than others, but a new report has found that the states agriculture industry as a whole has actually posted record revenues in the midst of the drought.

title: An Injury Away From Michael Vick: Is That Good or Bad for Steelers?
description: The Pittsburgh Steelers are a Super Bowl contender this year, in large part because their offense, as always, is in the safe hands of the dependable star quarterback Ben Roethlisberger.

title: From the Bench, a New Look at Punishment
description: Jessica Oteros request to the judge, made in neat handwriting, was simple: She wanted a second chance. Ten years after she was convicted of driving an illegal immigrant across the border, her felony record meant she could not get work in the medical field. I have learned from my past mistakes and am headed down a positive path, Ms. Otero wrote.

title: Groups Press Hillary Clinton to Take On Wall Streets Revolving Door With Government
description: Eight groups hoping to press Hillary Rodham Clinton to address Wall Street excesses released a letter on Wednesday urging her to focus on the issue of golden parachute compensation packages for Wall Street executives who go on to take government jobs.

title: Chinas Big Spenders Pull Back, as Stock Market Shudders
description: One of Hong Kongs busiest shopping streets winds past the Times Square center, under slick signs for brands like Mont Blanc, Cartier, Gucci and Burberry.

title: Keith Richards on Crosseyed Heart: Its Solo Rock n Roll, but He Likes It
description: Sometime around 2011, Keith Richards was ready to retire from his life in rock n roll. Approaching half a century with the Rolling Stones, he had done it all. I know what luck is. Ive had a lot, he reflected in an interview this month.

title: Sept. 13, 2005 | The Hard Road to the Big Easy
description: Joe Treaster, who has been racing hurricanes for Times readers for many years, made sure that on the Monday morning the storm hit we were the rare newspaper with a story from New Orleans itself. As thousands scrambled to escape the area before sundown the day before, Joe drove alone, from Mississippi, into the city. The locals thought he was crazy.

title: St. Pauls Student Takes the Stand, Denying Rape
description: CONCORD, N.H.  The student accused of rape in a case that has cast a harsh light on sex culture at an exclusive New England boarding school took the stand on Wednesday, denying that he had sex with the girl and presenting himself as a model of virtue: a high-achieving soccer captain who won an award for his character before graduating last year.

title: Carly Fiorina Pushes to Be Included in Top-Tier Debate Next Month
description: The second Republican presidential debate is less than a month away, and the jockeying for a coveted spot on the main stage is occurring in earnest.

title: In the Eye of the Storm: Remembering Katrina
description: Kate Zernike was one of the reporters on the scene who described her time in Mississippi, and contrasted it with her experiences in a later storm, Sandy. Here is her recollection:

title: Portrait of Katrina: A Photographer Reflects
description: In September 2005, Times reporters and editors who covered Hurricane Katrina wrote about their experiences for Ahead of The Times, our internal newsletter. David Frank, then deputy picture editor, recounted at the time the logistical, physical and technological challenges that our photographers faced.

title: The Appeal of Free: 75 Million Users Download Windows 10 in First Month
description: Free Windows is proving to be a very attractive price indeed. Seventy-five million users have downloaded Windows 10 to their personal computers and tablets in the first month of its release, Microsoft announced on Wednesday.

title: 1890: Murder on Paris Boulevard
description: A dramatic murder was committed last evening on the boulevard Malesherbes. The victim was Marie Gurin, a young girl in service who was to have been married on Thursday, and the murderess is a cook named Madeleine Colange. The motive of the crime, so far as it has been possible to ascertain it, seems to have been jealousy. As Marie was walking arm in arm with the young man to whom she was engaged they were accosted in front of the tramway station by her rival, who, after a few abusive words, drew a knife and with one blow stabbed her through the breast.  The New York Herald, European Edition, August 27, 1890

title: Market Turmoil Prompts New Speculation on the Feds Timetable
description: WASHINGTON  Turmoil in global financial markets has reduced the chances the Federal Reserve will raise its benchmark interest rate in September, a senior Fed policy maker said on Wednesday, but the possibility of a rate increase remains on the table, provided markets regain balance and economic problems in other countries do not disrupt the slow but steady performance of the domestic economy.

title: Verbatim: Hillary Clinton Reacts to Shooting in Virginia
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton, expressed condolences after the killing of two television journalists working for WDBJ7 of Roanoke, Va., on Wednesday.

title: Staying Private in Windows 10
Frank Dillane of Fear the Walking Dead, Dodging Zombies and Seeking a Pub
description: When your first movie role is the youthful incarnation of one of the all-time great villains, where do you go from there? For Frank Dillane, who at 16 won an open casting call to portray Tom Marvolo Riddle  the boy who would be Lord Voldemort  in Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince, you get thee to the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art. By auditioning with Hamlets soliloquy, no less.

title: For Rafael Nadal, a Little Strip Tennis Before the U.S. Open
description: It was 90 degrees in the sun, the spectators were wilting in the heat, and there on the court, Rafael Nadal was slicing and lobbing balls back over the net  in a full tailored suit.

title: Amy Bezunarteas New Villain Taps a Discomfort Zone of Terse Insights
description: A clear voice and an unsparing eye define the songs of Amy Bezunartea, who is playing Rockwood Music Hall in advance of the Sept. 25 release of her calmly implacable second album, New Villain (Kiam). She keeps the music slow and sparse, sometimes just a lone guitar or piano note, deliberately exposing the way her terse lyrics and finely chiseled melodies carry uncomfortable insights about herself and others.

title: National Geographics TV Outlets Examine Elephants Plight
description: It has been a summer full of shark programming, but National Geographics outlets are devoting the last Sunday of August to elephants and their struggles to survive. At 8 p.m., the National Geographic Channel brings back Explorer with an episode called Warlords of Ivory, a disturbing look at how extreme elephant poaching is in Africa. The journalist Bryan Christy puts a tracking device inside a fake tusk in an effort to determine what path it travels on its way to the black market, and who profits as it does. Mr. Christy has a self-aggrandizing style, but the episode demonstrates that the ivory trade is no longer limited to a lone poacher with a rifle; mass slaughter with automatic weapons shot from helicopters is part of the problem.

title: App Smart | Start School Right
description: Whether back-to-school means college or high school, apps can help a student stay organized and productive.

title: Video Feature: Back-to-School Apps for the Organized Student
description: Students enjoying their last days of summer break have the threat of back-to-school time hanging over their heads, like the sword of Damocles. If that Damocles reference has you confused, why not look up the ancient story using the Google app?
