title: Junaid Hussain, ISIS Recruiter, Reported Killed in Airstrike
description: LONDON  A 21-year-old hacker from Birmingham, England, who tapped into American military networks and was a central figure in the Islamic State militant groups online recruitment campaign, has been killed in Syria by an American airstrike, according to three senior American officials.

title: Money Managers Look for Stock Bargains in Turmoil
description: The steep market sell-off has spared hardly anyone. Even some of the countrys top-performing portfolio managers have been hit. A fund run by William Miller, the Legg Mason Opportunity Trust, gave back all of this years gains of 14 percent. Bill Smead, who manages the Smead Value Fund, lost about 10 percent over the last month. Both funds are now roughly flat over the last year.

title: Stephen King: Can a Novelist Be Too Productive?
description: THERE are many unspoken postulates in literary criticism, one being that the more one writes, the less remarkable ones work is apt to be. Joyce Carol Oates, the author of more than 50 novels (not counting the 11 written under the pseudonyms Rosamond Smith and Lauren Kelly), understands perfectly how little use critics have for prolific writers. In one of her journals she wrote that she seemed to create more, certainly, than the literary world allows for a serious writer.

title: Champions League Draw: Manchester City in Tough Group With Juventus
description: Manchester City, which has weathered difficult Champions League draws in recent years, will have to do so again after being grouped with Juventus, Sevilla and Borussia Mnchengladbach at the draw in Monaco on Thursday.

title: Dole C.E.O. and Aide Found Liable for $148 Million in Buyout
description: Taking the Dole Company private in 2013 was nothing new to David H. Murdock, the nonagenarian billionaire who first bought out the fruit seller in 2003.

title: The Slow Process of Countering the Emerald Ash Borer
description: In 2001, ash trees began dying in Detroit, and no one could say why. Then glittering green beetles were discovered crawling out of an ash log.

title: Carly Fiorina, Gaining in Polls, Moves to Secure Spot in 2nd G.O.P. Debate
description: WASHINGTON  When Carly Fiorina found herself relegated to the undercard for the first Republican primary debate this month, she seized the opportunity to stand out. Clad in a bright pink suit, the only woman in a sea of men, she delivered a forceful performance that catapulted her into the national spotlight and generated a bounce in public polls.

title: Spike Lee, Gena Rowlands, Debbie Reynolds to Receive Honorary Oscars
description: LOS ANGELESSpike Lee, fiercely independent in both his films and public remarks, will receive an honorary Oscar from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, as he joins the actresses Gena Rowlands and Debbie Reynolds among those to be honored at the groups Governors Awards on Nov. 14.

title: No Comment Necessary: China Is the Worlds Biggest Democracy
description: Those who describe India and the United States as the worlds biggest democracies are missing something, according to Han Zhen, the head of Beijing Foreign Studies University. We should speak with great confidence that China is the worlds biggest democracy, he wrote on Thursday in an op-ed in a Chinese state-run newspaper. If we dont, it means we have admitted we are a non-democracy.

title: Hillary Clinton Likens Republican Views on Women to Those of Terror Groups
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton compared Republican presidential candidates to terrorist groups when it comes to their views on women, arguing that their extreme positions are not right for 21st-century America.

title: At La Garagista, Hybrid Grapes Stand Up to Vermonts Elements
description: BARNARD, Vt.  Wine is now made in all 50 states, though few suggest much of it is any good. But on a hillside just outside this small town in central Vermont, a little east of the Killington ski resort, Deirdre Heekin makes wines under the label La Garagista that are so soulful and delicious, they challenge crucial assumptions long taken for granted.

title: No One to Rescue Me From My Drinking
description: Its sort of lounge-y in here, I remarked to my co-worker as I walked past his office late one April afternoon. The rooms fluorescent lights were off, and jazz floated quietly from his computer.

title: Second City Assesses Losses After Fire
description: A day after a fire ripped through the offices of Second City, the comedy theater and school in Chicago, the theaters staff members were coming to terms with their loss.

title: ISIS Suicide Attack Kills 2 Iraqi Generals Near Ramadi
description: BAGHDAD  In a further setback to the faltering American and Iraqi campaign to retake Anbar Province from the Islamic State, two Iraqi generals were killed in a suicide attack by the group Thursday morning outside Ramadi, the provincial capital.

title: School Lunches Becoming Healthier, Statistics Indicate
description: WASHINGTON  The humble school lunch, that staple of most every American childs diet, has become healthier.

title: Joe Biden Has Meeting With Head of the A.F.L.-C.I.O.
description: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. is meeting Thursday with Richard L. Trumka, the president of the A.F.L.-C.I.O., a person briefed on the get-together confirmed.

title: When a Child Comes Knocking, Selling Candy
description: I am a gay woman who lives near a single mother and her sweet 9-year-old son. The boy goes to a Roman Catholic parochial school. Every other minute he is knocking on my door, trying to sell me something to benefit the school. (This week it was candy for the athletic department.) I like these neighbors, but I have little interest in supporting private schools and even less interest in supporting church schools that take a dim view of my marriage. How can I deal with these neighbors nicely?

title: Miley Cyruss Style
description: The performers fashion choices and physique make of her a natural avatar for a post-gender generation.

title: Local Nets, Not Faraway Markets, Key to New Zealands Dolphin Decline
description: In my latest piece on how Chinese appetites for an endangered fish are indirectly driving Mexicos tiny porpoise, the vaquita, to extinction, I passingly mentioned the worlds other deeply imperiled toothedwhale  New Zealands Mauis dolphin. This diminutive marine mammal is a subspecies of that countrys Hectors dolphin. The subspecies isdown to fewer than 50 individuals by some counts, largely because of drownings in towed and anchored fishing nets.

title: Miley Cyruss Style: An Exuberant Sexuality
description: Like dog years, media hours multiply. Although Miley Cyrus is 22, so much of her life has been spent in front of the camera that it seems as if weve been studying her image for an exponentially longer period of time, watching her evolve in front of the mechanical lens and in a fast-changing society.

title: Many Psychology Findings Not as Strong as Claimed, Study Says
description: The past several years have been bruising ones for the credibility of the social sciences. A star social psychologist was caught fabricating data, leading to more than 50 retracted papers. A top journal published a study supporting the existence of ESP that was widely criticized. The journal Science pulled a political science paper on the effect of gay canvassers on voters behavior because of concerns about faked data.

title: A Fake Goldman Sachs Underlines a Real Chinese Strength
description: The Goldman Sachs leasing company in Shenzhen is as genuine as the Apple store in Kunming and the $5 bottle of Chteau Lafite-Rothschild in Beijing. Wall Streets best-known investment bank has joined an illustrious list of Chinese fakes that belie a very real Chinese strength.

title: SoundCloud Sued for Copyright Infringement by PRS for Music
description: SoundCloud, a popular music-streaming website that has previously clashed with the music industry, has been sued in connection with copyright infringement by a British agency that represents songwriters.

title: Kari Soinios City of Ghosts Series
description: The photographer manipulates his photos to create a Manhattan that seems, as he says, both familiar and utterly foreign.

title: Untangling the Mysteries of Personal Technology
description: In tech land, it has become commonplace to obsess over every shiny new device  and forget why we buy all this stuff in the first place.

title: Haunting Images That Make New York Landmarks Feel New Again
description: When he landed in New York City as a first-time tourist in 1990, the Finnish photographer Kari Soinio  like so many visitors before and after him  was struck by the breathtaking sweep of the Manhattan skyline. When he returned to live downtown for an artist residency in 2006, his gaze was again drawn upward. I was amazed by the canyon of high-rises, he says, and the whole idea of the newcomer looking up. It was with this view in mind that he embarked on an ongoing series, City of Ghosts, which combines street and architectural photography. Soinio captures the beauty of the citys renowned landmarks  the Washington Square Arch, the Flatiron and Woolworth buildings  and pulls them into the foreground, while unwitting passersby become shadowy, anonymous characters in a duet between pedestrian and monument. Shooting with a 4x5-inch camera with no viewfinder, the defocused scene is both familiar and utterly foreign, as Soinio puts it, thanks to his manipulation of the images depths of field. In the happy accident of photography, if you really know your camera, you can do so much, he says. As City of Ghosts has continued, Soinio has shifted his attention to the changing urban landscape and the new glass towers that now reach skyward. In an age during which its never been more tempting to keep your eyes glued to a screen while traversing the urban landscape, his photos are a welcome reminder: Look up!

title: A Homes Story, Told in Dust, Bacteria and Fungi
description: An analysis of dust from 1,200 homes across the continental United States provides new information about the fungal and bacterial communities sharing the great indoors with us.

title: Fines for College Football Players? Not So Fast
description: In the lead-up to the first college sports season in which players for the nations biggest programs will receive stipends worth as much as several thousand dollars per year, recent remarks from two prominent football coaches have revealed that confusion still exists about how to treat athletes who are ostensibly amateurs yet now receive checks from their teams.

title: Labor Board Ruling Eases Way for Fast-Food Unions Efforts
description: WASHINGTON  The National Labor Relations Board, in a long-awaited ruling, made it easier on Thursday for unions to negotiate on behalf of workers at fast-food chains and other companies relying on contractors and franchisees.

title: Trump Reads The Times at a Rally
description: Donald Trump, the Republican presidential candidate, reacted to an article about himself in The New York Times on Thursday at a campaign rally in Greenville, S.C.

title: Donald Trumps Latest Target: The New York Times
description: Theatricality is a staple of Donald J. Trumps campaign events. On Thursday, during a speech in Greenville, S.C., he deployed a new prop: a copy of The New York Times, from which he read, on and off, for about eight minutes  alternately praising and mocking a front-page article about him. When he was done, Mr. Trump dramatically flung the newspaper into the air, allowing it to slowly descend over the audience.

title: Pull on My Hair, Donald Trump Says: I Dont Wear a Toupee
description: Donald J. Trump brought his free-association presidential campaign to Greenville, S.C., on Thursday, following up a cavalier reference to the silent majority that supports him with an annotated reading of a New York Times front-page article about him and then with an invitation to a woman in the crowd to yank his hair (I dont wear a toupee  its my hair).

title: Miley Cyrus onNicki Minaj and Hosting a Raw MTV Video Music Awards
description: LOS ANGELES  This weekend, Miley Cyrus is throwing a rager. Everyones invited, and MTV is footing the bill.

title: Architectural Salvage at a Brooklyn Church
description: A Manhattan salvage business is stripping the interior of the Church of the Redeemer, which was sold to a real estate company last year.

title: At This Brooklyn Church, Everything Must Go
description: On a recent Saturday morning, dust choked the air, and debris rained inside the Church of the Redeemer in Brooklyn, just south of the Atlantic Terminal transit hub. Shards of stained glass panes had fallen onto remnants of floral floor tiles, near stacks of dirt-covered hymnals and mangled metal ceiling panels. Workers were hammering apart walls and carrying walnut pews, which were to be offered for sale at the Demolition Depot in Manhattan.

title: The Virginia Shooter Wanted Fame. Lets Not Give It to Him.
description: A BRUTAL attack takes place on live television; the on-air reporter and cameraman are fatally shot while at work on an early morning story.

title: The Ultimate Tennis Mom
description: Judy Murray, the British Fed Cup team captain and mother of Andy and Jamie Murray, explains how she harnessed the talent of her young boys on and off the tennis court.

title: Review: Zipper Stars Patrick Wilson as a Sex Addict
description: ZIPPER

title: The Bizarre Case Against a Rana Plaza Film
description: This has not been a good year for free speech in Bangladesh. Self-styled defenders of Islam have killed several bloggers who dared to write critically about the religion and its followers. And now, a court has banned the release of a film about a building collapse that killed more than 1,100 garment workers in 2013.

title: Review: 7 Chinese Brothers, a Slacker Comedy Starring Jason Schwartzman and His Dog
description: 7 CHINESE BROTHERS

title: The Art of the Out-of-Office Reply
description: Ah, the feeling of excitement and gratification that someone has replied to your email so quickly, followed milliseconds later by the deflating realization that what you have actually received is an out-of-the-office automatic reply.

title: Review: I Touched All Your Stuff, a Documentary About a Technicians Story
description: I TOUCHED ALL YOUR STUFF

title: Clarence Thomas, a Supreme Court Justice of Few Words, Some Not His Own
description: WASHINGTON  Justice Clarence Thomas has not asked a question from the Supreme Court bench since 2006. His majority opinions tend to be brisk, efficient and dutiful.

title: A Male Tngara Frogs Mating Signal
description: A male tngara frog calling within a chorus in Gamboa, Panama, in search of a potential mate.

title: A Twist to How a Tngara Frog Finds Her Prince
description: Given a choice of two males, female tngara frogs will select the most attractive  those with calls of a low frequency and long duration. But when a third male who is inferior is added to the lineup, researchers have found, females often choose the less attractive of the first two. In a study published in the journal Science, scientists at the University of Texas, Austin, and at the Smithsonian Tropical Research Institute suggest that when a social situation becomes too complex, obvious decisions become too burdensome for the frogs. A similar effect has been observed in humans, suggesting that irrationality in mate selection may have deep biological roots.

title: Review: In The Second Mother, a Guest Flouts Boundaries
description: THE SECOND MOTHER

title: Review: My Voice, My Life, a Story of Hong Kong Student Actors
description: MY VOICE, MY LIFE

title: Review: In Unsullied, a Competitive Racer Must Run for Her Life
description: UNSULLIED

title: The New Orleans Jails, 10 Years Later
description: On Aug. 28, 2005, the New Orleans city jail held more than 6,000 people, giving it the highest per capita rate in America.

title: Review: Fever, a French Tale of High School Homicide and Consequences
description: FEVER

title: Review: Leonor Antuness New Show Reflects Artists Who Inspired Her
description: LEONOR ANTUNES

title: Living With Cancer: Collateral Damage
description: When I was invited to attend a prostate cancer group called Us Too in my town, its members were meeting in a private room in our public library. About eight men, some accompanied by their wives, had great difficulty communicating their discomfort about urine leaks and diapers. They wanted to know what strategies my gynecological cancer group used to talk about sexual issues. To alleviate their daily problems, the participants needed professional help that I could not furnish.

title: Review: Measure Investigates the Art of Quantifying
description: MEASURE

title: Review: Dream House at Dia:Chelsea, a Hallucinatory Show
description: LA MONTE YOUNG

title: How To | Make a Lobster Boil
description: The N.Y.C.-based chefs Max and Eli Sussman wrap up their summer residency at Ruschmeyers in Montauk with a lobster boil. Their secrets? The freshest seafood and lots of Old Bay seasoning.

title: Review: Recalling Ray Johnson, a Pioneer of Mail Art
description: PLEASE RETURN TO

title: A Ruschmeyers-Style Lobster Boil, Starring the Sussman Brothers
description: Like many true New Yorkers, Eli and Max Sussman of Brooklyns Samesa are spending the summer in Montauk, as executive chefs at Ruschmeyers restaurant. Working closely with Hamptons farms and fishermen has been an incredible experience  both the personal, daily relationships and the ability to obtain the freshest products possible, Eli tells T. And living this close to the beautiful beaches is a very solid way to spend the summer. Here, the Sussmans (who are originally from Detroit) demonstrate how to make a lobster boil, Ruschmeyers style. And below, they share a recipe for the perfect starter or side dish, a light ceviche that plays on different flavors, but fits perfectly into the seafood theme of an East Coast boil.

title: Eric Cancel, an Apprentice Jockey at Saratoga, Listens and Learns
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y.  It was the nightcap, the final race on Mondays card, and all Eric Cancel had to show for his afternoon was dirty riding pants. His horses had so far managed to beat only two horses in three races. When he got a leg up on his final mount of the day, Confessa, the words of his agent and mentor, Angel Cordero Jr., rattled in his head.

title: Met Announces Extended Hours for Chinese Fashion Show
description: The long goodbye for China: Through the Looking Glass just got a little longer: The Metropolitan Museum of Art is extending hours for the exhibitions final weekend.

title: For Some New York Latinos, Enthusiasm for de Blasio Gives Way to Frustration
description: In December 2013, Bill de Blasio, then the mayor-elect, made a series of high-level appointments that heartened many people in the Latino and Hispanic community.

title: Daniel Barenboim Provokes Backlash Over Iran Concert
description: News that one of the most respected  and outspoken  Israeli musicians in the world, Daniel Barenboim, is hoping to conduct a concert in Iran with the Berlin Staatskapelle drew a furious reaction this week from Israels right-wing culture minister.

title: Pictures of the Day: Hungary and Elsewhere
description: Hungary and More  Pictures of the Day

title: MTV VMAs 2015: Nominees Offer a Bundle of Contradictions
description: NOWADAYS, music videos are anomalous in MTVs programming; the debacles of teenage moms and catfished romantics claim the airspace once occupied by Britney Spears and Michael Jackson. But the networks Video Music Awards show  now headed for its 32nd installment  endures as an annual spectacle of theatrical pop performances, salacious onstage antics and reliable scandals. (Bet on that this year, as the reigning V.M.A.s provocateur Miley Cyrus will host.)

title: Hillary Clinton Reaches Deal With Democratic Party on Fund-Raising
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton and the Democratic National Committee have finalized a joint fund-raising agreement after months of negotiations, opening the door for the party to gain a significant head start on Republicans at roping in big checks from Democratic donors.

title: August 27, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Hungary, Nigeria, Ukraine and China.

title: The Role of Dcor in Hitlers Life
description: A new book by the architectural historian Despina Stratigakos, Hitler at Home (Yale University Press), arriving next month, details how that dictator showed an enthusiastic interest in even the smallest detail of his dcor. His favorite interior designer, Gerdy Troost, who died in 2003 at 98, saved her voluminous papers.

title: Review: In When Animals Dream a Teenagers Secret Is a Revelation Even to Her
description: In American popular culture, lycanthropy has typically been a guy thing. For the hapless Eisenhower-era protagonist of I Was a Teenage Werewolf and for the studly Jacob Black in the Twilight movies, sprouting fur, fangs and claws was a metaphor for uncontrollable adolescent male rage. But girls are angry, too, and the teenage werewolf in When Animals Dream, a spare and smart Danish thriller, comes of age in particularly infuriating circumstances.

title: Agent Cleared Over 2010 Florida Shooting Inquiry, but Lawyer Lashes Out
description: Four years ago, a Florida state investigator was drawn into a highly contentious case involving a young single mother who was in the process of breaking up with her boyfriend, a St. Johns County deputy sheriff, when she was killed with the officers service weapon.

title: U.S. to Join Inquiry Into Death of New York Prisoner
description: The office of the United States attorney in Manhattan announced on Thursday that it was joining the investigation into the death of Samuel Harrell, a prisoner at the Fishkill Correctional Facility in Beacon, N.Y., who inmate witnesses say was handcuffed and beaten severely this year by a group of corrections officers.

title: Review: The Sympathizer, a Novel About a Soldier, Spy and Film Consultant
description: Theres a great comic interlude in Viet Thanh Nguyens novel The Sympathizer when the unnamed narrator, a Vietnamese Army captain exiled in Los Angeles, critiques the screenplay of a gung-ho Hollywood movie about Americas heroism in the Vietnam War.

title: Review: Korean Warriors Seek Vengeance in Memories of the Sword
description: MEMORIES OF THE SWORD

title: Migrant or Refugee? There Is a Difference, With Legal Implications
description: In the first half of this year alone, at least 137,000 men, women and children crossed the Mediterranean Sea to reach the shores of Europe, according to the United Nations. Thousands are traveling across the Balkans now.

title: Review: In We Are Your Friends, Angelenos Long for Life Beyond the Valley
description: WE ARE YOUR FRIENDS

title: F.D.A. Approves Repatha, a Second Drug for Cholesterol in a Potent New Class
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Thursday approved the second drug in a novel class of powerful cholesterol-lowering medications.

title: Draft Joe Biden Meeting Draws Small Crowd as Democrats Gather
description: MINNEAPOLIS  They werent exactly beating down the door shouting Run, Joe, run!

title: Days of Unrest Turn Deadly in Indian State of Gujarat
description: NEW DELHI  The authorities in the Indian state of Gujarat struggled to restore calm on Thursday after two days of widespread unrest and deadly clashes between residents and the police. Curfews remained in Ahmedabad, the states largest city, and a state court ordered an inquiry into allegations of police brutality.

title: Review: In Z for Zachariah, an End-of-Days Love Triangle
description: Z for Zachariah may not be the most eventful post-apocalyptic drama, but its grip is strong and sure. Set in a verdant valley (with New Zealand standing in for the American South) that has somehow survived the fallout from an unspecified nuclear catastrophe, this minimalist but deeply affecting morality play slowly tugs you in.

title: Loving Queens: Reporters Notebook
description: For years, an old Redbird subway car sat on a patch of land next to Queens Borough Hall on Queens Boulevard. It had been hauled from a rail yard somewhere and repurposed as a tourist information center, the boroughs one and only.

title: Movie Review: No Escape
description: The Times critic Daniel M. Gold reviews No Escape.

title: Serena Williams Sings Karaoke
description: The tennis star sang Under the Sea during a karaoke session at the 2nd Annual Delta Open Mic event.

title: U.S. Open Stars Juggle Preparation With Publicity
description: Nike organized street tennis for Maria Sharapova, Roger Federer and others in the meatpacking district. Tommy Hilfiger opted for strip tennis with Rafael Nadal in Bryant Park. Delta Air Lines held a celebrity karaoke night with Serena Williams near Times Square. And American Express staged what it called a hydro-interactive tennis experience featuring Ms. Sharapova along the Hudson River.

title: Review: Made in the Americas Explores Globalism From Way, Way Back
description: BOSTON  One of the great gifts that multiculturalist thinking gave us was final freedom from the tyranny of purity. Simply put, that old ideal was revealed as an illusion. It doesnt exist, at least not in art. There, in reality, everything is a mix. Wonderfully, the longer and closer we look, the richer the mix becomes. And this has always been true. Globalism, which we take to be so 21st century, with its networks and mash-ups, is as old as the hills.

title: A New Mexican Restaurant That Doesnt Skimp on the Spice
description: The restaurateur Dario Wolos began making tacos a decade ago, selling them out of a Volkswagen bus in Mexico. Since then, hes moved to New York and opened four restaurants, all called Tacombi, around the city, each focusing on a different Mexican regional cuisine. The fifth, Tacombi West Village, opens on the corner of Bleecker and Cornelia streets in September. Wolos and his chef, Jason DeBriere  who honed his kitchen chops at restaurants Washington Park, Barbuto and Peels  traveled throughout the Yucatn, stopping at roadside stands and markets in search of dishes and flavors they could bring back to New York. We wanted to focus and bring these flavors from the Yucatn, because there wasnt a lot of representation, DeBriere says.

title: Review: Grand Illusions Showcases Deceptive Photography
description: Grand Illusions: Staged Photography From the Met Collection is a small, choice, concentrated exhibition. Ensconced in modest galleries at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, its 40 works are drawn entirely from that museums collection and form a freewheeling introduction to staged photography. This tactic  arranging objects or people for the camera  began with photographys invention; figured prominently in portraiture, commercial and Surrealist lines of work; and entered mainstream art full throttle in the 1980s, with the arrival of the Pictures Generation and postmodernism.

title: Segerstrom Center Says It Is Nearing Its Fund-Raising Goal
description: The Segerstrom Center for the Arts in Costa Mesa, Calif., which has established itself in recent years as a leading dance theater, announced Thursday that it had raised nearly two-thirds of a new $68 million campaign to transform its plaza into a more welcoming public space, create a Center for Dance and Innovation, and establish more partnerships with community groups.

description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Endless House Expands the Definition of Home
description: If modern architecture has a quintessential building type, it is the apartment block  those functional, rigidly structured urban compressors that made architecture a form of social planning. The single-family home, by contrast, was a more suspicious thing. It stood for individualism, and therefore against progress  or at least the kind of progress envisioned in the grand metropolitan plans of the last century.

title: Venturing Outside for Opera and More on the Big Screen
description: As the end of summer nears, the options for outdoor cinema begin to dwindle. But judging from the lineup over the next several days, summer is not yielding just yet. On outdoor screens across town, there will be a little something for everyone, the most notable being the Metropolitan Operas Summer HD Festival.

title: Review: Elaine Lustig Cohens Paintings Move Into Philip Johnsons Glass House
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn.  Philip Johnson left behind a complicated legacy, which is entering an expansive new phase with exhibitions like the current one of Elaine Lustig Cohens paintings from the 1960s and 70s at his 49-acre estate in New Canaan, Conn.

description: Approximate running times are in parentheses. Theaters are in Manhattan unless otherwise noted. Full reviews of current productions, additional listings, showtimes and ticket information are at nytimes.com/theater. A searchable, critical guide to theater is at nytimes.com/events.

title: When Airlines Looked Cool and Showed It
description: In more ways than one, Airline Visual Identity, 1945-1975 (Callisto Publishing) is a hefty piece of work, landing at 430 pages, weighing 14 pounds and selling for $400. But the true size of its ambition is how it reveals the optimism of the Jet Age through nearly 400 posters and images from airlines like Pan Am, TWA, and United, evoking a time now seen as the golden age of flying.

description: Museums and Sites

title: Hamilton Is a Must-See for Treasury Chiefs, Too
description: AMONG the parade of power players flocking to see Hamilton on Broadway, there is a tiny subset with a special connection to the shows protagonist: men who have held the job Alexander Hamilton pioneered, secretary of the Treasury.

title: Record Number of Claims Filed Against New York Police a Year Ago, a Report Says
description: Personal-injury and other tort claims filed annually against the New York Police Department soared to a new high of 9,448 one year ago, according to a report released Thursday by the city comptrollers office.

title: The City that Lingers Between Day and the Dark
description: Lynn Savilles photographs of New York at night capture that near-dark moment when one state of being is just about to become something else.

title: Obama, in New Orleans, Praises Results of Federal Intervention
description: NEW ORLEANS  President Obama came to this once-stricken city on Thursday to make a case for his entire presidency: that when disaster strikes, the federal government should help not only to rescue the stranded but also to rebuild better and fairer than before.

title: Inside the List
description: Proust For The People: Almost 100 years after his death, Marcel Proust has finally cracked the best-seller list. Sort of. The French artist Stphane Heuets illustrated interpretation of Swanns Way, the first volume of Prousts sprawling semiautobiographical novel In Search of Lost Time, is at No. 5 in its seventh week on the graphic novel hardcover list.

title: New York Captured Between the Day and the Dark
description: These last nights of summer, the dark never quite arrives, not in the city. It lingers in the future, along with the fall harvest and the winter cold, not so much an absence of light as the ink for a page unready to be written yet. It will come, bringing definition and clarity. For now there is just miasma.

title: Melody Patterson, Wrangler Jane on F Troop, Dies at 66
description: Melody Patterson, a winsome actress best known for playing Wrangler Jane on the sitcom F Troop in the 1960s, died on Aug. 21 in Hollister, Mo. She was 66.

title: When the Tragedy Youre Covering Is Your Own
description: ROANOKE, Va.  The young journalists had just been reported dead when the calls and messages started pouring in late Wednesday morning. They came by email and phone, via Twitter and Facebook: The diaspora was calling home.

description: In the industrial city of Changzhi, some factories are sputtering on and others have gone quiet, but with a slowing economy, none have much reason to expect a return to boom times.

title: Colombians Flee Venezuelas Crackdown on Immigrants
description: SAN ANTONIO DEL TCHIRA, Venezuela  At night and in the early morning, they wade across the thigh-deep river in Colombia, with televisions, refrigerators and other household possessions on their backs. By day, watched by gun-toting soldiers, they line up to cross what was once a busy international bridge now under military lockdown, dragging roller suitcases while their children shoulder school backpacks.

description: The Food and Drug Administration  issued warnings to the makers of Natural American Spirit, Winston and Nat Sherman cigarettes, saying that the brands could not be marketed as additive-free or natural.

title: Obamas Sanctions Chief to Defend Iran Accord in Israel
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas sanctions chief will arrive in Israel on Friday to defend the nuclear containment deal with Iran and try to reassure a government and public deeply opposed to the accord that the United States is still prepared to inflict severe financial penalties on Tehran for its sponsorship of terrorism and support for military proxies.

title: On the Jersey Shore, Las Vegas Meets Coney Island
description: The kitschy hotels that turned Wildwood into a postwar destination for a generation of baby boomers are vanishing. But not before Mark Havens photographs them.

description: First, members of the adultery website Ashley Madison had their personal information unveiled to the world by hackers. Now, a bigger threat looms.

title: Darryl Dawkins, Lovable N.B.A. Figure and Fierce Dunker, Dies at 58
description: Darryl Dawkins, who arrived in professional basketball as a gigantic teenager and became one of the games fiercest dunkers and most notoriously lovable characters, a backboard-smashing, referee-dissing, fun-loving manchild known to fans as Chocolate Thunder from Planet Lovetron, died on Thursday in Allentown, Pa. He was 58.

title: Customers Embrace Shark Fin Substitutes
description: In the narrow aisles of Golden Profit Trading, a store on Mott Street in Chinatown selling dried seafood and medicinal herbs, shelves are stocked with crates and glass jars full of ingredients not usually found outside this Manhattan neighborhood. It has dried squid, birds nest, abalone and, for the enhancement of energy and virility, sea cucumber.

title: Why Carly Fiorina Has a Tough Climb to Make the Next Debate Cutoff
description: Carly Fiorina has surged in the polls after her strong performance in the so-called kiddie debate  the debate for candidates who werent in the top 10 in public opinion polls to qualify for the main Fox News debate on Aug. 6. She has moved up to sixth place in the Huffington Post Pollster average.

title: Rights Groups Stirring Over Sudan Presidents Travels
description: Plans by Sudans president to attend a World War II victory commemoration in China next week and a United Nations session later next month have angered rights groups seeking to remind the world about the international warrants for his arrest.

title: How a Gun in a Suitcase Became a Permanent Ball and Chain
description: At 27, Adele Langkil, mother of a 4-year-old son in Virginia, got her first extended break from her jobs as a single parent and waitress when her parents took the boy for a weekend. She spent a few days in New York.

title: Jessica Mendoza to Replace Curt Schilling for ESPN Broadcast
description: Jessica Mendoza, a gold-medal-winning Olympic softball player, will replace Curt Schilling on ESPNs broadcast Sunday night of the Chicago Cubs-Los Angeles Dodgers game. ESPN pulled Schilling from Sundays game as well as a Little League World Series game earlier this week because he shared a meme on Twitter that suggested extremist Muslims were comparable to Nazis.

title: Sit-In Leaders Are Charged in Hong Kong
description: Three student leaders of last years pro-democracy Umbrella Movement in Hong Kong  including the rail-thin teenager who at 17 became the face of the protests  were charged on Thursday over their roles in events that set off the huge rallies and sit-ins.

title: Brisk Business at Bronx Hotel, Center of Legionnaires Outbreak
description: The Opera House Hotel had to turn off its air-conditioning one hot day this month so that a cleaning crew could scrub away the Legionella bacteria lurking in the cooling tower on its roof.

title: 2 Killed Near Chicago After Report of Hazardous Material in Home
description: Two people were killed and five others were sent to the hospital on Thursday after an encounter with hazardous material at a suburban Chicago home, the authorities said.

title: Carlyle Finds Hedge Funds Hazardous as Its Private Equity Business Dominates
description: If nothing else, the last week has proved it can be very difficult to run a hedge fund. The Carlyle Group, the private equity giant, has known that for much longer.

title: Wary of Crowds, Bubba Watson Finds Himself in One Atop the Barclays Leaderboard
description: EDISON, N.J.  By the time the seventh threesome of the morning arrived at the tee box for its starting time Thursday at the Barclays, all 94 seats in the grandstand behind the 10th hole at Plainfield Country Club were filled, and an overflow stream of fans spilled down the stairs like an overturned cup of beer, the breakfast drink of choice for a few of the spectators.

title: Virginia Shooting Spotlights Riddle of Workplace Safety
description: The problems were flagrant, and his boss began to document them, only months after Vester Lee Flanagan II started working as a reporter at television station WDBJ in Roanoke, Va.

description: Photographs from the past week in New York City and the region include images of Queens surfers, Bronx Zoo gorillas and young immigrants.

title: Virginia Killings Produce Vow From Alison Parkers Father
description: WASHINGTON  Until Wednesday, Andy Parker was a low-profile talent recruiter for small banks who also dabbled in politics and theater. Today, with his 24-year-old daughter having been gunned down on live television, he is the nations latest crusader for gun control.

title: The Apprentice
description: Eric Cancel, 19, is an apprentice jockey, or bug boy, at Saratoga, achieving some success while learning valuable lessons from fellow riders.

title: A Life of Listing Grievances, and Then Virginia Gunmans Final Homicidal Explosion
description: ROANOKE, Va.  For two years after losing yet another television job, Vester Lee Flanagan II lived in a nondescript apartment across the street from WDBJ Channel 7, the station that had fired him. He worked in modest jobs at several insurance companies nearby. As thoughts of murder and revenge were swirling around his brain, he did his best to keep them out of sight.

title: Donald Trump Weighing Whether to Sign Pledge to Back Republicans Eventual Nominee
description: GREENVILLE, S.C.  Donald J. Trump said in an interview on Thursday that he would soon decide whether to sign a pledge to support the ultimate Republican presidential nominee, something the South Carolina Republican Party is requiring to compete in the states critical primary.

description: MAMARONECK, N.Y.  Ben Polland has a masters in business administration from Campbell University. He is also a pretty good study on the golf course.

description: LOS ANGELES  Californians cut water use by more than 31 percent in July, the largest savings the state has logged since a drought emergency was declared last year.

description: As Pedro Santana waited to pick up his first fare on a recent Saturday night, he stepped away from his cab, leaned over and plucked an ear of corn from a tall green stalk growing next to a sidewalk in the Bronx, shucking and halving it in one motion.

description: Consumer Reports gave the Tesla Model S P85D sedan its highest score ever for a car, breaking the magazines scoring system by initially giving it 103 out of 100. Editors were forced to adjust the scoring system, leaving the electric car with a mere 100 out of 100.

description: From his office in a trailer in a salvage yard in Queens, Sam Sambucci  6 1, 300 pounds  appeals for grace in one of the most graceless corners of the city.

description: PHILADELPHIA  Shortly after the Mets lineup was posted outside their clubhouse, Daniel Murphy walked over to inspect the blue card taped to the wall.

title: Student Dies After Savannah State University Shooting
description: Officials are investigating the death of a student in a shooting Thursday night at Savannah State University in Georgia, the university said in a statement.

title: Whats On TV Friday
description: 8 P.M. (TCM) CASABLANCA (1942) Casablanca, Morocco, is a refuge from Nazi-occupied Europe during World War II. Rick (Humphrey Bogart) runs a cafe, where, one evening, his ex-lover Ilsa (Ingrid Bergman, above with Bogart) turns up with her husband, Victor (Paul Henreid), and Rick becomes tormented by the memory of his life with Ilsa in Paris. Eventually, the cafe is occupied by Nazis as well, and Rick becomes tangled up with them, Ilsa and Victor. The film won three Academy Awards. Mr. Bogart is, as usual, the cool, cynical, efficient and super-wise guy who operates his business strictly for profit but has a core of sentiment and idealism inside, Bosley Crowther wrote in The Times in 1942. In short, we will say that Casablanca is one of the years most exciting and trenchant films. It certainly wont make Vichy happy  but thats just another point for it.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: It is clear that this is a case of organized criminality where a lot of money is at stake and business is made out of human suffering.

title: On the Jersey Shore, Las Vegas Meets Coney Island
description: If Marty McFly could do a Back to the Future reboot on the Jersey Shore, he might have found Wildwood strangely familiar. To see it for ourselves, theres no need for a DeLorean or plutonium. Your sedan will do the trick. Just set your GPS to Ocean Avenue, and marvel at an anomaly of space and time called the 1950s.

description: Test your knowledge of rocks and minerals by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Kim Jong-un Says Norths Military Muscle Made Korean Deal Possible
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, in his first public comments on the recent deal struck with South Korea to defuse border tensions, said leverage provided by the Norths nuclear arms program had made the landmark agreement possible, Pyongyangs official news media reported on Friday.

title: Europe Reels From More Migrant Deaths on Land and Sea
description: VIENNA  Europe reeled from fresh shocks in its escalating migration crisis Friday, with reports that 150 people drowned in the Mediterranean and news that far more bodies had been found crammed in an abandoned refrigeration truck in Austria than first thought. Damage to the vehicles side raised the possibility that victims had struggled to escape.

title: Calls for Gun Control After Shooting of TV Broadcasters
description: To the Editor:

title: Bernie Sanderss Small-Beer Donors in the Big Money Casino
description: As a measure of democracy, one of the more encouraging statistics of the 2016 presidential race is the fact that the average contribution to the long-shot campaign of Senator Bernie Sanders is $31.30. It would be hard to buy any politician for $31.30. That is exactly the message Mr. Sanders intends, in renouncing fat-cat, super PAC campaigning that is turning American politics into an exercise in plutocracy.

title: When ISIS Rapists Win
description: The ISIS atrocities have descended like distant nightmares upon the numbed conscience of the world. The first beheadings of Americans had the power to shock, but since then there has been a steady barrage of inhumanity: mass executions of Christians and others, throwing gay men from rooftops, the destruction of ancient archaeological treasures, the routine use of poison gas.

title: A Refugee Tragedy in Austria
description: European leaders attending a summit meeting Thursday in Vienna had already shifted their focus to Europes growing refugee crisis when the terrible news came: the decomposing bodies of more than 70 people, assumed to be refugees smuggled into Europe, were discovered packed in a truck only miles away, apparently abandoned by human traffickers.

title: How Common Core Can Help in the Battle of Skills vs. Knowledge
description: Washington  STANDARDIZED tests are commonly blamed for narrowing the school curriculum to reading and math. Thats one reason Congress is considering changes in the law that could lead states to put less emphasis on test scores. But even if we abolished standardized tests tomorrow, a majority of elementary schools would continue to pay scant attention to subjects like history and science.

title: The Cold Cases of the Jim Crow Era
description: IN March 1941, President Franklin D. Roosevelt received a letter from a desperate mother. Her son, who was black, had been killed two years earlier, his body pulled from a river near Pickens, Miss.

title: What Carter Achieved as President
description: To the Editor:

title: The Anti-Trump Cometh
description: One man hasnt watched television in 25 years, gets around in a Ford Focus, and is named for a nature-loving pauper who didnt believe in owning money, property or shoes. He is considered infallible, but often doubts his daily utterances.

title: In Australia, Dont Tip
description: To the Editor:

title: Crash-Test Dummies as Republican Candidates for President
description: Will Chinas stock crash trigger another global financial crisis? Probably not. Still, the big market swings of the past week have been a reminder that the next president may well have to deal with some of the same problems that faced George W. Bush and Barack Obama. Financial instability abides.

title: Iran Deal Opens a Vitriolic Divide Among American Jews
description: WASHINGTON  The attacks on Representative Jerrold Nadler, Democrat of New York, since he announced his support for the nuclear accord with Iran have been so vicious that the National Jewish Democratic Council and the Anti-Defamation League both felt compelled this week to publicly condemn Jewish voices of hate.

title: Young Tennis Players Struggle to Break Through on Pro Tours
description: At his namesake tennis academy on Randalls Island on Wednesday night, John McEnroe hastily rearranged the schedule to have one of his invited guests, Nick Kyrgios, play doubles with him during a charity event.

description: Some states are embracing play as an important part of the learning process after years in which explicit academic instruction has been increasing in kindergarten classrooms across the country.

title: Homeless Families Endure Roaches, Mice and Failed Promises
description: Beyond the unlocked front doors of 60 Clarkson Avenue in Brooklyn, the lobby is a half-lit cavern, its ornate plaster moldings and patterned floor smeared with dirt. The windows gape onto a courtyard dense with weeds and trash. On the days when it comes at all, the elevator smells of urine.

title: Finding a Little Greenery in New York for $500,000 or Less
description: In a city thats cleaner, leafier and safer than it has been in some time, home buyers are clamoring for private outdoor space, brokers say. But if youre looking at the lower end of the market  say, at apartments priced around $500,000 or less  is there any hope of finding your own terrace or lawn?

title: New York Today: Enforcing a Ban
description: Updated: 10:20 a.m.

title: China Investigates Top Executives of Communist Papers Website
description: HONG KONG  Two executives of the online arm of Peoples Daily, the powerful newspaper that speaks for the Chinese Communist Party, have been detained on suspicion of taking bribes, state investigators said on Friday.

title: Today in Politics: Democrats Give Their Pitches to Party Leaders
description: Good Friday morning. The Iran nuclear deal has been making its way back to the Capitol during summer break, even if Congress has not, and it will be a focus of several events. But the big party is with the Democrats as they meet in Minneapolis to hear the candidates try to curry favor with the partys leaders.

title: Bill Bryson Fears Humans More Than Bears
description: Park rangers along the Appalachian Trail are preparing for a huge influx of visitors, thanks to the release of A Walk in the Woods, the movie based on your book about trying to hike the whole thing. What type of person do you think would see that movie and think, I want to do that, too? Well, thats a good question, because Ive had at least as many people tell me that my book has put them off the idea of walking the Appalachian Trail.

title: Vienna Hotel Is Lavish, Stylish, but Not Stuffy
description: From 480 euros, about $515 at $1.08 to the euro.

title: The Countries Between Us
How to Sculpt With a Chain Saw
description: First, get the right safety equipment. Before you rev up your saws two-stroke engine, invest in padded, cut-resistant chaps. A chain saw can be a dangerous tool, says Takao Hayashi of Yamaguchi, Japan, winner of this years U.S. Open Chainsaw Sculpture Championship in Eau Claire, Wis.

title: Before Saying Farewell at U.S. Open, Mardy Fish Intends to Stay for a While
description: MASON, Ohio  The last time Mardy Fish played in the U.S. Open, he departed crumpled in anxiety, fear and tears.

title: Mirror. Memory
description: Cultural memory often involves a good measure of willed forgetting, an overlooking of some parts of experience in favor of a dominant narrative. In this poem, the precise imagery of faces reflected in a kettle  misted and revealed  hints at how these subjects are at once obscured and plainly seen. Here, the memory of people who are often left out of history is set against the imagery of the painting, connected by the single long sentence from which the poem is made.

title: European Publishers Play Lobbying Role Against Google
description: BERLIN  In private sessions this summer, giant publishers and media companies from Germany, France and elsewhere have met with European officials about proposals to regulate Europes digital economy. The discussions have covered a broad range of contentious issues, according to public disclosures and several people who attended or were briefed on the meetings. Central to almost all of them has been limiting the reach of a single American company: Google.

title: Tirana, Breaking Free From Communist Past, Is a City Transformed
description: You begin to understand Tirana, the capital of Albania, the first time you try to cross the citys main road, which locals simply refer to as Boulevard. There are zebra-striped crosswalks, and cars stop if they must, but the feat is something akin to stage diving into a free-form automotive ballet. Confidence is the operative word here  coupled with an understanding that Albanians live by a rhythmic, improvisational code: Fill space when its free.

title: The 8.16.15 Issue
description: Readers respond to our 8.16.2015 issue.

title: Myanmar Democracy Icon Finds Herself Assailed as Authoritarian
description: YANGON, Myanmar  Framed photographs of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the Nobel laureate, cover the walls of his small living room, but U Myo Khin, a longtime democracy activist, has harsh words for the woman he idolized for years as a crusader against dictatorship.

title: Morning Agenda: Investors Seek Signal in the Noise
description: INVESTORS SEEK SIGNAL IN THE NOISE | Asian markets continued to soar on Friday, on the back of a global rebound on Thursday. The fear was palpable just days ago, but by the end of Thursday, the gloom had dissipated, DealBooks Peter Eavis reports. The Standard & Poors 500-stock index had climbed 6 percent from the low of Tuesdays close by the end of Thursday.

title: Officials Discuss Austrian Truck Tragedy
description: Three people held in Hungary are being questioned after the bodies of 71 people, believed to be Syrian migrants, were found in a truck near Vienna.

title: Antonio Banderas Sets a Celebrity Fashion Precedent at Central St. Martins
description: Theres a new name on the roll call of celebrities in the fashion sphere. Joining Victoria Beckham, Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen, Sarah Jessica Parker, John Malkovich and Kanye West is  Antonio Banderas.

title: Steady Financial Advice, With Friendship as a Bonus
description: CHICAGO  Anxiety-prone investors looking for safety in the stock market have sometimes found it in so-called widows-and-orphans stocks. At their best, they pay dividends for decades and bounce around a bit less when the markets convulse, as they have over the last week. For years, AT&T was the textbook example. Procter & Gamble was another.

title: Tennessee Williams Short Stories, Now as One-Acts
description: The Acting Company has commissioned evenings like Desire before  a program of Chekhov adaptations in the 1980s, when Spalding Gray and Wendy Wasserstein were among the playwrights; in the 1990s, a slate of short plays inspired by Shakespeares sonnets, by writers including Tony Kushner and Ntozake Shange.

title: Play About Incarcerated Women Wins Best of Edinburgh Award
description: EDINBURGH  The real stories and experiences of women in a United Kingdom prison form the basis for Key Change, this years winner of the annual Carol Tambor Best of Edinburgh Award, to be announced here on Friday. The award is presented each year to a single theater production at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe that has never been presented in New York City, and the winning show is produced the following winter in New York. Past winners of the prize include The Object Lesson, written and performed by Geoff Sobelle, and David Greigs The Events.

title: Video Reviews of  When Animals Dream, Queen of Earth, and No Escape.
description: In this weeks video, Times critics share their thoughts on When Animals Dream, Queen of Earth, and No Escape. See all of this weeks reviews.

title: Jozef Wesolowski, Ex-Archbishop Accused of Sexual Abuse, Dies at 67
description: ROME  Jozef Wesolowski, a Polish former archbishop who would have been the first high-level cleric to stand before a Vatican tribunal on charges of child sexual abuse, was found dead early Friday, the Vatican said in a statement. He was 67.

title: About 150 Migrants Feared Dead After Boats Sink Off Libya
description: CAIRO  About 150 people are believed to have drowned off western Libya after a fishing boat and a smaller boat carrying migrants sank in the Mediterranean, Libyan and international relief officials said on Friday.

title: National Security Adviser Meets With Chinese President Before His U.S. Visit
description: BEIJING  President Obamas national security adviser, Susan E. Rice, met in Beijing on Friday with several Chinese leaders, including President Xi Jinping and a senior army general, to discuss a number of issues that included areas of tension between the two nations. Her meetings were in preparation for the scheduled state visit next month by the Chinese president to the United States.

title: No Crying Over Spilled Chicken
description: Dear Diary:

title: Zombie Factories Stalk the Sputtering Chinese Economy
description: Miao Leijie loses money on each ton of cement his company produces. But stopping production is not an option.

title: Test Yourself: 5 Questions From an 8th-Grade Math Test
description: This month, New York State reported that just 22 percent of the eighth graders who took this years Common Core-aligned math test received a passing mark. How do you compare?

title: Whats on This Week Around the World
description: Gwangju, South Korea

title: Regenerative Medicine Researcher Cleared of Scientific Misconduct Charges
description: A prominent researcher in the field of regenerative medicine was cleared on Friday of charges of scientific misconduct by the Karolinska Institute, the Swedish medical university where he had done much of his pioneering work.

title: The How-on-Earth Garden
description: If there were a competition for tackling decidedly out-of-the-ordinary landscaping projects, David Kelly, a landscape designer, would be on auto-entry.

title: Mishka Henner Uses Google Earth as Muse
description: Theres an absurdity to living in an age when everything is photographed, Mishka Henner, a Belgian-born artist, said recently from his home in Manchester, England, emphasizing, in particular, that every square inch of the earth seems to have been photographed and all of it is accessible online  including some of the worlds most secret places.

title: A City Rises in Queens for the U.S. Open
description: Every August since 1978, a city within a city has popped up in Flushing Meadows, Queens. In just a few weeks, the corner of an almost 900-acre public park is transformed into the United States Open, along with its six fully staffed restaurants and 60 concessions stands, 20 stocked and staffed stores, five active loading docks, dozens of artfully landscaped tennis courts and strolling areas, a police force the size of a small Montana town, and three stadiums filled with passionate tennis fans, some of whom will probably soon be dancing the Whip/Nae Nae for the spider cam at Arthur Ashe Stadium. All of this hustle and bustle will help to bring in an estimated $700 million-plus for the New York area.

title: Rethinking Work
description: HOW satisfied are we with our jobs?

title: Queens as a Tourist Destination? Readers React
description: An article Wednesday on the rising number of tourists visiting Queens  attributed to the Lonely Planet guidebooks designating the borough to be the No. 1 travel destination in the country this year  attracted reader responses from along the No. 7 train line and beyond.

title: Daily Report: From thefacebook.com to One Billion Users in a Single Day
description: Facebook hit quite a milestone on Thursday.

title: Facing Retirement, but Easing Your Way Out the Door
description: SEVEN years ago, Steve E. Norwitz, who was then a 61-year-old executive at the Baltimore mutual fund group T. Rowe Price, proposed a scaled-down work schedule that would reduce his duties.

title: 1998 in 2015
description: David Beckworth has a good if possibly over-elaborate discussion of Chinas flirtation with crisis. What I find striking is the extent to which China has managed to put itself into something like the situation many of its neighbors faced in the late 1990s. The renminbi wants to depreciate, partly because of a slowing economy and monetary easing, partly because of a crisis of confidence and capital flight. But Chinese authorities arent willing to let it drop all the way, perhaps because of fears of trade conflict but also perhaps because the private sector and state-owned enterprises now have a lot of foreign-currency debt.

title: Credit Default Swaps for North America
description: The credit default swaps for North American companies with the biggest one-day change in either tightening (reduced risk) or widening (increased risk).

title: In Stieg Larssons Head, but His Own Man
description: STOCKHOLM  The saga of Lisbeth Salander continues, and David Lagercrantz, who has written the sequel to Stieg Larssons wildly popular Millennium trilogy, is both proud and deeply anxious over how millions of readers will receive it.

title: Human Obstacle Surprises Horse, Ends Irelands Olympics Bid
description: Irelands show jumping team was looking good to qualify for next summers Olympic Games in Rio de Janeiro. The Olympic medalist Cian OConnor was perfect through 10 fences.

title: 1890: France-U.S. Trade Dispute
description: No one denies that if the American pig is addicted to the dissemination of trichinosis and if French wines are unwholesome, France has legally the right to exclude pigs from her territory and the United States has the right to exclude French wines. But is it not rather absurd to exclude pigs and wine and admit tourists? In old days the ocean passage was so long that if a traveler had contracted a contagious or infectious disease before starting, it was certain to be developed before the passage was ended.

title: Fear of Asymmetry
description: David Roberts has a very nice essay on American politics, framed as an analysis of what nerds dont get; but its not just nerds who seem weirdly blind to the reality here.

title: Tax-Free Savings Accounts for Disabled Are Expected in 2016
description: SPECIAL savings accounts for people with disabilities are likely to become available in most states next year.

title: 1940: Color Television to Start Jan. 1
description: A demonstration of television in full color was shown privately to James L. Fly, chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, by the Columbia Broadcasting System yesterday in its laboratories at 485 Madison Avenue. Paul W. Kesten, vice-president of C.B.S., said the company expected to be broadcasting color television commercially by Jan. 1. The system used, which was developed by Dr. Peter C. Goldmark, C.B.S. chief television engineer, would not render existing television sets obsolete, Mr. Kesten said. The receiver used in the demonstration was of standard type, adjusted to a minor extent and equipped with a simple attachment which can be produced at comparatively small costs, while other tests proved that standard sets without any adjustment would receive black and white images broadcast by the new method.  New York Herald Tribune, August 30, 1940

title: Stuff We Liked: TV Show Finales and Timeless Songs
description: This article was initially published as a letter to subscribers of The Upshots weekly newsletter. You can sign up for the email here to get this and all of the best of The Upshot.

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Glenn Ligon
description: For his new bookshop installation, One Grand, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next installment in the series comes from the conceptual artist Glenn Ligon, who shares his picks exclusively with T.

title: Governor Christies Gift to Exxon Mobil
description: For years, New Jersey officials have been trying to make Exxon Mobil Corporation pay for their staggering and unprecedented pollution of the states northeastern wetlands. The price tag for damages and cleanup of more than 1,500 acres in the Linden and Bayonne areas was estimated at $8.9 billion. Gov. Chris Christie settled for a payout of $225 million from Exxon, a paltry sum that won the approval of a state judge earlier this week.

title: Marco Rubio Lashes Out at Hillary Clinton Over Terrorist Remark
description: Senator Marco Rubio hit back at Hillary Rodham Clinton on Friday for comparing Republicans to terrorists when it comes to their views on women.

title: Virginia Shooting Victims Were Hit in Head, Autopsies Show
description: The Virginia television reporter and cameraman whose murder on live television has renewed a national debate over gun violence both suffered gunshot wounds to the head, the chief medical examiners office in Roanoke said Friday.

title: Inventive Menus at Soho House Berlins New Restaurant
description: On a recent Thursday evening in the fashionable neighborhood of Mitte, a crowd of artists and D.J.s descended on a large marble-top table loaded with seasonal dishes: radishes served with freshly churned kefir butter; Dutch oysters flavored with ponzu ginger and chile. Within 20 minutes, the platters were empty. This record release party took place at the Store Kitchen, a new restaurant within a recently opened design emporium called the Store, off the lobby of Soho House.

title: Obama Says New Orleans Inspires Him
description: President Obama delivered a speech in New Orleans on Thursday at an event commemorating the 10th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina. The president praised the citys efforts to rebuild.

title: In Flushing: Upscale Condos and Retail
description: For much of the citys Asian community, the center of New York City is not in Manhattan, but in downtown Flushing, Queens, the bustling shopping district at the end of the No. 7 subway line. Soon this crowded commercial hub will grow even busier as sales start early next month at Flushing Commons, a mixed-use development that has been in the works for a decade.

title: Fans in Cary, N.C., Protest as FIFA Scandal Hits Their Little Home Team
description: CARY, N.C.  Before a big match, the scene outside a Carolina RailHawks game is hardly unusual for a soccer team in second-to-last place in a second-tier professional league. At the entrance gate, interns at a folding table distribute discounted tickets bought online.

title: Reminder: Private Mortgage Insurance Is Temporary
description: Home buyers who cant put at least 20 percent down usually have to carry private mortgage insurance, often an expensive proposition. One good thing about mortgage insurance, though, is that it doesnt last forever.

title: Ashley Madison Chief Steps Down After Data Breach
description: In the last two years, online attacks have led to executive casualties at prominent companies like Sony Pictures Entertainment and Target. Now add to the list the chief executive of the company operating the adultery website Ashley Madison, a lesser known but far more salacious victim.

title: The Key to Soupe au Pistou: Lots of Vegetables
description: My first experience of soupe au pistou, that vegetable soup from the South of France, was in a freezing cold Paris garret. From a can, in the middle of winter. It remains one of my warmest and most nourishing memories.

title: U.S. Citizen, Once Held in Egypts Crackdown, Becomes Voice for Inmates
description: CAIRO  MOHAMED SOLTAN knew he had one thing going for him when the Egyptian police came to his door: He was a United States citizen, raised primarily in Ohio.

title: No Retrial for North Carolina Officer Who Killed Unarmed Man
description: DURHAM, N.C.  North Carolina will not retry a white police officer who killed an unarmed black man who had just survived a car crash, state officials said Friday. The officers trial ended in a hung jury.

title: For Parents With Troubled Adult Children, Financial Hurdles Abound
description: IT was the summer between her sophomore and junior year at the University of Wisconsin-Madison when Patti Sachers daughter Keisha had a breakdown. She had taken LSD at a Grateful Dead concert one weekend in 1989. When Mrs. Sacher called to check on her that Monday, Keisha wasnt making sense.

title: Vatican Envoy Dies While Awaiting Trial
description: A spokesman for the Vatican announced that Jozef Wesolowski, a former Vatican envoy who had been charged with child sex abuse, was found dead in his apartment on Friday morning.

title: Panda Cares for Surviving Cub
description: The panda Mei Xiang is seen caring for her surviving cub at the Smithsonian National Zoo in Washington. The second of her two cubs died on Wednesday.

title: Ian Rogers, Apple Music Executive, Is Leaving Company
description: A crucial executive in Apples new music streaming service is leaving the company, just two months after Apple introduced the service and began an intense competition with Spotify for dominance of the online music market.

title: Bush Visits School Rebuilt After Katrina
description: Former President George W. Bush visited Warren Easton Charter High School in New Orleans on the 10th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina.

title: Just What Do You Mean by Anchor Baby?
description: Frankly, its more related to Asian people, Jeb Bush said Monday in defense of his use of the term anchor baby. It had to have been one of the least artful clarifications of the 2016 presidential campaign.

title: A Yiddish Operetta, Once Lost, Will Receive Its Full First Staging in 70 Years
description: Di Goldene Kale, a Yiddish-language operetta from the 1920s that was lost to time, will soon receive its first full staging in nearly 70 years.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are co-ops in Lenox Hill, the Upper East Side and Park Slope, Brooklyn.

title: An S.E.C. Settlement With Citigroup That Fails to Name Names
description: How can we expect Wall Streets me-first culture to change when regulators wont pursue or even identify the me-firsters who are directly involved?

title: Chinas Vulnerability Is a Test for U.S. Presidential Candidates
description: For two decades, American politicians have been escalating their rhetoric about how to confront a rising China, one that grabs territory in the South China Sea, vacuums up American jobs and mounts cyber attacks on the United States.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Give Us the Ballot
description: This week, Ari Berman and Simon Winchester.

title: Inside The New York Times Book Review: Give Us the Ballot
description: This week, Ari Berman talks about Give Us the Ballot; Simon Winchester discusses Susan Barkers The Incarnations; and Parul Sehgal has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

title: For Loyal Guests, Hotels Bring Back the House Call
description: In the hotel industry, customer relationship management has evolved to keeping notes on a regular guests favorite foods or room preference. But now some of the countrys most celebrated properties are reviving an old service for an even more personalized connection: the house call.

title: The Fashion News to Know This Week
Home Sales Around the New York Region
description: Information on sales in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut.

title: Narcos Episode 2 Recap: Death to Kidnappers
description: Read all of our Narcos recaps.

title: Fed Officials Say a September Rate Increase Is Still on the Table
description: JACKSON HOLE, Wyo.  The Federal Reserve will give serious consideration to raising its benchmark interest rate in mid-September, particularly if volatility subsides in financial markets, a number of Fed officials said Friday.

title: The Perils of Email Auto-Fill
description: Every new technology is amazing, and every new technology brings its own horrors. For example, there was no such thing as waking up at 30,000 feet on the shoulder of a stranger who is covered in your drool until we invented commercial air flight (and Ambien).

title: Book Review Podcast: Give Us the Ballot
description: In The New York Times Book Review, Jeffrey Rosen reviews Ari Bermans Give Us the Ballot: The Modern Struggle for Voting Rights in America. Mr. Rosen writes:

title: Homeland Securitys Peculiar Prosecution of Rentboy
description: The website Rentboy.com is accused of connecting male sex workers with clients, enabling prostitution, which is unlawful virtually everywhere in the country. It operated fairly transparently, giving annual parties, announcing a scholarship contest for escorts and promoting the motto Money cant buy you love  but the rest is negotiable.

title: Setback for Suit Against N.S.A. on Phone Data
description: WASHINGTON  An appeals court ruled on Friday that the National Security Agency may continue to collect the phone records of millions of Americans, at least until a new law banning the practice goes into effect in November.

title: Al Arbour, Coach of Islanders 1980s Dynasty, Dies at 82
description: Al Arbour, who coached the New York Islanders to four consecutive Stanley Cup championships in the 1980s and finished his career with the second-most coaching wins in National Hockey League history, died on Friday in Sarasota, Fla. He was 82.

title: Hillary Clintons Rivals Critical of Democratic Party Politics
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Hillary Rodham Clinton staked her claim on Friday to lead Democrats in 2016 and beyond, delivering a fiery speech to hundreds of party officials in which she attacked Donald J. Trump and other Republicans for hateful remarks  The party of Lincoln has become the party of Trump, she said acidly  and pledged to rebuild the Democratic political machine to help candidates win races nationwide.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties include a waterfront home in Bayville, N.Y., and a carriage house in Highlands, N.J.

title: Eric Betzigs Life Over the Microscope
description: In October 2014, the Nobel Prize in Chemistry went to three scientists for their work developing a new class of microscopes that may well transform biological research by permitting researchers to observe cellular processes as they happen.

title: The Birkenstock Doctor
description: To track the rise of Birkenstocks, one might look to their reinterpretation in Clines Spring/Summer 2013 collection, peep under the tables of any Brooklyn coffee shop, or read Vogues seal of approval (Pretty Ugly: Why Vogue Girls Have Fallen for Birkenstocks). Alternatively, one could simply call Tom Lonergan. The sixty-something retiree living in Ohio doesnt know a thing about couture (Selena? Selena who? he responded when asked about the Cline tipping point), values comfort in attire above all else and has never paid any attention to the strange, mercurial shifts in fashion. But two years ago, Lonergans mail order Birkenstocks repair business doubled in orders overnight. For years, orders had come from Vermont, Maine, New Hampshire and Florida, but suddenly, return labels increasingly sported ZIP codes in New York and California. Women sent in pairs theyd worn at college in the 90s and wanted to refurbish; millennials mailed damaged, rare styles theyd found on eBay.

title: Upper East Side Penthouse for $37.94 Million
description: A three-apartment penthouse combination, spanning the top four floors of the Charles condominium at 1355 First Avenue, sold for $37.94 million and was the most expensive closed sale of the week, according to city records.

title: Tomato Sandwiches
description: This sandwich pairs slightly overripe tomato slices with the essence of pan con tomate.

title: The Tomato Sandwich Perfected
description: When tomatoes are in season, you cant do better than a simple tomato sandwich.

title: An App Connects Users With Start-Ups That Are Hiring
description: We have come to expect our smartphone apps to accomplish any simple task we ask of them: order food, get from here to there, read the news and maybe buy tickets to a movie or a concert. But when they offer to do complex tasks, its best to remain skeptical.

title: Syrian Refugees on Their Journeys
description: Record numbers of people have arrived in Europe this year to seek asylum, many of them fleeing the war in Syria. Some of those refugees described their experiences.

title: Popcast: The Weeknd, No Longer a Mysterious Internet Presence
description: Abel Tesfaye is the Weeknd, a revelatory R&B singer and a narrative conceit, a persona with a high and lovely ballad-voice about his self-absorbed hedonism. He started in 2010 through a mysterious Internet presence, then some mixtapes, and finally a career: negotiating with record labels, getting onstage, going on the road.

title: Days Before Kidney Transplant, Aries Merritt Wins Bronze in Hurdles
description: BEIJING  There are the hurdles on the track, all of which Aries Merritt cleared on Friday night on his way to a bronze medal at the world track and field championships.

title: Mississippis Recovery After Katrina Holds Lessons for Policy Makers
description: GULFPORT, Miss.  Hurricane Katrina did not directly hit New Orleans, which flooded because of levee failures. Mississippi, it walloped.

title: Rudolph Giulianis Outrage on Homelessness, and Richard Geres
description: If the offenses of Donald J. Trump werent getting played out by the hour at the volume of a jackhammer in competition with a Nascar event, then recent comments by another New Yorker synonymous with unchecked expressiveness, and also touched by the pixie dust of presidential aspiration, might be generating more outrage. In an interview with NBCs local news channel in New York, former Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani explained, with both glee and self-regard, that not long ago he had paid a visit to the 19th Precinct station house on the Upper East Side to complain about a homeless man who had taken up residence on his block.

title: Scott Walker Vows to Defeat ISIS and Assails Democrats
description: Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin struck an aggressive posture in a foreign policy speech on Friday, taking aim equally at Americas enemies in the Middle East and Mr. Walkers political rivals in both parties.

title: What I Love | Frederique van der Wal
description: A model whose rsum includes Victorias Secret spends weekends in an 18th-century house near Rhinebeck, N.Y.

title: Popcast: The Weeknd
description: Times critics discuss The Weeknds music and new album, Beauty Behind the Madness.

title: NASAs Next Horizon in Space
description: Since New Horizons beamed back photos of Pluto, the question has loomed: Whats next? More than 1,600 Times readers shared their ideas.

title: Owen Labrie of St. Pauls School Is Found Not Guilty of Main Rape Charge
description: CONCORD, N.H.  The prep school graduate accused of raping a younger student at the elite St. Pauls School dropped his head and sobbed for the first time since the start of his trial: He had been found not guilty on Friday of felony sexual assault charges, but was convicted of having sex with a girl who was below the age of consent.

title: A Victorias Secret Model on Her Permanent Fixer-Upper
description: Frederique van der Wal decided to buy a weekend house 15 years ago, when she was pregnant with Scyler, her daughter with the screenwriter Nicholas Klein.

title: Death of Knut the Polar Bear Is Explained at Last
description: HEIDELBERG, Germany  Scientists have solved the zoological mystery of what killed Knut, the Berlin Zoos famous polar bear, more than four years after he drowned in his enclosure as horrified visitors watched.

title: India and Pakistan Accuse Each Other in Deaths of Civilians
description: ISLAMABAD  Pakistan and India on Friday accused each other of targeting civilians in the latest deadly exchange of cross-border fire, as relations continued to worsen just days after talks between top security officials of both countries were canceled.

title: Three Popular Psychology Studies That Didn't Hold Up
description: Researchers re-did 100 published psychology studies, and many did not check out. These are three of the studies, and some possible explanations for why they couldnt be replicated.

title: Seeing Freedom in Their Future, Psychics Reveal All: Its a Scam, Sir
description: Is it real? Or a bunch of baloney? Its a question New Yorkers and visitors to the city may ask themselves when they pass any of the seemingly countless storefront fortunetellers.

title: Marco Rubio Urges a More Aggressive Approach Toward China
description: Senator Marco Rubio of Florida issued a sharp critique of Chinas behavior on Friday, using a speech in South Carolina and an opinion piece in The Wall Street Journal to fault Beijing on such issues as military expansionism, cybertheft, human rights abuses and economic misconduct.
