title: Oliver Sacks, Casting Light on the Interconnectedness of Life
description: Its no coincidence that so many of the qualities that made Oliver Sacks such a brilliant writer are the same qualities that made him an ideal doctor: keen powers of observation and a devotion to detail, deep reservoirs of sympathy, and an intuitive understanding of the fathomless mysteries of the human brain and the intricate connections between the body and the mind.

title: Dr. Oliver Sacks, Explorer of the Brain
description: Dr. Oliver Sacks was a neurologist and best-selling author who explored the brains strangest pathways. His work touched Hollywood, theater, even opera, and his legacy lasts in the stories he told.

title: Oliver Sacks, Neurologist Who Wrote About the Brains Quirks, Dies at 82
description: Oliver Sacks, the neurologist and acclaimed author who explored some of the brains strangest pathways in best-selling case histories like The Man Who Mistook His Wife for a Hat, using his patients disorders as starting points for eloquent meditations on consciousness and the human condition, died on Sunday at his home in Manhattan. He was 82.

title: Defection of Perry Aide to Trump Camp Has Iowans Fearing for Image
description: DES MOINES  Is Iowa for sale?

title: Behind Deadly Tianjin Blast, Shortcuts and Lax Rules
description: TIANJIN, China  One partner was the son of a local police chief, the other an executive at a state-run chemicals firm. After meeting at a dinner party, they started a company here to handle the export of the most dangerous chemicals made in China, promising outstanding service and good results.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know to start your week.

title: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories.

title: Apps to Bring Math and Science Skills Back After Summers Slide
description: After a summer of fun, the shift back into schoolwork can be tough for kids. Feeling out-of-practice when it comes to math facts, logical thinking or even, for younger kids, the alphabet can make the transition even harder. Its time for a little review, but that review will go over much more sweetly if it seems more like fun than work.

title: Tianjin Explosion Reveals Company That Exploited Weak Governance
description: More than two weeks after explosions at its warehouses killed 145 people, Rui Hai International Logistics has become a symbol of the high cost of rapid industrialization in a closed political system rife with corruption.

title: Oil, Oligarchs, Climate and Obamas Arctic-Focused Alaska Trip
description: The Arctic seems hot these days, and not just because of rising temperatures and retreating ice, or because President Obama plans to speak at an Arctic policy meeting and visit an Arctic community on an Alaska tourstarting Monday.

title: Defying Expectations, Mayor Ras Baraka Is Praised in All Corners of Newark
description: NEWARK  Mayor Ras J. Baraka came into office last summer practically taunting his doubters.

title: Narcos Episode 5 Recap: There Will Be a Future
description: Read all of our Narcos recaps.

title: Iowa Poll Suggests Dangers for Hillary Clinton and Donald Trumps Strengths
description: In Iowa, when J. Ann Selzer talks, people listen.

title: Jason Rezaians Status Unclear After Iran Sentences 2
description: TEHRAN  Irans judiciary sentenced two people to 10 years in prison on Sunday for spying for the United States and Israel, but their names were not released, local media reported.

title: The Witches of Venice by Philip Glass to Have American Premiere
description: Philip Glasss The Witches of Venice, an opera-ballet for children first performed two decades ago at La Scala in Milan, will be given its American premiere next summer during Opera Saratogas 2016 Summer Festival in upstate New York, the festival announced Sunday.

title: The Time an 11-Year-Old Took Down Nadal
description: So, about Nadal, Estee Ackerman said in her unassuming way, about to relive the summer of 2013 serve by serve, volley by volley, point by point.

title: Straight Outta Compton Is No. 1 for Third Week at Box Office
description: LOS ANGELES  With the return to school preoccupying a major chunk of the movie-going audience, and Hollywood holding back significant new releases as a result, theaters in North America were relatively uninhabited over the weekend.

title: 1965: Dr. Kings Children Enroll in White School
description: ATLANTA  The Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. and his top assistant in the civil rights movement today enrolled five of their children in a previously all-white elementary school as classes began. Dr. Kings wife Coretta brought two of her children, and Mrs. Ralph Abernathy, whose husband is vice president of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference, enrolled three of her children in the Spring Street school.

title: Republican Candidates Address Donald Trump and Volatility in Polls
description: As the summer of Donald J. Trump winds down, some of the real estate moguls rivals took to the Sunday political talk shows, discussing plans for emerging from Mr. Trumps shadow in the Republican field.

title: Obamas Alaska Visit Puts Climate, Not Energy, in Forefront
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will travel to Alaska on Monday to call for urgent and aggressive action to tackle climate change, capitalizing on a poignant tableau of melting glaciers, crumbling permafrost and rising sea levels to illustrate the immediacy of an issue he hopes to make a central element of his legacy.

title: Big Apple Circus to Focus on Early Travel in 38th Season
description: The Big Apple Circuss new show, The Grand Tour!, will arrive at Lincoln Center in October. The production is a tribute to early-20th-century travel, and will feature performers from every continent, except Antarctica.

title: Food Trucks Divide a Missouri Town Looking for Sizzle
description: NORTH KANSAS CITY, Mo.  This region for years has prized its trendy and innovative side  from the shiny, modern performing arts center that resembles a seashell to the custom homes that look more Malibu than Midwest to the streetcar that is near completion.

title: 1940: Arab World Sitting on Fence As War Nears Its Threshold
description: CAIRO  As the British Middle East concentrates its attention on preparing to resist the expected Italian drive from the Libyan Desert eastward into Egypt, the Arab world, which in some of its parts flamed into revolt against the Ottoman power during the World War and seldom has been entirely peaceful since, remains curiously quiet.

title: VMAs 2015: Moments to Watch
description: Enough of the finger pointing and the slut shaming, Jon Caramanica wrote in 2013 in response to the moral panic that gripped the nation over Miley Cyruss twerk-filled, tongue-wagging MTV Video Music Awards performance. The haters havent gone away, but Ms. Cyrus rolls on, ready to court controversy, as she teased in an interview with The Times last week. There will be skits, psychedelic and raw elements, and thousands of Twitter fingers ready to critique her every move. I didnt want this V.M.A.s to be like theyve been in the past, she said. Since its the Viacom executive Van Tofflers last year, anything goes: Its one big party, and MTV is footing the bill. (The show starts at 9 p.m. on MTV.)

title: Hillary Clinton Secures Backing of Senator Jeanne Shaheen of New Hampshire
description: Senator Jeanne Shaheen, the popular Democrat from New Hampshire and the first woman to be elected senator and governor in the state, will publicly endorse Hillary Rodham Clinton next Saturday, Mrs. Clintons campaign said.

title: Protesters Demand Restoration of Mephistopheles Sculpture in St. Petersburg
description: MOSCOW  Hundreds of St. Petersburg residents and cultural preservationists gathered on Sunday to protest the destruction of a bas-relief sculpture of Mephistopheles that was removed from a historic 1910 apartment building last week and demand that it be restored.

title: To Jar North, South Korea Used a Pop-Music Barrage
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Chirpy bubble-gum harmonies bop across the desolate Demilitarized Zone. Look at me, Im your genie, your dream, your genie, the K-pop band Girls Generation beckons as grim-faced soldiers patrol the border.

title: After American Pharoah Is Dethroned, Baffert Has Plan to Cement His Place
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y.  Neither American Pharoah nor his trainer, Bob Baffert, looked worn out or deflated the morning after the colt was run down by Keen Ice in the final strides of the 146th running of the Travers Stakes. The white-haired Baffert smiled as he led his big bay colt outside his barn here, stopping to let a little girl feed him carrots.

title: Battling Arm Injuries, a Tennis Player Changes ... Hands
description: My forehand sailed deep  not just behind-the-baseline deep, but over-the-fence deep. Ive played tennis for more than four decades, yet I was staring at my right hand as if it had never swung a racket, which was sort of true.

title: Soul-Searching in TV Land Over the Challenges of a New Golden Age
description: John Landgrafs comments arrived like a thunderbolt.

title: Egypt Defends Ruling Against Two Al Jazeera Journalists
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian Foreign Ministry said Sunday that it had summoned the British ambassador to object to his comments on a recent court ruling to jail two journalists, escalating the governments defense of its crackdown on dissent.

title: 4x400 Relay Offers Bright Moment, but U.S. No Longer Dazzles
description: BEIJING  The last gold medal went to the United States as the veteran LaShawn Merritt ran another poised and powerful anchor leg to clinch victory in a tight 4x400-meter relay.

title: Mets Hang On to Edge the Red Sox
description: A familiar sound, a nervous murmuring, emanated from the crowd during the seventh inning as Manager Terry Collins hurried out of the Mets dugout toward the mound.

title: On Chinas Economy
description: Economic fears about China culminated last week in a global market rout.

title: Mount McKinley Will Again Be Called Denali
description: President Obama announced on Sunday that Mount McKinley was being renamed Denali, using his executive power to restore an Alaska Native name with deep cultural significance to the tallest mountain in North America.

title: Tennis Players Are Helped by Products (at Least They Think So)
description: In recent years there has been a proliferation of so-called smart rackets and other high-tech gadgets, including Sonys Smart Tennis Sensor and Babolats Play racket, that compile data on strokes. This fall, Babolat will introduce POP, a wristband that will provide similar analysis when used with any racket.

title: The Phone Charger Situation
description: A group of Syrian refugees gathered around a single power strip to charge their phones.

title: A New Look for the Wadsworth Atheneum
description: Photos of the renovated museum in downtown Hartford.

title: The Wadsworth Atheneum in Hartford Puts Final Touches on a Comeback
description: HARTFORD  At the Wadsworth Atheneum, they called it the Leak Tour, and sometimes the Horror Tour.

title: Review: Todrick, on the YouTube Star Todrick Halls Relentless Pursuit of Fame
description: Todrick is a television show about the making of YouTube videos by a singer who once tried to become famous by performing on TV and failed. Which is to say that either the performer has changed, music has changed, or TV has.

title: Review: Martha Graham Dancers Explore Myth and Machismo at Jacobs Pillow
description: BECKET, Mass.  The ghost of Ted Shawn, who turned a farm here into the Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival and worked tirelessly to present dancing as a manly activity, might have been pleased to see a burly guy chopping wood on Thursday on the barnlike stage of the Ted Shawn Theater. Shawn might have been tickled, too, to learn that the man wielding the ax was a member of the dance troupe of his old student and partner Martha Graham.

title: Zhang Huoding of Peking Opera Takes a Turn in the United States
description: BEIJING  When The Legend of the White Snake opens Wednesday at the David H. Koch Theater at Lincoln Center, an American audience will get its first glimpse of Zhang Huoding, one of Chinas biggest Peking Opera stars, as she makes her United States debut.

title: Review: LoftOpera Brings Mischief, and a Crowd, to Berlioz and Mahler
description: Ill admit, with a certain degree of shame, that my predominant feeling on Friday night when I entered the Muse, a warehouse deep in Bushwick, Brooklyn, usually used as a circus school, was surprise, even shock. I hadnt trusted that 10 love songs by Berlioz and Mahler had much power to draw a crowd; after all, lieder has long been operas poor relation, and even opera, some say, today struggles to find an audience.

title: Review: Choosing a Husband or a Lover in DellArte Opera Ensembles Rosina
description: Did you hear? Rosina has a baby. From Cherubino! Theyve moved to Madrid. He paints  mostly her  but that doesnt pay the rent. Rumor has it that Count Almaviva is looking for Rosina, but nobody knows if hes out to kill her for her infidelity or beg forgiveness for his own string of escapades, which helped push her into the arms of his young page.

title: Review: At Indian Dance Festival, Subtleties in the Sway of a Torso
description: Since India has many languages, it would take a true polyglot to comprehend all its poetry. On Friday, when the Erasing Borders Festival of Indian Dance held an indoor program enticingly called An Evening of Poetry, Danced at Pace Universitys Schimmel Center, the audience was given words in five different languages. If we accept Frosts theory that poetry is what is lost in translation, probably most of those present lost a great deal. Much, however, remained.

title: The Stress of the Slam
description: In the days leading up to the 1969 United States Open, pressure was mounting on Rod Laver. He had won the Australian Open in grueling fashion and followed it up with victories at the French Open and Wimbledon.

title: In Lordes Wake, a Groundswell of Female Rebels in Pop
description: From a distance, this seems like a great moment for female friendship in pop. Look at Taylor Swifts current tour, which includes appearances from people she admires, often women: Serena Williams, Selena Gomez, Mary J. Blige, Ellen DeGeneres, Lisa Kudrow (hmmm), Joan Baez (what?).

title: Supplanting CBS and Tennis Channel, ESPN Empire Will Show All U.S. Open Matches
description: Serena Williamss quest to complete the Grand Slam at the U.S. Open will be a production of the ESPN empire, viewable only on ESPN, ESPN2 and ESPN3.

title: Review: The End of Tsarist Russia by Dominic Lieven
description: Dominic Lievens stated reason for this contribution to the centenary literature on World War I is to place Russia where it belongs, at the very center of the wars history. Certainly the war proved to be at the center of Russian history, leading to revolution, dictatorship, repression and more war.

title: Whats New at the U.S. Open? Start at the Top
description: The most visible change at the U.S. Open this year is hard to miss. Long before fans get to the U.S.T.A. Billie Jean King National Tennis Center by road or by rail, they will notice the new shape of Arthur Ashe Stadium.

title: Ms and Ns
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Who knew there were three different ways to invite us into the pool?

title: Review: Phantom, on the Trail of Mumbai Terrorists
description: Daniyal (Saif Ali Khan) and Nawaz (Katrina Kaif), the hapless secret agent heroes of Kabir Khans revenge thriller Phantom, could have used some pointers before being sent into the field.

title: Susan Rice, Obamas Security Adviser, Urges Pakistan to Do More Against Militants
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  President Obamas national security adviser, Susan E. Rice, urged Pakistani civilian and military leaders on Sunday to do more to stop militants from using Pakistani territory to stage attacks in neighboring countries.

title: Review: Magic Trick, the Tale of a Breakup in the World of Burlesque
description: A relationship dramedy set in the world of burlesque, Mariah MacCarthys Magic Trick lives low to the ground. This is partly by necessity: The plays main character is a young woman who uses a wheelchair, and much of the action occurs as she and others are sitting or lying down.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Aug. 31
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Kanye West to Perform an 808s Concert
description: Kanye West will perform a one-off concert celebrating his 2008 album, 808s & Heartbreak, at the Hollywood Bowl next month. That album, which featured heavy use of auto-tune and synthesizers, did not receive universal acclaim upon release but now is regarded as a pivotal influence on current hip-hop and R&B stars, including Drake, the Weeknd and Future.  808s & Heartbreak sounds like none of his other albums, nor any rap album of note, Jon Caramanica wrote in his review for The Times. At best, it is a rough sketch for a great album. Mr. West later described it as the first black new wave album in an interview with Mr. Caramanica. The concert will take place on Sept. 25. Tickets go on sale Friday.

title: Mayor de Blasio Authorizes Emergency Measure to Aid Homeless People
description: With few beds available in New York Citys homeless shelters, Mayor Bill de Blasio has authorized another emergency measure to provide rental assistance to people facing homelessness.

title: Captains Death Rattles a Marina in New Jersey
description: BELFORD, N.J.  He was a retired construction worker who turned his fishing hobby into a low-pressure business, taking a delight in almost anything he brought back.

title: Manchester United Sputters as Wayne Rooney Struggles to Ignite
description: SWANSEA, Wales

title: As Police Investigate Deaths in Truck, Migrants and Smugglers Appear to Shift Tactics
description: NICKELSDORF, Austria  Investigators continued to work their way on Sunday through a truck that carried 71 migrants to their deaths last week, removing articles of clothing and bagging and labeling them as possible evidence in an inquiry against the smuggling operation believed to be responsible.

title: An Archipelagos Gulag
description: Russians clash over how best to memorialize those killed at a monastery used as a Soviet prison camp.

description: Maria Sharapova, the 2006 U.S. Open champion, withdrew from the Open on Sunday, citing a leg injury.

description: The New York Times has followed Serena Williamss career since 1990, when she was an 8-year-old in Compton, Calif. Here are excerpts from The Timess coverage of some of her significant moments at Grand Slam events.

title: A Tug of War Over Gulag History in Russias North
description: SOLOVETSKY ISLANDS, Russia  Yuri Brodsky, who has dedicated his life to exposing the dark secrets of the ancient Solovetsky Monastery, pointed at a small, dirty courtyard window blocked by a crooked red brick wall.

title: Grand Slam Dominance: Serena Williams, in Three Charts
description: In her service game, her ability to bounce back after losing a first set and her hold on the top ranking, Williams stands apart.

title: Ahead of I.P.O., Univision Faces Bigger Rival Than Trump: Shifting TV Habits
description: Donald Trump isnt Univisions only problem, or even its biggest.

description: Vitalia Diatchenko, a 25-year-old from Sochi, Russia, traveled to New York alone, without a coach or her family.

title: Gary Keys, Filmmaker Who Documented Duke Ellington, Dies at 81
description: Gary Keys, a filmmaker whose documentaries captured some of the most important figures in jazz from the 1960s through the 1980s  notably Duke Ellington, the subject of three of his films  died on Aug. 9 in Manhattan. He was 81.

description: Read all of our Narcos recaps.

title: ISIS DamagesTemple of Baal in Palmyra
description: A week after reports of destruction by Islamic State militants in the ancient city of Palmyra in Syria, fighters severely damaged the Temple of Baal there, one of the oldest and culturally significant in the region, according to activists.

title: Car Sales, Samsungs New Smartwatch, and the Jobs Report
description: Major automakers are expected on Tuesday to report healthy August sales of new vehicles in the United States, despite posting an overall decline from the same month last year, which included the Labor Day weekend. Industry analysts project that year-over-year sales will drop slightly, but will still exceed 1.5 million vehicles for the month. So far this year, consumers have flooded vehicle showrooms to buy pickup trucks and sport utility vehicles, while sales of passenger cars have declined. The trend has benefited the Detroit automakers, which are expected to report sales increases in August. Analysts do not expect the recent stock market fluctuations to have had much effect on the auto industry. Bill Vlasic

title: Fernando Valenzuela Quietly Affirms His Status as a U.S. Citizen
description: LOS ANGELES  Fernando Valenzuela recently held his right hand over his heart and clutched an American flag in his left hand, the same one that used to fire screwballs past major league batters.

title: Indian Scholar Who Criticized Worship of Idols Is Killed
description: NEW DELHI  An Indian scholar whose criticism of idol worship had angered religious groups was fatally shot Sunday, the police said.

title: Growing Migrant Crisis Prompts Call for Urgent Meeting of E.U. Officials
description: LONDON  With increasing public consternation about the flow of migrants and asylum seekers to Europe and the dangers of their passage, Germany, France and Britain made a joint call on Sunday for an urgent meeting of European Union interior and justice ministers to find concrete measures to cope with the escalating crisis.

title: Challenged on Left and Right, the Fed Faces a Decision on Rates
description: JACKSON HOLE, Wyo.  Conservative activists who want the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates distributed chocolate coins in golden wrappers at the local airport last week as Fed officials arrived for their annual policy retreat.

title: Banking Ties Could Hurt Joe Biden in Race With Populist Overtone
description: During a meeting with consumer advocates in Washington in July 2010, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. lauded the Obama administrations progress on reforms it had long sought while offering pointed words about the practices of lenders and banks.

title: Caste Quotas in India Come Under Attack
description: AHMEDABAD, India  The resentment built slowly in Hardik Patel. It took root when he watched his younger sister lose out on a college scholarship because of Indias version of affirmative action, a system of strict quotas that reserves nearly half of government jobs and public college slots for those who come from disadvantaged castes or tribes.

title: Its Hard to Foretell a Brady Ruling, if There Is One
description: Trying to figure out how judges will rule is a fools errand, but that has not stopped prognosticators from wondering what Judge Richard M. Berman of Federal District Court in Manhattan will do in the showdown between Tom Brady and the N.F.L.

title: Tom Coughlin Has Sober Appraisal of Giants Readiness
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  A day after the Giants stumbling preseason performance against the Jets, there were no encouraging updates about the teams many injured stars nor were there any uplifting assessments of the teams progress. The season opens in roughly two weeks.

title: Wall St. Policy Poses a Challenge for Presidential Candidates
description: Even seven years after the financial crisis, Wall Street has lost none of its ability to stir partisan rancor.

title: University of Texas at AustinMoves Confederate Statue
description: A statue of Jefferson Davis, the president of the Confederacy during the Civil War, was taken down from its pedestal outside the clock tower on the University of Texas at Austin campus on Sunday, after a legal appeal to keep the memorial in place was rejected.

title: Jets Leonard Williams Expected for Opener After Test Reveals a Strain
description: Leonard Williams, who left the Jets preseason game Saturday against the Giants with a knee injury, appears to have avoided a long-term absence.

title: James L. Flanagan, Who Helped Make Computers Talk, Dies at 89
description: James L. Flanagan, whom we can thank for articulate digital assistants like Siri and intelligible subway loudspeakers and blame for the disembodied voices that inform frustrated telephone callers to listen carefully because their banks, airlines or insurance companys automated customer care options have changed, died on Tuesday at his home in Warren Township, N.J. He was 89 and would have turned 90 the next day.

title: Braves Honor Fan Who Died in Fall
description: ATLANTA  Gregory K. Murrey was a small-business owner, father and grandfather who enjoyed seeing a local blues band and the Atlanta Braves, for whom he had been a season-ticket holder for 23 years. His passion for his hometown baseball team was evident Saturday night as Murrey, 60, wearing a Braves cap, sat with two companions in the second row of the upper deck at Turner Field.

title: At Least 13 Reported Dead in Yemen Strikes
description: MUKALLA, Yemen  Airstrikes by a Saudi-led military coalition killed at least 13 civilians working early Sunday at a water plant in northern Yemen, the plants owner said.

title: Texas Suspect in the Killing of a Deputy Had Jail Time
description: HOUSTON  Details emerged on Sunday of an arrest history for Shannon Jaruay Miles, the 30-year-old man the authorities have accused of fatally shooting a sheriffs deputy at a suburban gas station here on Friday in what officials called an unprovoked coldblooded execution.

title: Tools for Tailored Learning May Expose Students Personal Details
description: If the efforts by state legislators to restrict the use of student data are any guide, the email addresses and search queries of the nations schoolchildren are a hot commodity.

title: A 2nd Chance to Study Law After a Raw Deal
description: Bennett L. Gershman, a professor at Pace Law School, is a big believer in second chances. So when he read a news article from April about David Powers, a man who had been kicked out of another law school after it learned the full details of his drug past, he thought, this man should come to Pace.

title: Baseballs Quirkiest Corners Make Life Interesting for Third-Base Coaches
description: When a ball is hit into the left-field corner at Fenway Park and a Red Sox base runner comes barreling around second base thinking about trying to score, it may take him a moment to locate Bostons third-base coach, Brian Butterfield, who will be either waving him around or putting up a stop sign.

title: Whats Real in Track? Its Hard to Know
description: MONTREAL  The track and field world championships ended Sunday, marking the conclusion of the usual drama.

title: Yankees Bombard Braves With 21 Hits and Finish Three-Game Sweep
description: ATLANTA  The Yankees, who arrived here tired and somewhat tense, having lost their division lead, momentum and their two most imposing sluggers, found that a weekend in Atlanta was good for their disposition, as well as their standing.

title: V.M.A.s 2015: On the Red Carpet
description: What Miley Cyrus, Taylor Swift and others wore to the MTV Video Music Awards.

title: A Somber Conclusion for IndyCar
description: SONOMA, Calif.  The IndyCar series closed out a troubled 2015 season here on Sunday, crowning a champion, while grieving the death of one its most popular drivers in a freak accident a week earlier, and trying to weather the latest round of criticism of the sports inherent dangers.

title: Terminal Is Evacuated at Newark Airport
description: Travelers at Newark Liberty International Airport were evacuated on Sunday evening and were forced to pass through a security checkpoint again upon re-entering, the authorities said.

title: Shedding Underachiever Label, Jason Day Wins Again and Has FedEx Cup in Sight
description: EDISON, N.J.  Few players on the PGA Tour are more popular among their peers than Jason Day, whose niceness is no longer construed as an impediment to his progress. Day is such hale company that he has become a practice-round regular of the more reserved Tiger Woods, the same Woods whom a teenage Day, in a rare moment of braggadocio, declared he wanted to take down.

title: Walmart Decides to Drop Sale of AR-15 Assault Rifles
description: A generation ago, the American gun industry came up with a devilish new campaign to bolster declining sales  militarizing the civilian firearms market with lightly adapted versions of potent battlefield weapons like the M-16 rifle. Renamed the AR-15, this semiautomatic assault rifle has come to haunt society in the hands of criminals and the deranged, who regularly kill innocent people in high-powered mass shootings.

title: Fear the Walking Dead Recap: Saddest Birthday Party Ever
description: Season 1, Episode 2: So Close, Yet So Far

title: V.M.A.s 2015: On the Red Carpet
description: The MTV Video Music Awards, held at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles on Sunday night, was an opportunity for singers, actors and reality stars to try some bolder looks. Less is less and glitter seemed to be themes of the night.

title: Actors Fatal Fall Underscores Dangers of Fire Escapes, a Refuge for Many in the City
description: The romance was born of necessity. Before air-conditioning, fire escapes offered New Yorkers a refuge from tenements in the summer heat. They read there. They drank there. At night, they slept there.

title: Three Facing Gun Charges in Inquiry That Turned Deadly
description: Three people charged in connection with an illegal-firearms investigation that went awry late last week were arraigned in Manhattan on Sunday.

title: Daniel Zwirn Forges Partnership With Canadian Investment Firm
description: In 2009, the hedge fund manager Daniel B. Zwirn closed his firm, D.B. Zwirn, amid a Securities and Exchange Commission investigation into accounting irregularities.
