description: Season 3, Episode 8, Surrogates

title: Red Bulls Outdo a Rival and Climb the Standings
description: HARRISON, N.J.  The Red Bulls clearly thrive when they play a team they love to hate.

title: Marvin Mandel, Progressive Maryland Governor Convicted of Fraud, Dies at 95
description: Former Gov. Marvin Mandel, whose record of modernizing Marylands state government was overshadowed by a messy divorce and a fraud conviction for helping associates profit from a racetrack deal, died on Sunday in St. Marys County, Md. He was 95.

title: Word of the Day + Quiz | somnambulist
description: somnambulist \sm-nam-by-list\ noun

title: Inside the Making of Dead Petz, Miley Cyruss Surprise Album
description: For Miley Cyrus, complete personal and artistic freedom  the kind that allowed her to announce at the MTV Video Music Awards on Sunday that she was following 2013s Bangerz, her platinum-selling, major label pop album, with 23 sprawling new songs, now streaming free online  is something shes earned after nearly a decade of fame.

title: 2015 MTV Video Music Awards
description: Taylor Swift, Nicki Minaj, Bruno Mars and Kanye West took home trophies.

title: Whats on TV Monday
description: 1:35 P.M. (MAX) THE GRAND BUDAPEST HOTEL (2014) In this Wes Anderson film, Zero Moustafa (F. Murray Abraham) tells an author (Jude Law) the story of how he came to own the Grand Budapest Hotel. The film flashes back to 1932, detailing the friendship between the young Zero (Tony Revolori, center, with Tom Wilkinson, left, and and Owen Wilson) and the hotel concierge, Gustave H. (Ralph Fiennes). Gustave is framed for the murder of an aristocrat (Tilda Swinton) and flees with Zero. They are pursued by her family and henchmen (Adrien Brody, Willem Dafoe) while trying to protect a prized painting. Zero, meanwhile, deals with romance. There is no doubt that Mr. Anderson possesses a distinctive sensibility and a consistent visual style, and that instead of striking out in new directions, he tends to embroider and elaborate on familiar themes and pictorial habits, A. O. Scott wrote in The Times. You will see many of them here: static, densely packed, fussily composed frames; traveling shots in which the camera glides alongside the characters like a low-flying bird; action sequences that refuse the usual digital hocus-pocus in favor of the older, artisanal magic of stop-motion animation, matte paintings and rear projection. You will also meet eccentric characters possessed by a kind of madcap melancholy, soulful and silly in equal measure.

title: Wes Craven, Whose Slasher Films Terrified Millions, Dies at 76
description: Wes Craven, a master of horror cinema and a proponent of the slasher genre who was best known for creating the Nightmare on Elm Street and Scream franchises, died on Sunday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 76.

title: From a Canoe
description: Many visitors come to Kolovesi National Park in Finland to see the rare Saimaa ringed seals. But even if there are no sightings, the area offers immense natural beauty.

title: Quotation of the Day: August 31, 2015
description: Hes like the local boy who grew up and said, I need to fix my city. How do you not get inspired by that?

title: Child Goddesses in Nepal
description: PERPIGNAN, France  Stephanie Sinclair is best known for having published and exhibited her photographs of child brides, images that she hopes will expose  and one day end  the practice of young girls forced into marriage.

title: A Race With a View
description: Observers say that races like the Gede Pangrango Trail Marathon are gaining popularity because people enjoy being in unusual settings.

title: Mr. Erdogans War Against the Kurds
description: Its not unusual for political leaders in trouble to use diversionary tactics to turn their fortunes around. Hollywood capitalized on this theme in a popular 1997 film called Wag the Dog in which, right before an election, a political spin doctor distracts voters from a presidential sex scandal by engaging a film producer to create a fake war with Albania.

title: Times Square: The Naked Truth
description: COPENHAGEN  PUBLIC controversy has returned to haunt Times Square. This time, it is the presence of body-painted, topless women, who call themselves desnudas, and are accused of polluting the public space by aggressive panhandling.

title: 60 Years Later, Echoes of Emmett Tills Killing
description: Friday was the 60th anniversary of the savage killing of Emmett Till.

title: Gender Identity: A Complex Question
description: To the Editor:

title: Protecting the Great Lakes
description: To the Editor:

title: How Much Water Should We Drink Every Day?
description: To the Editor:

title: The Two Koreas in Dialogue
description: To the Editor:

title: A Heckuva Job
description: There are many things we should remember about the events of late August and early September 2005, and the political fallout shouldnt be near the top of the list. Still, the disaster in New Orleans did the Bush administration a great deal of damage  and conservatives have never stopped trying to take their revenge. Every time something has gone wrong on President Obamas watch, critics have been quick to declare the event Obamas Katrina. How many Katrinas has Mr. Obama had so far? By one count, 23.

title: Let Consumers Use Better, Cheaper Cable Boxes
description: Of all the electronic devices in American homes, the cable box is one of the hardest to use and probably one of the most expensive. A recent survey by two Democratic senators found that consumers spend on average about $231 a year to rent them.

title: When Bad Doctors Happen to Good Patients
description: ONLY in Albany can a bill pass the Assembly with overwhelming bipartisan support, be sponsored by a majority of the State Senate, be endorsed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, and yet never come up for a final vote. That happened to Laverns Law, a bill that would have helped grievously injured victims of medical malpractice have their day in court. This summer, the Senate majority leader, John J. Flanagan, a Republican, wouldnt allow the bill to be voted on, effectively killing it.

title: At MTV V.M.A.s, Celebrity Feuds, Miley Cyrus and Also Some Music
description: By any measure, booking Miley Cyrus to host the 2015 MTV Video Music Awards seemed like a certain coup. Two years ago, performing on the show, she ignited a thousand think pieces with her antics, and since then, shes become perhaps our most unfiltered pop star, for better and often for worse. She is a reliable generator of controversy, and a reliable generator of memes.

title: The First Year College Reading List
News Qs | A New Cold War in the Warming Artic
description: In U.S. Is Seen as Laggard as Russia Asserts Itself in Warming Arctic, Steven Lee Myers writes about recent developments in the Arctic.

title: The Selfie-Drone: Invasion of the Vacation Snatchers
description: It was a blistering hot Sunday in Provence. The painted shutters of the houses in Arles were closed. Visitors were scarce. In the Roman amphitheater, built to hold some 20,000 spectators, I sat among empty bleachers, above homes with orange tile roofs, looking past ancient arcades and terraces to the blue horizon. Was this the sort of stillness van Gogh experienced when he was in Arles on this same June day in 1888? I began to entertain the thought but was distracted by a soft whirring; a faint electric hum. Something was drawing near. I looked around and saw nothing  until it and I were eye to eye.

title: As His Term Wanes, Obama Champions Workers Rights
description: WASHINGTON  With little fanfare, the Obama administration has been pursuing an aggressive campaign to restore protections for workers that have been eroded by business activism, conservative governance and the evolution of the economy in recent decades.

title: Protests in Iraq Bring Fast Promises, but Slower Changes
description: BAGHDAD  Surrounded by the clamor of protest  a sea of Iraqi flags, vendors selling coffee and melon drinks, protesters singing the national anthem and railing against politicians  two friends paused and described their dreams.

title: Builders and Brewers Honor Brooklyns Beer Heritage
description: Besides its name, there is little about Schaefer Landing, a 350-unit apartment complex in South Williamsburg, Brooklyn, that betrays its history as one of New York Citys foremost breweries.

title: Twisted Updos and Flowing Locks for Our Spring and Summer Brides
description: The brides featured in the announcements this wedding season chose a chic or relaxed hairstyle in which to say I do.

title: Do You Find It Easier to Make New Friends Online or In Person?
description: According to the Pew Research Center, 57 percent of American teenagers age 13 to 17 say they have made a friend online  say while browsing social networks like Instagram or playing a game like Call of Duty. Have you made good friends online?

title: This Struck a Serious Chord: Readers Respond to One Womans Battle With Alcoholism
description: Last Thursdays Modern Love column inspired readers to share stories about overcoming alcohol dependence and being in relationships with those who have addictions.

title: Air and Rail Travel News: Free Reading on Amtrak, Deals on Airfare
description: Our morning travel news digest, with deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.

title: Ask Well: An On-and-Off Relationship With Antidepressants
description: Question:

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Right Response to Youth Concussions
description: As the number of youngsters who participate in organized sports grows and reports of concussions rise, its vital for parents, athletes and coaches to know how these injuries are properly diagnosed and treated to avoid long-lasting consequences.

title: New York Today: Advantage, Queens
description: Updated: 10:00 a.m.

title: Can We Improve?
description: Human beings have made progress in various areas, though it is often fitful, double-edged and reversible. But are we capable of substantial moral improvement? Could we someday be much better ethically than we are now? Is it likely that members of our species could become, on average, more generous or more honest, less self-deceptive or less self-interested? I have known individual people who have improved morally in various ways (and many who have made the opposite journey) but Im not sure that as a species as a whole we are any better than we were 100 or even 10,000 years ago.

title: Today in Politics: Hillary Clinton, Facing a Difficult Summer, Flexes Her Muscle
description: Good Monday morning. As Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont continues to gain on her in the polls and as Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. considers joining the race, Hillary Rodham Clinton has increased her efforts to show her foundational support.

title: Morning Agenda: Challenges on All Sides for the Fed
description: CHALLENGES ON ALL SIDES FOR THE FED | The Federal Reserves vice chairman, Stanley Fischer, said he expected inflation to rebound to a healthier pace and maintained that the Fed was still on course to raise interest rates this year, Binyamin Appelbaum reports in The New York Times.

title: Migrant Crisis Tests Core European Value: Open Borders
description: VIENNA  The desperate migrants and asylum seekers now flooding into Europe by the tens of thousands, and the inability so far to accommodate them in an organized way, may be starting to fray Europes commitment to erase old borders.

title: A New Way to Think About Conflicts of Interest in Medicine
description: Most of what we know about prescription drugs and medical devices comes from industry-funded clinical trials. Does the source of funding affect study findings?

title: 15 Ways to Use The Learning Network This School Year
description: Welcome to the brand new Learning Network! Here is what were offering this school year and how to use it.

title: Beijings World War II Military Parade: What to Expect
description: Read in Chinese |

title: Palmyra Temple Was Destroyed by ISIS, U.N. Confirms
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  After a day of conflicting reports about the extent of damage that Islamic State militants had inflicted on the Temple of Baal in the ancient city of Palmyra, Syria, a United Nations agency said late Monday that satellite images confirmed that the structure had been largely destroyed.

title: Miley Cyrus at the MTV Video Music Awards
description: The singer and show host changed her outfit so many times that people lost count.

title: At the V.M.A.s, Costume Outdoes Fashion
description: Though it is a tenet of contemporary pop culture that fashion is a crucial component of pretty much every awards show under the sun, the MTV Video Music Awards on Sunday proved an exception to the rule.

title: Some Battle Lines Harden, Others Fade, in 2016 Fight for Senate Control
description: WASHINGTON  While the nation has been preoccupied with cacophonous presidential primary battles, the fight over control of the Senate has been quietly falling into place.

title: Supreme Courts End-of-Summer Conference: Where Appeals Go to Die
description: WASHINGTON  Four weeks from now, on Sept. 28, the Supreme Court justices will gather in private for an annual ritual called the long conference. They will consider the roughly 2,000 petitions to hear appeals that have piled up over the summer. And they will reject almost every one.

title: Cyprus Hopes Reunification Talks Will Revive a Resort, Population 0
description: FAMAGUSTA, Cyprus  Beyond a wilderness of parched weeds, crumbling buildings and roads amputated by tangles of razor wire, a long line of multistory hotels basks in the east Mediterranean sun.

title: Valerie Plame Is Among Hillary Clintons September Fund-Raisers
description: Hillary Rodham Clinton will make a two-day swing across the West Coast to raise money next month, where her campaign will hold a fund-raiser with the exposed former C.I.A. officer Valerie Plame.

title: Times Critics Guide: What to Do This Week
description: Looking to break out of a cultural rut?

title: Burning Mans Fashion Is Wild, but There Are Rules
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Glitter is a no-no. Sequins are frowned upon. Feathers were verboten, though they have still infiltrated in trims and turbans, to gnashing controversy.

title: The China Debt Zombie
description: Matthew Klein notes that Very Serious People are now worried that Chinas troubles, which have caused it to switch rather suddenly from a buyer of Treasuries to a seller, will cause U.S. interest rates to spike. He rightly finds this unconvincing. What he doesnt note is were looking at another instance of an economic zombie in action.

title: Daily Report: Educational Software Gets Attention from State Politicians
description: Children throughout the United States are heading back to school and many of them  some for the first time  will be using a range of online learning tools. Unfortunately, it is not always clear what the companies providing those tools are allowed to do with the information they glean from students.

title: Clashes in Ukraine After Parliament Vote
description: Protesters and police officers were injured in clashes outside the Ukrainian Parliament in Kiev after a vote to give greater powers to separatist regions in the countrys east.

title: Kanye West for President? His Fans Look Forward to 2020
description: After the 2015 MTV Video Music Awards, viewers were left wondering about the status (and the veracity) of the feuds among todays female pop stars as they traded obscenity-laced barbs, glares and hugs on the stage.

title: China Punishes Nearly 200 Over Rumors About Stocks, Blasts and Parade
description: BEIJING  The Chinese Ministry of Public Security has punished at least 197 people in recent days for spreading rumors online, it said. Its announcement did not give details, but the accused have presumably been detained.

title: 1890: Guatemalan Rebels Murder
description: NEW YORK  The Herald has received a despatch from the city of Mexico confirming the report of the shooting of General Barrundia by the Guatemala authorities on board a Pacific mail steamer flying the American flag.

title: The Asian Side of Istanbul
description: In this excerpt from Travel Channels new show, 36 Hours with The New York Times, Times writer Ceylan Yeginsu takes hosts Kristen and Kyle across the Bosphorus river to explore Istanbuls Asia.

title: 36 Hours in Istanbul: Differences Between European and Asian Side
description: 36 Hours, a television program inspired by The Timess 36 Hours column, airs Mondays at 8 p.m. Eastern on Travel Channel. The next episode on Istanbul dovetails with our latest column.

title: The Problem With G.O.P. Plans to Sell Health Insurance Across State Lines
description: At the Fox News Republican debate last month, Donald Trump offered a way to lower health care costs: allow insurers to sell their policies across state lines.

title: 2 More Officers Die in Violent Protest Over Autonomy for East Ukraine
description: KIEV, Ukraine  The results of a fiercely contested parliamentary vote over autonomy for eastern Ukraine were counted on Monday, partly in blood: 265 in favor, three major parties opposed and one dead policeman.

title: Replacing Pesticides With Genetics
description: GENEVA, N.Y.  Every spring, a host of unwelcome visitors descends on the Hansen farm in upstate New York. Diamondback moths blown in from the South threaten rows of cabbages to be sold for slaw and sauerkraut.

title: Miley Cyruss V.M.A. Style
description: At Sunday nights MTV Video Music Awards, Miley Cyruss guiding sartorial principle seemed to be X-rated Betty Boop meets Barbarella. Ms. Cyrus, who changed outfits a mind-boggling eight or more times, chose exaggerated garments to make a statement over Instagram. Here are some of her looks.

title: What We Dont Talk About When We Talk About Alcohol: Binge Drinking
description: As a parent, youve probably talked to your young children about alcohol (See this drink Im having? Its not for you) and to teenagers about drinking (Dont do it, and if you do dont drive, and did I ever do it? Ooh, look, a woodpecker!). But have you talked to your children, particularly your high schoolers and soon-to-be college students, about drinking the way its often done at that age  hard, fast, and with the intent of getting drunk?

title: Thai Police to Be Rewarded in Bomb Case
description: Thailands police chief praised officers investigating a deadly bombing and promised to hand out about $84,000 among them as a reward for catching a suspect who has not yet been charged.

title: I Am Cait Episode 6 Recap: Enough of This Dating Nonsense
description: Season 1, Episode 6: The Dating Game

title: President Obama to Run Wild With Bear Grylls
description: President Obama has withstood six years in the White House and a tumultuous political era, but how would he fare in the Alaska wilderness?

title: Hotels Fight Back Against Sites Like Expedia and Priceline
description: For years, travelers have been drawn to online sites like Expedia, Travelocity, Orbitz and Priceline to find and reserve hotel rooms, flights and rental cars.

title: Increase Taxes? Talk by Donald Trump Alarms G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  For years, Republicans have run for office on promises of cutting taxes and bolstering business to stimulate economic growth, pledging allegiance to a Reaganesque model of conservatism that has largely become the partys orthodoxy.

title: Thai Police Seize Explosives in Bangkok Bombing Investigation
description: BANGKOK  The Thai police on Monday expanded their investigation into a deadly Bangkok shrine bombing, seizing explosives from a suburban apartment building and warning that the group they are pursuing had been preparing quite a lot of bombs.

title: History Channel Host Helps His Teacher Find a Kidney
description: A simple book dedication from a former student has saved the life of a Florida high school teacher and shined the social media spotlight on organ donation.

title: Dora Charles Moves On From Paula Deen, and Makes It All About the Seasoning
description: GARDEN CITY, Ga.  In the kitchen of her double-wide trailer, Dora Charles sets spare ribs kissed with flour into a deep fryer and sauts yesterdays collard greens with rice and onions. Her cooking is practiced and deliberate, learned at the hand of her father and her grandmother Hattie Smith, who showed her that seasoning something well and cooking it slowly encouraged flavors to bloom.

title: Dick Cheney Jabs at Hillary Clintons Emails and Urges Joe Biden to Run
description: Former Vice President Dick Cheney has not been shy about sharing opinions about his successors since leaving office, and he is not holding back on trying to meddle in the Democratic nominating contest.

title: Trump, Taxes and the G.O.P.
description: As an accompaniment to my Sunday column on Donald Trumps challenge to the existing Republican-conservative matrix, its worth reading Byron York on how Trumps forays on tax policy exemplify his unorthodox approch:

title: A Dispute Over the End of the Appalachian Trail
description: Jensen Bissell, the director of Baxter State Park, has threatened to move the end of the Appalachian Trail off Mount Katahdin and out of the park to protect it from growing crowds.

title: With No Settlement, Judge Will Decide Tom Bradys Case
description: A federal judge will rule this week on whether to lift or uphold New England Patriots quarterback Tom Bradys four-game suspension by the N.F.L. after Brady and the league failed to reach an agreement to their seven-month standoff.

title: One Thing You Can Do With Your Portfolio Right Now
description: When the markets get scary, theres an overwhelming temptation to do something, anything really, with our portfolios. But we know better. We all know on an intellectual level that selling during a dip is a bad idea, and the data confirms that successfully timing the market is, at the very least, highly unlikely. Yet it feels crazy to just sit in front of what feels like an oncoming train.

title: A Dream Parisian Cafe, Brought to Life
description: In the early 1970s, George Whitman, the late owner of the legendary Shakespeare & Company bookshop in Paris, had visitors make sketches of his dream cafe, which he intended to open in the adjacent building, if he ever managed to take it over. Unearthed after his death by his daughter, the current co-owner Sylvia Whitman, the drawings depicted a convivial meeting place with outdoor seating and books aplenty. Now, after more than 50 years of vacancy, the space next door has undergone a massive overhaul (the retro floor tiles were one of the few things preserved), complete with large windows through which the bookish set will be able to gaze at Notre Dame while snacking on literary treats such as Proustian madeleines and Salinger-inspired Love and Squalor pie.

title: You Can Reduce Your Blind Spot, a Study Says
description: The human eye has a blind spot, though few of us realize it. Now, a new study suggests that it is possible to reduce the spot with training.

title: Where to Eat and Drink in Evanston
description: The urban suburb north of Chicago has a downtown area that is picking up steam with the recent openings of farm-to-table restaurants and world-class distilleries and breweries.

title: Breaking the Grip of the Gaokao, Chinas SAT
description: The notorious Gaokao, (, or High Test) is Chinas SAT on steroids, with a score on the nine-hour test being the sole criterion for admission to Chinese universities. Preparing for the test is ayears-longobsession for both students and parents. (In case you missed it: Brook LarmersInside a Chinese Test-Prep Factory.) And for many, the unfortunate consequence is that the lengthy preparation destroys, rather than enhances, academic ability. Student enthusiasm and curiosity are crushed.

title: Angela Merkel Calls for European Unity to Address Migrant Influx
description: BERLIN  Faced with a humanitarian crisis that shows no signs of letting up, Chancellor Angela Merkel gave her fellow Germans and other Europeans a pep talk on Monday, praising those assisting the thousands seeking asylum here but warning that the Continents open-border policy was at risk unless all European countries showed an equal willingness to help.

title: Kathy YL Chan and Her Coveted Tea, Never to Be Brewed
description: A year ago, a member of a private tea society in Shanghai presented Kathy YL Chan with a small box as slender as a cigarette case. Inside were four tiles of highly prized pu-erh tea, conjoined like a chocolate bar and almost black, twined with green and ocher.

title: A Tour of Jayma Cardosos Airy Montauk Home and Office
description: The Surf Lodge owner has filled her home with artworks and objects from friends.

title: A Montauk Home Where the Windows Are Always Open
description: The hotelier and nightlife entrepreneur Jayma Cardoso has been involved in a handful of high-profile Manhattan projects: SoHos GoldBar, Lavo in Midtown. But none is unmistakably hers as the Surf Lodge, the Montauk mainstay now wrapping up its sold-out eighth season: like the hotel, Cardoso is unfussy and welcoming, with an accent left over from her native Brazil and a throaty laugh she deploys often.

title: Denalis Name Change Upsets a Senator
description: I know its a tricky thing to expect consistency from politicians, but I was struck by Senator Rob Portmans indignation at President Obamas decision to change the name of Mount McKinley in Alaska back to Denali, which is the name that local Native Americans gave it.

title: The Long, Winding Interview With Miley Cyrus
description: Last night, after hosting the MTV Video Music Awards in a typical polarizing performance, Miley Cyrus surprise-released a free, 23-track new album, Miley Cyrus & Her Dead Petz, written and recorded largely at her home with members of the Flaming Lips. In a five-hour interview the previous weekend, Ms. Cyrus, 22, discussed the experimental project, which you can read about here. But along the way, she also touched on her budding friendship with Caitlyn Jenner, learning about herself through drugs, and how shes learned to handle the media.

title: Ben Carson Ties Donald Trump in Iowa Poll
description: Donald J. Trump likes to brag that he leads his Republican rivals in every poll, but a new poll on Monday showed him with company at the top of the field.

title: Relationships, and Sex Lives, Benefit When Men Share Child Care
description: Men who share in child-care duties are more likely to have better relationships  with more satisfying sex lives  than those who do not help, new research shows.

title: 1965: Russia Rejects U.S. Proposal
description: GENEVA The Soviet Union formally rejected today [Aug. 31] the American-proposed disarmament treaty which was designed to try to halt the spread of nuclear weapons. Soviet delegate Semyon K. Tsarapkin told the 17-nation disarmament conference the U.S. treaty draft presented Aug. 17 was unacceptable even as a basis for discussion. He described the draft as a cynical Western attempt to admit West Germany to the nuclear club by the back door.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, September 1, 1965

title: Oliver Sacks: Diverse Elements in Harmony
description: In 2001, shortly after his book, Uncle Tungsten: Memories of a Chemical Boyhood, was published, I asked Dr. Oliver Sacks which of the chemical elements he had written about was his favorite.

title: Challah and Brisket, Rethought for Rosh Hashana
description: Most challah is made from wheat flour. But rye, barley, spelt and oats may also be used according to Jewish law. This year, in time for Rosh Hashana, Breads Bakery is using a mixture of spelt and wheat to make a handsome and tasty round loaf. It is not kosher. The gluten- and dairy-free By the Way Bakery is making challah primarily from oat flour, under rabbinical supervision, so its kosher and pareve. It is baked in a ring shape and is dense and thickly studded with raisins for a bread thats earthy and sweet: Spelt challah, $8.50, beginning Friday at Breads Bakery, 18 East 16th Street, and Breads Bakery kiosk in Bryant Park, breadsbakery.com; oat challah, $12, Sept. 11, 13, 18, 21 and 22 from By the Way Bakery, 2442 Broadway (90th Street); 574 Warburton Avenue, Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y., BTWBakery.com.

title: Rick Perrys Woes Continue as Iowa Staff Is Cut to One Person
description: Former Gov. Rick Perrys campaign continues to retrench.

title: Carrie Brownsteins Book Tour to Kick Off in Brooklyn
description: From Portlandia to Portland, Ore., and Brooklyn, too, Carrie Brownstein will be traveling to 11 cities across the United States this fall to promote her memoir, Hunger Makes Me a Modern Girl (Riverhead Books), due in October.

title: The Eerie Realism of Mr. Robot
description: In the first episode of Mr. Robot, a drama that is nearing the end of its first season on the USA Network, Elliot  the shows main character, played by Rami Malek  delivers a memorable monologue about his disillusionment with society. Elliots Margaret Keane-size eyes go blank as he describes feelings of isolation and disconnection from popular culture.

title: Tracking People Like Packages: Republicans Inhumane Immigration Ideas
description: The Republican presidential candidates just cant help themselves on immigration. That subject is a rhetorical sinkhole that, like Donald Trumps mouth, just seems to keep getting bigger, swallowing candidates left and right.

title: A New Place to Sleep in Old Barcelona
description: Despite not being particularly known for its contemporary art scene or flashy architectural projects, Barcelona is one of those rare cities that somehow always feels up to date. The same, however, cant be said for its hotels, which are either Old World-stodgy or genera-minimalist. But the affordable new Casa Bonay, located in a stately, sun-washed 1869 building in the citys central, semi-industrial Dreta de lEixample neighborhood, is changing that. The co-owner Ins Mir-Sans, who worked with the Brooklyn-based design firm Studio Tack to restore the space without destroying its 19th-century charms, preserved as many details as she could, from old fireplaces to the mosaic floors, while keeping the feeling super simple.

title: Live and Kicking: Soccer Games to Watch
description: Most of the worlds top leagues have the week off for the international break, but the worlds top players, as usual, will get no rest. The Timess soccer editor, Andrew Das, an unapologetic Ajax fan, suggests what to watch on television.

title: Third World Trade Center Parachutist Is Sentenced
description: The last of three sky divers convicted on misdemeanor charges for parachuting off 1 World Trade Center two years ago was sentenced on Monday to 300 hours of community service and a $2,000 fine.

title: Monsters Unleashed
description: Twyla Tharp is writing about rehearsing, touring and creating new work, 50 years after her first dance concert.

title: London Theater Journal: Discipline, Punish and Put on a Play
description: LONDON  Plays about putting on plays  including knockabout farces like Noises Off  almost invariably raise a lump in the throat of the sentimental theatergoer. But even those resistant to this sub-genres charms may well mist up during a certain scene in Timberlake Wertenbakers Our Countrys Good, which has been given a big, handsome and somewhat literal-minded revival at the National Theater here.

title: Born in Chiapas
description: A look at the traditional midwife in southern Mexico, and at modern inroads into childbirth

title: Training Midwives to Save Expectant Mothers in Chiapas
description: Chiapas, the southernmost state in Mexico, is a mix of wonder and sadness. It is home to rain forests, Mayan ruins, waterfalls, rugged highlands  and some of the countrys highest death rates among women in childbirth.

title: Reformist Iranian Politician Is Said to Be Held
description: TEHRAN  Iranian security forces arrested a prominent reformist politician on Monday, hours after he held a news conference thanking President Hassan Rouhani for a more open political atmosphere, several Iranian news agencies reported.

title: Slowing Growth Exposes Chinese Banks Debt Debris
description: Chinas economic slowdown is exposing the debt debris in its banking sector. Shaky credits on the balance sheets of the countrys four biggest lenders jumped by 28 percent to 592 billion renminbi ($92.8 billion) in the first half of the year. Further deterioration would send earnings growth into reverse.

title: A Kugel to Savor for Rosh Hashana
description: This savory kugel is from my 102-year-old mother, Pearl, who in 1950 put the recipe in a spiral-bound cookbook to raise money for her temple. Rather than raisins and sugar, it calls for onions and garlic, with what were then considered secret ingredients, Worcestershire and Tabasco.

title: Favorite to Lead Britains Labour Party Is Criticized for Bin Laden Comments
description: LONDON  The effort to undermine Jeremy Corbyn, the consensus front-runner for the leadership of Britains opposition Labour Party, continued on Monday with reports that Mr. Corbyn called the death of Osama bin Laden a tragedy in a 2011 interview just after the event.

title: A Complicated Love Story
description: This story begins with two couples living in Seattle. The men are in a band. When one of the women gets into the City University of New York School of Law, everyone moves to New York together.

title: From Seattle With Love: A Tale of 4 Friends and One Band
description: This is a complicated summer love story. It involves four people and one band that plays trippy surf music with elements of punk. It starts in Seattle and ends in Brooklyn. The tale is highbrow (Walt Whitman) and lowbrow (Pabst Blue Ribbon). It has a soundtrack that might be confusing.

title: A Warhol-Worthy Watch
description: Andy Warhols prediction of a future in which everyone would be world-famous for 15 minutes has largely come true. And yet, nearly 30 years after his death, his own fame lives on: Maison Piagets Black Tie Vintage Inspiration watch, with a spare black onyx face framed in white gold, is an updated version of a 1973 model from the artists own collection.

title: Eating on the Move May Lead to Later Overindulging
description: Eating on the go may be worse than eating in front of the television, a new study reports, and may lead people to overindulge later.

title: Supplements Dont Fight Cognitive Decline, N.I.H. Study Says
description: Omega-3 fatty acids and antioxidants are often marketed to promote brain health. But one study to test these supplements has found no evidence that the pills stave off cognitive decline in older people.

title: Amid Attacks over Mountain Names and Arctic Oil Leases, Obama Seeks Alaska Survival Tips from Bear Grylls
description: Kicking off his Alaska tour, President Obama is scheduled to talkabout climate change, oil and the Arctic later tonight at an ambitiously titled Anchorage event  theConference on Global Leadership in the Arctic: Cooperation, Innovation, Engagement and Resilience.

title: S.E.C.s In-House Judges Not Too Tough, a Review Shows
description: The Dodd-Frank Act allowed the Securities and Exchange Commission to bring almost any claim that it can file in a federal court before its own administrative law judges. The agency has since taken up this power against a panoply of inside traders and others accused of securities fraud.

title: The Most Prized (and Totally Random) Possessions of Nine Famous People
description: Each weekend, T hands over the keys of its Instagram account to a single editor to post pictures of whatever he or she is feeling at the moment. The most recent curations have been all-summer-everything: Ts deputy editor Hanya Yanagihara and senior online editor Isabel Wilkinson each posted images of remote places in which to take a dip (hotel pools and swimming holes, respectively); art director Shawn Carney celebrated the dog days with a survey of seasonal album covers; and features associate Lauren Poggi honored summers finest elements through the lenses of art and photography.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: When Your Sex Life Doesnt Follow the Script
description: If someone had told me 10 years ago that I would one day announce in The New York Times how old I was when I lost my virginity, I would have died of embarrassment.

title: Judge Allows Moral, Not Just Religious, Contraception Exemptions
description: WASHINGTON  Employers do not need to provide insurance coverage for contraception even if their objections are moral rather than religious, a federal judge here ruled on Monday.

title: D.A. Recounts Shooting of Police Officer
description: Devon Anderson, the district attorney for Harris County, Tex., described the fatal shooting of Deputy Darren Goforth. Shannon J. Miles has been charged with murder.

title: On the Town Takes Box Office Leap Thanks to Misty Copeland
description: The nations most famous ballerina has now conquered Broadway too.

title: Prosecutors Say Shannon Miles Shot Texas Deputy 15 Times
description: HOUSTON  The man charged with killing a sheriffs deputy at a suburban gas station Friday emptied his 15-round handgun into the back and the back of the head of the deputy, as witnesses watched in horror and surveillance cameras captured the shooting, prosecutors said Monday.

title: Mediator on Failed Brady Talks
description: Jay Feely of the N.F.L. Players Association spoke to reporters, and the N.F.L. commissioner, Roger Goodell, and the New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady left court after settlement talks failed.

title: Afghanistans Electoral Reform Plan Is Met With Skepticism
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Months late, Afghanistans electoral reform commission has delivered a list of proposals, in a critical step to holding overdue parliamentary elections.

title: Faking Doctors Notes to Escape Gaza War Zone
description: GAZA  The medical report details some worrying conditions: chronic dyspnea  a shortage of breath that could be a sign of heart or lung disease  and bronchial asthma. It says the patient, a 28-year-old woman from Gaza City, relies on continuous medication and an inhaler.

title: Amal Clooney Discusses Al Jazeera Case
description: Amal Clooney, a lawyer representing the Canadian journalist Mohamed Fahmy of Al Jazeera during his trial in Egypt, reiterated her call for the Canadian prime minister to intervene.

title: Indias Supreme Court Suspends Ban on Starvation Ritual
description: NEW DELHI  Indias Supreme Court on Monday suspended a state-level courts ban on a religious practice called santhara, a fast to the death most often undertaken by the sick and aged.

title: The Cost of Cable Is Preposterous: Readers Sound Off on Set-Top Boxes
description: Our editorial this morning calling on the Federal Communications Commission to make it easier for people to buy their own cable boxes attracted hundreds of comments from readers. Not surprisingly, most of the people writing in were unhappy with cable and satellite companies, which generate nearly $20 billion in revenue from renting out boxes to their customers.

title: Can a Computer Tell Whether Something Was Written by a Man or a Woman?
description: Q. Can a computer tell from published documents whether the author is a man or a woman?

title: Ponchos Are the New Frontier
description: Five styles for the modern pioneer. (Go West, young man.)

title: MTVs V.M.A.s Dominated Social Media, but Had Fewer Viewers
description: MTVs Video Music Awards drew 9.8 million viewers on Sunday, about a half a million viewers fewer than watched last years show, according to Nielsen.

title: SpongeBob Musical Will Open in Chicago, With Sights on Broadway
description: He might live in a pineapple under the sea, but next year SpongeBob SquarePants hopes to make his home onstage on Broadway. First: Chicago.

title: Wes Craven, a Filmmaker Who Invaded Your Dreams
description: When Wes Craven started making horror movies, he had hardly seen any. I didnt even know what a horror film was, he told me several years ago. I kind of made it up as I went along.

title: White Supremacist Convicted of Killing 3 at Kansas Jewish Centers
description: OLATHE, Kan.  A white supremacist was convicted of capital murder on Monday in the shooting deaths of three people a year ago at a Jewish community center and an assisted living facility in suburban Kansas City.

title: Review: Puffin Rock Joins Parade of Shows Aimed at Youngest Viewers
description: The newest Netflix series, Puffin Rock, arrives on Tuesday full of action, suspense and topicality. A valuable cargo is hauled across a beach under a ticking deadline. The storys heroine disappears, and her father sets out to find her. The whole cast gathers to take in the supermoon.

title: In Topping Charts, Disturbed Accomplishes a Rare Feat
description: The metal band Disturbed has the No. 1 album this week with Immortalized (Reprise), which sold 93,000 copies and had just over three million streams, according to Nielsen. It is the bands fifth consecutive release to open in the top slot, a rare chart feat  Metallica and the Dave Matthews Band are the only other groups to have done it, Billboard reported.

title: Mourning Kyle Jean-Baptiste, Les Misrables Actor Who Plunged to His Death
description: Several hundred people gathered at the Bethesda Fountain in Central Park on Monday afternoon to celebrate the life of Kyle Jean-Baptiste, the 21-year old actor who died last week in a fall from a fire escape in Brooklyn. Mr. Jean-Baptiste was the first African-American to play the role of Jean Valjean in Les Misrables on Broadway, as well as the youngest.

title: Strict Enforcement of FIFA Rules Sidelines Young Players Abroad
description: Ben Lederman still gets up early for school every morning so he can be finished in time for soccer training. He still practices, every day, at La Masia, the famed youth academy of F.C. Barcelona. He still spends much of his time at a place where he occasionally crosses paths with stars like Lionel Messi.

title: Transgender Inmate Who Sued Georgia Gets Unexpected Parole
description: Ashley Diamond, the transgender inmate who sued Georgia in February for access to hormone therapy and protection against prison rape, was unexpectedly paroled on Monday after serving less than a third of a 12-year sentence for burglary.

title: Review: Atomic Orbital and Midway Avenue, Examining Electrons and Memories
description: Choreography may not be quite as perplexing as quantum mechanics, but it is a mysterious art. Atomic Orbital, Laura Petersons contribution to a shared program at Here this past weekend, is an abstract dance whose clean lines, attention to detail and complex sense of stage space recall the work of Merce Cunningham. And yet something is missing, the something that makes such abstraction dramatically absorbing. Its hard to say exactly what that something is.

title: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know at the end of the day.

title: Review: Locrian Chamber Players, With Music Wrapped in Temporary Mystery
description: Two rules govern concerts by the Locrian Chamber Players: The music cannot be older than 10 years, and program notes are provided only after the event, at the exit.

title: Review: Madboots Dance Ignores Gender Boundaries
description: BECKET, Mass.  In the final week of this years Jacobs Pillow Dance Festival, much of the warmest applause was directed at the woman giving the preshow speeches: Ella Baff, who is moving on after 17 years as the festivals executive and artistic director. Her closing round of introductions addressed Americas oldest dance troupe, the Martha Graham Dance Company, and one of its youngest, Madboots Dance.

title: Michigan Lawmakers Misused Aides to Cover Up Affair, Report Finds
description: Two Michigan legislators forced their aides to do political and personal work on state time, including helping cover up their affair, and then lied repeatedly about their actions, according to an investigation by the State House of Representatives, whose findings were released Monday.

title: Tennis Fans Excited for U.S. Open
description: Tennis fans lining up outside Arthur Ashe Stadium in New York, excited to see their favorite players, including Serena Williams, in this years U.S. Open.

title: T-Mobile Says It Will Ban Abusers of Unlimited Data Plan
description: T-Mobile USA, one of the few phone carriers to still offer an unlimited data plan, has run into a classic Homer Simpson problem: The company says it will get rid ofabusers of its all-you-can-eat data privileges, similar towhen Homer was thrown out of a restaurantfor eating too much seafood at an all-you-can-eat buffet.

title: Review: From Taka Kigawa, a Class on Resonance at Le Poisson Rouge
description: Summer school has been in session in New York piano recitals. Recently, at the Kaplan Penthouse at Lincoln Center, Pierre-Laurent Aimard gave a lesson in canons and fugues, a prelude to his performance of George Benjamins combination of those two forms in Shadowlines. And on Aug. 24 at another intimate space, Le Poisson Rouge, Taka Kigawa held a class on reverberation and resonance.

title: Review: In Make Me, Lee Child Adds Another Layer to Jack Reacher
description: Grain, meet the railroad Jack Reacher tells himself, after hes picked the latest sinister little Nowheresville in which to spend a books length of time. He appears to have gotten off a train in the middle of wheat country, for no better reasons than he liked the cryptic name of the town, Mothers Rest, and that hes got foolproof instincts for sniffing out trouble. Lee Childs Reacher series has hit Book No. 20 with a resounding peal of wisecracking glee (Are you going to be a problem? Im already a problem. The question is, what are you going to do about it?). Everything about it, starting with Reachers nose for bad news, is as strong as ever.

title: Pictures of the Day: Ukraine and Elsewhere
description: Ukraine and More  Pictures of the Day

title: August 31, 2015  Pictures of the Day
description: Photos from Ukraine, Greece, Russia and Nepal.

title: An Outpouring of Reader Reflection After the Death of Oliver Sacks
description: When Oliver Sacks died at age 82 on Sunday, readers flocked to his obituary to pay their respects. Many wrote of their connections to the neurologist as patients, mentees and, largely, as readers. In his essay last February My Own Life, Dr. Sacks acknowledged the impact his readers had had on his life, writing, I have had an intercourse with the world, the special intercourse of writers and readers.

title: In Vienna, Trains Packed With Refugees Are Welcomed and Ushered On
description: VIENNA  Six trains packed with migrants arrived on Monday at the Westbahnhof rail station in Vienna from Budapest and Hegyeshalom, a Hungarian village near the border with Austria.

title: Jorge Ramos Is Not Walter Cronkite
description: Shortly after Donald Trumps bodyguard forcibly removed him from a press conference in Dubuque, Iowa, the Univision news anchor Jorge Ramos declared that the ejection had caught him by surprise. As he told George Stephanopoulos on Good Morning America, Never in my life, and Ive been a journalist more than 30 years, have I been thrown out of a press conference. Technically, Ramoss statement is true. But anyone who has read his books knows that he has tangled with bodyguards before, even if they werent at a press conference.

title: Obama Makes Urgent Appeal in Alaska for Climate Change Action
description: ANCHORAGE  President Obama on Monday issued a global call for urgent action to address climate change, declaring that the United States was partly to blame for what he called the defining challenge of the century and would rally the world to counter it.

title: Why Students With Smallest Debts Have the Larger Problem
description: Politicians who complain about college costs frequently cite two numbers: one trillion and seven million. Student borrowers owe more than $1 trillion, and seven million borrowers are in default, according to the latest Department of Education data.

title: At Manhattan Marriage Bureau, a Union of Matrimony and Bureaucracy
description: The brides wore white, temporarily, retrieving ticket No. C685 from a kiosk inside the Manhattan marriage bureau  that great municipal deli of matrimony  and waiting to be served.

title: A Day at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau
description: Two changes have helped fuel greater use of the bureau: the legalization of same-sex marriage and an effort by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg to make it a premiere wedding destination.

title: Greenlight Capital Down 14% for Year; David Einhorn Surveys Investors
description: David Einhorn has earned a reputation as one of the savviest stock pickers on Wall Street. But the recent market turmoil has not spared him, and this year is shaping up to be one of the worst in his big hedge fund firms two-decade history.

title: Iran Nuclear Deal Gains Momentum With Endorsements of Four House Democrats
description: Three House Democrats from New York and a House Democrat from Florida who is running for a Senate seat endorsed President Obamas nuclear deal with Iran on Monday, lending fresh momentum to the pact from political quarters that once appeared most leery of it.

title: Mayor de Blasio Takes to Twitter for a Lunchtime Chat
description: The message went out just before 1 p.m., lurching into the social media wilderness of lunchtime on a late summer Monday.

title: Calling the Midwife, in Chiapas
description: In Chiapas, Mexico, a midwife may be the only person there to help a woman when she gives birth.

title: Teenage Motherhood in France
description: Vivane Dalles labored to find the money  and outside interest  to pursue an intensive project on teenage mothers in France.
